Product: Debt collection
Consumer complaint narrative:
am disputing an alleged debt of {$440.00} reported by Midland Credit Management ( MCM ) and originating from XXXX Bank ( XXXX Credit ). The claims related to this debt are inaccurate and unverifiable based on the following : Unrecognized XXXX Credit Accounts : XXXX linked the debt to XXXX XXXX XXXX account numbers ( ending in XXXX and XXXX ) that I have never opened or authorized. 
I have had a XXXX account for 12 years, tied to my email address, but I have never had a XXXX XXXX account with digital account numbers as claimed. 
Positive Balance and Payment History : On XX/XX/year>, I received a XXXX payment of {$910.00}, which should have fully covered any outstanding balances. 
I maintain that my account had a positive balance, leaving no possibility of owing money. Despite this, XXXX Bank issued a statement for {$160.00} in XX/XX/year> without explanation. 
No Grammarly Purchase in History : MCM claims the debt includes a Grammarly purchase in 2023, yet : My XXXX transaction history shows no such purchase. 
My Grammarly subscription was canceled on XX/XX/year>, as confirmed in an email from XXXX. 
Documents provided on XXXX 's website under this case show no transaction history for a XXXX purchase. 
Request for Validation Ignored : I have contacted XXXX Bank and XXXX multiple times to request validation of the debt, including : Proof that I authorized the XXXX Credit accounts tied to the alleged debt. 
A full transaction history and explanation of how the {$440.00} balance was calculated. 
Confirmation of whether XXXX itself was consulted during this investigation. 
To date, neither XXXX Bank nor XXXX has provided adequate validation of this debt. XXXX continues to report this collection to credit bureaus, harming my credit score, and has made repeated unauthorized credit inquiries.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX used unfair collection practices to repossess my vehicle ; I have been long time member with XXXX XXXX made vehicle payments on time paid more than monthly amount for 3 years recently fell on hard times. Reached out to XXXX XXXX XXXX to discuss hardship/ deferment payment options which they have a plan that I'm billed monthly at XXXX to protect auto loan in the event I am faced with a hardship I had to " APPLY/QUALIFY '' for this assistance ; application were submitted for 3 months and were either ignored, marked as incomplete or denied. How do you get denied for hardship assistance when there's a reduction of income. All lenders offer the ability to place payments at the end of the loan without submitting proof of income/harship we have never used this benefit/program. It my belief we qualified due to national COVID disaster assistance programs, reduction of income due to being temporarily unemployed, and vehicle was in area of Hurricane XXXX of XXXX so we had 3 life changing events that XXXX advertise assistance for and we were repeatedly denied. Furthermore in State of Illinois lenders are required to send letter advising consumers of intent of repossession detailing redemption process ; and allow consumer 21 days to resolve issue before action is taken if loan is paid off more than 30 %. We never received written notification and loan is paid off 50 %. The original loan taken out XX/XX/XXXX was {$49000.00}. our current balance is XXXX which includes additional fees payments. Consumer rights were violated : 15 USC 1681b ( a ) ( 2 ), 15 USC 1681i, 15 USC 1681s-2, UCC 9 PART 6, UCC 9-609 ( b ) Breach of Peace, Public Disturbance. I logged into XXXX website and submitted payment of {$1500.00} which would have bought account current covering payment 2 months of payments our regular monthly payment is {$740.00} on XX/XX/XXXX at XXXX CST was advised by XXXX customer service representative the repossession order was sent out XX/XX/XXXX at XXXX CST which was after payment was submitted. Once XX/XX/XXXX when vehicle was repo 'd contact representative that advised to cancel payment from day before the amount due had changed ( fees added and needed to add XX/XX/XXXX payment which posted to account XX/XX/XXXX ) the new amount due is {$3600.00} which is outrageous. The total due of account was {$2200.00} on XX/XX/XXXX when payment for {$1500.00} was submitted. Its my assumption that XXXX XXXX XXXX practiced unlawful collection tactics to repo vehicle due to the fact we have a great interest rate of 4 % the vehicle is more than 50 % paid off and there would be equity in vehicle if resold making repossession of vehicle more profitable transaction to bank verses working it out with a longtime consumer ; there is no reason we should have been denied hardship repayment due to income that's the purpose of hardship income changes. We had to submit application and checks stubs to " APPLY '' to use coverage program that I have been billed XXXX per month for last 3 years. Repossession was preformed without proper legal authority. 

MAJOR CREDIT bureaus : I am writing to formally dispute numerous errors/ inaccurate information reflecting on my consumer credit profiles with all three major credit bureaus and to address several violations of consumer protection laws that have come to my attention. Upon reviewing credit reports dated XX/XX/XXXX I believe this action was taken unlawfully and in violation of both state and federal consumer laws, including the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) and the Uniform Commercial Code ( UCC ). The below mention account ( s )/ information were mishandled and in direct volitation of the following consumer laws ; I reference the following laws and regulations in support of my dispute : 15 USC 1681b ( a ) ( 2 ) 15 USC 1681i 15 USC 1681 s-2 15 USC 1681c-2 ( a ) 15 USC 1666b 15 USC 1637 ( b ) 15 USC 1681 e ( b ) 15 USC 1681b ( 2 ) 15 USC 1681 ( q ) 15 USC 1681 ( 2XI ) 15 USC 1692c 15 USC 1635 15 USC 1692g UCC 9 part 6 UCC 9-609 ( b ) 12 CFR 1006.34C 12 CFR 1006.6C 12 CRF 1026.13 Failure to provide written notice of repossession intent and redemption options in a timely manner Failure to provide 1099-c Breach of peace Public Disturbance 1. 15 USC 1681b ( a ) ( 2 ) : This provision states that consumer reporting agencies may furnish reports only for permissible purposes. I have concerns that my information has been accessed without a legitimate reason.

2. 15 USC 1681i : Under this statute, I am entitled to dispute inaccurate information in my credit report. I request that you investigate the accuracy of the information being reported.

3. 15 USC 1681s-2 : This law requires furnishers of information to provide accurate data. I believe that the information you have reported is incorrect and must be corrected.

4. 15 USC 1681c-2 ( a ) : This provision details the expiration of certain negative information. I believe that information being reported is outdated and should not be included in my credit file.

5. 15 USC 1666b : This section pertains to billing error resolutions. I have not received proper resolution pertaining to the billing discrepancies on my account.

6. 15 USC 1637 ( b ) : This law requires clear disclosure of terms and conditions, which I believe were not adequately provided in my case.

7. 15 USC 1681e ( b ) : You have a duty to ensure maximum possible accuracy in the information you report. Failure to do so constitutes a violation of this section.

8. 15 USC 1681b ( 2 ) : This section mandates that I must be informed of the nature of the information used to make adverse decisions. I have not received adequate information regarding this.

9. 15 USC 1681 ( q ) : This provision prohibits the use of consumer reports for improper purposes. I am concerned my report has been accessed without my knowledge or consent.

10. 15 USC 1681 ( 2XI ) : This statute emphasizes the importance of accuracy in credit reporting, which I believe has not been upheld.

11. 15 USC 1692c : Under this law, I have the right to request debt validation which has not been provided to me satisfactorily.

12. 15 USC 1635 : This statute requires that consumers be informed about their right to cancel certain transactions, which was not properly communicated in my case.

13. 15 USC 1692g : This section mandates that I be provided with validation of the debt upon request. I have not received the necessary validation.

14. UCC 9-609 ( b ) : This provision states that a secured party must not breach the peace during the repossession process. I have concerns regarding the manner in which the repossession was conducted.

15. 12 CFR 1006.34C and 12 CFR 1006.6C : These regulations govern the treatment of accounts in collections and require proper disclosures regarding debt collection practices.

16. 12 CFR 1026.13 : This section provides additional requirements for credit card issuers to address billing errors, which I believe were not met in this situation.

- Failure to Provide Written Notice of Repossession Intent and Redemption Options : I did not receive the required written notice prior to the repossession of my vehicle, violating my rights under relevant laws.

- Failure to Provide 1099-C : I have not received a 1099-C for any canceled debts, which is necessary for accurate tax reporting.

- Breach of Peace/Public Disturbance : The manner in which the repossession was handled caused a public disturbance and did not adhere to the legal requirement of maintaining the peace.

Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), I have the right to dispute inaccurate information in my credit file. I am requesting that you conduct a thorough investigation of this matter to verify whether the creditor has reported this debt accurately and whether they have fulfilled their obligation to issue a 1099-C. If they are unable to provide proof of the cancellation of debt and the corresponding 1099-C, I request that you remove this entry from my credit report.

First, I would like to remind you that under the FDCPA, a creditor must provide proper notification before taking action such as repossession. I did not receive any written notice concerning a default or an impending repossession within the time frame required by law. Specifically, in Illinois where vehicle is registered lender is required to send written notice of default and repossession intent informing borrower of intent to recover vehicle provide instruction of remedy of default ; notice also allows borrower 21 days to bring loan current if vehicle is more than 30 % paid off.

Additionally, I would like to request that you provide me with documentation proving your right to repossess the vehicle, including the original loan agreement and any correspondence related to the default. According to the law, I have the right to receive this information, and failure to provide it may constitute additional violations of our rights as a consumer. My personal data information has been leaked in multiple " DATA BREACHES '' companies, bureaus and social security administration.

Consumer complaint narrative:
VALIDATION AND CEASE AND DESIST XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Dear ( Debt Collector ) I recently received a debt collection notice from your office. I am writing to verify that you have contacted the correct individual and to request that you provide documentation confirming this. Please supply me with a copy of any contract or agreement signed with your company or the original creditor. 

In accordance with the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I request the following information : XXXX. The name and address of the original creditor and the current creditor. 
XXXX. Verification of the debt amount you are seeking to collect, including evidence that a contract exists creating the amount you claim is owed. 
XXXX. Documentation of all assignments showing the transfer of the debt from the original creditor to the current creditor. 
XXXX. Proof that the original creditor securitized the debt. 
XXXX. Documentation showing the assignments of the debt from the original creditor to the secured trust and then back to the original creditor. 

Please cease and desist from collecting on this debt until you have provided validation of the debt. 

Additionally, I request that you do not access my credit report or report anything to my credit bureaus. I dispute the validity of this debt amount, and this dispute should be reflected on my credit report if you have already reported this debt. 

Permissible Purpose : Please state your permissible purpose for accessing my credit information. I dispute your right to do so. 

Notification to Other Collectors : I dispute that I owe this debt to you. Should you transfer this debt to another collector, please inform them of my dispute regarding the validity of this debt. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally request your assistance in resolving a critical issue regarding inaccuracies on my credit report, which have severely impacted my ability to purchase a home. I discovered that my student loan accounts are being reported with a " collection '' or " charged off '' status, despite my consistent good standing and compliance with all repayment obligations. This erroneous reporting violates the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically 15 U.S.C. 1681g, as it fails to ensure the accuracy and integrity of the information being reported.

The emotional distress caused by this situation is profound, as the inaccurate reporting has obstructed my ability to achieve homeownership, a significant milestone in my life. I respectfully request that the CFPB investigate this matter promptly and work with the relevant credit reporting agencies and loan servicers to correct these inaccuracies and remove the erroneous information from my credit report.

Thank you for your time and attention to this matter.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am submitting this formal complaint regarding violations of federal and California state laws by XXXX XXXX, and consumer reporting agencies, EXPERIAN, XXXX, and XXXX. These entities have engaged in unlawful practices that infringe upon my federally and state-protected rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ), Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act ( GLBA ), Privacy Act of 1974, Federal Trade Commission ACT / Holder Rule , and related California laws .

According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act 15 USC 1681 section 602 ( a ) states, " There is a need to ensure that consumer reporting agencies exercise their grave responsibilities with fairness, impartiality, and a respect for the consumers right to privacy. XXXX, XXXX, AND EXPERIAN, are consumer reporting agencies, and I am the Consumer. I have the right to make sure my private information isn't shared which is supported by 15 USC 6801 which states It is the policy of the Congress that each financial institution has an affirmative and continuing obligation to respect the privacy of its customers and to protect the security and confidentiality of those customers nonpublic personal information. '' XXXX XXXX is a financial institution by definition under that title. 15 USC 1681 section 604 a section 2 states that " In general Subject to subsection ( c ), any consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report under the following circumstances and no other : in accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates. XXXX XXXX and the Consumer reporting agencies XXXX, XXXX AND EXPERIAN do not have my consent to furnish this information, and they surely do not have my written consent. Any and all consent that may have been given to XXXX, XXXX, EXPERIAN, and XXXX XXXX whether it be verbal, non-verbal, written, implied or otherwise is revoked. 15 USC 6802 ( b ) ( c ) states that A financial institution may not disclose non-public personal information to a nonaffiliated third party unless the consumer is given an explanation of how the consumer can exercise that nondisclosure option. XXXX XXXX never informed me of my right to exercise my nondisclosure option. Not only that 15 USC 1681C ( a ) ( 5 ) states, Except as authorized under subsection ( b ), no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information Any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years. '' This account is an adverse item they are reporting again without my permission which is against the law. Under 15 USC 1681 Section 604 ( a ), agencies are prohibited from furnishing reports without explicit written instructions from the consumer. I have not provided such instructions, yet my information has been unlawfully reported. 
There should be no late payments being reported to any of my accounts. Payment history is illegal to post to a credit report. 15 USC Code 1681 ( b ) outlines Permissible purposes of consumer reports. Per 15 USC 1681c - Requirements relating to information contained in consumer reports, no adverse item besides the conviction of crimes should be in your report. Any item that is a derogatory mark is not allowed into consumer reports without the consumers consent. " Violation of 15 USC 1681a ( 2 ) ( a ) ( i ) and 1681s-2 ( a ) - XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX inaccurate and misleading information to consumer reporting agencies, including EXPERIAN, XXXX, and XXXX, XXXX violation of 15 U.S. Code 1681a ( 2 ) ( a ) ( i ) and 15 U.S. Code 1681s-2 ( a ). Specifically, the FCRA states that consumer reports should not include information solely related to transactions or experiences ( e.g., payment history, charge-off status ) between a consumer and the entity reporting, XXXX XXXX XXXX Additionally, 15 U.S. Code 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) prohibits a furnisher from providing any information to a consumer reporting agency if they know or have reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate. Despite my notification to XXXX XXXX regarding inaccuracies in their reporting, they have failed to cease furnishing incorrect data to these agencies. As a federally protected consumer, I hereby demand that XXXX XXXX immediately cease all reporting of inaccurate information and correct the errors with all consumer reporting agencies. 
Breach of Privacy Act of XXXX and Unauthorized Sharing of Information : XXXX XXXX violated the Privacy Act of XXXX by unlawfully sharing my personal financial information with non-affiliated third parties, specifically EXPERIAN, XXXX, and XXXX, which are not affiliates of XXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXX own terms and conditions prohibit sharing such information with non-affiliates, yet they have disregarded this obligation. Per the Privacy Act of 1974 ( 5 U.S. Code 552 ( a ), I hereby revoke any and all authorizations given written, verbal, non-verbal that may have been previously provided to XXXX XXXX. Effective immediately, XXXX XXXX is prohibited from sharing, reporting, or distributing any of my personal or financial information to any third party, including consumer reporting agencies. 
Non-Compliance with Opt-Out Provisions under 15 U.S.C. 6802 ( Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act ) : As a federally protected consumer under the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act ( 15 U.S.C. 6802 ), I hereby opt-out of any and all authorizations, written or verbal, that I may have provided to XXXX XXXX regarding the sharing of my personal information. XXXX XXXX has failed to honor its obligations under federal law by continuing to share my information without proper authorization, and I demand immediate compliance. 
XXXX XXXX has inaccurately reported information about transactions and experiences, such as late payments and charge-off statuses, in violation of 15 U.S.C. 1681a ( a ) ( 2 ) ( A ) ( i ) and 1681s-2 ( a ). It is illegal for a consumer reporting agency to report a consumer 's experiences and transactions, including payment history. These " late payments '' must be removed, and this account must be updated immediately. Despite being notified of these inaccuracies, they continue to furnish misleading information to Experian, XXXX, and XXXX, which also violates 15 U.S.C. 1666 ( a ), as they failed to send periodic statements at least 21 days before the due date, improperly marking payments as late. I have not received the required notices or statements, which caused further harm to my credit profile.

Per 15 U.S.C. 1666 ( a ) Time to make payments : A creditor may not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open-end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose, unless the creditor has adopted reasonable procedures designed to ensure that each periodic statement including the information required by section 1637 ( b ) of this title is mailed or delivered to the consumer not later than twenty-one days before the payment due date. XXXX XXXX is in violation of this code. 
Violations of the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ) Failure to Address Credit Balances ( 15 U.S.C. 1666d ) : When a credit balance exceeding {$1.00} arises from payments, rebates, or other transactions, the creditor must : ( A ) Credit the amount to the consumer 's account. ( B ) Refund any remaining balance upon the consumer 's request. ( C ) Make a good-faith effort to refund balances exceeding six months unless the consumer 's current location can not be determined. I formally requested documentary evidence under 15 U.S.C. 1666 ( b ) ( 2 ) and 44 to clarify disputed amounts and resolve the BILLING ERROR NOTICE sent to XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX. XXXX XXXX has failed to comply with these provisions, depriving me of the rightful return of funds. Failure to Provide Documentary Evidence ( 15 U.S.C. 1666 ( b ) ( 2 ) and 44 ) : Under these sections, I again formally request documentary evidence, including books of account, to clarify disputed amounts and resolve this billing error. Forfeiture of Collection Rights ( 15 U.S.C. 1666 ( e ) ) : Creditors who fail to address disputes and comply with billing error resolution requirements forfeit their rights to collect on disputed amounts. The creditors continued noncompliance means they have forfeited the right to collect on all past, present, and future amounts related to this account. 
XXXX XXXX, Experian, XXXX, and XXXX have also violated the Privacy Act of 1974 ( 5 U.S.C. 552a ) by unlawfully sharing my personal financial information with non-affiliated third parties, including consumer reporting agencies, without authorization.

Violation of 16 CFR 433.1 and 433.2 Under the FTCs Holder Rule ( 16 CFR Part 433 ), creditors are not exempt from responsibility for compliance with consumer protections. Specifically, according to 16 CFR 433.3 ( a ), any seller who has taken or received an open-end consumer credit contract before XX/XX/XXXX, shall be exempt from certain requirements only if the contract does not cut off the consumer 's claims and defenses. Any attempts by this creditor to waive or limit my rights are invalid under these provisions. Despite this, XXXX XXXX has attempted to limit my rights by reporting false and inaccurate data. Section 5 of the FTC Act prohibits unfair and deceptive practices, mandating that consumer credit reports be accurately maintained.

Under California Civil Code 1785.25 ( a ), furnishing inaccurate or incomplete information to consumer reporting agencies is prohibited. XXXX XXXX has knowingly submitted false data. California Civil Code 1785.31 allows consumers to seek damages for inaccuracies. Additionally, under the California Financial Code 4052-4053, financial institutions must disclose how personal financial information is shared or used, which XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX do. 
I formally exercise my right to opt out of any disclosures of my personal information under 15 U.S.C. 6802 ( GLBA ), 12 CFR 1016.7 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( ii ), and 16 CFR 313.7. FORM OF OPT OUT NOTICE TO CONSUMERS/OPT OUT METHODS- SECTION ( f ) A consumer may opt out at any time. I revoke all implied or expressed consent for the use or disclosure of my data. Additionally, under the Privacy Act of 1974, my Social Security number must not be disclosed to any third parties except federal agencies as required by law.

The penalties for these violations are substantial. Violations of GLBA result in civil penalties of up to {$100000.00} per violation, personal liability for officers and directors of up to {$10000.00} per violation, and possible imprisonment. TILA violations may incur damages of up to {$1000.00} per violation, class action damages up to {$500000.00} or 1 % of the creditors net worth, and legal fees. Under the FTC Act, deceptive practices can lead to significant fines and corrective measures.

Removal of erroneous hard Inquiries : Pursuant to 17 CFR 424, I hereby demand that XXXX, XXXX, and Experian remove all inquiries related to my personal information that are not linked to an active account from your records and any third-party reporting systems, including credit agencies, within XXXX business days. These inquiries include : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, TX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX, MI XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX, NC XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX TN XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, PA XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX  SD XXXX XXXX XXXX 
I formally request that XXXX XXXX and the consumer reporting agencies including XXXX, XXXX, and Experian immediately cease all unauthorized sharing of my personal information, correct all inaccuracies in my credit reports, and provide the accounting per the NOTICE OF BILLING ERROR. These entities must adhere to my opt-out rights under 15 U.S.C. 6802-6805, prohibiting further distribution or processing of my data without my explicit consent. Compliance with the Privacy Act of 1974 is also required to prevent any unauthorized handling or dissemination of my personal information.

The unlawful practices described have caused significant financial harm, emotional distress, and reputational damage. The continued sharing of private information, inaccurate reporting of adverse items, and failure to address disputes have severely compromised my financial stability and undermined my rights as a federally protected consumer. 
I urge the CFPB to investigate these violations thoroughly and impose appropriate enforcement actions. If these issues are not resolved promptly, I reserve the right to pursue additional legal remedies.

I would like to lodge a formal and strong complaint against Experian, a credit reporting agency. Every time I attempt to freeze or unfreeze my credit report, I am forced to spend countless hours navigating a frustrating system of phone numbers, only to achieve no meaningful results. 

Additionally, every time I set a password, I am told upon my next login attempt that it is incorrect, which traps me in an endless loop of automated recordings and unhelpful prompts. This lack of effective customer support and resolution is unacceptable. 

How can Experian be entrusted with overseeing and reporting consumer credit when the company itself demonstrates a lack of credibility, efficiency, and adequate consumer support? This situation urgently requires attention and improvement.

Consumer complaint narrative: I lodged a complaint with these Bureaus a month ago, but unfortunately, the inaccurate information on my report still remains. Consumer complaint narrative:
I recently conducted a review of my credit report and found several items that have caused me significant distress. These items appear to be unverifiable, inaccurate, and questionable. Your agency has failed to ensure the accuracy of the information as required under 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ) Accuracy of Reports. This statute mandates that consumer reporting agencies must follow reasonable procedures to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of the information they report. 

Furthermore, under 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) Treatment of Inaccurate or Unverifiable Information, you are required to promptly delete or modify any information found to be inaccurate, incomplete, or unverifiable during a reinvestigation. If you are unable to provide me with verifiable proof of the accuracy of the disputed items within 15 days of your investigation, these accounts and the related information must be removed from my credit report. 

Additionally, under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I do not recognize any of the alleged creditors or debt collectors. I have never entered into a valid contract with any of these entities, nor have I engaged in any transactions with them. As such, these accounts are fraudulent and and inaccurate information. 

Moreover, under the Fair Credit Billing Act, my right to privacy has been violated, and this breach infringes upon my rights as outlined in The Privacy Act of 1974. Removing the inaccurate and fraudulent information from my credit report will help restore my privacy and prevent further violations.

Desired Resolution : I request the CFPB to compel XXXX to : XXXX. Investigate and Remove the Fraudulent Account : Immediately investigate and remove all accounts and activity associated with my identity without authorization. 
XXXX. Provide Documentation of Account Activity : XXXX should provide evidence of how and when the account was opened, including the identification used. 
XXXX. Confirm Resolution in Writing : XXXX must confirm in writing that the fraudulent account has been removed and that I am not liable for any associated charges or obligations. 
XXXX. Prevent Future Identity Theft : XXXX should implement stronger identity verification processes to prevent similar issues in the future.

I trust the CFPB will ensure XXXX fulfills its obligations under the law and resolves this matter promptly. 

Please contact me at XXXX or XXXX if additional information is required. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
I recently conducted a review of my credit report and found several items that have caused me significant distress. These items appear to be unverifiable, inaccurate, and questionable. Your agency has failed to ensure the accuracy of the information as required under 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ) Accuracy of Reports. This statute mandates that consumer reporting agencies must follow reasonable procedures to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of the information they report.

Furthermore, under 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) Treatment of Inaccurate or Unverifiable Information, you are required to promptly delete or modify any information found to be inaccurate, incomplete, or unverifiable during a reinvestigation. If you are unable to provide me with verifiable proof of the accuracy of the disputed items within 15 days of your investigation, these accounts and the related information must be removed from my credit report. 

Additionally, under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I do not recognize any of the alleged creditors or debt collectors. I have never entered into a valid contract with any of these entities, nor have I engaged in any transactions with them. As such, these accounts are fraudulent and and inaccurate information. 

Moreover, under the Fair Credit Billing Act, my right to privacy has been violated, and this breach infringes upon my rights as outlined in The Privacy Act of 1974. Removing the inaccurate and fraudulent information from my credit report will help restore my privacy and prevent further violations.

Consumer complaint narrative:
# # Summary for CFPB and FCRA Complaint **Subject : ** Formal Complaint Regarding Credit Reporting and Debt Collection Violations **Address : ** XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  Summary of Issues : This complaint highlights systemic violations by multiple creditors, furnishers, and credit reporting agencies ( CRAs ), resulting in severe inaccuracies and harm to my credit profile. The following issues are identified : -- - # # # **Violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) : ** 1. **Failure to Conduct Reasonable Investigation : ** - Section 1681s-2 ( b ) : Creditors and CRAs failed to conduct proper investigations after disputes were filed. 

2. **Inaccurate Information Reporting : ** - Section 1681e ( b ) : CRAs failed to ensure the accuracy of information reported, including : - Incorrect payment history. 
- Re-aging of delinquent accounts. 
- Misrepresentation of charge-offs as active accounts. 

3. **Improper Reinvestigation : ** - Section 1681i ( a ) : CRAs did not reinvestigate disputed items in good faith, leaving inaccuracies unresolved. 

4. **Incorrect Reporting Beyond Statutory Limits : ** - Section 1681c : Charge-offs and delinquency dates were improperly reported beyond the allowable statutory period. 

-- - # # # **Violations of the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ) : ** 1. **Failure to Provide Clear Disclosures : ** - Section 1026.17 : Credit terms, including payment schedules and fees, were not disclosed accurately.

2. **Misrepresentation of Finance Terms : ** - Section 1026.18 : Credit transactions were misrepresented as loans, misleading the borrower about the nature of the agreement. 

-- - # # # **Violations of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) : ** 1. **Unauthorized Communication : ** - Section 1692c : Debt collectors communicated without my consent or proper authorization.

2. **False or Misleading Representations : ** - Section 1692e : - Misrepresentation of debt character, amount, and legal status. 
- Threatening legal actions not intended to be taken or legally permissible. 
- Communicating false information to CRAs, including disputed accounts. 

3. **Use of Deceptive Forms : ** - Section 1692j : Debt collectors furnished deceptive forms to create the false belief that a third party was involved in debt collection. 

-- - # # # **Impact of Violations : ** 1. **Financial Harm : ** - Loss of creditworthiness, denial of credit opportunities, and increased borrowing costs. 

2. **Emotional Distress : ** - Harassment and stress caused by deceptive and inaccurate reporting.

3. **Interstate Commerce Impact : ** - These violations disrupt fair credit reporting and debt collection practices, negatively affecting financial systems reliant on accurate data.

-- - # # # **Requested Action : ** 1. **Immediate Investigation and Correction : ** - Ensure all inaccuracies are corrected on my credit report across all CRAs. 

2. **Accountability for Violators : ** - Impose statutory penalties and sanctions against entities responsible for these violations.

3. **Compensation : ** - Request damages for financial harm and emotional distress under the FCRA , TILA, and FDCPA provisions.

4. **Regulatory Oversight : ** - Recommend increased oversight and auditing of the involved entities to prevent recurrence. 

**Attachments : ** Detailed exhibits and supporting documents have been provided for review. 
# # # Comprehensive Dispute Document **Subject : ** Full-Proof Dispute with Supporting Exhibits, Violations, and Remedies for Injury\ **From : **\ **Date : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX : This letter serves as a formal dispute regarding the inaccurate and incomplete information reported by [ Creditor/Furnisher Name ] to the credit reporting agencies ( CRAs ). This dispute is made pursuant to my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ), and other applicable laws. 

-- - # # # # VIOLATIONS IDENTIFIED : 1. **FCRA Violations : ** - **Section 1681s-2 ( b ) : ** Failure to conduct a reasonable investigation upon notification of a dispute. 
- **Section 1681e ( b ) : ** Failure to maintain accurate information.

- **Section 1681i ( a ) : ** Failure of the CRA to conduct proper reinvestigation upon dispute. 
- **Section 1681c : ** Incorrect reporting of charge-offs and aging beyond the statutory limit. 

2. **TILA Violations : ** - **Section 1026.17 : ** Failure to provide clear and accurate disclosures related to credit terms. 
- **Section 1026.18 : ** Misrepresentation of finance charges and annual percentage rates ( APR ). 
- **Misrepresentation of Credit Terms : ** Incorrectly labeling credit transactions as loans. 

3. **FDCPA Violations : ** - **Section 1692c : ** Communication without my consent and without proper authorization.

- **Section 1692e : ** Misrepresentation of the character, amount, or legal status of a debt. Specific violations include : - ** ( 2 ) : ** Misrepresentation of the character, amount, or legal status of any debt.

- ** ( 5 ) : ** Threat to take action that can not legally be taken or is not intended to be taken. 
- ** ( 8 ) : ** Communicating false credit information or failing to indicate a disputed debt.

- **Section 1692j : ** Furnishing deceptive forms to create the false belief that a person other than the creditor is collecting a debt. 

4. **Contract Breaches : ** - Aging and re-aging of payment history without basis. 
- Unauthorized sale of property or accounts without proper notice. 

-- - # # # # REMEDIES FOR INJURY : 1. **FCRA Violations : ** - **Statutory Damages : ** Up to \ {$1000.00} per violation under 15 U.S. Code 1681n. 
- **Actual Damages : ** Compensation for financial harm, emotional distress, and loss of credit opportunities. 

2. **TILA Violations : ** - **Statutory Damages : ** Up to \ {$5000.00} for each instance of non-compliance under 15 U.S. Code 1640.

3. **FDCPA Violations : ** - **Statutory Damages : ** Up to \ {$1000.00} per violation under 15 U.S. Code 1692k. 

4. **Contract Breaches and Misrepresentation : ** - **Damages for Loss of Property Value : ** Compensation for unauthorized sales or breaches.

- **Equitable Relief : ** Nullification of contracts improperly formed or executed. 

-- - # # # # DISPUTED ACCOUNTS AND DETAILS : 1. **Account Name : ** XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX 

- **Account Number : ** XXXX - XXXX : ** Inaccurate reporting of balance and delinquency. Misrepresentation of charge-off status without proper updates after sale.

XXXX. **Account Name : ** XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX - **Account Number : ** XXXX - **Issues : ** Re-aging of delinquency dates. Charged-off account reported as active, contrary to the FCRA. 
- **Supporting Exhibit : ** Refer to Exhibit B and Exhibit D. 

XXXX. **Account Name : ** XXXX XXXX XXXX - XXXX XXXX : ** XXXX - XXXX : ** Improper reporting of sold charge-offs as active accounts. Violation of FDCPA for harassment and misleading representations. 
- **Supporting Exhibit : ** Refer to Exhibit C and Exhibit D. 

4. **Account Name : ** XXXX XXXX XXXX - **Account Number : ** XXXX - XXXX : ** Re-aging of accounts, misrepresentation of payment history, and improper closure status. Violations include inaccurate reporting under FCRA and TILA. 
- **Supporting Exhibit : ** Refer to Exhibit E and Exhibit F.

- **Supporting Exhibit : ** Refer to Exhibit G and Exhibit H. 

6. **Account Name : ** XXXX XXXX, XXXX.

-- - NXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Consumer Financial Protection Bureau XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Re : Formal Complaint Against Credit Reporting Agencies and Debt Buyers for Misconduct , Inaccuracies, Unauthorized Inquiries, and Incorrect Personal Information on My Credit Report Agencies XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX 
Experian, XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Dear CFPB, I am filing this formal complaint regarding several violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) by credit reporting agencies and debt buyers. These violations include inaccurate reporting of charge-offs, unauthorized inquiries, incorrect personal information ADDRESS NAMES, and errors that continue to harm my credit profile. Despite my efforts to resolve these matters directly, the violations remain unaddressed. I seek your intervention to enforce the law and hold the responsible parties accountable. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Re : Violations of Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) I recently got a copy of my consumer file and noticed that there was inaccurate information. According to the FCRA you must be reporting 100 % correct information at all times and that is not what my credit file reflects at this time. You have 30 days to remove the personal information listed in this letter. I am also requesting you to provide me with the furnisher of this information or where you got this information from. Please PERMANENTLY REMOVE the following. 
This letter serves as a demand for immediate corrective actions, including the removal of inaccurate information from my credit report and the imposition of appropriate fines and penalties for your non-compliance.the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S. Code 1681, and the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), 15 U.S. Code 1692. I demand immediate corrective actions, including the removal of inaccurate information, imposition of fines, and enforcement of compliance with relevant laws You are referring to a portion of 15 U.S. Code 1681c ( a ), which outlines restrictions on the inclusion of certain types of information in consumer reports. Here 's a rewritten version of the relevant clause with clarity on what consumer reporting agencies can not include : Consumer reporting agencies are prohibited from including in a consumer report any adverse items of information ( other than records of convictions of crimes ) that are older than 7 years. This includes adverse financial data such as : Accounts sent to collections. 
Charged-off accounts. 
Any other negative financial information. 
However, records of convictions of crimes are an exception to this rule and may be reported beyond the 7-year limitation.

This provision ensures that outdated and irrelevant negative information ( except criminal convictions ) does not unfairly impact a consumer 's creditworthiness or access to opportunities.

Here 's a clear summary : 15 U.S. Code 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) - Duty of Furnishers to Provide Accurate Information 1. Prohibition on Reporting Inaccurate Information : A furnisher ( such as a creditor or lender ) can not knowingly furnish information to a consumer reporting agency if : The information is inaccurate. 
The furnisher has reason to believe the information is inaccurate. 
2. Obligation to Update and Correct Information : If the furnisher discovers that previously provided information is inaccurate or incomplete, they must : Promptly correct or update the information.

Notify all consumer reporting agencies to which the inaccurate information was furnished.

Under 15 U.S. Code 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( B ), it is explicitly prohibited for any person to furnish information to a consumer reporting agency if : The information relates to a transaction or experience ( e.g., payment history ) that the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe involves an illegal activity.

This includes any dealings or transactions, such as reporting payment history or account activities, that are associated with unlawful conduct. Reporting such information is considered a violation of federal law and undermines the integrity of consumer reporting. 
Let me know if you need help drafting this into a formal letter or document! 
Under 15 U.S. Code 1681b ( f ), the illegal reporting of inquiries refers to the prohibition of accessing or furnishing consumer reports for impermissible purposes. Here 's how this applies : Illegal Reporting of Inquiries : A consumer reporting agency or any person shall not obtain or use a consumer report unless : 1. The report is requested for a permissible purpose as outlined in 15 U.S. Code 1681b ( a ) ( e.g., credit applications, employment, insurance underwriting ). 
2. The requester has a legitimate business need for the information, authorized by the consumer or required by law.

If an inquiry appears on a consumer 's credit report without a valid permissible purpose or the consumer 's authorization, this constitutes illegal reporting of inquiries. Such unauthorized inquiries can harm a consumer 's credit score or appear as misuse of their personal information. 

Would you like help drafting a dispute letter to address unauthorized inquiries or further explanation of permissible purposes?

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally dispute the validity of the account reported by your agency on my credit report, as noted on XX/XX/year>. I have no knowledge of this account and am not aware of any obligation to pay the debt you claim I owe. I believe this account is either a result of an error or fraud, and I respectfully request that you provide all documentation proving the legitimacy of this account. 

This account, which is currently affecting my credit, is causing significant harm to my financial standing and impeding my ability to thrive. The presence of this inaccurate information is creating unnecessary obstacles, preventing me from obtaining credit, securing housing, and pursuing opportunities that would allow me to move forward in life. 
In addition, I believe your actions are in violation of my rights under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), specifically under the provisions of 15 U.S.C. 1692g ( the right to dispute a debt ) and 15 U.S.C. 1692c ( the prohibition on certain communications with consumers ). You have failed to provide the required documentation in a timely and proper manner, and your communication practices have not adhered to the protections afforded to me under the law.

Given these violations, I am requesting the following : 1. A full investigation into the validity of the reported debt, including all relevant documentation.

2. The immediate removal of this account from my credit report, as it is incorrect and violates my rights under the FDCPA.

3. Compensation for the financial and emotional damages I have incurred as a result of the violation of my rights.

Please respond to this dispute in writing within 30 days of receipt of this letter, in accordance with the requirements of the FDCPA. Failure to do so will leave me with no choice but to pursue further legal action to protect my rights.

Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally file a complaint regarding inaccurate and misleading information being reported on my credit report by Experian. Specifically, I am addressing issues with a XXXX XXXX  account that is reporting in violation of credit reporting regulations. The following inaccuracies are causing significant harm to my credit score, and I am requesting immediate action to correct or remove these entries. 

XXXX. Re-aged Account The XXXX XXXX  account is being reported with a re-aged date, which is a violation of credit reporting standards. This account should reflect its original date of delinquency and not a re-aged or altered date. This deliberate misrepresentation is harmful to my credit profile, and I demand the immediate removal of the re-aged date. 

XXXX. Balance on Closed Account The XXXXXXXX XXXX  account is also showing a balance despite being closed. A closed account should not reflect any outstanding balance. This inaccurate information is misleading and must be corrected immediately by removing the balance reported on this account. 

XXXX. Account Showing as Over the Limit The same account is incorrectly reporting as over the credit limit, despite being closed. A closed account should not be subject to over-limit reporting, and this misrepresentation of the accounts status is not only misleading but also unlawful. 

These inaccuracies are in direct violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), which mandates that all information reported to credit bureaus must be accurate and complete. The continued presence of these errors is damaging my credit score and may have broader implications on my financial well-being. 

I request that Experian immediately investigate and correct the reporting of this XXXXXXXX XXXX account. The re-aged date must be removed, the balance on the closed account must be eliminated, and the over-limit status must be corrected to accurately reflect the closed status of the account. If Experian is unable to correct these inaccuracies, I request that they be removed entirely from my credit report. 

Please acknowledge receipt of this complaint and confirm the actions taken to resolve these issues. I trust that the CFPB will assist in ensuring that my credit report accurately reflects my financial history and that these discrepancies are resolved promptly. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to a timely resolution.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing to demand immediate action to address the inaccurate, damaging, and negligent reporting related to two XXXX XXXX accounts and a lawsuit filed against me that has since been dismissed for want of prosecution ( DWOP ). Despite my efforts over the past three years to provide evidence of identity theft, neither XXXX XXXX nor the credit bureaus ( Experian, XXXX, and XXXX ) have taken appropriate steps to resolve this matter. 

Here are the critical facts of this issue : 1. Identity Theft and Disputed Accounts : I was a victim of identity, a time during which two XXXX XXXX accounts in good standing were fraudulently used. 
I provided police reports and a Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) Identity Theft Report to XXXX XXXX and the credit bureaus, documenting this crime and disputing the debts. 
Despite clear evidence that these debts were not mine, XXXX XXXX refused to acknowledge the theft or resolve the accounts appropriately. 
2. Lawsuit Filed and Dismissed : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  pursued legal action against me in 2024, despite the ongoing identity theft dispute and my inability to pay for debts that were not mine. 
On XX/XX/year>, the court dismissed the case for want of prosecution ( DWOP ), with no judgment entered against me. This dismissal further supports my position that this debt is invalid and should not have been pursued in the first place. 
3. Credit Reporting Negligence : Despite the dismissal and my repeated disputes, all three credit bureaus continue to report inaccurate and derogatory information related to these accounts and lawsuit. 
The excuse provided by Experianthat the lawsuit was filed and therefore can not be removedis baseless given that the case was dismissed, and the accounts were the result of identity theft. 
The continued failure to address this issue violates the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), which mandates accurate and fair credit reporting. 

This negligence has severely impacted my credit standing and financial stability for years. The prolonged failure to remove fraudulent accounts and the erroneous lawsuit from my credit file has caused undue hardship, limiting my ability to rebuild after the closure of my business.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I recently discovered several inaccuracies on my credit report that need immediate investigation and correction under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). Specifically : Multiple accounts, including those with XXXX, XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, and XXXX  XXXX, are inaccurately reporting late payments. Per 15 U.S.C. 1681i, I am disputing these inaccuracies and requesting the accounts be updated to reflect a status of paid as agreed/never late. 

The XXXX account is listed without proper validation. Under 15 U.S.C. 1692g ( b ), I have the right to request verification of the debt. I am demanding documentation such as the original signed agreement and proof of authorization to collect. If this validation is not provided, this entry must be removed from my report. 

There are unauthorized hard inquiries from XXXX XXXX  ( XX/XX/XXXX ), XXXX  ( XX/XX/XXXX ), and XXXX XXXX  ( XX/XX/XXXX ). Per 15 U.S.C. 1681n, these inquiries must be deleted unless evidence of my explicit consent is provided. 

My credit report includes an incorrect address : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, GA, XXXX. This must be removed immediately under 15 U.S.C. 1681i, as it does not belong to me. 

These inaccuracies not only misrepresent my financial history but also violate my rights under federal law. Credit reporting agencies are required to conduct thorough investigations within 30 days under 15 U.S.C. 1681i. They are also liable for damages if they fail to comply, as outlined in 15 U.S.C. 1681n and 15 U.S.C. 1681o.

I am requesting a detailed explanation of the procedures used during the investigation, per 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 6 ) ( B ) ( iii ), along with a corrected copy of my credit report. If these issues are not resolved promptly, I am prepared to escalate the matter by filing complaints with the CFPB and FTC or pursuing legal remedies. 

My goal is to ensure my credit report accurately reflects my financial history, and I expect this matter to be addressed with the urgency and thoroughness it requires. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Problem with personal statement of dispute
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally dispute an inaccurate entry on my credit report, which I pulled on XX/XX/2024. Specifically, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX account is incorrectly reported as closed, with inaccurate multiple payment history dates. Despite this, you have continued to verify and report the information as accurate, without providing any supporting documentation to substantiate its accuracy. 

This failure to correct the error is a violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically under 15 USC 1681i, which requires credit bureaus to investigate and verify disputed information within 30 days. As such, I request that you promptly investigate this matter and remove or correct the inaccurate information from my credit report. 

If the inaccurate information is not corrected within the required 30-day timeframe, I will be forced to pursue legal action under 15 USC 1692g .

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Notice of Deletion of XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Charge-Off and Request for Removal from All Credit Reports Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing to inform you of the recent deletion of a charge-off from my XXXX credit report related to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) . The account, identified as " XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, '' had a reported balance of {$1000.00} and was listed as a charge-off. 

As of XX/XX/year>, after submitting a formal dispute, XXXX completed their investigation and deleted the account from my XXXX report. Please find the relevant details of the account : Account Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Type : Charge-Off Amount : {$1000.00} Dispute Resolution Date : XX/XX/year> Outcome : Account Deleted According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), a consumer is entitled to accurate and verifiable information being reported on their credit report. Since XXXX has completed their investigation and determined that the information is unverifiable, they have deleted this account from my XXXX credit file. 

In light of the deletion from XXXX, I kindly request that all other credit reporting agencies, including but not limited to XXXX, Experian, and XXXX, conduct a thorough review of this account. If these agencies can not verify this debt, I am requesting that they remove the account from my credit reports as well. The FCRA mandates that credit reporting agencies must ensure that any information they report is accurate, and if they can not verify the information, it must be deleted. 

Legal Basis for Removal : Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) Section 1681i : This section states that if any information is found to be inaccurate or unverifiable during a dispute process, it must be removed or corrected. Given that XXXX has deleted the account, the other CRAs are obligated to ensure their reports reflect accurate and verified information. 

Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) Section 1681e ( b ) : Requires that credit reporting agencies maintain procedures to ensure the accuracy of the information reported. 

Please take notice that I am requesting the removal of this unverifiable account within 30 days or less. If the account is not removed in the specified timeframe, I reserve the right to pursue legal action, including suing for violation of my rights under the FCRA. I understand that under FCRA Section 1681n, I may be entitled to seek damages if my rights have been violated, including statutory damages and attorney fees. 

I look forward to your prompt resolution of this matter and expect that the unverifiable account will be removed within the legally required timeframe.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear CFPB, I am writing to file a formal complaint against Experian regarding their handling of my dispute related to identity theft and a fraudulent account reported on my credit report. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I reported to Experian that an account from XXXX  XXXX XXXX was incorrectly listed under my name, and that this account was opened fraudulently without my authorization. The account was created under the status of an 'authorized user ' using my personal information, which I did not consent to. I specifically stated that I do not have any account with XXXX  XXXX XXXX and requested Experian to investigate this as a case of identity theft. 

However, Experian declined to dispute the account. I then submitted another dispute request on XX/XX/XXXX, followed by another request on XX/XX/XXXX. Each time, Experian denied my request to remove or dispute this false account. 

I have provided Experian with a police report verifying that I am a victim of identity theft and have repeatedly asked them to provide the full XXXX  XXXX XXXX account number listed on my credit report. Despite these requests, Experian has refused to provide the full account number, citing that they can not see the complete number on their end. I find this particularly troubling, as Experian has made the determination that this is my account without being able to access all relevant information. Furthermore, XXXX  XXXX XXXX has confirmed that there is no account associated with my personal information or Social Security number in their records. 

Additionally, I have verified that this fraudulent account does not appear on my credit reports from XXXX or XXXX, further indicating that this is an error or fraud that Experian is mishandling. 

Experian 's repeated denials of my dispute requests and their failure to provide full account details are causing me undue stress and harm, as this fraudulent account continues to appear on my credit report. I am concerned that Experian is not properly investigating this case or adhering to the procedures necessary to protect my rights as a consumer. 

I am requesting your assistance in investigating this matter and ensuring that Experian properly disputes the fraudulent account, removes it from my credit report, and provides me with the information necessary to further address this issue with XXXX  XXXX XXXX. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your support in resolving this issue. Here is the latest declined dispute report with Experian for your reference # XXXX Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX # XXXX XXXX TX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
I recently conducted a review of my credit report and found several items that have caused me significant distress. These items appear to be unverifiable, inaccurate, and questionable. Your agency has failed to ensure the accuracy of the information as required under 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ) Accuracy of Reports. This statute mandates that consumer reporting agencies must follow reasonable procedures to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of the information they report.

Furthermore, under 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) Treatment of Inaccurate or Unverifiable Information, you are required to promptly delete or modify any information found to be inaccurate, incomplete, or unverifiable during a reinvestigation. If you are unable to provide me with verifiable proof of the accuracy of the disputed items within 15 days of your investigation, these accounts and the related information must be removed from my credit report.

Additionally, under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I do not recognize any of the alleged creditors or debt collectors. I have never entered into a valid contract with any of these entities, nor have I engaged in any transactions with them. As such, these accounts are fraudulent and and inaccurate information.

Moreover, under the Fair Credit Billing Act, my right to privacy has been violated, and this breach infringes upon my rights as outlined in The Privacy Act of 1974. Removing the inaccurate and fraudulent information from my credit report will help restore my privacy and prevent further violations.

I previously disputed the accuracy and legitimacy of several items on my credit report, yet your agency has failed to act in accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ).

I demand that the following items be deleted immediately from my credit report :

Consumer complaint narrative:
I conducted a review of my credit report and identified several inaccuracies and potential violations of federal laws, including unauthorized hard inquiries, inaccurate reporting of late payments, and unverified debts. Specifically : Multiple accounts inaccurately reflect late payments, which violates 15 U.S.C. 1666 and related regulations under 12 C.F.R. 1026.13. These entries are incorrectly reported as late, despite the fact that payments were made as agreed.

Several debts are being reported without proper validation, in violation of 15 U.S.C. 1692g. I am requesting that debt collectors provide specific documentation, including contracts or agreements bearing my signature, to verify their claims. Without this validation, these debts must be removed as per federal requirements.

Numerous unauthorized hard inquiries are present on my credit report, which constitutes a breach under 15 U.S.C. 1681n for willful noncompliance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). These inquiries were conducted without my consent and must be deleted immediately.

In essence, my rights under the FCRA and related statutes have been violated, and I am demanding that these inaccuracies be promptly investigated and corrected to prevent further harm to my credit profile and financial wellbeing.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing to formally lodge a complaint regarding the repeated failure of XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX to properly investigate and validate disputed information on my credit report, as required under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), codified at 15 U.S.C. 1681. Despite my numerous disputes and lawful requests for validation and verification, the credit reporting agencies have failed to provide evidence substantiating their claims and continue to report inaccurate and unverified information.

To summarize : 1.Failure to Provide Proper Validation : I requested the following documents to validate the alleged debts : Validation of the debt ( including actual accounting ) ; Verification of the claim against me ( such as a sworn affidavit or a hand-signed invoice compliant with the Bills of Exchange Act, 1882 ) ; A true and certified copy of the original contract or agreement binding both parties ; A certified copy of the original note ( credit agreement ) under penalty of perjury, confirming it has not been sold ; Confirmation of the identity of the authorized representative who performed due diligence under the Money Laundering Regulations 2007. 
These lawful requests were ignored or inadequately addressed. Instead, I received generic responses claiming the information was verified, without any substantive evidence to support these claims. 
2.Violation of 15 U.S.C. 1681i : Under 15 U.S.C. 1681i, credit reporting agencies are required to conduct a reasonable investigation when disputes are raised. Merely stating that the information was verified without providing evidence or details of the investigation constitutes a failure to meet this legal standard.

3.Reappearance of Removed Items : Items previously removed from my credit report have inexplicably reappeared, raising serious concerns about the integrity of the investigation process and adherence to proper procedures.

4.Failure to Respond in Good Faith : My repeated attempts to dispute these inaccuracies were met with dismissive responses warning me not to send further disputes. This is both inappropriate and contrary to consumer protection laws under the FCRA. 

Given the severity of these issues, I am requesting immediate action to : 1.Conduct a thorough, independent investigation into the practices of XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX in handling my disputes ; 2.Ensure compliance with 15 U.S.C. 1681i by requiring the credit reporting agencies to provide documented proof of their investigations and validations ; 3.Remove any and all unverifiable and inaccurate items from my credit reports ; 4.Impose penalties or corrective actions against the credit reporting agencies for non-compliance with FCRA standards.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Complaint Summary : I am filing this complaint against Affirm for their failure to properly verify account ownership, resulting in the opening of fraudulent accounts using my personal information. This has caused significant financial harm and damage to my credit report.

Details of the Complaint : 1. Fraudulent Activity : A fraudulent account was opened with Affirm using my personal information under the name XXXX XXXX XXXX, which is not my legal name. My legal name is XXXX XXXX. 
I have never authorized or initiated any accounts or activity with Affirm.

2. Identity Theft : I am a victim of identity theft, as documented in my FTC Identity Theft Report and IC3 Complaint.

Affirm has failed to investigate or resolve this issue despite clear evidence of unauthorized account activity.

3. Impact on My Credit : This fraudulent account has negatively impacted my credit report, causing significant distress and financial harm.

Affirms lack of action violates the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), which requires creditors to investigate disputes and ensure accurate reporting.

Desired Resolution : I request the CFPB to compel Affirm to : 1. Investigate and Remove the Fraudulent Account : Immediately investigate and remove all accounts and activity associated with my identity without authorization.

2. Provide Documentation of Account Activity : Affirm should provide evidence of how and when the account was opened, including the identification used.

3. Confirm Resolution in Writing : Affirm must confirm in writing that the fraudulent account has been removed and that I am not liable for any associated charges or obligations.

4. Prevent Future Identity Theft : Affirm should implement stronger identity verification processes to prevent similar issues in the future.

Supporting Documents : To support my claim, I am prepared to provide the following : FTC Identity Theft Report IC3 Complaint Report Copy of my government-issued ID confirming my legal name is XXXX XXXX Conclusion : Affirms failure to act on clear evidence of identity theft and fraudulent activity has caused undue stress and harm. I trust the CFPB will ensure Affirm fulfills its obligations under the law and resolves this matter promptly. 

Please contact me at XXXX or XXXX if additional information is required. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
I was contacted by a company claiming to be XXXX, which presented itself as a legitimate employer offering remote work. The job involved completing sets and reviewing albums and singles. I performed the tasks requested and communicated with the alleged representatives of XXXX throughout the process. 

After completing the work, I expected compensation as agreed, but I was never paid. When I reached out to the actual owner of XXXX to address the issue, they informed me that their company was being impersonated and had no involvement in the job offer or the tasks I completed. 

During this process, I was scammed out of a significant amount of moneyapproximately {$13000.00}. These funds were transferred through transactions that I now understand were part of the scam, as the fraudulent individuals convinced me to send money under false pretenses. 

I reported the fraud to my bank, Santander, and provided all the evidence I had, including communication with the scammers, details of the transactions, and proof of the alleged job tasks I completed. Despite this, my claim was denied due to " inconsistencies. '' However, I do not understand what inconsistencies the bank found, as I believe my documentation clearly demonstrates that I was scammed. 

This situation has caused me significant financial hardship, and I am seeking further clarity on why my claim was denied and what additional steps I can take to recover my lost funds. I have also reported this incident to law enforcement and would like assistance in resolving this matter.

Product: Mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative:
Hello I need your immediate help because XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX is proceeding with the Forclosure process while they are supposed to be considering me for the XXXX XXXX under the presence of Financial Counseling for Mortgage Forclosure. They are not properly communicate between departments and my XXXX  XXXX XXXX and are delaying my approval and working at a glacier pace. I need your help to ensure that I can keep my home!! 

I have spoken with the servicer, and they have confirmed you are still on Foreclosure hold. 



Here are notes about being in contact with your servicer. 



They initially denied you for all loss mitigation options under the new XXXX  waterfall implemented by servicer of XX/XX/XXXX. I had them send over reason for denial on all loss mitigation. They stated the reason you were denied for XXXX is due to less than XXXX payments since origination. After review of your case, they miscalculated the payments made applying the Partial claim awarded in XXXX to the payments, when those were used to bring your loan current in XXXX. Due to this they miscalculated the months of payments in origination. I brought this to your servicers attention XX/XX/XXXX, stating to review for the XXXX XXXX  again since you have in fact made XXXX payments since last origination of loan. I was told XX/XX/XXXX that the information was given to the group that processes the XXXX cases. I followed up beginning of XXXX through a phone call where they stated they did not have a response from the team and then followed up again by email XX/XX/XXXX asking if they had an update on the case as well. After my phone call again today XX/XX/XXXX the servicer had stating they are pushing it for review, but no movement on the file has started now stating that it should start the review early next year. After the call they did send a follow up email stating that they are following up to see when the review will actually start and attached the letter and explained that the foreclosure is still on hold and letter given was for some sort of counseling. I did inquire more information about the letter and why it was sent and why counseling was needed based off you already being provided counseling on how to avoid XXXX and we are just waiting on them to process the loss mitigation.

Consumer complaint narrative: I have had an account with Credit Karma for probably XXXX years. This account has always been under the same email address and I access the account weekly as I like to keep an eye on my credit scores. Last month I had a Credit Karma Guarantee offer pop up stating that if I was denied for a personal loan they guaranteed I could get, they would pay me {$50.00}. I applied for the loan in an attempt to consolidate some personal debts and I was declined for the loan. About a week ago, I reached out to Credit Karma inquiring as to how the {$50.00} was awarded to me and was told I would be receiving an email in the coming week. Flash forward to 2 days ago, I go to log into my credit karma account to check my information and my account is gone. Their system states that no account has ever been registered with my email address even though its the email I use weekly to login. I am confident that Credit Karma wiped my account so they did not have to pay the {$50.00} as now there is no record of me having applied for that loan through their Credit Karma Guarantee. I need this matter investigated as I am sure Im not the only person this has happened to in Credit Karmas attempt to avoid paying out what theyve guaranteed.

Product: Student loan
Sub-issue: Can't get other flexible options for repaying your loan
Consumer complaint narrative:
Complainant Information Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Pennsylvania XXXX XXXX Number : XXXX Email Address : XXXX Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing to file a formal complaint regarding a series of high-interest student loans that I, XXXX XXXX, obtained under circumstances that I believe were exploitative and highly detrimental to my financial and mental well-being. These loans, which originally amounted to {$210000.00}, have ballooned to a staggering {$280000.00} due to exorbitant interest rates. As a result, I am now facing severe financial hardship and emotional distress, which I believe were exacerbated by improper loan origination practices and predatory lending. 

Background : Loan Amounts : {$210000.00} Current Loan Balance : {$280000.00} Issues Leading to the Complaint : 1. Uncertainty During the Pandemic : During the COVID-19 pandemic, when many were in a state of uncertainty, I was led to believe that acquiring a loan through a certain financial institution would help alleviate my burden. I was not given a clear understanding of how these loans would affect my long-term financial health. 
2. Exploitation of Family Circumstances : The lender took advantage of my familys perceived ability to contribute to the loan, particularly my mothers financial situation, despite her limited ability to do so. This assumption about her contribution was misleading, creating a false sense of security about the loan repayment process.

3. Marital Instability : At the time, my co-signer was going through marital instability, which further complicated my ability to make informed decisions regarding the loans. The lender failed to offer any understanding or accommodations for these personal circumstances, and I was pressured into accepting terms that were not suitable for my financial situation.

4. Lack of Experience and Knowledge Regarding Student Loans : As a recent graduate with little to no experience managing large debts or understanding the full scope of loan terms, I was not adequately educated on the long-term impact of these high-interest loans. The lender did not provide sufficient guidance or support to ensure I understood the full risks involved in the loan terms. 
XXXX. Excessive Interest Rates : The loans I was offered carried interest rates that were excessively high, far above the federal loan rates or typical private loan terms for someone in my situation. These high rates have caused the original debt of {$210000.00} to balloon to {$280000.00}, regardless of making regular payments.

6. Limited Refinancing Options : Due to the size of the loans and the high-interest rates, refinancing options are slim to none. I have explored various refinancing opportunities, but my loans remain unmanageable. The lack of viable alternatives has left me in a situation where the debt continues to grow, further impeding my ability to repay. 

Impact : Financial Distress : The escalating loan balance has created significant financial strain, preventing me from achieving financial stability. My ability to save for the future, invest in my career, or even manage day-to-day expenses has been severely compromised. 
Emotional Distress : The constant pressure of an insurmountable debt, combined with the knowledge that I am paying excessively high interest rates, has caused significant emotional distress. I feel trapped and overwhelmed by the financial burden, which has adversely affected my mental health. 
Inability to Pay : Due to the ballooning loan balance and my financial instability, I am now in a position where I can not make the required payments, further exacerbating my situation. The loan terms and conditions have left me unable to meet my obligations, which is putting me at risk of default and damaging my credit.
Company public response: Company believes it acted appropriately as authorized by contract or law
