Product: Credit card
Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Consumer complaint narrative:
Complaint Summary : I am writing to report a series of issues I have experienced with KeyBank that have caused me significant frustration, confusion, and financial penalties. These issues stem from the banks failure to correctly process a credit card payment on my behalf, conflicting explanations provided by representatives, and a lack of timely follow-up to resolve the matter. 

Details of the Issue : 1. Initial Incident : XX/XX/2024 : I misplaced my credit card and promptly logged into my online banking to place a temporary lock on the account. I also reported the card as lost to KeyBank and requested a replacement. 
XX/XX/2024 : While attempting to pay my credit card balance, I noticed that the account associated with this card had disappeared from my online banking. To ensure I had sufficient funds available, I transferred {$4000.00} from another KeyBank savings account to my checking account, bringing the total to over {$8900.00}. I called KeyBank and explained the situation to a representative, who confirmed my checking account balance and assisted me by making a {$5000.00} payment to my credit card on my behalf, as I could not access the account myself. I received an email confirming that the payment was successfully completed. 

2. Payment Reversal : A few days later, I noticed that the {$5000.00} payment had been reversed. 
XX/XX/2024 : When I called KeyBank to inquire, a representative informed me that the reversal was due to " insufficient funds. '' This explanation was incorrect since my checking account had more than enough funds to cover the payment. The representative claimed there was a glitch in the system and advised me to manually make the {$5000.00} payment myself now that the credit card account was visible again on my online banking. I complied and made the payment, and the representative assured me that there would be no penalties, impact on my credit, or other negative consequences as a result of this issue. 

3. Further Issues with My Credit Card : XX/XX/2024 : My replacement credit card arrived, and I activated it. 
XX/XX/2024 : Both transactions I attempted with the card were declined. I called KeyBank and was told the card had been temporarily blocked due to " suspicious activity. '' I explained that the attempted transactions were mine, but I was transferred between multiple representatives. One representative told me I would need to visit a branch for further assistance, while another supervisor explained that the issue stemmed from the payment error on XX/XX/2024. 
The supervisor clarified that the payment made on XX/XX/2024 had been incorrectly applied to the wrong account, which caused the reversal and a late fee of {$76.00}. The earlier explanation of " insufficient funds '' was inaccurate. The supervisor assured me that the interest charge would be waived, and I would receive a follow-up call on XX/XX/2024. 

4. Unresolved Follow-Up : XX/XX/2024 : I did not receive the promised follow-up call. When I called KeyBank later that night, I was informed that a follow-up call was scheduled for later in the week or the following week, contradicting the supervisor 's earlier assurance. I spoke with another representative and their supervisor, who promised a call on XX/XX/2024 or XX/XX/2024. 

Reasons for My Frustration : 1. Inconsistent Explanations : Between XX/XX/2024 and XX/XX/2024, I spoke with multiple representatives and supervisors, each providing different and conflicting explanations. It wasnt until XX/XX/2024 that a supervisor offered a clear explanation of the real issueKeyBanks error in processing my payment on XX/XX/2024. 

2. Wrongful Late Fee : The {$76.00} late fee was unfairly charged due to KeyBanks failure to correctly process the payment I requested on XX/XX/2024. Despite receiving a confirmation email for the payment, the error caused a reversal and penalty, which was not my fault. 

3. Lack of Transparency and Accountability : KeyBank representatives have been inconsistent, untruthful, and unhelpful. The repeated misinformation, lack of resolution, and delays in follow-up have caused me significant frustration, concern, and inconvenience. 


I appreciate your attention to this matter and hope the CFPB can help resolve this issue promptly. Thank you for your time and support. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX is inaccurately reporting my account as charged-off and closed, yet it continues to display the account as having an unpaid balance of {$2800.00} and a delinquent status on my credit reports with TransUnion, XXXX, and XXXX. This reporting is misleading and inconsistent with the legal definition of a charged-off debt. Additionally, XXXX has refused to issue a Form 1099-C to document the cancellation of this debt, further complicating the situation. 

I filed a prior complaint ( XXXX ) with the CFPB about similar issues, but the investigation appears to have been incomplete. XXXX continues to report inaccurate information, despite my requests for correction under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 

Actions I have taken : Contacted XXXX directly to dispute the accounts inaccurate status, including their refusal to issue a Form 1099-C. 
Filed a previous complaint with the CFPB regarding this account. 
Actions taken by XXXX : Refused to issue a Form 1099-C while still reporting the debt as charged off. 
Continued to report an unpaid balance and delinquent status on my credit report. 
This inaccurate reporting has significantly harmed my credit and financial standing, and I believe it violates both FCRA accuracy standards and 26 U.S. Code 6050P, which governs the reporting of canceled debts. 

I respectfully request a thorough investigation of this issue, as I believe the previous investigation did not fully address these concerns or result in a fair resolution.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative: I am writing to dispute the accuracy of certain information contained in my credit report as provided by your agency. This letter serves as my tenth formal dispute under the provisions of the fair credit reporting act ( 15 U.S.C. & 1681 ). I believe these inaccuracies may be linked to the XXXX data breach, which compromised my personal information. I have enclosed copies of ( supporting documents such as a statement, A FTC report, and verification of my identity that substantiate my claim. Please investigate this matter thoroughly. Correct the disputed information, and provide me with a revised copy of my credit report. Under the FCRA, you are required to investigate my dispute within 30 days or receipt of this letter, Notify the furnisher of the disputed information promptly and provided me with the results of your investigation and corrected credit report if changes are made. If the investigation does not resolve my dispute, I request that you include a statement of my dispute in my credit file and in future reports provided to others. Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

Product: Checking or savings account
Sub-issue: Funds not handled or disbursed as instructed
Consumer complaint narrative: In response to an unsolicited internet ad I opened a checking account online with PNC Bank. I had been a customer in the past and was not impressed with them and closed the account. With the prospect of new management and a {$200.00} bonus ( terms attached ), I decided to give them another try. The deal was to have direct deposits of at least {$2000.00} made to the account within the first 60 days from opening. The deposits were to be made from a regular month income source like pension, employer, etc. I am a publisher, writer, and editor. I had one of my clients send my usual monthly earnings to this new account as the offer required. His payments came from his business account which I verified with PNC Bank. The payments were made by nbkc bank which denominated them as XXXX payments despite the fact that they were made from a business account to an employee. PNC Bank refused to honor the bonus insisting that XXXX payments did not count. I contend PNC requirements are contradictory. These payments were indeed money earned from an outside source, a sole proprietor, who paid from his bona fide business account as he does for all the people who work for him. This is the elevation of form over substance, and wrong. I should be awarded the {$200.00}. The money was due on XX/XX/year>. I contacted them on XX/XX/year>, and since then they have refused to pay the bonus telling me they are still " thinking about it. '' Since the terms of the offer contradict themselves, that is, business payments can be denominated as XXXX at least at some banks and for some sole proprietors, this is a deceptive and abusive practice as noted in the CFPB circular at pages XXXX attached. Note also how long the ad is and how hidden are the terms of the offer. " Hiding elephants in mouse holes. ''

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Credit Report Dispute Request for Investigation and Correction To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to formally dispute several inaccuracies on my Experian credit report. I have reviewed my credit report as of [ Insert Date ], and I have identified the following errors that require immediate correction under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). Below is a detailed explanation of the disputed accounts and the inaccuracies : XXXX. XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX ( Account Ending in XXXX ) - Date Opened : XX/XX/XXXX Inaccuracy : The account shows a credit usage of 268 %, which is mathematically impossible given a {$300.00} credit limit. 
Requested Correction : Verify and update the balance and credit usage to reflect accurate and lawful reporting. 

XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX ( Account Ending in XXXX  ) - Date Opened : XX/XX/XXXX Inaccuracy : This account appears to duplicate the above account from XX/XX/XXXX. Both accounts indicate charge-offs, but there is no clarification as to whether they represent the same debt. 
Requested Correction : Investigate and delete any duplicate reporting. If they are separate obligations, please provide detailed documentation to verify the legitimacy of both accounts. 

XXXX XXXX ( Account Ending in XXXX XXXX - Date Opened : XX/XX/XXXX Inaccuracy : The account shows a credit usage of 127 %, which exceeds the reported {$700.00} credit limit. Additionally, the last payment date and balance update timelines are inconsistent. 
Requested Correction : Verify and correct the credit usage and balance. Provide clarification on the reporting discrepancies for the timeline of updates. 

XXXX. XXXXXXXX XXXX  ( Account Ending in XXXX ) - Date Opened : XX/XX/XXXX Inaccuracy : This account shows a credit usage of 201 % with a {$600.00} limit and an outstanding balance of {$1200.00}. Additionally, the comment mentions first payment never received, but the report lacks detail on whether this is accurate. 
Requested Correction : Verify and update the reported credit usage and outstanding balance. Clarify and provide evidence to support the comment listed under this account. 

XXXX. XXXX XXXX ( Account Ending in XXXX ) - Date Opened : XX/XX/XXXX Inaccuracy : The report states : Collection account. {$1800.00} past due as of XX/XX/XXXX, but there is no indication whether the debt is with the original creditor or a third-party collector. 
The timeline for updates is inconsistent, with Status Updated in XX/XX/XXXX and XXXX XXXX in XX/XX/XXXX, despite the account being opened less than a year before. 
The terms listed as 1 month do not align with the balance reported unless additional charges ( e.g., termination fees ) are properly documented. 
Requested Correction : Investigate the validity of this collection account, verify the timeline for updates, and ensure the balance reflects lawful reporting. Clarify whether the debt remains with XXXX or has been sold to a collection agency. 

6. General Reporting Errors Inaccurate Status Updates : Several accounts reflect conflicting last payment dates and status update dates ( e.g., balance updates for closed accounts ). 
Duplicate Reporting : The XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX accounts appear redundant. 
Requested Correction : Ensure that all statuses, dates, and balances are accurately reflected.

I have attached a copy of my credit report with the disputed accounts highlighted for your reference, along with a copy of my government-issued ID and proof of address to verify my identity.

Please conduct a thorough investigation into these issues and provide me with the results of your findings. If you determine that the disputed information is inaccurate, I request that you promptly update my credit report to reflect the corrections and notify any creditors that received the incorrect information.

In accordance with the FCRA, I expect a response within 30 days. You may contact me via mail at the address above or by phone at XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX if you require additional information. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your timely resolution. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative: This request is made in accordance with several provisions of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) : 1. **15 USC 1681c-2 ( a ) ** : This statute requires consumer reporting agencies to block information resulting from identity theft. I request that all accounts fraudulently opened in my name be blocked immediately. 2. **15 USC 1681i** : Under this section, I am entitled to dispute and request the deletion of any inaccurate or unverifiable information on my credit report. Please investigate and delete any such information linked to this breach. **15 USC 1681e ( b ) ** : This provision mandates that consumer reporting agencies maintain reasonable procedures to ensure the accuracy of information. Given the breach, I request a thorough review of my credit report to identify and rectify any inaccuracies. 3. **15 USC 1681g ( a ) ** : I request access to my complete consumer report, as I have the right to understand what information is being reported and to identify potential inaccuracies resulting from this breach. 4. **15 USC 1681m** : As required by this statute, please ensure that any negative information resulting from the breach is not reported inappropriately. 5. **15 USC 1681n** : I reserve the right to seek damages for any violations of the 6. FCRA resulting from this breach, should you fail to comply with my requests. 7. Please confirm the receipt of this letter and provide written confirmation of the actions taken regarding my accounts. Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I look forward to your immediate response in 4 days! Sincerely XXXX XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
My name is XXXX. I got my credit report on a website and was able to see that my information is being reported by companies like XXXX, XXXX, Experian and with many inaccuracies that I never consented to or have reported that info myself nor did they ever contact me to ask for my consent, whether it be the personal information ( MY NAME ) that is incorrect on my XXXX report : MY CORRECT NAME : XXXX XXXX THE INCORRECT NAMES INCLUDED IN XXXX REPORT, ( included along with the attachments provided ) : XXXX OR XXXX XXXX My consent was not asked for by these companies when it comes to all inquiries that are listed on my XXXX XXXX credit report, the inquiries are all Unauthorized, I need these removed immediately. 

Lastly, my consent was not asked for by Experian for the account listed as negative Therefore, this is an Unauthorized by me, XXXX XXXX. ( company of account : XXXX XXXX account number : XXXX ) Under 15 USC 1666B , this is a billing error, always paid as agreed on time this is an error, this account is in violation. 

Not only does Experians actions presently affect how lenders view my ability to borrow but it is completely violating me, my rights and the LAWS/ACTS/CODES that stand to protect me, because these companies have FALSE information they are using in my name I never consented for them to report nor was I, XXXX XXXX, asked once again. 

Misleading false reporting, negligently and inaccurately reporting failing to comply to 15 USC 1692 ( g ) Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically 15 USC 1681, section 602a, it is stated that consumer reporting agencies must handle their responsibilities with fairness, impartiality, and respect for consumer privacy. XXXX and Experian are consumer reporting agencies, and as a consumer, I have the right to ensure that my private information is not disclosed. This right is supported by 15 USC 6801, which requires financial institutions to protect the privacy and confidentiality of their customers ' nonpublic personal information. Since these agencies are considered " furnishers of information '' under this law, they are obligated to follow these privacy standards.

Furthermore, according to 15 USC 1681, section 604a ( 2 ), a consumer reporting agency can only share a consumer report under specific circumstances, and one of those conditions is with the written consent of the consumer. XXXX, Experian, and any financial institutions providing information to them do not have my permission, either written or verbal, to share my information. Any consent, whether implied or expressed, is hereby revoked. 
Additionally, 15 USC 6802 ( b ) ( c ) mandates that a financial institution can not disclose nonpublic personal information to a third party without informing the consumer about their right to opt out. Neither XXXX nor Experian has provided me with this necessary information. According to 15 USC 1681c ( a ) ( 5 ), consumer reporting agencies are prohibited from including certain adverse information that is older than seven years, including any account or item that would negatively affect my credit, unless specifically authorized by law.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I recently conducted a review of my credit report and found several items that have caused me significant distress. These items appear to be unverifiable, inaccurate, and questionable. Your agency has failed to ensure the accuracy of the information as required under 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ) Accuracy of Reports. This statute mandates that consumer reporting agencies must follow reasonable procedures to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of the information they report.

Furthermore, under 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) Treatment of Inaccurate or Unverifiable Information, you are required to promptly delete or modify any information found to be inaccurate, incomplete, or unverifiable during a reinvestigation. If you are unable to provide me with verifiable proof of the accuracy of the disputed items within 15 days of your investigation, these accounts and the related information must be removed from my credit report.

Additionally, under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I do not recognize any of the alleged creditors or debt collectors. I have never entered into a valid contract with any of these entities, nor have I engaged in any transactions with them. As such, these accounts are fraudulent and and inaccurate information.

Moreover, under the Fair Credit Billing Act, my right to privacy has been violated, and this breach infringes upon my rights as outlined in The Privacy Act of 1974. Removing the inaccurate and fraudulent information from my credit report will help restore my privacy and prevent further violations.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally dispute an inaccurate entry on my credit report, which I pulled on XX/XX/year>. Specifically, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX account is incorrectly reported as closed, with inaccurate multiple payment history dates. Despite this, you have continued to verify and report the information as accurate, without providing any supporting documentation to substantiate its accuracy. 
This failure to correct the error is a violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically under 15 USC 1681i, which requires credit bureaus to investigate and verify disputed information within 30 days. As such, I request that you promptly
investigate this matter and remove or correct the inaccurate information from my credit report.

If the inaccurate information is not corrected within the required 30-day timeframe, I will be forced to pursue legal action under 15 USC 1692g .

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
I recently conducted a review of my credit report and found several items that have caused me significant distress. These items appear to be unverifiable, inaccurate, and questionable. Your agency has failed to ensure the accuracy of the information as required under 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ) Accuracy of Reports. This statute mandates that consumer reporting agencies must follow reasonable procedures to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of the information they report.

Furthermore, under 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) Treatment of Inaccurate or Unverifiable Information, you are required to promptly delete or modify any information found to be inaccurate, incomplete, or unverifiable during a reinvestigation. If you are unable to provide me with verifiable proof of the accuracy of the disputed items within 15 days of your investigation, these accounts and the related information must be removed from my credit report. 

Additionally, under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I do not recognize any of the alleged creditors or debt collectors. I have never entered into a valid contract with any of these entities, nor have I engaged in any transactions with them. As such, these accounts are fraudulent and and inaccurate information.

Moreover, under the Fair Credit Billing Act, my right to privacy has been violated, and this breach infringes upon my rights as outlined in The Privacy Act of 1974. Removing the inaccurate and fraudulent information from my credit report will help restore my privacy and prevent further violations.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports

Consumer complaint narrative:
I reviewed my consumer reports and there are inaccuracies in the reports. There are accounts marked as 30 Days Late and I have never been late with any payments. I have always made on time payments on my accounts, I have never been late. Consumer reporting agencies are required by law to report accurate information. The law is being broken and my consumer rights are being violated. I am requesting a thorough investigation of these discrepancies with documented written evidence to prove these late payment accusations that legally support these consumer reporting agencies inaccurate claims. 

Please provide my original creditors financial statements with payment history logs of my accounts showing these late payments with the exact dates, and dollar amounts of the actual missed payments and when these late payments were actually received, as well as provide me with a written transcript of the recorded phone call conversations with the time, date and staff persons names of when these late payment discrepancies were reported to these consumer reporting agencies from the original creditors. 

The accounts in discrepancy is as follows : XXXX XXXX Services Account # XXXX Inaccurately Reporting as XXXX  days late for XX/XX/year> & Inaccurately Reporting as XXXX  Days Late for XX/XX/year>XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Inaccurately Reporting as XXXX Days Late for XX/XX/year> I have attached a copy of my passport, notarized affidavit of identity, screenshots of the credit reports showing the accounts and the negative XXXX  day late reports. 

If you are unable to furnish the requested proof, I demand an immediate update of my payments to reflect the true on time paid as agreed/ never late status, as I have never been late on a payment. I have consistently upheld my payment obligations without delay. As I appreciate your prompt attention and action on this matter.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to report a violation of my consumer rights regarding a collection account reported on my credit report by XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. I have requested validation of the debt, as required by the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), but I have not received any documentation or response from either XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX or the credit reporting agency. 

Here are the details of the issue : Debt Collection on Credit Report : A collection account from XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX is listed on my credit report. This account is inaccurate or incomplete, and I have reasons to believe it may not be valid. 

Request for Debt Validation : On XX/XX/year>, I sent a formal request to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX for validation of the debt under Section 809 of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ). This request required them to provide detailed documentation of the debt, including the original creditor, the amount owed, and proof that they have the legal right to collect the debt. 

Failure to Respond to Debt Validation Request : Despite the legal requirement for XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX to provide validation of the debt within 30 days, I have not received any response. This failure to validate the debt violates my rights as a consumer. 

Violation of Credit Reporting Requirements : Additionally, I have contacted the credit bureau that is reporting this collection account. The credit bureau is also in violation of my rights because, under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), they are obligated to ensure the accuracy and completeness of the information they report. Since XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX has not validated the debt, the credit bureau is continuing to report this account without confirming its validity, which is a violation of my rights under the FCRA. 

As a result of these actions, I am requesting that the CFPB investigate the failure of both XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and the credit reporting agency to comply with consumer protection laws, including the FDCPA and FCRA. I am seeking the following actions : Immediate removal of the invalid collection account from my credit report. 
A written explanation from XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX regarding their failure to validate the debt. 
A correction or update to my credit report to reflect the accurate information. 
I appreciate your prompt attention to this matter and look forward to your assistance in resolving these violations of my consumer rights. 

Thank you for your help.

XX/XX/XXXX Issues : Showing credit limit when the account is closed, payment history In accordance with 15 USC 1681e ( b ), consumer reporting agencies are mandated to follow reasonable procedures to assure the maximum possible accuracy of the information contained in consumer reports. Additionally, under 15 USC 1681i ( 5 ) and 15 USC 1681i ( 5 ) ( a ), consumers have the right to dispute inaccurate information, and the agencies must investigate and correct any inaccuracies. Furthermore, 15 USC 1681s-2 obligates furnishers of information to ensure the accuracy and integrity of the information they provide to consumer reporting agencies.

Despite submitting all necessary documentation to support my dispute, Experian, TransUnion, and Equifax have failed to take corrective action within the legally required timeframe. This negligence has caused significant harm to my creditworthiness and financial well-being.

Furthermore, the following regulations support my position : 12 CFR 1006.34 ( c ) : This regulation addresses the need for accurate and complete information in debt collection communications.

12 CFR 1006.6 ( c ) : This regulation outlines the requirements for debt collectors to provide accurate information when communicating with consumers.

15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( a ) : This section imposes obligations on furnishers of information to ensure the accuracy and integrity of the information they provide to consumer reporting agencies.

15 U.S.C. 1666b : This section deals with the prompt correction of billing errors. 

I request the CFPB to investigate this matter and compel Experian, XXXX, and XXXX to rectify the inaccuracies on my credit reports immediately. Furthermore, I seek damages of {$1000.00} for each inaccuracy, as per the provisions of the FCRA. 

Thank you for your attention to this urgent matter.

Recently I did an investigation on my credit report and found several items on there to be inaccurate. 

Under 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ) Accuracy of report Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report, it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure the maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates. 

15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In general if, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shalli ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Identity theft protection or other monitoring services
Sub-issue: Problem canceling credit monitoring or identify theft protection service
Consumer complaint narrative:
I received a notice from Experian telling me that I would need to opt out of a new information collection policy. 

The process wasn't straightforward ( had to log in, then unclear where to opt out ), and since I don't get much value from Experian and dislike their repeated emails and nag screen trying to upsell me whenever I log in, I decided simply to cancel my account with them. This revealed additional dark pattern practices. 

I saw no clear link for this. I engaged with their AI chat and it told me that to cancel I would have to phone them during working hours. 

I called them and got a very inflexible automated service which understood that I wanted to cancel, but it insisted that I explain why. I replied " dark patterns '' twice and it claimed that it couldn't understand me and would not proceed with the cancellation. I gave a fuller explanation but it continued to ( it claimed ) be unable to understand my response. ( I had spoken very clearly. ) It ended the call and I never spoke to a live individual. 

For a credit reporting company ( one of an oligopoly of such services ) to be this impenetrable is clearly unacceptable and a disservice to citizens. Please require minimum criteria for ease of account cancellation AND data deletion. Experian has been breached in the past and, like many data aggregators, continues to modify their " privacy policy ''. 

Thank you for your consideration.

Consumer complaint narrative:
**Subject : Dispute of Alleged Violation of 18 U.S.C . 1029 Fraudulent Use of Access Devices** XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/2024 XXXX XXXX. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Dear XXXX XXXX XXXX : Dispute of Alleged Violation of 18 U.S.C . 1029 Fraudulent Use of Access Devices** I am writing to formally dispute an alleged violation of 18 U.S.C. 1029, which pertains to the fraudulent use of access devices, including credit card fraud, unauthorized access to systems, and other related crimes. I have recently been made aware of an issue involving my account ( s ), which I believe to be the result of a misunderstanding, fraud, or error. 

The relevant section of the statute defines a number of fraudulent actions involving unauthorized access to or use of credit, debit, or other financial devices or information. According to the law, an individual can be found in violation of this statute if they knowingly use, possess, or transfer any counterfeit or unauthorized access device with the intent to commit fraud or obtain unlawful financial gain. 

To clarify the situation, I would like to request the following : XXXX. **Clear Explanation of the Alleged Violation** : Please provide me with specific details regarding the alleged violation, including the exact nature of the incident, the involved account ( s ), dates, and any associated documentation ( e.g., transaction records, communication logs ). 

XXXX. **Evidence of Fraudulent Activity** : If the dispute involves claims of fraudulent activity on my part or involving my account ( s ), kindly provide any supporting evidence that has led to these allegations, such as transaction history or relevant correspondence. 

XXXX. **Investigation and Resolution** : If the issue involves fraudulent activity that I did not authorize, I request that your office initiate a formal investigation to determine the source and nature of the alleged offense. In the event that this is the result of a fraudulent claim, I ask that appropriate measures be taken to clear up the matter. 

XXXX. XXXX*My Position** : I categorically deny any involvement in fraudulent activities and assert that I have neither knowingly nor intentionally participated in any actions that would violate 18 U.S.C. 1029. 

Please acknowledge receipt of this dispute letter and provide a timeline for when I can expect a response or resolution. I am confident that through proper investigation and review, this matter can be resolved swiftly. 

If you need additional information or clarification from my side, please dont hesitate to contact me at ( XXXX ) XXXX or via email at XXXX. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX -- - This letter is intended as a formal dispute of an allegation regarding fraudulent use of access devices under 18 U.S.C. 1029. Depending on your specific case, you may need to adjust or add details that reflect your situation more accurately.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX, CA XXXX XX/XX/XXXX Subject : Notice of Intent to Sue for Violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to formally notify you of continued inaccuracies and discrepancies regarding the account [ Account Number : XXXX ] reported on my credit file. Despite prior disputes and reinvestigations, the following issues persist, in direct violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681 et seq., as well as other federal and state consumer protection laws.

Violations Identified : 1. Duplicate and Inconsistent Reporting : The account is reported with conflicting statuses, balances, and dates. The continued listing of a charged-off account with varying balances ( {$490.00} remaining balance, {$45000.00} written off ) is misleading and inaccurate.

2. Failure to Mark Account as Disputed : Despite my formal dispute dated [ Insert Date of Previous Dispute ], the account was not updated to reflect its disputed status as required under FCRA Section 611.

3. Incorrect Reporting Timeline : The account is scheduled to remain on record until XX/XX/XXXX. This exceeds the permissible seven-year reporting window if calculated from the first delinquency date. This misrepresentation negatively impacts my creditworthiness. 
XXXX. Payment History Discrepancies : Reporting charge-off status for months alongside ongoing balances without payments contradicts FCRAs requirement for accurate and complete reporting. 

Legal Basis for Complaint : Under the FCRA : Creditors and furnishers are required to ensure the maximum accuracy of information reported to consumer reporting agencies ( Section 607 ).

Consumers are entitled to dispute incomplete or inaccurate information, and the creditor/furnisher must reinvestigate and correct the errors ( Section 611 ).

My Demands : Immediate Correction : Update the reporting of this account to accurately reflect its true status, correcting all inconsistencies in balance, charge-off reporting, and payment history. 
Removal of Erroneous Information : Remove any incorrect data from my credit report, including improper balances and inaccurate reporting dates. 
Written Confirmation : Provide written confirmation within 15 days of receipt of this letter that the inaccuracies have been corrected or removed. 

Consequences of Non-Compliance : Should you fail to comply with the FCRA and resolve this matter immediately, I will have no choice but to escalate my complaints by filing formal disputes with the following agencies : The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) ; The Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) ; and The [ Your State ] Attorney Generals Office. 

Additionally, I reserve the right to initiate a lawsuit against your organization for willful non-compliance, under FCRA Section 616, seeking damages, attorney fees, and any other remedies permitted by law.

This letter serves as formal notice of my intent to escalate this matter should you fail to act within 15 days. Please address this matter urgently and confirm your compliance by [ XX/XX/XXXX ; 15 days from today ]. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
List of addresses below has violated my federally protected consumer rights to privacy and confidentiality under 15 USC 1681 XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, OH XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX, XXXX, OH XXXX I looked at my Experian credit report on XXXX XXXX and noticed some things are incomplete and not accurate. And according to the fair credit reporting act Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates according to 15 USC 1681 ( e ) ( b ).

And according to 15 USC 1681 5 they are supposed to do this ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In general, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall ( i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer.

and according to 15 USC 1681s-2 they are supposed to not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

CORRECTION TO MY REPORT DELETE ALL UNAUTHORIZED ADDRESSES

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally dispute inaccuracies on my Experian credit report. Pursuant to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), I request a thorough investigation into the accounts listed below and their removal from my credit file. I am requesting a thorough investigation of these matters and the removal of the listed accounts from my file within 30 days of receipt of this letter as required by FCRA. To assist with this process, I have enclosed a copy of my identification to prevent any delays in the investigation. Since you have everything you need to investigate this, I will not accept any stalling letter assuming that anyone besides myself have initiated this dispute. I am writing on behalf of myself and without any influence from unmentioned or unauthorized parties. Any response outside of a proper and full investigation into my claim may result in assumption of willful negligence. That may result in litigation.

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. 
Accounts in Dispute : XXXX. XXXX XXXX o Account Number : XXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXX o Account Number : XXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX o Account XXXX : XXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX Account XXXX : XXXX XXXX. Bank XXXX XXXX o Account Number : XXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Numbers : XXXX and XXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX  o Account Number : XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX  XXXX Bankruptcy Dismissed o Reference Number : XXXX Legal Basis for Dispute : Under 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ), I am entitled to dispute inaccuracies in my credit report and request an investigation. Additionally, 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) requires consumer reporting agencies to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of the information included in my file.

Supporting Documents : I have included a copy of my government-issued ID, proof of address, and a copy of my Experian credit report highlighting the disputed items. 
Requested Action : If the disputed accounts can not be verified as accurate, please remove them from my credit file in accordance with 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ). Additionally, provide written confirmation of the investigation results and any corrections made.

Thank you for your prompt attention. I expect resolution within the required 30-day timeframe. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX [ Enclosures : Copy of ID, Proof of Address, Credit Report ]

Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, I am writing to bring to your attention ongoing issues regarding my XXXX XXXX account ( Account Number : XXXX ) that I have disputed multiple times with Experian. Despite my repeated attempts to rectify the situation, each time the account comes back as verified and updated ; however, the information being reported does not align with the payment records I have obtained directly from XXXX XXXX.

Per the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) I am a federally protected consumer I am now opting out of any and all authorization ( S ) I the consumer may have given you written, unwritten, verbal and non-verbal permission 15 USC 6802 asserting my rights to opt out of the unauthorized sharing and reporting of my nonpublic personal information to third parties, including credit reporting agencies. XXXX XXXX is in violation of the following laws : 1. Violation of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act ( 15 U.S.C. 6802 ) : I sent XXXXXXXX XXXX a formal opt-out request, dated XX/XX/XXXX, under my rights outlined in 15 U.S.C. 6802. This statute requires financial institutions to provide consumers with a clear and conspicuous opportunity to opt out of the disclosure of their nonpublic personal information to nonaffiliated third parties, such as credit bureaus. XXXXXXXX XXXX continues to report my payment history and utilization rate to credit bureaus despite my opt-out notice, which violates this section. Full Citation ( 15 U.S.C. 6802 ) : A financial institution may not, directly or through any affiliate, disclose to a nonaffiliated third party any nonpublic personal information, unless such financial institution provides or has provided to the consumer ( A ) a clear and conspicuous disclosure of the financial institutions privacy policies and practices ; ( B ) a reasonable opportunity to opt out ; and ( C ) the consumer has not opted out. How XXXX Violated : XXXX failed to honor my opt-out request and continued to share my personal information, breaching federal privacy standards. 2. Violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 U.S.C. 1681b ) : Under the FCRA, consumer reporting agencies may only disclose consumer information under permissible purposes, including the written consent of the consumer. My opt-out explicitly revoked any prior authorization for XXXX XXXX to share my information with credit bureaus, yet they continue to report my payment history and utilization rate without consent. Full Citation ( 15 U.S.C. 1681b ) : ( 2 ) In accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates. How XXXX Violated : XXXX continues to report my data to credit bureaus without my consent, failing to adhere to the permissible purposes outlined in the FCRA. 3. Violation of the Privacy Act of 1974 ( 5 U.S.C. 552a ( b ) ) : This Act ensures that no entity may disclose personal information without the prior written consent of the individual. XXXX XXXX reporting of my personal data to credit bureaus after my opt-out notice constitutes unauthorized disclosure. Full Citation ( 5 U.S.C. 552a ( b ) ) : No agency shall disclose any record which is contained in a system of records by any means of communication to any person, or to another agency, except pursuant to a written request by, or with the prior written consent of, the individual to whom the record pertains. How XXXX Violated : By continuing to report my personal information after my opt-out, XXXX violated my federally protected right to privacy. 4. Violation of 12 C.F.R. 1016.9 ( Regulation P ) : This regulation requires financial institutions to comply with opt-out requests as soon as practicable. XXXXXXXX XXXX has not honored my opt-out request within a reasonable timeframe. Full Citation ( 12 C.F.R. 1016.9 ) : A financial institution shall comply with a consumers opt-out direction as soon as reasonably practicable after the financial institution receives it. How XXXX Violated : XXXX failed to process my opt-out request in a timely manner, continuing to share my information. 5. Violation of 12 C.F.R. 1016.4 ( Regulation P ) : Under this regulation, financial institutions must provide periodic privacy notices. I have not received required annual privacy notices, depriving me of the opportunity to understand and control how my information is used. Full Citation ( 12 C.F.R. 1016.4 ) : A financial institution shall provide a clear and conspicuous notice that accurately reflects its privacy policies and practices annually to customers throughout the duration of the customer relationship. How XXXX Violated : XXXXXXXX XXXX  failed to provide required privacy notices as mandated.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
I recently conducted a review of my credit report and found several items that have caused me significant distress. These items appear to be unverifiable, inaccurate, and questionable. Your agency has failed to ensure the accuracy of the information as required under 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ) Accuracy of Reports. This statute mandates that consumer reporting agencies must follow reasonable procedures to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of the information they report. 
Furthermore, under 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) Treatment of Inaccurate or Unverifiable Information, you are required to promptly delete or modify any information found to be inaccurate, incomplete, or unverifiable during a reinvestigation. If you are unable to provide me with verifiable proof of the accuracy of the disputed items within 15 days of your investigation, these accounts and the related information must be removed from my credit report.

Additionally, under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I do not recognize any of the alleged creditors or debt collectors. I have never entered into a valid contract with any of these entities, nor have I engaged in any transactions with them. As such, these accounts are fraudulent and and inaccurate information. 

Moreover, under the Fair Credit Billing Act, my right to privacy has been violated, and this breach infringes upon my rights as outlined in The Privacy Act of 1974. Removing the inaccurate and fraudulent information from my credit report will help restore my privacy and prevent further violations.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I was listed in several major data breaches, compromising my personal information and making it susceptible to misuse. These breaches have resulted in the inclusion of numerous incorrect and unverified items on my credit reports, which vary inconsistently across the three major credit bureausXXXX, Experian, and XXXX. After obtaining my free credit reports, I discovered these discrepancies and initiated disputes with the companies reporting the negative items and the credit bureaus directly. 

Despite my efforts, the inaccuracies persist, causing significant harm to my credit standing and personal reputation. Despite my repeated efforts to correct multiple inaccuracies on my credit reports with all three credit bureaus, these errors remain unresolved. These inaccuracies negatively affect my creditworthiness and violate my rights under the FCRA. 

These breaches make any electronic records suspect, as digital signatures and documents could have been compromised or fraudulently created.

Under 15 U.S.C. 1692g ( Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ), failure to provide this information invalidates the debt. Moreover, the inclusion of such unverifiable items on my credit reports violates the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681, which mandates that credit reports be accurate and complete.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Dispute of Inaccurate and Misleading Reporting for XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  Account To : Equifax and XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Date : XXXX/XXXX/XXXX Dear Equifax I am writing to dispute inaccuracies and violations under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and other applicable consumer protection laws regarding the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX account appearing on my credit report. The misreporting of this account has directly impacted my ability to obtain credit and caused significant harm to my financial standing. 

Specifically, the following issues require immediate investigation and correction : Inaccurate Reporting of Charge-Off Status : The account is marked as CO ( charge-off ) for every month in XXXX. According to the FCRA, 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( B ), furnishers of information are required to report accurate and complete information. Charge-offs are recorded as a single event, not repeatedly every month, as this creates a misleading impression of ongoing delinquency. 
Failure to Validate Debt : Under 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ), I have the right to dispute the accuracy of information and request validation. I have not received proper validation or documentation of the alleged debt. If the creditor or furnisher can not verify the accuracy of this account, it must be removed from my credit report. 
Harm Caused by Outdated Information : Negative information, including charge-offs, can only remain on my credit report for seven years from the date of first delinquency per 15 U.S.C. 1681c ( a ) ( 4 ). The reported delinquency first occurred in XX/XX/XXXX, yet it appears inaccurately and continues to affect my credit profile unfairly. 
Impact on My Ability to Obtain Credit : The inaccurate and misleading reporting of this account has resulted in denials for credit and higher interest rates, violating my right to a fair and accurate credit report under the FCRA. 
Requested Actions : I respectfully request the following actions : Immediate investigation of the inaccuracies under 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ). 
Removal of repeated CO entries for XXXX and correction of any misleading payment history. 
Validation of the account details, including the original agreement, account ledger, and evidence of charge-off status. If this information can not be provided, the account must be deleted. 
Notification of corrections made to my credit report. 
Failure to address these inaccuracies and violations may result in further action, including filing complaints with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and potentially seeking legal remedies under 15 U.S.C. 1681n for willful noncompliance. 

Please provide written confirmation of your findings and any actions taken within 30 days, as required by the FCRA. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

I recently reviewed my credit report and discovered several inaccuracies and unauthorized entries that must be addressed immediately. These issues include : Inaccurate Late Payment Reports : Accounts like XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, and XXXX are incorrectly reporting late payments. This violates provisions under 15 USC 1666 and 12 CFR 1026.13, which govern the correction of billing errors. I demand these entries be updated to reflect " paid as agreed/never late. '' Unverified Debts : Multiple entries, such as those reported by XXXX, XXXX, and others, require validation under 15 USC 1692g. Ive requested documentation including signed contracts and proof of the debts legitimacy. Deceptive Practices : Entities like XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXX appear to be furnishing deceptive forms, as prohibited under 15 USC 1692j. This raises concerns about compliance with federal laws, and I insist these entries be deleted unless they can be substantiated. 

Unauthorized Hard Inquiries : Inquiries from XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX, and others are unauthorized and violate 15 USC 1681n ( A ), which outlines civil liability for willful noncompliance. These inquiries must be removed immediately. 

Incorrect Personal Information : My report lists incorrect addresses, such as XXXX XXXX XXXX, which I never resided at. This misinformation must be deleted promptly to ensure the accuracy of my personal data. 

These inaccuracies reflect willful noncompliance with federal regulations, including the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). If these issues are not resolved within the legally mandated timeframe, I am prepared to escalate the matter through legal channels to ensure compliance and safeguard my rights.

I am challenging several instances of inaccurate and potentially unlawful activity related to my credit report. These include debts reported under false pretenses, unauthorized hard inquiries, and incorrect personal information. Each issue violates provisions of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) or other U.S. laws that safeguard my consumer rights.

For debts, I am invoking 15 U.S. Code 1692g, which requires debt validation, and I am demanding specific documentation proving the validity of the debts in question, such as contracts or applications bearing my signature. I cite precedent cases like XXXX XXXX Trans Union Corp. to highlight the legal liability for willful non-compliance.

For unauthorized hard inquiries, I reference 15 U.S.C. 1681b ( a ) ( 2 ), which mandates a permissible purpose for accessing consumer reports. I demand these inquiries be deleted unless proven legitimate. 

In regard to the incorrect addresses listed on my report, I am asserting my right under 15 U.S.C. 1681i to dispute and correct inaccuracies, holding the credit bureau accountable for ensuring the highest standards of accuracy, as established in XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX Trans Union XXXX. 

I am demanding a thorough investigation and immediate correction of these issues. Additionally, I am prepared to escalate the matter to regulatory bodies or pursue legal action under 15 U.S.C. 1681n and 1681o if the situation is not resolved promptly and satisfactorily.

Sub-issue: Credit card company isn't resolving a dispute about a purchase on your statement
Consumer complaint narrative: Our XXXX XXXX Capital One XXXX statement arrived and we noticed immediately that there was a charge from Garage and XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  in the amount of {$690.00}. We live in Massachusetts and haven't been to XXXX XXXX in over 50 years. We called Capital One Fraud Department on or about XX/XX/XXXX and they said they would look into it. Shortly thereafter, we received XXXX letters all on the same day and all dated XX/XX/XXXX. The first one said they were investigating, the second one said we were not responsible and the third one said that we WERE responsible and were being charged because the physical card was used, which was impossible as we had it in our possession the whole time. We have called numerous times and each time they tell us that they will not investigate further as the physical card was used ; each time telling us a different story as to how the card was used. The first time they said the card was physically used, the second time they said the card was tapped and the third time they said the chip was used. We have requested further information but they refuse as they said the card was physically used so it is our responsibility. I have been researching throughout the internet and I have found numerous stories from people that have had the same thing happen to them so the chip isn't as safe as Capital One is claiming it is! Also, I have scanned the internet and there is no company with this name in any search I have made. We are responsible senior citizens and would NEVER not pay what was ours but this charge is not! We have found the representatives extremely rude and dismissive to our problem and actually I was hung up on yesterday, XX/XX/XXXX. We don't know how to proceed as we are not getting any help from Capital One. We would appreciate anything you can do to help us with this fraudulent claim. Thank you!

Product: Student loan
Issue: Dealing with your lender or servicer
Sub-issue: Trouble with how payments are being handled
Consumer complaint narrative: First, my account has been improperly placed into a forbearance and/or deferment, when it should have been in the SAVE plan so that all months count toward my student loan forgiveness. I had originally been on the REPAYE and then switched to the SAVE repayment plan for the rest of my repayment period since it was first offered. When my loans were transferred to MOHELA, Mohela improperly removed my loans from SAVE and put them into a standard repayment plan - more than doubling my monthly payment amount. Prior to that, my loans were all on the SAVE plan. Accordingly, all of the loans should have been automatically moved onto the SAVE plan since they were originally on the REPAYE plan before. This was not done. Inexplicably, without my consent or request, MOHELA placed all of my loans onto the Standard/Level repayment plan. To fix these issues that MOHELA themselves caused, MOHELA placed me on administrative forbearance and/or deferment and told me to reapply for the SAVE plan that I had already been on prior to my loans being transferred to MOHELA. Their actions appear fraudulent. I never, ever asked to be placed on a standard or level repayment which is what MOHELA unilaterally did to my loans. MOHELA illegally capitalized my interest. MOHELA illegally charged me interest even after my account was placed onto the SAVE repayment plan. The SAVE plan is supposed to PREVENT the accrual of interest so long as all payments are made. As of the most recent injunction in XX/XX/year>, my monthly payment under the SAVE plan is supposed to be {$0.00} until the injunction is lifted. Instead of listing my payment as {$0.00} dollars, MOHELA still has my account listed as in forbearance and/or deferment, which is only after I was put on hold for 3 hours to argue a {$700.00} bill that MOHELA sent me in the mail. I need the account to be immediately placed into the SAVE plan. MOHELA coerced me into submitting a new IDR plan request under the false pretense that I needed to submit a new IDR application. In fact, there was no need to submit ANY new IDR applications. MOHELA was supposed to simply convert my REPAYE plan to the SAVE plan pursuant to the direction of the Biden administration. This was not done. Instead, MOHELA made me submit numerous applications each time I called in and then placed me on forbearance and deferment that set me back on my repayment schedule. Under the federal regulations, my IDR application, should have been the only IDR plan in effect on my account. As a result - All past due amounts ( and interest ) that has accrued on the account is the WRONG amount. MOHELA is willingly and openly committing fraud and taking advantage of financially vulnerable people. Action must be taken against the company as they are blatantly and knowingly defrauding Americans and misrepresenting the Department of Education and its values. There must be accountability for their crimes and American citizens like myself must be protected from predatory corporations like MOHELA.
Company public response: Company believes it acted appropriately as authorized by contract or law

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
I recently discovered several inaccuracies on my credit report, which prompted me to take action by sending a formal demand for correction to TransUnion. The issues I encountered include the following : Incorrect Reporting of Late Payments : Multiple accounts, including those with XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX are inaccurately showing late payments. I requested these accounts be updated to reflect " paid as agreed/never late '' under the guidelines of 15 U.S.C. 1681i, which requires credit reporting agencies to investigate disputed accuracy. 

Unauthorized Hard Inquiries : Hard inquiries from XXXX XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX XXXX appeared on my report without authorization. Under 15 U.S.C. 1681n, I demanded these be deleted due to their unauthorized nature. 

Debt Validation Issues : Regarding XXXX, I invoked my rights under 15 U.S.C. 1692g ( b ) to request validation of the alleged debt, including original contracts and documentation proving the legitimacy of the claim. I emphasized that failure to provide such validation necessitates the deletion of the entry. 

Inaccurate Personal Information : An incorrect address was listed on my report ( XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ), and I requested its immediate removal. 

I cited relevant federal laws, including the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and case precedents such as XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX Trans Union XXXX, to emphasize TransUnion 's legal obligation to conduct thorough and accurate investigations. I also warned of potential legal action for willful or negligent noncompliance as outlined in 15 U.S.C. 1681n and 1681o. 

I expect TransUnion to provide a detailed description of the investigation procedures and an updated credit report reflecting the necessary corrections. Should this not be resolved promptly, I am prepared to escalate the matter to regulatory authorities or pursue legal remedies.

Product: Checking or savings account
Issue: Problem with a lender or other company charging your account
Consumer complaint narrative:
I disputed transactions made to my business checking account on XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX. Additionally, those same disputes were submitted to my personal checking account ( a separate bank ), which investigated them all and found them fraudulent. I submitted evidence to XXXX ( XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  issues debit cards ). Approximately XXXX fraudulent charges totaling over {$3000.00} USD from non-existent companies in XXXX, XXXX. I provided proof that these companies did not exist. My disputes were all denied with no substantive explanation. The dispute decisions were emailed and read, " Weve reviewed your dispute for XXXX XXXX XXXX  ( XXXX ) on XXXX ( date ), 2024. Unfortunately, based on the information provided, it doesnt appear that an error occurred. For this reason, we are unable to move forward with your dispute. Were sorry to not have better news for you. '' On XX/XX/year>, I requested all the documentation used to decide to deny my disputes. Initially, all of my requests were ignored. However, on XX/XX/XXXX, an employee, " XXXX, '' insisted they would prepare a dispute summary for me with all the information I requested. On XX/XX/XXXX, I followed up with my request after not receiving that information. I was assured by " XXXX '' that I would receive the information right away. On XX/XX/XXXX, I followed up with XXXX in the Risk department because I still hadn't received the information. On XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX said they would prepare the dispute summary with the requested documentation. On XX/XX/XXXX, I followed up again because I had not received anything from the risk department or the bank. On XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX responded, " XXXX XXXX, I apologize for the delay. We are still preparing a dispute summary for you regarding your claim. Once it's complete, we will follow up with you here. '' Today is the XXXX of XXXX, and I have still not received this information. 

If the bank can not provide me with the information they used to make the decision, they should provide provisional credits within ten business days of the dispute. They failed to do so and failed to provide me with any documents, correspondences, or information supporting their decision to deny each dispute ( some within hours ). I would like sufficient evidence that these disputes were investigated, as well as documentation and any other investigation-related materials that they used to make these decisions. It has been 26 days, and I've not received anything I requested. After performing some research, it appears that XXXX XXXX  consistently denies consumers ' disputes and does not provide any substantive information or evidence supporting those decisions.

2. Failure to Validate Debt : As per 12 CFR 1006.34 ( c ), there has been a lack of validation for the debts in question. No clear and accurate description of the debts or evidence of contractual obligation has been provided. 
Upon reviewing my consumer reports, I identified the following discrepancy that requires immediate correction : Disputed Account 1 Account Name : US DEPT ED Account Number : XXXX Dispute Reason Code : 003 - Inaccurate Information Explanation : I have never held an account with this number under the name US DEPT ED .

Inaccurate Information Explanation : I have never held an account with this number under the name XXXX XXXX Disputed Account 12 Account Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX  Account Number : XXXX Dispute Reason Code : XXXX - Inaccurate Information Explanation : I have never held an account with this number under the name XXXX XXXX XXXX  I request a manual review of this information due to the complexity of the inaccuracies. I have attached highlighted copies of my credit report with the incorrect information clearly marked. Please investigate this matter and remove the inaccurate information from my credit report. Notify me in writing of the results of your investigation and any actions taken. 
Under the FCRA, I am entitled to a thorough and transparent investigation of my dispute. I expect a prompt response to this request. If you fail to provide a detailed description of the investigation process, I will consider filing a complaint with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and may seek legal advice to ensure my rights are protected.

12 CFR 1006.34 ( c ) : The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) has established requirements for the validation of debts. Under this regulation, the debt collector must provide clear and accurate information about the debt, including a detailed description of the nature of the debt and the original creditor. This requirement has not been met in my case.

Requested Actions : In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), I request that XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX conduct a thorough investigation of my dispute, correct the inaccuracies, and provide me with an updated copy of my XXXX and XXXX XXXX, XXXX Consumer Disclosure Report once the corrections have been made. 
I respectfully request the following under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) : 1. Conduct a thorough investigation of this dispute and remove the inaccurate information from my consumer reports.

2. Provide me with a detailed written statement of the investigation results and any actions taken.

3. Send me an updated copy of my corrected consumer reports.

4. Address the following specific details regarding your investigation : o Methods used to verify the disputed information.

o Sources consulted during the investigation.

o Documentation reviewed to support verification.

o Verification process and criteria used.

o A timeline of the investigation, including key dates and actions taken.

Be advised that the description of the procedure used to determine the accuracy and completeness of the information is hereby requested, to be provided within fifteen ( 15 ) days of the completion of your investigation. Additionally, please provide the name, address, and telephone number of each person contacted regarding this alleged account. I am formally requesting a copy of any documents provided bearing my signature, showing that I have a legally binding contractual obligation to pay them the exact amount claimed.

Additionally, I request a description of the procedures used to determine the accuracy and completeness of the disputed information and the contact details of each person consulted regarding this account. Please also provide copies of any documents bearing my signature that establish a legally binding contractual obligation to pay the amount in question.

Failure to correct these inaccuracies within 30 days, as required under the FCRA, may result in further action, including filing a complaint with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) or pursuing legal remedies.

Requested Actions : 1. Conduct a thorough investigation of the disputed accounts.

2. Remove the inaccurate information from my credit report.

3. Provide me with a written statement detailing the outcome of your investigation.

4. Send a corrected copy of my credit report to my address above.

5. Methods Used : Please describe the specific methods and procedures used to verify the disputed information.

6. Sources Consulted : Provide a list of all sources, including creditors or data furnishers, consulted during the investigation.

7. Documentation Reviewed : Detail any documentation or evidence reviewed to support the verification of the disputed information.

8. Verification Process : Explain how the accuracy of the information was verified and the criteria used for validation.

9. Timeline of Investigation : Outline the timeline of the investigation, including key dates and actions taken. 
Additional Requests : 1. Procedure Description : Be advised that the description of the procedure used to determine the accuracy and completeness of the information is hereby requested. This should include a detailed explanation of how the reinvestigation was conducted and the specific steps taken.

2. Contacts : Additionally, please provide the name, address, and telephone number of each person contacted regarding this alleged account.

3. Documents Bearing Signature : I am formally requesting a copy of any documents provided bearing my signature, showing that I have a legally binding contractual obligation to pay the exact amount claimed.

2. Permanently opt me out of all pre-approved credit and insurance offers, marketing campaigns, and data-sharing programs.

Background : XXXX. Check Information Date : XXXX  Amount : {$5000.00} Payee : Myself, XXXX XXXX 2. Incident Details I deposited the above-mentioned check into my Wells Fargo account XXXX Subsequently, my account was closed, and the funds were held by Wells Fargo. 
Despite repeated attempts to contact Wells Fargo, I received no clear resolution and was told that the issuing bank ( XXXX XXXX  ) must initiate a formal claim. 
Recently, XXXX XXXX  submitted the claim as instructed. However, Wells Fargo now claims the funds were transferred to the Tennessee unclaimed property website. 

Issues : 1. Both I and the check issuer ( my friend ) searched our names on the Tennessee unclaimed property website and found no record of the {$5000.00}.

Product: Credit card
Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Consumer complaint narrative:
This is an ongoing issue. I got the Bank of America Silver Visa at the time of opening my checking/savings account at the location closest to the XXXX postal code. 

At first everything was great, but gradually nasty things emerged. 

Although I had set up online payments they weren't going through. I contacted the friendly bank official immediately. He had provided me with his direct line and email. He responded with a video link explaining " how to set up online payments ''. I did watch, but honestly, this wasn't my first account or first time setting up auto payments, and not even my first BOA account. 

He even insisted I visit him in person so he could " show me '' how to do it. I had no desire to interact with people who were clearly unwilling to accept responsibility. I would set up auto-pay. It would invariably go to - it is past due. I wasn't even getting alerts!! No alerts about payment dates which is another thing I got used to over the years. I wrote to them many times. 

They have done nothing to fix the flaw on their website/system. Also, sometimes the payment itself does not go through, and I have had to keep an eye to make sure it doesn't fail. 

It is almost as if they are very eager for my credit score to go down. They just sent me a letter informing me that they're reducing my credit line for " not paying on time '' in part. 

This is just nasty. I don't deserve to be treated this way!! 

I have to add, that I am an accomplished XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX I may be unemployed now, but I am not brain dead yet. 

But this is not how any customer should be treated. 

BOA has kind of a monopoly. There are no other banks that offer the range of services that BOA does. More recently, this seems to have become their point of contention significantly affecting the quality of service.

Consumer complaint narrative: XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, and XX/XX/XXXX, I have received a letter from Synchrony/Care Credit claiming poor credit/payment history/etc as an excuse for them to consitently lower my credit limit with them. They continuously do this even though I have a clear and consistent history of not only paying my bill on time, but have in fact overpaid on every monthly installment ( my previous payments this year alone have been $ 150 monthly -- this past month being the exception at {$100.00} -- with the minimum payment due being about $ 60 monthly ). I share this account as a joint account in name with my father, who I am not currently on speaking terms with. However, he does not use the account nor does he make payments. I called in XXXX this year to address the issue, to see if I could get my previous limit back or open another seperate account in my own name so this no longer occurs. They would not allow me to do either. As such, even though I have used this account and made proper, on time payments in good faith, Care Credit is not only damaging my credit with themselves by continuously and needlessly reducing my credit limit with them, they are artificially damaging my credit score by reducing what credit I have available to me, as well as damaging my credit utilization by reducing the limit down to dollars of what I currently owe ( In XXXX of XXXX, I had a credit limit of {$2000.00} and an available credit of {$570.00}. Now in XXXX of XXXX, I have a credit limit of {$1400.00} with an available credit of {$40.00}. In XXXX of XXXX, my credit limit was reduced to {$2200.00}. In a year 's time, my credit limit has been reduced {$880.00} even though I remain in good financial standing with Care Credit. I have not used my card at all in this time ; the lack of credit is soley from them reducing my available credit, not due to any purchases, fees, etc ) I do not have any other credit cards or services that treat me this way, and this is financially damaging to me as someone who is trying to build their credit. On my credit report, I have good payment history, a very low percentage of late payments, and very few derogatory marks. I do not have poor credit to where I should be constantly having this issue. And for this company to attack my credit even though I have had nothing but good payment history and high payment amounts demonstrates their lack of transparency and deceptive practices.
