Consumer complaint narrative:
To Whom It May Concern, I am wring to express my extreme frustration and utter disgust are discovering that the following companys ) have reported charge off ( s ) on my consumer report : [ Fair Collections & XXXX ] According to the IRS, when a debt is charged off by a creditor, it means the creditor has given up on attempting to collect the debt and has declared it as a loss for tax purposes.

When a creditor charges off a debt, they're required to file a 1099-C form with the IRS, which reports the amount of the canceled debt as income. This means that I may owe taxes on the charged-off amount, even though I didn't receive any money from the creditor.

Let me be clear, the charge off ( s ) on my consumer report is/are a blatant violation of my consumer rights and will not be tolerated. I demand the immediate removal of these late payments ) without any further delay!

I would like to remind you that the consumer laws ) cited below are not suggestions, but are in fact, legally binding regulations that you are required to follow.

15 USC 1681a 2 -Exclusions ( a ) ( i ) is a subsection of the Fair Credit Reporting Act that clearly states " Any report containing information solely as to transactions and experiences between the consumer and the person making the report.

15 USC 6802 is a section of the United States Code that outlines the obligations of financial institutions with respect to the disclosure of personal information. 15 USC 6802 outlines the " Opt Out '' requirements for financial instructions when disclosing nonpublic personal information to nonaffiliated third pares. Financial institutions are required to clearly and conspicuously disclose to the consumer, in wring or in electronic form, that their personal information may be disclosed to third pares. The consumer must be given the opportunity to direct that their information not be disclosed and must be provided with an explanation of how they can exercise that option.

15 use 1681b ( a ) ( 2 ) is a section of the United States Code that outlines the permissible purposes for which a consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report. In general, a consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report only under the following circumstances and no other : 1 ) The consumer must give written authorization, and I did not and will not give any creditor the right to add negative, inaccurate and injurious information to my consumer report.

It is clear that the charge off ( s ) on my consumer report is/are in direct violation of the laws cited above. As such, I am entitled to receive damages for this willful noncompliance. Let me be unequivocally clear, according to 15 US Code1681n, I can charge {$1000.00} for damages if you fail to remove this item immediately, as it is causing me significant harm and distress.

I demand that you take immediate action and rectify this issue promptly. Any delay or inaction on your part will be considered a deliberate attempt to violate my consumer rights and will not be tolerated.

I do not expect to receive a verification of the item in question as it is abundantly clear that it is in violation of the law. I demand that you send me an updated copy of my consumer report once the disputed item has been removed.

I trust that you will take this matter seriously and resolve it immediately.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Unfair Charges and Mismanagement by BrightWay Credit Card Details of My Complaint : On XX/XX/2024, I used my BrightWay credit card to rent an XXXX for a total of {$2200.00} ( {$1700.00} + {$440.00} ). On XX/XX/2024, I decided to cancel the reservation and contacted OneMain Financial to notify them that the XXXX provider would be refunding the amount to my account. OneMain Financial assured me that once the refund was processed, the overage amount would be mailed to me, and there would be no additional charges. 

Shortly after, I received an overage refund check for {$2000.00}. However, when I logged into my account to verify my balance, I noticed a charge of {$44.00} had been posted. I immediately contacted OneMain Financial to understand this charge, and I was informed that it was due to a " cash advance '' taken on my account. 

This explanation did not make sense to me because I had not requested or authorized a cash advance. Upon reviewing the BrightWay app on my phone, it indicated that cash advances can only be performed at an ATM using a PIN and selecting the cash advance option, which I never did. I raised my concern with BrightWay, and an employee assured me the issue was corrected, and the charge was removed. 

To my surprise, on XX/XX/2024, the exact same {$44.00} charge reappeared on my account. This recurring charge is causing me great concern, as it could result in overdraft fees or late payments when my other scheduled payments are processed. 

Why I Believe This Is Unfair : I did not authorize or initiate a cash advance. 
Despite assurances from BrightWay that the issue was resolved, the charge reappeared. 
The repeated posting of this charge, coupled with the lack of clear communication and accountability from BrightWay, suggests possible mismanagement or unfair practices. 
This situation has caused unnecessary stress, and I feel as though BrightWay is taking advantage of me by imposing unauthorized charges on my account. 

Requested Resolution : I am requesting a thorough investigation into this matter and for the {$44.00} charge to be permanently removed from my account. Additionally, I ask that BrightWay ensure no future unauthorized charges occur and take measures to improve their customer service and billing practices. 

I have attached pictures from XXXX that document the dates and details of these transactions as evidence for your review. 

Thank you for addressing this matter promptly. 

Sincerely,

Product: Debt collection
Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Sub-issue: Debt was result of identity theft
Consumer complaint narrative:
To Whom It May Concern : DEPT VALIDATION REQUEST Be advised this is not a refusal to pay, but a notice that your claim is disputed and validation is requested. Under the Fair Debt collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I have the right to request validation of the debt you say I owe you. I am requesting proof that I am indeed the party you are asking to pay this debt, and there is some contractual obligation that is binding on me to pay this debt.

This is NOT a request for verification or proof of my mailing address, but a request for VALIDATION made pursuant to 15 USC 1692g Sec. 809 ( b ) of the FDCPA. I respectfully request that your offices provide me with competent evidence that I have any legal obligation to pay you.

At this time I will also inform you that if your offices have or continue to report invalidated information to any of the three major credit bureaus ( XXXX, XXXX, XXXX XXXX ), this action might constitute fraud under both federal and state laws. Due to this fact, if any negative mark is found or continues to report on any of my credit reports by your company or the company you represent, I will not hesitate in bringing legal action against you and your client for the following : Violation of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act and Defamation of Character.

I am sure your legal staff will agree that non-compliance with this request could put your company in serious legal trouble with the FTC and other state or federal agencies.

If your offices are able to provide the proper documentation as requested in the following declaration, I will require 30 days to investigate this information and during such time all collection activity must cease and desist. Also, during this validation period, if any action is taken which could be considered detrimental to any of my credit reports, I will consult with legal counsel for suit. This includes any listing of any information to a credit-reporting repository that could be inaccurate or invalidated. If your offices fail to respond to this validation request within 30 days from the date of your receipt, all references to this account must be deleted and completely removed from my credit file and a copy of such deletion request shall be sent to me immediately.

It would be advisable that you and your client assure that your records are in order before I am forced to take legal action.

CREDITOR/DEBT COLLECTOR DECLARATION Please provide the following : Agreement with your client that grants you the authority to collect on this alleged debt.

Agreement that bears the signature of the alleged debtor wherein he/she agreed to pay the creditor. Any insurance claims been made by any creditor regarding this account.

Any Judgments obtained by any creditor regarding this account. Name and address of alleged creditor.

Name on file of alleged debtor.

Alleged account number.

Address on file for alleged debtor.

Amount of alleged debt.

Date this alleged debt became payable.

Date of original charge off or delinquency.

Verification that this debt was assigned or sold to collector.

Complete accounting of alleged debt.

Commission for debt collector if collection efforts are successful.

Please provide the name and address of the bonding agent for COLLECTIONAGENCY in case legal action becomes necessary. Your claim can not and WILL NOT be considered if any portion of the above is not completed and returned with copies of all requested documents. This is a request for validation made pursuant to the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act. Please allow 30 days for processing after I receive this information back. 
Best Regards XXXX XXXX cc Federal Trade Commission

Since then, my home has been removed from foreclosure status.

Additionally, I have received letters from the company stating that my mortgage is in default due to these unexplained charges. Based on my previous experiences, I believe Selene. Finance iss engaging in predatory practices designed to delay responses and attempt to possess my home. 

I am requesting a thorough investigation into these charges. If they are indeed related to the prior illegal foreclosure, I demand that all fees be removed. Furthermore, I request confirmation that these fees have been eliminated from my account.

After I told their agent that I am complaining to CFPB and that I have recorded their calls, they filed an internal complaint and now refuse to speak to me over the phone stating that their system is down ( I also recorded this as proof ) the problem : 1. As a consumer I have the right to information on my account such as my balance, recent transactions, payment history. 2. Capital one refuses to update my address and phone number stating that they need to verify my ID, and they are not willing to accept my United States Passport or my Passport Card. ( these are two valid forms of ID that I used to open my account ) I have no other ID, eve though I offered my birth certificate as well. 3. My personal data is being sent to an old address that is now someone else residence, this means that I don't have access to any communication including debt collection. I am concerned that someone else is getting my statements. 4. I am unable to update my phone number for the same reason, they state that I lack a state ID, however I simply do not have this, nor do I have the means to obtain. 5. I am unable to make purchases because I can not receive the security PIN, it keeps going to the old number. 6. The biggest problem is that I can not login online, nor can I update my address to get statements meaning that I have to call in to Capone to get status updates, verify transactions, and I'm concerned that the information may not be accurate or complete, and it is also very time consuming as to call in requires going through verification and hold times. 7. I believe that by law as a consumer I have the right to receive statements by mail to my designated address, on the last phone call I clearly provided this address to the agent and she acknowledged it but was not able to update. I believe Capone is out of compliance with at least one federal law, which is their duty to maintain updated customer information. Because I don't know how much I owe or payments, now the card is going into collections and this will impact my credit score. I Have attached the XXXX recording of phone call. If you are not able to download or access the recording please reach out to me. I have also added the recording on XXXX and I can send the link if needed.

Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally request your assistance in resolving a critical issue regarding inaccuracies on my credit report, which have severely impacted my ability to purchase a home. I discovered that my student loan accounts are being reported with a " collection '' or " charged off '' status, despite my consistent good standing and compliance with all repayment obligations. This erroneous reporting violates the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically 15 U.S.C. 1681g, as it fails to ensure the accuracy and integrity of the information being reported. 

The emotional distress caused by this situation is profound, as the inaccurate reporting has obstructed my ability to achieve homeownership, a significant milestone in my life. I respectfully request that the CFPB investigate this matter promptly and work with the relevant credit reporting agencies and loan servicers to correct these inaccuracies and remove the erroneous information from my credit report. 

Thank you for your time and attention to this matter.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally dispute an inaccurate entry on my credit report, which I pulled on XX/XX/2024. Specifically, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX account is incorrectly reported as closed, with inaccurate multiple payment history dates. Despite this, you have continued to verify and report the information as accurate, without providing any supporting documentation to substantiate its accuracy. 

This failure to correct the error is a violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically under 15 USC 1681i, which requires credit bureaus to investigate and verify disputed information within 30 days. As such, I request that you promptly investigate this matter and remove or correct the inaccurate information from my credit report. 

If the inaccurate information is not corrected within the required 30-day timeframe, I will be forced to pursue legal action under 15 USC 1692g .

So on XX/XX/XXXX I pointed out that this account was showing as 120 days late in XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/XXXX which is inaccurate. I have attached XXXX reporting of this account. These inaccuracies are highly injurious to my credit, it undermines the faith in the credit reporting system, is illegal, and against the FCRA statutes. After I have asked you to fix these 3 times, you still have neglected to correct the mistakes. I am demanding a deletion of this account. Failure to comply with this demand within the specified timeframe will leave me no choice but to pursue legal remedies, which may include filing formal complaints with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), as well as seeking damages through litigation. I look forward to your prompt response and resolution of this matter. Please confirm receipt of this letter and provide a written response outlining the steps you are taking to address this issue.

Product: Credit card
Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Issue: Problem with a purchase shown on your statement
Sub-issue: Card was charged for something you did not purchase with the card
Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/XXXX I got an alert that I was over my credit limit on a Capital One Quicksilver Credit Card. I checked my card immediately and noticed XXXX charges that I did not make. XXXX for XXXX, XXXX for XXXX, and XXXX for XXXX. I promptly call the credit card fraud number on the back of my card. I was asked if I still had the card in my hand and I honestly answered yes. I asked how the charges were made and was told by the rep via XXXX or XXXX XXXX tap. The rep canceled my card and issued me a new one. On XX/XX/XXXX, I received a letter stating my card was not compromised and I needed to pay the charges. I called capital one back and was told the charges were made with the chip. Therefore, Im liable for the charges. I explained I did not make these charges and XXXX is full of articles regarding credit card duplications. One including chip duplication. I asked for the documents showing the investigated and what methods they used. The rep just stated she does not have that. I asked for the person that does. She stated over that I am liable for the charges. I called back later the same day. I spoke with a different rep and he stated the charges were reversed. I asked him to hold while I checked and to my surprise they were. I was told by the rep I would never see the charges again. On XX/XX/XXXX, I checked my card again and the charges were back. I called again and got a fraud department supervisor. He just repeated over and over that capital one believes I made the charges. I explained I didnt and why would I go through this trouble if I have had XXXX problems paying for charges in the past. He just kept repeated my card was not compromised and I made the charges. The investigation was based on me still having the card in hand. Case closed. I would like more answers and an explanation if this is Capital ones best practices for any future instances. I need help getting my money back as I did not make these charges.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Recently, I did an investigation on my credit report and found several items on there to be inaccurate. 
Under 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ) Accuracy of report whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates. 
15 U.S. Code 1681i 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In general If, after any re-investigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall ( i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the re-investigation; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/year>, I submitted an identity theft affidavit to XXXX XXXX to dispute two fraudulent accounts on my credit report : 1. XXXX  XXXX XXXX- {$180.00} ( Account ending in XXXX ) 2. XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX - {$300.00} Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2, consumer reporting agencies are required to block fraudulent information within four business days of receiving the following : 1. Proof of identity, 2. An identity theft affidavit, 3. Identification of the fraudulent accounts, and 4. A statement affirming the items are fraudulent. Despite submitting all required documentation on XX/XX/year>, XXXX XXXX failed to block or remove these fraudulent accounts. On XX/XX/year>, they completed my dispute and provided me with a result from XXXX, but they failed to address or remove the two fraudulent accounts on my screening report. This failure to comply with federal law has caused significant harm. XXXX XXXX provided this inaccurate screening report to the apartment community I applied to, resulting in a delay in my approval and preventing me from moving into my new residence as planned on XX/XX/year>. This delay has disrupted my housing situation and created further financial and personal hardship. I request that XXXX XXXX immediately comply with the FCRA by : 1. Removing or blocking the fraudulent accounts from my file, and 2. Providing written confirmation of the corrected information to me and any third party that received the inaccurate screening report. 


XXXX - Reporting Public Bankruptcy three times. All bankruptcy being reoprted do not belong to me and need to be removed. Please provide me with an transcript in to your investigation.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
I recently conducted a review of my credit report and found several items that have caused me significant distress. These items appear to be unverifiable, inaccurate, and questionable. Your agency has failed to ensure the accuracy of the information as required under 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ) Accuracy of Reports. This statute mandates that consumer reporting agencies must follow reasonable procedures to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of the information they report. 

Furthermore, under 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) Treatment of Inaccurate or Unverifiable Information, you are required to promptly delete or modify any information found to be inaccurate, incomplete, or unverifiable during a reinvestigation. If you are unable to provide me with verifiable proof of the accuracy of the disputed items within 15 days of your investigation, these accounts and the related information must be removed from my credit report.

Additionally, under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I do not recognize any of the alleged creditors or debt collectors. I have never entered into a valid contract with any of these entities, nor have I engaged in any transactions with them. As such, these accounts are fraudulent and and inaccurate information. 

Moreover, under the Fair Credit Billing Act, my right to privacy has been violated, and this breach infringes upon my rights as outlined in The Privacy Act of 1974. Removing the inaccurate and fraudulent information from my credit report will help restore my privacy and prevent further violations.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Notice of Deletion of XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Charge-Off and Request for Removal from All Credit Reports Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing to inform you of the recent deletion of a charge-off from my XXXX credit report related to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX The account, identified as " XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, '' had a reported balance of {$1000.00} and was listed as a charge-off. 

As of XX/XX/year>, after submitting a formal dispute, XXXX completed their investigation and deleted the account from my XXXX report. Please find the relevant details of the account : Account Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Type : Charge-Off Amount : {$1000.00} Dispute Resolution Date : XX/XX/year> Outcome : Account Deleted According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), a consumer is entitled to accurate and verifiable information being reported on their credit report. Since XXXX has completed their investigation and determined that the information is unverifiable, they have deleted this account from my XXXX credit file. 

In light of the deletion from XXXX, I kindly request that all other credit reporting agencies, including but not limited to XXXX, XXXX, and TransUnion, conduct a thorough review of this account. If these agencies can not verify this debt, I am requesting that they remove the account from my credit reports as well. The FCRA mandates that credit reporting agencies must ensure that any information they report is accurate, and if they can not verify the information, it must be deleted. 

Legal Basis for Removal : Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) Section 1681i : This section states that if any information is found to be inaccurate or unverifiable during a dispute process, it must be removed or corrected. Given that XXXX  has deleted the account, the other CRAs are obligated to ensure their reports reflect accurate and verified information.

Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) Section 1681e ( b ) : Requires that credit reporting agencies maintain procedures to ensure the accuracy of the information reported. 

Please take notice that I am requesting the removal of this unverifiable account within 30 days or less. If the account is not removed in the specified timeframe, I reserve the right to pursue legal action, including suing for violation of my rights under the FCRA. I understand that under FCRA Section 1681n, I may be entitled to seek damages if my rights have been violated, including statutory damages and attorney fees. 

I look forward to your prompt resolution of this matter and expect that the unverifiable account will be removed within the legally required timeframe.

Hello, I am writing to dispute fraudulent information appearing on my credit report. Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681, I am entitled to accurate reporting and the removal of any information resulting from identity theft or fraud. 

The following accounts have been fraudulently opened or contain information that is not attributable to me : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX - XXXX a. Issue : Fraudulent account not authorized by me. 

XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX a. Issue : Fraudulent account not authorized by me. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX a. Issue : Fraudulent account not authorized by me. 

XXXX. XXXX - XXXX a. Issue : Fraudulent account not authorized by me. 

XXXX. XXXX - XXXX a. Issue : Fraudulent account not authorized by me. 

XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX - XXXX a. Issue : Fraudulent account not authorized by me. 

I have attached the following supporting documents to substantiate my claim : A police report confirming the identity theft incident. 
A fraud affidavit detailing the unauthorized accounts. 

Additionally, under 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2, I formally request the removal of these fraudulent accounts from my credit report. This section of the FCRA ensures that credit reporting agencies must block information resulting from identity theft within XXXX business days of receiving sufficient proof, including : XXXX. Proof of identity. 
XXXX. A copy of the police report. 
XXXX. A detailed statement of the fraud. 

Attached to this dispute are : - A copy of my government-issued ID. 
- Proof of address. 
- A copy of the police report and fraud affidavit. 

I request the removal or blocking of these accounts as required by law. Please confirm receipt of this dispute and notify me of any action taken to resolve it. Should you need additional information, please contact me promptly. 

Thank you for your assistance in resolving this matter and ensuring compliance with the FCRA. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
My name is XXXX. I got my credit report on a website and was able to see that my information is being reported by companies like TransUnion, XXXX, XXXX and with many inaccuracies that I never consented to or have reported that info myself nor did they ever contact me to ask for my consent, whether it be the personal information ( MY NAME ) that is incorrect on my XXXX report : MY CORRECT NAME : XXXX XXXX THE INCORRECT NAMES INCLUDED IN XXXX REPORT, ( included along with the attachments provided ) : XXXX OR XXXX XXXX My consent was not asked for by these companies when it comes to all inquiries that are listed on my Trans Union credit report, the inquiries are all Unauthorized, I need these removed immediately. 

Lastly, my consent was not asked for by XXXX for the account listed as negative Therefore, this is an Unauthorized by me, XXXX XXXX. ( company of account : XXXX XXXX account number : XXXX ) Under 15 USC 1666B , this is a billing error, always paid as agreed on time this is an error, this account is in violation.

Not only does Experians actions presently affect how lenders view my ability to borrow but it is completely violating me, my rights and the LAWS/ACTS/CODES that stand to protect me, because these companies have FALSE information they are using in my name I never consented for them to report nor was I, XXXX XXXX, asked once again.

Misleading false reporting, negligently and inaccurately reporting failing to comply to 15 USC 1692 ( g ) Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically 15 USC 1681, section 602a, it is stated that consumer reporting agencies must handle their responsibilities with fairness, impartiality, and respect for consumer privacy. XXXX and XXXX are consumer reporting agencies, and as a consumer, I have the right to ensure that my private information is not disclosed. This right is supported by 15 USC 6801, which requires financial institutions to protect the privacy and confidentiality of their customers ' nonpublic personal information. Since these agencies are considered " furnishers of information '' under this law, they are obligated to follow these privacy standards.

Furthermore, according to 15 USC 1681, section 604a ( 2 ), a consumer reporting agency can only share a consumer report under specific circumstances, and one of those conditions is with the written consent of the consumer. XXXX, XXXX, and any financial institutions providing information to them do not have my permission, either written or verbal, to share my information. Any consent, whether implied or expressed, is hereby revoked. 
Additionally, 15 USC 6802 ( b ) ( c ) mandates that a financial institution can not disclose nonpublic personal information to a third party without informing the consumer about their right to opt out. Neither XXXX nor XXXX has provided me with this necessary information. According to 15 USC 1681c ( a ) ( 5 ), consumer reporting agencies are prohibited from including certain adverse information that is older than seven years, including any account or item that would negatively affect my credit, unless specifically authorized by law. 

Moreover, 15 U.S. Code 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) stipulates that no one should report inaccurate information to consumer reporting agencies, and XXXX and XXXX must ensure they follow reasonable procedures to prevent such violations. Lastly, 12 CFR 1016.7 grants consumers the right to opt out of reporting services at any time, and I am formally exercising that right.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am submitting this formal complaint regarding violations of federal and California state laws by XXXX XXXX, and consumer reporting agencies, XXXX, TRANSUNION, and XXXX. These entities have engaged in unlawful practices that infringe upon my federally and state-protected rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ), XXXX XXXX XXXX GLBA ), Privacy Act of XXXX, Federal Trade Commission ACT / Holder Rule , and related California laws .

According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act 15 USC 1681 section 602 ( a ) states, " There is a need to ensure that consumer reporting agencies exercise their grave responsibilities with fairness, impartiality, and a respect for the consumers right to privacy. XXXX, TRANSUNION, AND XXXX, are consumer reporting agencies, and I am the Consumer. I have the right to make sure my private information isn't shared which is supported by 15 USC 6801 which states It is the policy of the Congress that each financial institution has an affirmative and continuing obligation to respect the privacy of its customers and to protect the security and confidentiality of those customers nonpublic personal information. '' XXXX XXXX is a financial institution by definition under that title. 15 USC 1681 section 604 a section 2 states that " In general Subject to subsection ( c ), any consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report under the following circumstances and no other : in accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates. XXXX XXXX and the Consumer reporting agencies XXXX, TRANSUNION AND XXXX do not have my consent to furnish this information, and they surely do not have my written consent. Any and all consent that XXXX have been given to XXXX, TRANSUNION, XXXX, and XXXX XXXX whether it be verbal, non-verbal, written, implied or otherwise is revoked. 15 USC 6802 ( b ) ( c ) states that A financial institution may not disclose non-public personal information to a nonaffiliated third party unless the consumer is given an explanation of how the consumer can exercise that nondisclosure option. XXXX XXXX never informed me of my right to exercise my nondisclosure option. Not only that 15 USC 1681C ( a ) ( 5 ) states, Except as authorized under subsection ( b ), no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information Any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years. '' This account is an adverse item they are reporting again without my permission which is against the law. Under 15 USC 1681 Section 604 ( a ), agencies are prohibited from furnishing reports without explicit written instructions from the consumer. I have not provided such instructions, yet my information has been unlawfully reported.

There should be no late payments being reported to any of my accounts. Payment history is illegal to post to a credit report. 15 USC Code 1681 ( b ) outlines Permissible purposes of consumer reports. Per 15 USC 1681c - Requirements relating to information contained in consumer reports, no adverse item besides the conviction of crimes should be in your report. Any item that is a derogatory mark is not allowed into consumer reports without the consumers consent. " Violation of 15 USC 1681a ( 2 ) ( a ) ( i ) and 1681s-2 ( a ) - XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX inaccurate and misleading information to consumer reporting agencies, including XXXX, TRANSUNION, and XXXX, XXXX violation of 15 U.S. Code 1681a ( 2 ) ( a ) ( i ) and 15 U.S. Code 1681s-2 ( a ). Specifically, the FCRA states that consumer reports should not include information solely related to transactions or experiences ( e.g., payment history, charge-off status ) between a consumer and the entity reporting, XXXX XXXX XXXX Additionally, 15 U.S. Code 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) prohibits a furnisher from providing any information to a consumer reporting agency if they know or have reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate. Despite my notification to XXXX XXXX regarding inaccuracies in their reporting, they have failed to cease furnishing incorrect data to these agencies. As a federally protected consumer, I hereby demand that XXXX XXXX immediately cease all reporting of inaccurate information and correct the errors with all consumer reporting agencies. 
Breach of Privacy Act of XXXX and Unauthorized Sharing of Information : XXXX XXXX violated the Privacy Act of XXXX by unlawfully sharing my personal financial information with non-affiliated third parties, specifically XXXX, TRANSUNION, and XXXX, which are not affiliates of XXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXX own terms and conditions prohibit sharing such information with non-affiliates, yet they have disregarded this obligation. Per the Privacy Act of XXXX ( 5 U.S. Code 552 ( a ), I hereby revoke any and all authorizations given written, verbal, non-verbal that may have been previously provided to XXXX XXXX. Effective immediately, XXXX XXXX is prohibited from sharing, reporting, or distributing any of my personal or financial information to any third party, including consumer reporting agencies. 
Non-Compliance with Opt-Out Provisions under 15 U.S.C. 6802 ( XXXX XXXX ) : As a federally protected consumer under the XXXX XXXX ( 15 U.S.C. 6802 ), I hereby opt-out of any and all authorizations, written or verbal, that I may have provided to XXXX XXXX regarding the sharing of my personal information. XXXX XXXX has failed to honor its obligations under federal law by continuing to share my information without proper authorization, and I demand immediate compliance. 
XXXX XXXX has inaccurately reported information about transactions and experiences, such as late payments and charge-off statuses, in violation of 15 U.S.C. 1681a ( a ) ( 2 ) ( A ) ( i ) and 1681s-2 ( a ). It is illegal for a consumer reporting agency to report a consumer 's experiences and transactions, including payment history. These " late payments '' must be removed, and this account must be updated immediately. Despite being notified of these inaccuracies, they continue to furnish misleading information to XXXX, TransUnion, and XXXX, which also violates 15 U.S.C. 1666 ( a ), as they failed to send periodic statements at least 21 days before the due date, improperly marking payments as late. I have not received the required notices or statements, which caused further harm to my credit profile.

Per 15 U.S.C. 1666 ( a ) Time to make payments : A creditor may not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open-end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose, unless the creditor has adopted reasonable procedures designed to ensure that each periodic statement including the information required by section XXXX ( b ) of this title is mailed or delivered to the consumer not later than twenty-one days before the payment due date. XXXX XXXX is in violation of this code. 
Violations of the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ) Failure to Address Credit Balances ( 15 U.S.C. 1666d ) : When a credit balance exceeding {$1.00} arises from payments, rebates, or other transactions, the creditor must : ( A ) Credit the amount to the consumer 's account. ( B ) Refund any remaining balance upon the consumer 's request. ( C ) Make a good-faith effort to refund balances exceeding six months unless the consumer 's current location can not be determined. I formally requested documentary evidence under 15 U.S.C. 1666 ( b ) ( 2 ) and 44 to clarify disputed amounts and resolve the BILLING ERROR NOTICE sent to XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX. XXXX XXXX has failed to comply with these provisions, depriving me of the rightful return of funds. Failure to Provide Documentary Evidence ( XXXX XXXX. XXXX ( b ) ( XXXX ) and XXXX ) : Under these sections, I again formally request documentary evidence, including books of account, to clarify disputed amounts and resolve this billing error. XXXX of XXXX Rights ( XXXX XXXX. XXXX ( XXXX ) ) : Creditors who fail to address disputes and comply with billing error resolution requirements forfeit their rights to collect on disputed amounts. The creditors continued noncompliance means they have forfeited the right to collect on all past, present, and future amounts related to this account. 
XXXX XXXX, XXXX, TransUnion, and XXXX have also violated the Privacy Act of XXXX ( XXXX XXXX. XXXX ) by unlawfully sharing my personal financial information with non-affiliated third parties, including consumer reporting agencies, without authorization. 
Violation of XXXX CFR XXXX and XXXX Under the FTCs Holder Rule ( XXXX CFR Part XXXX ), creditors are not exempt from responsibility for compliance with consumer protections. Specifically, according to XXXX CFR XXXX ( a ), any seller who has taken or received an open-end consumer credit contract before XX/XX/XXXX, shall be exempt from certain requirements only if the contract does not cut off the consumer 's claims and defenses. Any attempts by this creditor to waive or limit my rights are invalid under these provisions. Despite this, XXXX XXXX has attempted to limit my rights by reporting false and inaccurate data. Section XXXX of the FTC XXXX prohibits unfair and deceptive practices, mandating that consumer credit reports be accurately maintained. 
Under California XXXX XXXX XXXX ( a ), furnishing inaccurate or incomplete information to consumer reporting agencies is prohibited. XXXX XXXX has knowingly submitted false data. California XXXX XXXX XXXX allows consumers to seek damages for inaccuracies. Additionally, under the California XXXX XXXX XXXX, financial institutions must disclose how personal financial information is shared or used, which XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX do. 
I formally exercise my right to opt out of any disclosures of my personal information under XXXX XXXX. XXXX ( GLBA ), XXXX XXXX XXXX ( a ) ( XXXX ) ( XXXX ), and XXXX CFR XXXX. FORM OF OPT OUT NOTICE TO CONSUMERS/OPT OUT METHODS- SECTION ( f ) A consumer XXXX opt out at any time. I revoke all implied or expressed consent for the use or disclosure of my data. Additionally, under the Privacy Act of XXXX, my Social Security number must not be disclosed to any third parties except federal agencies as required by law. 
The penalties for these violations are substantial. Violations of XXXX result in civil penalties of up to {$100000.00} per violation, personal liability for officers and directors of up to {$10000.00} per violation, and possible imprisonment. TILA violations XXXX incur damages of up to {$1000.00} per violation, class action damages up to {$500000.00} or 1 % of the creditors net worth, and legal fees. Under the FTC XXXX, deceptive practices can lead to significant fines and corrective measures. 
Removal of erroneous hard Inquiries : Pursuant to XXXX XXXX XXXX, I hereby demand that XXXX, TransUnion, and XXXX remove all inquiries related to my personal information that are not linked to an active account from your records and any third-party reporting systems, including credit agencies, within 10 business days. These inquiries include : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, TX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, PA XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX  SD XXXX XXXX XXXX 
I formally request that XXXX XXXX and the consumer reporting agencies including XXXX, TransUnion, and XXXX immediately cease all unauthorized sharing of my personal information, correct all inaccuracies in my credit reports, and provide the accounting per the NOTICE OF BILLING ERROR. These entities must adhere to my opt-out rights under 15 U.S.C. 6802-6805, prohibiting further distribution or processing of my data without my explicit consent. Compliance with the Privacy Act of XXXX is also required to prevent any unauthorized handling or dissemination of my personal information. 
The unlawful practices described have caused significant financial harm, emotional distress, and reputational damage. The continued sharing of private information, inaccurate reporting of adverse items, and failure to address disputes have severely compromised my financial stability and undermined my rights as a federally protected consumer. 
I urge the CFPB to investigate these violations thoroughly and impose appropriate enforcement actions. If these issues are not resolved promptly, I reserve the right to pursue additional legal remedies.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Consumer Name : ( XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ), Consumer Social Security Number : ( XXXX ), Consumer Date of Birth, ( XX/XX/XXXX ) Contents of complaint : This CFPB complaint has been filed to request pursuant to FCRA 605B ( 15 U.S.C. 1681 c-2 ) that you, the TransUnion credit reporting agency , block any information reporting on my consumer FICO credit report that is the result of identity theft and fraud within the 4 days of you receiving this complaint. This inaccurate, fraudulent, and false information consists of multiple accounts which are listed below : -The 1st fraudulent account consist of a personal credit card account issued by XXXX XXXXXXXX on XX/XX/XXXX under the account number ( XXXX ) -The 2nd fraudulent account consist of personal credit card issued by XXXX  XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX under the account number ( XXXX ) -The 3rd fraudulent account consist of an auto loan issued by XXXX XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX under the account number ( XXXX ) -The 4th fraudulent account consist of a bank account issued by XXXX XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX under the account number ( XXXX  ) -The 5th fraudulent account consist of a personal credit card account issued by XXXX XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX under the account number ( XXXX ) -The 6th fraudulent account consist of a credit line issued by XXXX. XXXX, XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX under the account number ( XXXX ). 
These accounts have resulted in numerous fraudulent hard inquiries and fraudulent collections reporting on my consumer FICO credit report. I've also attached a list of the unauthorized hard inquiries in question as well as a copy of my consumer FICO credit report, which is maintained by you, which shows the aforementioned fraudulent items. I do not recognize the aforementioned accounts, collections, or hard inquiries appearing on my consumer report. The aforementioned accounts, collections, and hard inquiries reporting on my consumer FICO report maintained by you were not opened, made, or initiated by me. All of the aforementioned accounts, collections, and hard inquiries are the result of identity theft and fraud. I have attached 2 copies of FTC Identity Theft Affidavit reports ( Report # XXXX & Report # XXXX ) as proof from the US Federal Trade Commission that all of the aforementioned consumer credit accounts, collections, and hard inquiries are the result of identity theft and fraud

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
I recently conducted a review of my credit report and found several items that have caused me significant distress. These items appear to be unverifiable, inaccurate, and questionable. Your agency has failed to ensure the accuracy of the information as required under 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ) Accuracy of Reports. This statute mandates that consumer reporting agencies must follow reasonable procedures to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of the information they report. 

Furthermore, under 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) Treatment of Inaccurate or Unverifiable Information, you are required to promptly delete or modify any information found to be inaccurate, incomplete, or unverifiable during a reinvestigation. If you are unable to provide me with verifiable proof of the accuracy of the disputed items within XXXX  days of your investigation, these accounts and the related information must be removed from my credit report. 

Additionally, under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I do not recognize any of the alleged creditors or debt collectors. I have never entered into a valid contract with any of these entities, nor have I engaged in any transactions with them. As such, these accounts are fraudulent and and inaccurate information. 

Moreover, under the Fair Credit Billing Act, my right to privacy has been violated, and this breach infringes upon my rights as outlined in The Privacy Act of 1974. Removing the inaccurate and fraudulent information from my credit report will help restore my privacy and prevent further violations.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
I recently conducted a review of my credit report and found several items that have caused me significant distress. These items appear to be unverifiable, inaccurate, and questionable. Your agency has failed to ensure the accuracy of the information as required under 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ) Accuracy of Reports. This statute mandates that consumer reporting agencies must follow reasonable procedures to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of the information they report. 

Furthermore, under 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) Treatment of Inaccurate or Unverifiable Information, you are required to promptly delete or modify any information found to be inaccurate, incomplete, or unverifiable during a reinvestigation. If you are unable to provide me with verifiable proof of the accuracy of the disputed items within XXXX  days of your investigation, these accounts and the related information must be removed from my credit report. 

Additionally, under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I do not recognize any of the alleged creditors or debt collectors. I have never entered into a valid contract with any of these entities, nor have I engaged in any transactions with them. As such, these accounts are fraudulent and and inaccurate information. 

Moreover, under the Fair Credit Billing Act, my right to privacy has been violated, and this breach infringes upon my rights as outlined in The Privacy Act of 1974. Removing the inaccurate and fraudulent information from my credit report will help restore my privacy and prevent further violations.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Credit Report Dispute Request for Investigation and Correction To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to formally dispute several inaccuracies on my XXXX credit report. I have reviewed my credit report as of [ Insert Date ], and I have identified the following errors that require immediate correction under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). Below is a detailed explanation of the disputed accounts and the inaccuracies : XXXX. XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX  ( Account Ending in XXXX XXXX - Date Opened : XX/XX/XXXX Inaccuracy : The account shows a credit usage of 268 %, which is mathematically impossible given a {$300.00} credit limit. 
Requested Correction : Verify and update the balance and credit usage to reflect accurate and lawful reporting. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Ending in XXXX XXXX - Date Opened : XX/XX/XXXX Inaccuracy : This account appears to duplicate the above account from XX/XX/XXXX. Both accounts indicate charge-offs, but there is no clarification as to whether they represent the same debt. 
Requested Correction : Investigate and delete any duplicate reporting. If they are separate obligations, please provide detailed documentation to verify the legitimacy of both accounts. 

XXXX XXXX  ( Account Ending in XXXX ) - Date Opened : XX/XX/XXXX Inaccuracy : The account shows a credit usage of 127 %, which exceeds the reported {$700.00} credit limit. Additionally, the last payment date and balance update timelines are inconsistent. 
Requested Correction : Verify and correct the credit usage and balance. Provide clarification on the reporting discrepancies for the timeline of updates. 

XXXX. XXXX XXXX ( Account Ending in XXXX  ) - Date Opened : XX/XX/XXXX Inaccuracy : This account shows a credit usage of 201 % with a {$600.00} limit and an outstanding balance of {$1200.00}. Additionally, the comment mentions first payment never received, but the report lacks detail on whether this is accurate. 
Requested Correction : Verify and update the reported credit usage and outstanding balance. Clarify and provide evidence to support the comment listed under this account. 

XXXX. XXXX XXXX ( Account Ending in XXXX  ) - Date Opened : XX/XX/XXXX Inaccuracy : The report states : Collection account. {$1800.00} past due as of XX/XX/XXXX, but there is no indication whether the debt is with the original creditor or a third-party collector. 
The timeline for updates is inconsistent, with Status Updated in XX/XX/XXXX and Balance Updated in XX/XX/XXXX, despite the account being opened less than a year before. 
The terms listed as 1 month do not align with the balance reported unless additional charges ( e.g., termination fees ) are properly documented. 
Requested Correction : Investigate the validity of this collection account, verify the timeline for updates, and ensure the balance reflects lawful reporting. Clarify whether the debt remains with XXXX or has been sold to a collection agency. 

XXXX. General Reporting Errors Inaccurate Status Updates : Several accounts reflect conflicting last payment dates and status update dates ( e.g., balance updates for closed accounts ). 
Duplicate Reporting : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  accounts appear redundant. 
Requested Correction : Ensure that all statuses, dates, and balances are accurately reflected. 

I have attached a copy of my credit report with the disputed accounts highlighted for your reference, along with a copy of my government-issued ID and proof of address to verify my identity. 

Please conduct a thorough investigation into these issues and provide me with the results of your findings. If you determine that the disputed information is inaccurate, I request that you promptly update my credit report to reflect the corrections and notify any creditors that received the incorrect information. 

In accordance with the FCRA, I expect a response within 30 days. You may contact me via mail at the address above or by phone at ( XXXX ) XXXX if you require additional information. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your timely resolution. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting act. The List of accounts below has violated my federally protected consumer rights to privacy and confidentiality under 15 USC 1681. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, has violated my rights I looked at my Trans Union credit report on XX/XX/year> and noticed some things are incomplete and not accurate. And according to the fair credit reporting act Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates according to 15 USC 1681 ( XXXX ) ( b ). 

And according to 15 USC 1681i XXXX they are suppose to do this ( XXXX ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In general if, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( XXXX ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall- ( ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( XXXX ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer. 


and according to 15 USC 1681s-2 they are suppose to not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : ** Complaint Regarding Credit Bureau Non-Compliance with FCRA XXXX XXXX XXXX  Dear CFPB, I am a victim of XXXX XXXX, also known as " false imprisonment. '' Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically [ 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ( a ) ], credit reporting agencies are required to block negative information on a credit report resulting from human trafficking upon receipt of appropriate documentation. 

I provided the credit bureaus with all necessary documentation, including proof of my status as a trafficking victim, and requested that the negative items related to this situation be blocked from my credit report. Despite my submission, the credit bureaus negligently failed to comply with their legal obligation to block the disputed items. 

This failure to act has caused ongoing harm and is a direct violation of the FCRA. I am requesting that the CFPB take action to hold the credit bureaus accountable for this negligence and ensure they fulfill their legal duty to protect victims of human trafficking. 

Thank you for your assistance in resolving this matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

TransUnion LLC refuses to conduct a proper investigation into my disputes. When speaking with the customer service representatives they request me to verify telephone number and email address in case the call is disconnected. Often time the call is disconnected on their end but they never call back. The customer service representatives often provide inaccurate information to me. They state that the situation will be escalated by the special handling department but no never follow up! 

This is civil liability for willful non compliance 15 USC 1681n. Please this a violation and I would like my payment per each violation. 

I have disputed XXXX XXXX XXXX with TransUnion for over XXXX months. I have disputed that XXXX XXXX who works with TransUnion deleted the XXXX XXXX XXXX Account from my credit report and uploaded supporting documentation to their TransUnion website but I was told today that they wont accept the documents with no clear explanation. I also disputed the inaccurate payment history. TransUnion has been reporting inaccurate information. Per TransUnion last payment date for XXXX XXXX XXXX was XX/XX/XXXX, but the payment history reflects payments in XX/XX/XXXX. This is a violation and this needs be permanently removed from my credit report. 

I also disputed XXXX XXXX XXXX with TransUnion. I disputed that they are reporting this as an open account when collection accounts are to be closed. Also I do not know who this collection agency is as I have never been in agreement with them. I ask that TransUnion please provide me with evidence stating that I signed any sort of agreement with XXXX XXXX XXXX. Please delete from my credit report immediately. 

TransUnion also sent me a letter stating that they can not locate my credit report for the above disputes. So when I call TransUnion and speak with a customer service representative they have to look at the credit report to provide information over the phone. Once again this is a violation of my rights. Civil Liability for Wilful noncompliance 15 USC 1681n. 

Please investigate TransUnion and their practices of investigating disputes. Consumers have a right to a XXXX XXXX accuracy in their credit reports.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally dispute inaccuracies on my XXXX credit report. Pursuant to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), I request a thorough investigation into the accounts listed below and their removal from my credit file. I am requesting a thorough investigation of these matters and the removal of the listed accounts from my file within 30 days of receipt of this letter as required by FCRA. To assist with this process, I have enclosed a copy of my identification to prevent any delays in the investigation. Since you have everything you need to investigate this, I will not accept any stalling letter assuming that anyone besides myself have initiated this dispute. I am writing on behalf of myself and without any influence from unmentioned or unauthorized parties. Any response outside of a proper and full investigation into my claim may result in assumption of willful negligence. That may result in litigation. 
Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. 
Accounts in Dispute : XXXX. XXXX XXXX o Account Number : XXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXX o Account Number : XXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX o Account XXXX : XXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Account XXXX : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX o Account Number : XXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Numbers : XXXX and XXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX  XXXX Bankruptcy Dismissed o Reference Number : XXXX Legal Basis for Dispute : Under 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ), I am entitled to dispute inaccuracies in my credit report and request an investigation. Additionally, 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) requires consumer reporting agencies to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of the information included in my file. 
Supporting Documents : I have included a copy of my government-issued ID, proof of address, and a copy of my XXXX credit report highlighting the disputed items. 
Requested Action : If the disputed accounts can not be verified as accurate, please remove them from my credit file in accordance with 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ). Additionally, provide written confirmation of the investigation results and any corrections made. 
Thank you for your prompt attention. I expect resolution within the required 30-day timeframe. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX [ Enclosures : Copy of ID, Proof of Address, Credit Report ]

Consumer complaint narrative:
VALIDATION AND CEASE AND DESIST XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  Account number : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Dear ( Debt Collector ) I recently received a debt collection notice from your office. I am writing to verify that you have contacted the correct individual and to request that you provide documentation confirming this. Please supply me with a copy of any contract or agreement signed with your company or the original creditor. 
In accordance with the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I request the following information : 1. The name and address of the original creditor and the current creditor.

2. Verification of the debt amount you are seeking to collect, including evidence that a contract exists creating the amount you claim is owed.

3. Documentation of all assignments showing the transfer of the debt from the original creditor to the current creditor.

4. Proof that the original creditor securitized the debt.

5. Documentation showing the assignments of the debt from the original creditor to the secured trust and then back to the original creditor.

Please cease and desist from collecting on this debt until you have provided validation of the debt.

Additionally, I request that you do not access my credit report or report anything to my credit bureaus. I dispute the validity of this debt amount, and this dispute should be reflected on my credit report if you have already reported this debt.

Permissible Purpose : Please state your permissible purpose for accessing my credit information. I dispute your right to do so.

Notification to Other Collectors : I dispute that I owe this debt to you. Should you transfer this debt to another collector, please inform them of my dispute regarding the validity of this debt. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX CA, XXXX XX/XX/year> Subject : Dispute Regarding Charged-Off Account and Request for 1099-C Form Dear CFPB Dispute Department, I am writing to dispute the reporting of a charged-off account on my credit report under 15 U.S. Code 1681i, which mandates the proper investigation and verification of reported information. The account in question is : Creditor Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Issue : Charged-off account inaccurately reported As you may be aware, a charged-off account is considered taxable income by the IRS, and I am required to report this on my tax return. According to IRS regulations, creditors are required to issue a 1099-C form for cancellation of debt when the amount exceeds {$600.00}. 
To ensure accurate reporting on my end, I kindly request that XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX issue and send the required 1099-C form to my address listed below.

Additionally, I request that all 3 credit bureaus investigate this account for accuracy. If it can not be fully verified as compliant with all applicable laws, I request its immediate removal from my credit report. 
Please confirm receipt of this letter and provide me with updates regarding the investigation and removal process, as well as confirmation from XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX regarding the issuance of the 1099-C form. 
Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

The first is a {$2700.00} XXXX XXXX account classified as " potentially negative. '' The second is a {$2200.00} collection account set up by XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX never approved these accounts ; they are not mine. 

I will be sending a report I filed with the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), which details this conflict. I am claiming my rights as a victim of possible identity theft under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), more especially 15 U.S.C. Section 605B. Following receipt of this dispute and my supporting paperwork, I am asking that these accounts be stopped or deleted from my credit file within the required 4-day period.

Furthermore, under 15 U.S.C. 604 the credit reporting companies have obligations to guarantee that just verified and correct information is recorded. I want an instant look at and validation of these accounts. These accounts have to be permanently removed off my credit report if the furnishers of this information neglect to produce official evidence of my authorization or a current assignment of the obligation. 

I want all three credit reporting companiesEquifax, XXXX, and XXXX act immediately to get these accounts taken off of my file. I want complete FCRA compliance. Ignoring may lead to legal action to uphold my rights and pursue statutory damages.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
I recently conducted a review of my credit report and found several items that have caused me significant distress. These items appear to be unverifiable, inaccurate, and questionable. Your agency has failed to ensure the accuracy of the information as required under 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ) Accuracy of Reports. This statute mandates that consumer reporting agencies must follow reasonable procedures to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of the information they report.

Furthermore, under 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) Treatment of Inaccurate or Unverifiable Information, you are required to promptly delete or modify any information found to be inaccurate, incomplete, or unverifiable during a reinvestigation. If you are unable to provide me with verifiable proof of the accuracy of the disputed items within 15 days of your investigation, these accounts and the related information must be removed from my credit report.

Additionally, under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I do not recognize any of the alleged creditors or debt collectors. I have never entered into a valid contract with any of these entities, nor have I engaged in any transactions with them. As such, these accounts are fraudulent and and inaccurate information. 

Moreover, under the Fair Credit Billing Act, my right to privacy has been violated, and this breach infringes upon my rights as outlined in The Privacy Act of 1974. Removing the inaccurate and fraudulent information from my credit report will help restore my privacy and prevent further violations.

Reached out to XXXX XXXX XXXX to discuss hardship/ deferment payment options which they have a plan that I'm billed monthly at XXXX to protect auto loan in the event I am faced with a hardship I had to " APPLY/QUALIFY '' for this assistance ; application were submitted for 3 months and were either ignored, marked as incomplete or denied. How do you get denied for hardship assistance when there's a reduction of income. All lenders offer the ability to place payments at the end of the loan without submitting proof of income/harship we have never used this benefit/program. It my belief we qualified due to national COVID disaster assistance programs, reduction of income due to being temporarily unemployed, and vehicle was in area of XXXX XXXX of XXXX so we had 3 life changing events that XXXX advertise assistance for and we were repeatedly denied. Furthermore in State of Illinois lenders are required to send letter advising consumers of intent of repossession detailing redemption process ; and allow consumer 21 days to resolve issue before action is taken if loan is paid off more than 30 %. We never received written notification and loan is paid off 50 %. The original loan taken out XX/XX/XXXX was {$49000.00}. our current balance is XXXX which includes additional fees payments. Consumer rights were violated : 15 USC 1681b ( a ) ( 2 ), 15 USC 1681i, 15 USC 1681s-2, UCC 9 PART 6, UCC 9-609 ( b ) Breach of Peace, Public Disturbance. I logged into XXXX website and submitted payment of {$1500.00} which would have bought account current covering payment 2 months of payments our regular monthly payment is {$740.00} on XX/XX/XXXX at XXXX CST was advised by XXXX customer service representative the repossession order was sent out XX/XX/XXXX at XXXX CST which was after payment was submitted. Once XX/XX/XXXX when vehicle was repo 'd contact representative that advised to cancel payment from day before the amount due had changed ( fees added and needed to add XX/XX/XXXX payment which posted to account XX/XX/XXXX ) the new amount due is {$3600.00} which is outrageous. The total due of account was {$2200.00} on XX/XX/XXXX when payment for {$1500.00} was submitted. Its my assumption that XXXX XXXX XXXX practiced unlawful collection tactics to repo vehicle due to the fact we have a great interest rate of 4 % the vehicle is more than 50 % paid off and there would be equity in vehicle if resold making repossession of vehicle more profitable transaction to bank verses working it out with a longtime consumer ; there is no reason we should have been denied hardship repayment due to income that's the purpose of hardship income changes. We had to submit application and checks stubs to " APPLY '' to use coverage program that I have been billed XXXX per month for last 3 years. Repossession was preformed without proper legal authority. 

MAJOR CREDIT bureaus : I am writing to formally dispute numerous errors/ inaccurate information reflecting on my consumer credit profiles with all three major credit bureaus and to address several violations of consumer protection laws that have come to my attention. Upon reviewing credit reports dated XX/XX/XXXX I believe this action was taken unlawfully and in violation of both state and federal consumer laws, including the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) and the Uniform Commercial Code ( UCC ). The below mention account ( s )/ information were mishandled and in direct volitation of the following consumer laws ; I reference the following laws and regulations in support of my dispute : 15 USC 1681b ( a ) ( 2 ) 15 USC 1681i 15 USC 1681 s-2 15 USC 1681c-2 ( a ) 15 USC 1666b 15 USC 1637 ( b ) 15 USC 1681 e ( b ) 15 USC 1681b ( 2 ) 15 USC 1681 ( q ) 15 USC 1681 ( 2XI ) 15 USC 1692c 15 USC 1635 15 USC 1692g UCC 9 part 6 UCC 9-609 ( b ) 12 CFR 1006.34C 12 CFR 1006.6C 12 CRF 1026.13 Failure to provide written notice of repossession intent and redemption options in a timely manner Failure to provide 1099-c Breach of peace Public Disturbance 1. 15 USC 1681b ( a ) ( 2 ) : This provision states that consumer reporting agencies may furnish reports only for permissible purposes. I have concerns that my information has been accessed without a legitimate reason. 

2. 15 USC 1681i : Under this statute, I am entitled to dispute inaccurate information in my credit report. I request that you investigate the accuracy of the information being reported.

3. 15 USC 1681s-2 : This law requires furnishers of information to provide accurate data. I believe that the information you have reported is incorrect and must be corrected.

4. 15 USC 1681c-2 ( a ) : This provision details the expiration of certain negative information. I believe that information being reported is outdated and should not be included in my credit file.

5. 15 USC 1666b : This section pertains to billing error resolutions. I have not received proper resolution pertaining to the billing discrepancies on my account.

6. 15 USC 1637 ( b ) : This law requires clear disclosure of terms and conditions, which I believe were not adequately provided in my case.

7. 15 USC 1681e ( b ) : You have a duty to ensure maximum possible accuracy in the information you report. Failure to do so constitutes a violation of this section.

8. 15 USC 1681b ( 2 ) : This section mandates that I must be informed of the nature of the information used to make adverse decisions. I have not received adequate information regarding this.

9. 15 USC 1681 ( q ) : This provision prohibits the use of consumer reports for improper purposes. I am concerned my report has been accessed without my knowledge or consent.

10. 15 USC 1681 ( 2XI ) : This statute emphasizes the importance of accuracy in credit reporting, which I believe has not been upheld.

11. 15 USC 1692c : Under this law, I have the right to request debt validation which has not been provided to me satisfactorily.

12. 15 USC 1635 : This statute requires that consumers be informed about their right to cancel certain transactions, which was not properly communicated in my case.

13. 15 USC 1692g : This section mandates that I be provided with validation of the debt upon request. I have not received the necessary validation.

14. UCC 9-609 ( b ) : This provision states that a secured party must not breach the peace during the repossession process. I have concerns regarding the manner in which the repossession was conducted.

15. 12 CFR 1006.34C and 12 CFR 1006.6C : These regulations govern the treatment of accounts in collections and require proper disclosures regarding debt collection practices.

16. 12 CFR 1026.13 : This section provides additional requirements for credit card issuers to address billing errors, which I believe were not met in this situation.

- Failure to Provide Written Notice of Repossession Intent and Redemption Options : I did not receive the required written notice prior to the repossession of my vehicle, violating my rights under relevant laws.

- Failure to Provide 1099-C : I have not received a 1099-C for any canceled debts, which is necessary for accurate tax reporting.

- Breach of Peace/Public Disturbance : The manner in which the repossession was handled caused a public disturbance and did not adhere to the legal requirement of maintaining the peace.

Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), I have the right to dispute inaccurate information in my credit file. I am requesting that you conduct a thorough investigation of this matter to verify whether the creditor has reported this debt accurately and whether they have fulfilled their obligation to issue a 1099-C. If they are unable to provide proof of the cancellation of debt and the corresponding 1099-C, I request that you remove this entry from my credit report.

First, I would like to remind you that under the FDCPA, a creditor must provide proper notification before taking action such as repossession. I did not receive any written notice concerning a default or an impending repossession within the time frame required by law. Specifically, in Illinois where vehicle is registered lender is required to send written notice of default and repossession intent informing borrower of intent to recover vehicle provide instruction of remedy of default ; notice also allows borrower 21 days to bring loan current if vehicle is more than 30 % paid off.

Additionally, I would like to request that you provide me with documentation proving your right to repossess the vehicle, including the original loan agreement and any correspondence related to the default. According to the law, I have the right to receive this information, and failure to provide it may constitute additional violations of our rights as a consumer. My personal data information has been leaked in multiple " DATA BREACHES '' companies, bureaus and social security administration.

Consumer complaint narrative:
This letter is my formal written request for you to investigate the following " Unverified '' accounts listed below : According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. 1681 your company is required by federal law to verify - through the physical verification of the original signed consumer contract - any and all accounts you post on a credit report to assure maximum accuracy. Without proper verification by your company, anyone paying for your reporting services could fax, mail or email in a fraudulent account.

I demand to see a copy of the Verifiable Proof ( an original Consumer Contract with my Signature on it ) that you used to verify that the account belonged to me the first time you reported the account on my credit report. Your failure to properly verify these accounts has hurt my ability to obtain credit. Under the FCRA 15 U.S.C. 1681, unverified accounts must be promptly deleted. If you are unable to provide me with a copy of the verifiable proof that you have on file within 30 days for each of the accounts listed below, then you must remove these accounts from my credit report. Please provide me with a copy of an updated and corrected credit report showing these items removed. 



I demand the following accounts be verified or removed Immediately. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX
