Consumer complaint narrative:
Fraudulent Collection accounts Due to Data breach from XXXX XXXX XXXX and transunion : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Opened XX/XX/XXXX {$2500.00} XXXX XXXX Opened XX/XX/XXXX {$460.00} XXXX XXXX Opened XX/XX/XXXX {$130.00} Fraudulent unauthorized credit inquiries : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX My information may have been impacted by the XXXX, TransUnion and XXXX XXXX XXXX and may have got into the hands of the wrong person You are required to remove this inaccurate information immediately, as mandated by U.S. Code 605B, without subjecting my dispute to a 30-day investigation. Under this law, inaccuracies related to identity theft must be blocked or deleted promptly upon receipt of appropriate documentation, and I fully expect compliance with this legal obligation. 

Under The Doctrine of Estoppel by silence, Engelhardt V Gravens ( mo ) 281 sw 715, 719, I may presume that no proof of the alleged debt, nor therefore any such debt, in facts exists Im calling into place two TITLE 15 US CODES 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 Which challenges accuracy of the debt In accordance with [ applicable state statute ], which mandates a 15-day period for debt validation, I am requesting that you provide me with the following documentation within 15 days of receiving this letter : 1. Proof that I owe this debt, including a detailed accounting of the original amount, any accrued interest, fees, and any other charges.

2. Copies of any signed agreements or contracts pertaining to the debt. 
3. Evidence that your company has legal standing to collect this debt.

Please note that failure to provide this information within the stipulated time period will result in my reporting your company to the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and any other relevant regulatory bodies.

In which, they have not given anything thing to proof no break downs or signed agreements THEN ITS REPORTED DIFFERENT ON THREE DIFFERENT BUREAUS I WANT IT TO BE DELETED DUE TO INACCURATE REPORTING Second Title 15 US CODE 15 U.S.C. 1692c ( c ) of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I am exercising my right to request that all communication from the debt collector cease immediately. 

Please take the necessary steps to ensure compliance with this federal law and notify the debt collector to stop further contact regarding this matter. 

Additionally, I request that you : 1. Investigate and verify the accuracy of the debt reported. 
2. Provide confirmation that this matter has been addressed, along with any updates to my credit file reflecting the resolution.

This request serves as official notice. I expect you to act promptly and within the timeframes required by law. 

If These items are not deleted I hold each credit bureau responsible and will take legal action on credit and credit bureau for breaking the laws put in place by the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) Again, You are required to remove this inaccurate information immediately, as mandated by U.S. Code 605B, without subjecting my dispute to a 30-day investigation. Under this law, inaccuracies related to identity theft must be blocked or deleted promptly upon receipt of appropriate documentation, and I fully expect compliance with this legal obligation. 

Respectfully XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/year>, my locked car at XXXX XXXX XXXX in XXXX, GA was broken into and my credit cards stolen. I was unaware for about an hour when I checked my bank accounts online and noted text messages requesting approval. All cards have a {$300.00} limit for validation. XXXX cards denied attempts by the thief but XXXX allowed a {$560.00} charge at XXXX  in XXXX, Ga ( XXXX address is used for XXXX and XXXX as USPS uses zip codes ). I cancelled all cards and requested new ones, filed claim XXXX with Truist. I called XXXX and went to the store where the fraud occurred and was able to get a copy of the receipt. I spoke with the Security Guard who checked the video and remembered the thief who went through the self checkout. He said the video would be available to the police but I could not view it. I called the XXXX police but the dispatcher mistakenly transferred me to XXXX saying that the theft occurred there. I filed a police report with XXXX XXXX ( XXXX case # XXXX ) and emailed it to the address Truist gave me ( XXXX ). XXXX Police followed up and stated that the theft occurred in XXXX and I need to file a report with them, so I did and sent that police report on XX/XX/year> with the receipt to Truist via email ( XXXX Police # XXXX ). I received a form in the mail from Truist to fill out for products not received. I called Truist and spoke to a supervisor who admitted the claim was filed incorrectly and should have gone for fraud and I should have received an affidavit. She also noted that the email address I was given was incorrect so I resent the receipt with Police case numbers to the new email address : XXXX. I noted that the charges were removed from my account until 2 days later XX/XX/year>. I called Truist and spoke with a supervisor who said my claim had been finally denied because I sent a receipt. WHAT??? She said I should get the video and send it to Truist. Again WHAT??? Arent the Truist investigators supposed to review police reports and videos on the report? I called the police and they confirmed that they do NOT send videos to banks. The Banks are supposed to investigate fraud claims and, in this case, I have given them everything they need that verifies my dispute. Apparently, they have not contacted the police or reviewed the video. As of today, XX/XX/year>, I have a {$560.00} bill on the XXXX so I sent another email explaining that the video is with the police report from XXXX and there is also a Police report from XXXX that confirms my report of theft.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I lived and worked in XXXX for XXXX years ( XXXX to XXXX ) and had an XXXX retirement account with XXXX. 

XX/XX/XXXX - I closed my RRSP account at XXXX in XXXX and had them mail me a check for {$130000.00} ( XXXX ) - the full amount in the account. The check was actually from XXXX Bank XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ) which is the bank used by XXXX. 

XX/XX/XXXX - I deposited the check into my Bank of America checking account. After the conversion to USD the value was {$92000.00} XX/XX/XXXX - This exact amount was reversed from my acct by Bank of America account. No communication was provided by Bank of America. I only found out about it when my debit card was rejected at a retail store. 

After multiple phone calls to all three financial institutions and unlimited frustration, this is what I know- Bank of America ( after many phone calls and emails ) provided the attached letter stating what they did and what they know. 

XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) stated they can not give me any information since I don't and never did have an account with them and that I need to have XXXX request to XXXX to track the check. 

XXXX ( after many phone calls and emails ) states their records simply show the money was withdrawn on XX/XX/XXXX and there is no issue. See attached document that shows their email response. When I later received the Bank of America letter, I forwarded it to XXXX and asked them to relook at this issue. They said they would and that they would " elevate it internally ''. Despite more calls to them, they have not provided any feedback. Aside - once I withdrew my money in the RRSP account I no longer have any money at that bank or any remaining investments in XXXX at all.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing to demand immediate action to address the inaccurate, damaging, and negligent reporting related to two XXXX XXXX accounts and a lawsuit filed against me that has since been dismissed for want of prosecution ( DWOP ). Despite my efforts over the past three years to provide evidence of identity theft, neither XXXX XXXX nor the credit bureaus ( XXXX, XXXX, and TransUnion ) have taken appropriate steps to resolve this matter. 

Here are the critical facts of this issue : 1. Identity Theft and Disputed Accounts : I was a victim of identity, a time during which two XXXX XXXX accounts in good standing were fraudulently used. 
I provided police reports and a Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) Identity Theft Report to XXXX XXXX and the credit bureaus, documenting this crime and disputing the debts. 
Despite clear evidence that these debts were not mine, XXXX XXXX refused to acknowledge the theft or resolve the accounts appropriately. 
2. Lawsuit Filed and Dismissed : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  pursued legal action against me in 2024, despite the ongoing identity theft dispute and my inability to pay for debts that were not mine. 
On XX/XX/year>, the court dismissed the case for want of prosecution ( DWOP ), with no judgment entered against me. This dismissal further supports my position that this debt is invalid and should not have been pursued in the first place. 
3. Credit Reporting Negligence : Despite the dismissal and my repeated disputes, all three credit bureaus continue to report inaccurate and derogatory information related to these accounts and lawsuit. 
The excuse provided by XXXXthat the lawsuit was filed and therefore can not be removedis baseless given that the case was dismissed, and the accounts were the result of identity theft. 
The continued failure to address this issue violates the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), which mandates accurate and fair credit reporting. 

This negligence has severely impacted my credit standing and financial stability for years. The prolonged failure to remove fraudulent accounts and the erroneous lawsuit from my credit file has caused undue hardship, limiting my ability to rebuild after the closure of my business.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

I've attached a list of the hard inquiries in question as well as a copy of the consumer FICO credit report maintained by you which shows the aforementioned fraudulent items. The aforementioned accounts, collections, and hard inquiries appearing on my consumer credit report maintained by you were not opened, made, or initiated by me. All of the aforementioned accounts, collections, and hard inquiries are the result of identity theft and fraud. I have attached a copy of FTC Identity Theft Criminal Complaint # ( private case number ) as proof from the US Federal Trade Commission that all of the aforementioned consumer credit accounts, collections, and hard inquiries are the result of identity theft and fraud.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to report a violation of my consumer rights regarding a collection account reported on my credit report by XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. I have requested validation of the debt, as required by the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), but I have not received any documentation or response from either XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX or the credit reporting agency. 

Here are the details of the issue : Debt Collection on Credit Report : A collection account from XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX is listed on my credit report. This account is inaccurate or incomplete, and I have reasons to believe it may not be valid. 

Request for Debt Validation : On XX/XX/24, I sent a formal request to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX for validation of the debt under Section 809 of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ). This request required them to provide detailed documentation of the debt, including the original creditor, the amount owed, and proof that they have the legal right to collect the debt. 

Failure to Respond to Debt Validation Request : Despite the legal requirement for XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX to provide validation of the debt within 30 days, I have not received any response. This failure to validate the debt violates my rights as a consumer. 

Violation of Credit Reporting Requirements : Additionally, I have contacted the credit bureau that is reporting this collection account. The credit bureau is also in violation of my rights because, under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), they are obligated to ensure the accuracy and completeness of the information they report. Since XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX has not validated the debt, the credit bureau is continuing to report this account without confirming its validity, which is a violation of my rights under the FCRA. 

As a result of these actions, I am requesting that the CFPB investigate the failure of both XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and the credit reporting agency to comply with consumer protection laws, including the FDCPA and FCRA. I am seeking the following actions : Immediate removal of the invalid collection account from my credit report. 
A written explanation from XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX regarding their failure to validate the debt. 
A correction or update to my credit report to reflect the accurate information. 
I appreciate your prompt attention to this matter and look forward to your assistance in resolving these violations of my consumer rights. 

Thank you for your help.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
I recently conducted a review of my credit report and found several items that have caused me significant distress. These items appear to be unverifiable, inaccurate, and questionable. Your agency has failed to ensure the accuracy of the information as required under 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ) Accuracy of Reports. This statute mandates that consumer reporting agencies must follow reasonable procedures to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of the information they report. 

Furthermore, under 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) Treatment of Inaccurate or Unverifiable Information, you are required to promptly delete or modify any information found to be inaccurate, incomplete, or unverifiable during a reinvestigation. If you are unable to provide me with verifiable proof of the accuracy of the disputed items within XXXX  days of your investigation, these accounts and the related information must be removed from my credit report. 

Additionally, under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I do not recognize any of the alleged creditors or debt collectors. I have never entered into a valid contract with any of these entities, nor have I engaged in any transactions with them. As such, these accounts are fraudulent and and inaccurate information. 

Moreover, under the Fair Credit Billing Act, my right to privacy has been violated, and this breach infringes upon my rights as outlined in The Privacy Act of 1974. Removing the inaccurate and fraudulent information from my credit report will help restore my privacy and prevent further violations.

These breaches have resulted in the inclusion of numerous incorrect and unverified items on my credit reports, which vary inconsistently across the three major credit bureausXXXX, XXXX, and TransUnion. After obtaining my free credit reports, I discovered these discrepancies and initiated disputes with the companies reporting the negative items and the credit bureaus directly. 

Despite my efforts, the inaccuracies persist, causing significant harm to my credit standing and personal reputation. Despite my repeated efforts to correct multiple inaccuracies on my credit reports with all three credit bureaus, these errors remain unresolved. These inaccuracies negatively affect my creditworthiness and violate my rights under the FCRA. 

These breaches make any electronic records suspect, as digital signatures and documents could have been compromised or fraudulently created. 

Under 15 U.S.C. 1692g ( Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ), failure to provide this information invalidates the debt. Moreover, the inclusion of such unverifiable items on my credit reports violates the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681, which mandates that credit reports be accurate and complete.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
I recently conducted a review of my credit report and found several items that have caused me significant distress. These items appear to be unverifiable, inaccurate, and questionable. Your agency has failed to ensure the accuracy of the information as required under 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ) Accuracy of Reports. This statute mandates that consumer reporting agencies must follow reasonable procedures to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of the information they report.

Furthermore, under 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) Treatment of Inaccurate or Unverifiable Information, you are required to promptly delete or modify any information found to be inaccurate, incomplete, or unverifiable during a reinvestigation. If you are unable to provide me with verifiable proof of the accuracy of the disputed items within 15 days of your investigation, these accounts and the related information must be removed from my credit report.

Additionally, under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I do not recognize any of the alleged creditors or debt collectors. I have never entered into a valid contract with any of these entities, nor have I engaged in any transactions with them. As such, these accounts are fraudulent and and inaccurate information. 

Moreover, under the Fair Credit Billing Act, my right to privacy has been violated, and this breach infringes upon my rights as outlined in The Privacy Act of 1974. Removing the inaccurate and fraudulent information from my credit report will help restore my privacy and prevent further violations.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
Per the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) I am a federally protected consumer I am now opting out of any and all authorization ( S ) I the consumer may have given you written, unwritten, verbal and non-verbal permission 15 USC 6802 asserting my rights to opt out of the unauthorized sharing and reporting of my nonpublic personal information to third parties, including credit reporting agencies. XXXXXXXX XXXX is in violation of the following laws : 1. Violation of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act ( 15 U.S.C. 6802 ) : I sent XXXX XXXX a formal opt-out request, dated XX/XX/XXXX, under my rights outlined in 15 U.S.C. 680XXXX. This statute requires financial institutions to provide consumers with a clear and conspicuous opportunity to opt out of the disclosure of their nonpublic personal information to nonaffiliated third parties, such as credit bureaus. XXXX XXXX continues to report my payment history and utilization rate to credit bureaus despite my opt-out notice, which violates this section. Full Citation ( 15 U.S.C. 6802 ) : A financial institution may not, directly or through any affiliate, disclose to a nonaffiliated third party any nonpublic personal information, unless such financial institution provides or has provided to the consumer ( A ) a clear and conspicuous disclosure of the financial institutions privacy policies and practices ; ( B ) a reasonable opportunity to opt out ; and ( C ) the consumer has not opted out. How XXXX Violated : XXXX failed to honor my opt-out request and continued to share my personal information, breaching federal privacy standards. 2. Violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 U.S.C. 1681b ) : Under the FCRA, consumer reporting agencies may only disclose consumer information under permissible purposes, including the written consent of the consumer. My opt-out explicitly revoked any prior authorization for XXXX XXXX to share my information with credit bureaus, yet they continue to report my payment history and utilization rate without consent. Full Citation ( 15 U.S.C. 1681b ) : ( 2 ) In accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates. How XXXX Violated : XXXX continues to report my data to credit bureaus without my consent, failing to adhere to the permissible purposes outlined in the FCRA. 3. Violation of the Privacy Act of 1974 ( 5 U.S.C. 552a ( b ) ) : This Act ensures that no entity may disclose personal information without the prior written consent of the individual. XXXX XXXX reporting of my personal data to credit bureaus after my opt-out notice constitutes unauthorized disclosure. Full Citation ( 5 U.S.C. 552a ( b ) ) : No agency shall disclose any record which is contained in a system of records by any means of communication to any person, or to another agency, except pursuant to a written request by, or with the prior written consent of, the individual to whom the record pertains. How XXXX Violated : By continuing to report my personal information after my opt-out, XXXX violated my federally protected right to privacy. 4. Violation of 12 C.F.R. 1016.9 ( Regulation P ) : This regulation requires financial institutions to comply with opt-out requests as soon as practicable. XXXX XXXX has not honored my opt-out request within a reasonable timeframe. Full Citation ( 12 C.F.R. 1016.9 ) : A financial institution shall comply with a consumers opt-out direction as soon as reasonably practicable after the financial institution receives it. How XXXX Violated : XXXX failed to process my opt-out request in a timely manner, continuing to share my information. 5. Violation of 12 C.F.R. 1016.4 ( Regulation P ) : Under this regulation, financial institutions must provide periodic privacy notices. I have not received required annual privacy notices, depriving me of the opportunity to understand and control how my information is used. Full Citation ( 12 C.F.R. 1016.4 ) : A financial institution shall provide a clear and conspicuous notice that accurately reflects its privacy policies and practices annually to customers throughout the duration of the customer relationship. How XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX failed to provide required privacy notices as mandated. 


NOT A DUPLICATE

Consumer complaint narrative:
Having tried unsuccessfully to resolve my recent complaints with Bank of America ( BoA ), I now find it necessary to refer these complaints to the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) to try to get more full and satisfactory answers and solutions from my bank. Please note I am an overseas customer of BoA, being a XXXX XXXX and now fully XXXX  and resident in the XXXX, after XXXX periods of living and working in the XXXX, prior to my retirement. 
The recent attempts by individuals from the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( CCET ) of BoA to resolve or answer my queries and concerns have been vague and evasive and entirely unhelpful, to the point I am disgusted with the banks conduct. Despite my detailed emails to BoA on my complaints, I have received no formal response by email or other forms of written communication, setting out BoAs response or stance. I only get phone calls from them, during which they provide me with lots of platitudes and understanding of my reasons for complaining, but they do absolutely nothing to provide meaningful responses or any solutions to my complaints. While I never expected the staff at XXXX to have all the answers immediately available during the calls, I did expect they would make further enquiries with other staff in other departments who could provide proper answers but they repeatedly said they could not do this, nor would they explain why they couldnt make further enquiries, simply saying they couldnt do anything for me beyond their apologies and understanding. 
I attach hard copies of three relevant emails, dated XXXX and XXXX XX/XX/XXXX detailing the origins and progress with my complaints, before and after two calls I received from CCET. I have received nothing at all from BoA to attach, as they provided me only with two phone calls which proved useless in answering or resolving my complaints. I also now set out a summary of my individual complaints and what I would like BoA to do to resolve these for me. However, I stress that for the complete picture it is necessary to review in full the attached emails and other documents I provide. 
My initial XXXX complaints were listed and then detailed in my first email dated XXXX XX/XX/XXXX. I can confirm that complaint number XXXX is now dropped as it was only ever a minor issue for me. I never got from XXXX a proper explanation of why my initial telephone complaint was never responded to, or even acknowledged, but I dont see much point in pursuing this further. It has affectively been overtaken by my later more formal complaints by email. I do, however, wish to pursue complaints XXXX, XXXX and XXXX, via this process with CFPB. 

Complaint XXXX - Increased credit card limit During my first call with CCET, the lady who called me was able to reduce the limit back to XXXX XXXX. She did this without having to send me any security PIN. The XXXX gentlemen who fielded my calls to BoA in XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX, failed to reduce the limit back to its original level because they were unable to send a PIN number to my XXXX mobile phones ( see also complaint XXXX below ). As the card limit is now back to where it was before BoA increased it without any reference to or agreement from me, all that remains on this complaint, is for BoA to reimburse me the cost of the calls I had to make to the bank from my home landline number in XXXX and XXXX. The cost of the calls is detailed in the hard copy emails attached, along with copies of my phone bills for XXXX, XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX. 

Complaint XXXX BoA cant register XXXX XXXX phones for sending PINs Despite repeated requests, BoA have not provided me with an explanation on why they can not register XXXX XXXX  phone numbers for the purpose of securely sending PINs, when trying to do online banking with BoA from the XXXX. Without access to a XXXX cell phone, to facilitate wire transfers to my XXXX banks, I have had to purchase, at XXXX insistence, a XXXX XXXX XXXX at a cost of XXXX XXXX, which is about XXXX XXXX. I would like BoA to explain why they will not, or can not, use XXXX mobile phone numbers in the same way as they use XXXX cell phone numbers for issuing PINs. This practice is prejudicial against overseas customers. I also ask that BoA reimburse me the XXXX XXXX  cost of the security key. I dont need to use it for any XXXX banking, I only use it for BoA transactions. 

Complaint XXXX no response to telephone complaint made in XX/XX/XXXX As stated above, I am dropping this complaint, as it is now superfluous. 
Complaint XXXX Cancellation of a wire transfer without explanation During my calls with XXXX, they were unable to explain why this transfer was cancelled by BoA after it was shown online as successful. XXXX were also unwilling to enquire further with other departments in order to get an answer to this. The transfer was made to XXXX of my XXXX XXXX XXXX  accounts, which was listed online with BoA as one of my previous and therefore trusted recipient accounts. It defies any logic that the transfer was cancelled, causing further necessary phone calls by me from the XXXX to sort out. I would like an explanation from BoA why this was cancelled after it showed as successful when I was online. I also want BoA to reimburse the cost of my calls on this. 
Complaint XXXX inability to do wire transfers to the XXXX in XXXX  The full explanation on this complaint is shown over my XXXX attached emails of XXXX, XXXX and XXXX XX/XX/XXXX. In response to my first XXXX emails, I took calls from different individuals from XXXX on XXXX and XXXX XX/XX/XXXX, both providing no meaningful information to help me see and understand what specific sections and/or clauses of the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX BoA from wire transferring XXXX  from my BoA savings account to XXXX of my XXXX bank accounts, both of which are previous recipients of my wire transfers. Neither of the individuals I spoke to were willing to enquire further with other BoA departments to find out this information for me. 
I find it astounding and completely unacceptable that BoA are hiding behind such broad legislation and are unwilling to be more specific on the actual date ( s ) and wording ( s ) of the relevant clauses of the legislation so that I may read and understand this for myself. BoA are using a very broad description of legislation, which was introduced from XXXX onwards, primarily to protect consumers financial interests, to prevent me doing what I want with my money. The Dodd Frank legislation runs to many thousands of pages, introduced and amended during three government administrations, over XXXX  years so far. Why cant BoA provide me with the details and wordings of the clauses which prevent them doing what I want to do? This lack of a full and proper response from BoA is not only unreasonable it is ridiculous. What are they trying to hide here? This is my money it does not belong to BoA. The actions of BoA are delaying me making wire transfers to the XXXX which would earn me better interest and also, potentially, better exchange rate and fee outcomes for me. The irony is that they are quoting consumer protection legislation to justify this restrictive practice! 
Also, the BoA verbal explanation to me that they can not do XXXX  transfers to the XXXX without being able to tell me the fees and charges of the XXXX bank do not square with the XXXX smaller ( test ) transfers I did in XXXX  in XX/XX/XXXX. BoA did the exchanges to XXXX  and the XXXX transfers included the same caveat that I may get less if the XXXX bank charged me fees. BoA need to explain this anomoly to me. 
BoA also refused to tell me which, if any, XXXX banks would let BoA know the charges beforehand to allow the transfer to go ahead in XXXX. 
I want a fully detailed description from BoA of the precise legislation titles, dates and wordings that prevent them doing transfers in XXXX  to my XXXX XXXX. I also want BoA to explain the obvious anomoly between their Dodd Frank legislation explanation and the fact they can do transfers in GBP without being able to tell me the XXXX bank 's fees. Finally, I want BoA to advise me which XXXX banks, if any, they can transfer to in XXXX  by getting the supposed necessary XXXX fee information.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
In XX/XX/XXXX a security breach left XXXX XXXX people vulnerable to a hack which also involved millions of American 's personal social security numbers. 
Please see cited source : XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act 15 USC 1681 section 602 a states " There is a need to insure that consumer reporting agencies exercise their grave responsibilities with fairness, impartiality, and a respect for the consumers right to privacy. '' XXXX and XXXX are consumer reporting agencies and I am the Consumer. I have the right to make sure my private information isn't shared which is backed by 15 USC 6801 which states '' It is the policy of the Congress that each financial institution has an affirmative and continuing obligation to respect the privacy of its customers and to protect the security and confidentiality of those customers nonpublic personal information. '' ( Furnisher of information to credit agencies ) is a financial institution by definition under that title. 15 USC 1681 section 604 a section 2 states that " In general Subject to subsection ( c ), any consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report under the following circumstances and no other : in accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates. '' ( Furnisher of information to credit agencies ) the financial institution and the Consumer reporting agencies XXXX and XXXX do not have my consent to furnish this information and they surely do not have my written consent. Any and all consent to XXXX, XXXX, ( Furnisher of information to credit agencies ) whether it be verbal, non-verbal, written, implied or otherwise is revoked. 15 USC 6802 ( b ) ( c ) states that " A financial institution may not disclose nonpublic personal information to a nonaffiliated third party unless the consumer is given an explanation of how the consumer can exercise that nondisclosure option. '' ( Furnisher of information to credit agencies ) Never informed me of my right to exercise my nondisclosure option. Not only that 15 USC 1681C ( a ) ( 5 ) states '' Except as authorized under subsection ( b ), no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information Any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years. '' This account is an adverse item they are reporting again without my permission which is against the law. 15 U.S. Code 1681s2 ( A ) ( 1 ) A states " A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate. 15 U.S. Code 1681e states '' Every consumer reporting agency shall maintain reasonable procedures designed to avoid violations of section 1681c of this title and to limit the furnishing of consumer reports to the purposes listed under section 1681b of this title. XXXX and XXXX are not maintaining reasonable procedures. Also 12 CFR 1016.7 states that " A consumer may exercise the right to opt out at any time. '' I am opting out of your reporting services.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Dispute of Charge-Off Reporting for Debt # XXXX Dear Synchrony Bank, I am writing to formally dispute the reporting of a charge-off associated with the above-referenced debt on my credit report. Upon reviewing the debt history and publicly available records, it appears that Synchrony Bank securitized this debt under the Synchrony Credit Card Master Note Trust ( XXXX : XXXX, located at XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  CT XXXX ). This transfer of ownership to the trust raises several concerns regarding the accuracy and legitimacy of the reported charge-off. 

Additionally, I have identified multiple data points associated with this debt that are being reported inaccurately across various credit bureaus. These inaccuracies further undermine the legitimacy of the charge-off and contribute to harm against me as a consumer.

Specifically, I am disputing the following : Accuracy of Charge-Off Reporting : If the debt was securitized and the receivables were transferred to the trust, Synchrony Bank may no longer hold the debt in its portfolio. Therefore, reporting a charge-off may not be accurate or compliant with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 
Validation of Debt : I request detailed, debt-level documentation proving that Synchrony Bank retained the authority to report the charge-off after securitization. This should include a solid chain of authority demonstrating the assignment or reassignment of the debt back to Synchrony Bank, evidence of the debts transfer, the balance at the time of transfer, and any agreements validating Synchrony Bank 's continued reporting authority for this debt.

Potential Double Recovery : If the debt was sold or securitized, Synchrony Bank may have already been compensated for this debt through the securitization process. In such a case, reporting the debt as a charge-off could mislead credit reporting agencies and harm me as a consumer.

I request that you investigate this matter thoroughly and provide a written response within 30 days, as required under the FCRA. If you can not validate the legitimacy of this charge-off reporting, I demand that you remove this entry from my credit reports with all major credit reporting agencies ( XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX ) XXXX 

Failure to address this dispute accurately and promptly may result in additional action on my part, including but not limited to filing complaints with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), or pursuing legal remedies.

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Product: Debt collection
Consumer complaint narrative:
To Whom It May Concern : I recently received a debt collection notice from your office. I am writing to verify that you have contacted the correct individual and to request that you provide documentation confirming this. Please supply me with a copy of any contract or agreement signed with your company or the original creditor.

In accordance with the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I request the following information : 1. The name and address of the original creditor and the current creditor.

2. Verification of the debt amount you are seeking to collect, including evidence that a contract exists creating the amount you claim is owed.

3. Documentation of all assignments showing the transfer of the debt from the original creditor to the current creditor.

4. Proof that the original creditor securitized the debt.

5. Documentation showing the assignments of the debt from the original creditor to the secured trust and then back to the original creditor.

6. Chain of Custody 7. Assignment of Contract Please cease and desist from collecting on this debt until you have provided validation of the debt.

Additionally, I request that you do not access my credit report or report anything to my credit bureaus. I dispute the validity of this debt amount, and this dispute should be reflected on my credit report if you have already reported this debt.

Permissible Purpose Please state your permissible purpose for accessing my credit information. I dispute your right to do so.

Notification to Other Collectors I dispute that I owe this debt to you. Should you transfer this debt to another collector, please inform them of my dispute regarding the validity of this debt.

I have not received a validation response to my request for verification on the debt. You have not sent me designation or proof of ownership of the debt or identification of the original creditor and subsequent assignees of the debt. As you know under 15 USC 1692g ( a ) the CFPB recently increased the requirements of a debt collectors validation response to the following : Name and mailing information of the debt collector ; and Name of the creditor to whom the debt is owed ; and Account number ( if any ) associated with the debt ; and An itemization of the current amount of the debt that reflects interest, fees, payments, and credits since a particular date that you may be able to recognize or verify with records ; and, the current amount of the debt as of when the validation notice is provided.

None of the above were provided to me.

PURSUANT TO THE FDCPA, I WOULD LIKE THE FOLLOWING PROVIDED : 1. THE NAME AND ADDRESS OF THE ORIGINAL AND CURRENT CREDITOR 2. VERIFICATION OF THE DEBT AMOUNT THAT YOU ARE SEEKING TO COLLECT 3. ASSIGNMENT FROM THE ORIGINAL CREDITOR WITH MY NAME AND ORIGINAL ACCOUNT NUMBER ON THE ORIGINAL DEBT 4. ALL INFORMATION ON THE SECURITIZATION OF THE DEBT AND PROOF THE DEBT WAS ASSIGNED BACK TO UNDER FEDERAL LAW : Pursuant to XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, XXXX & XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, XXXX  XXXX XXXX ( XXXX XXXX. XX/XX/year> ), and XXXX XXXX XXXX ( b ), you are required to cease and desist from collecting upon the debt ( including contacting a debtors credit ) until you properly validate and verify the debt amount. 
Please do not look at my credit or report anything to my credit reports as I dispute I owe this debt to you and that dispute should be stated on my credit report. Do not contact my credit report.

Consumer complaint narrative:
In XX/XX/year>, I upgraded my partners cell phone through XXXX. In order to initiate the upgrade, we needed to pay a fee of {$35.00} and then XXXX would send us a contract to sign. We paid the {$35.00} but we never received the contract. We went into the store and requested a refund. XXXX refused to give us a refund and told us that the money would be returned automatically within seven days. 

The money was never returned after 11 days so I contacted my bank and the teller recommended that instead of doing this through XXXX, we just opened a disputed transaction. As per her advice, I disputed the transaction with my bank. Several months later in XXXX, I received a letter saying that there was not enough evidence of a fraudulent charge, even though I was charged for a service that I never received. I opened an appeal process with my bank and sent them screenshots of my conversation with the XXXX Representative have a conversation which we discussed disputing the transaction as recommended by my bank. 


In short, I was charged {$35.00} for a service I never received. The vendor refused the refund and my bank refused to dispute. The charge and my account is now - {$35.00} as a result. This is extremely fraudulent to me and I was acting on advice given to me by the bank.

Sub-issue: Old information reappears or never goes away
Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing to formally lodge a complaint regarding the repeated failure of XXXX, Experian, and XXXX to properly investigate and validate disputed information on my credit report, as required under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), codified at 15 U.S.C. 1681. Despite my numerous disputes and lawful requests for validation and verification, the credit reporting agencies have failed to provide evidence substantiating their claims and continue to report inaccurate and unverified information.

To summarize : 1.Failure to Provide Proper Validation : I requested the following documents to validate the alleged debts : Validation of the debt ( including actual accounting ) ; Verification of the claim against me ( such as a sworn affidavit or a hand-signed invoice compliant with the Bills of Exchange Act, XXXX ) ; A true and certified copy of the original contract or agreement binding both parties ; A certified copy of the original note ( credit agreement ) under penalty of perjury, confirming it has not been sold ; Confirmation of the identity of the authorized representative who performed due diligence under the Money Laundering Regulations XXXX. 
These lawful requests were ignored or inadequately addressed. Instead, I received generic responses claiming the information was verified, without any substantive evidence to support these claims. 
2.Violation of 15 U.S.C. 1681i : Under 15 U.S.C. 1681i, credit reporting agencies are required to conduct a reasonable investigation when disputes are raised. Merely stating that the information was verified without providing evidence or details of the investigation constitutes a failure to meet this legal standard.

3.Reappearance of Removed Items : Items previously removed from my credit report have inexplicably reappeared, raising serious concerns about the integrity of the investigation process and adherence to proper procedures.

4.Failure to Respond in Good Faith : My repeated attempts to dispute these inaccuracies were met with dismissive responses warning me not to send further disputes. This is both inappropriate and contrary to consumer protection laws under the FCRA. 

Given the severity of these issues, I am requesting immediate action to : 1.Conduct a thorough, independent investigation into the practices of XXXX, Experian, and XXXX in handling my disputes ; 2.Ensure compliance with 15 U.S.C. 1681i by requiring the credit reporting agencies to provide documented proof of their investigations and validations ; 3.Remove any and all unverifiable and inaccurate items from my credit reports ; 4.Impose penalties or corrective actions against the credit reporting agencies for non-compliance with FCRA standards.

Consumer complaint narrative: My CD account with Merrill ( Bank of America ) has been a nightmare. I opened a CD account with Merrill on XX/XX/year>. When I checked my CD on XX/XX/year>, I noticed that the CD balance was going down every day. When I asked about this, the bank advisor told me " it's a penalty ''. I was confused because I had no plans to close my CD, but the penalty had already been charged. I realized that Merrill CD was a fraudulent account and I immediately closed my CD account on XX/XX/year>. When I called Merrill on XX/XX/year> because I hadn't received a check for a week, the lady who answered the phone threatened me " where did your money come from '' and " we need to investigate ''. Merrill withheld my money for at least a week until I contacted the bank 's top director. After receiving the check, I asked the bank 's senior management several times via email. ( 1 ) Is it legal for you to withhold customers ' money for an " investigation '' without any evidence after I closed my CD account? ( 2 ) Why did you use my money regardless of whether it was dirty money or not, and then withheld my money for investigation after I closed my CD account? I never got a reasonable answer. It is terrible for a bank to arbitrarily withhold customers ' money without any evidence after the account is closed. So, I suggest that we need to be very careful when depositing money with Merrill ( Bank of America ).

Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear CFPB, I am writing to file a formal complaint against XXXX regarding their handling of my dispute related to identity theft and a fraudulent account reported on my credit report. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I reported to XXXX that an account from Bank of America was incorrectly listed under my name, and that this account was opened fraudulently without my authorization. The account was created under the status of an 'authorized user ' using my personal information, which I did not consent to. I specifically stated that I do not have any account with Bank of America and requested XXXX to investigate this as a case of identity theft. 

However, XXXX declined to dispute the account. I then submitted another dispute request on XX/XX/XXXX, followed by another request on XX/XX/XXXX. Each time, XXXX denied my request to remove or dispute this false account. 

I have provided XXXX with a police report verifying that I am a victim of identity theft and have repeatedly asked them to provide the full Bank of America account number listed on my credit report. Despite these requests, XXXX has refused to provide the full account number, citing that they can not see the complete number on their end. I find this particularly troubling, as XXXX has made the determination that this is my account without being able to access all relevant information. Furthermore, Bank of America has confirmed that there is no account associated with my personal information or Social Security number in their records. 

Additionally, I have verified that this fraudulent account does not appear on my credit reports from XXXX or XXXX, further indicating that this is an error or fraud that XXXX is mishandling. 

XXXX 's repeated denials of my dispute requests and their failure to provide full account details are causing me undue stress and harm, as this fraudulent account continues to appear on my credit report. I am concerned that XXXX is not properly investigating this case or adhering to the procedures necessary to protect my rights as a consumer. 

I am requesting your assistance in investigating this matter and ensuring that XXXX properly disputes the fraudulent account, removes it from my credit report, and provides me with the information necessary to further address this issue with Bank of America. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your support in resolving this issue. Here is the latest declined dispute report with XXXX for your reference # XXXX Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX # XXXX XXXX TX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

15 U.S.C 1681 Section 604 A Section 2 : It also states a consumer reporting agency can not furnish a account without my written instructions 15 U.S.C 1681c. ( a ) ( 5 ) Section States : no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information Any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years.

15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( A ) ( 1 ) A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
I recently conducted a review of my credit report and found several items that have caused me significant distress. These items appear to be unverifiable, inaccurate, and questionable. Your agency has failed to ensure the accuracy of the information as required under 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ) Accuracy of Reports. This statute mandates that consumer reporting agencies must follow reasonable procedures to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of the information they report. 

Furthermore, under 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) Treatment of Inaccurate or Unverifiable Information, you are required to promptly delete or modify any information found to be inaccurate, incomplete, or unverifiable during a reinvestigation. If you are unable to provide me with verifiable proof of the accuracy of the disputed items within XXXX  days of your investigation, these accounts and the related information must be removed from my credit report. 

Additionally, under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I do not recognize any of the alleged creditors or debt collectors. I have never entered into a valid contract with any of these entities, nor have I engaged in any transactions with them. As such, these accounts are fraudulent and and inaccurate information. 

Moreover, under the Fair Credit Billing Act, my right to privacy has been violated, and this breach infringes upon my rights as outlined in The Privacy Act of 1974. Removing the inaccurate and fraudulent information from my credit report will help restore my privacy and prevent further violations.

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/2024, I submitted an identity theft affidavit to XXXX XXXX to dispute two fraudulent accounts on my credit report : 1. XXXX  XXXX XXXX- {$180.00} ( Account ending in XXXX ) 2. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX - {$300.00} Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2, consumer reporting agencies are required to block fraudulent information within four business days of receiving the following : 1. Proof of identity, 2. An identity theft affidavit, 3. Identification of the fraudulent accounts, and 4. A statement affirming the items are fraudulent. Despite submitting all required documentation on XX/XX/2024, XXXX XXXX failed to block or remove these fraudulent accounts. On XX/XX/2024, they completed my dispute and provided me with a result from Equifax, but they failed to address or remove the two fraudulent accounts on my screening report. This failure to comply with federal law has caused significant harm. XXXX XXXX provided this inaccurate screening report to the apartment community I applied to, resulting in a delay in my approval and preventing me from moving into my new residence as planned on XX/XX/2024. This delay has disrupted my housing situation and created further financial and personal hardship. I request that XXXX XXXX immediately comply with the FCRA by : 1. Removing or blocking the fraudulent accounts from my file, and 2. Providing written confirmation of the corrected information to me and any third party that received the inaccurate screening report.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally dispute an inaccurate entry on my credit report, which I pulled on XX/XX/2024. Specifically, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX account is incorrectly reported as closed, with inaccurate multiple payment history dates. Despite this, you have continued to verify and report the information as accurate, without providing any supporting documentation to substantiate its accuracy. 

This failure to correct the error is a violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically under 15 USC 1681i, which requires credit bureaus to investigate and verify disputed information within 30 days. As such, I request that you promptly investigate this matter and remove or correct the inaccurate information from my credit report. 
If the inaccurate information is not corrected within the required 30-day timeframe, I will be forced to pursue legal action under 15 USC 1692g .

Product: Mortgage
Sub-issue: Closing disclosure or other related disclosures
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Formal Demand for Validation of Mortgage and Request for Documentation** To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to formally challenge the validity of my mortgage loan with Cadence and demand a comprehensive validation of the terms, documentation, and actions surrounding its origination and administration. This request is made in accordance with applicable laws under the Uniform Commercial Code ( UCC ), Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ), Real Estate Settlement Procedures Act ( RESPA ), and related fiduciary principles.

Legal Basis for My Request : Truth in Lending Act ( 15 U.S.C. 1601 et seq. ) : TILA requires clear, accurate, and full disclosure of all terms associated with a loan. I demand validation that all disclosures were made in compliance with this federal law, including the calculation of interest, fees, and the true cost of the loan.

Good Faith Obligation ( UCC 1-304 ) : Under the Uniform Commercial Code, all parties are required to act in good faith. I request evidence that [ Bank Name ] acted in good faith during the origination, securitization, and servicing of this mortgage. 

Chain of Title and Ownership of the Note : As established in XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX XXXX XXXX ), the deed must follow the note. I demand a complete chain of title for the promissory note and proof that [ Bank Name ] or its agents have maintained alignment between the note and the deed of trust.

Fraud and Misrepresentation : If the promissory note was monetized, securitized, or otherwise transferred without full disclosure, this constitutes a material misrepresentation. Under equitable doctrines, fraud invalidates any claim arising from it.

Fiduciary Responsibility ( RESPA 12 U.S.C. 2601 et seq. ) : RESPA requires servicers to manage escrow accounts and loan administration with transparency and in the borrowers best interests. I request proof that [ Bank Name ] has upheld its fiduciary duties throughout the life of the loan.

Immediate Actions Requested : Provide Validation of the Mortgage : A certified copy of the original promissory note, including endorsements, assignments, or securitization records.

A detailed accounting of how the loan was funded, including whether the promissory note was monetized or sold.

Demonstrate Good Faith : Evidence that all actions taken by [ Bank Name ] complied with UCC 1-304s good faith requirement. This includes proof of proper handling of the deed, note, and lien.

Disclosure of Fees and Costs : An itemized breakdown of all fees, interest, and charges applied to the loan to ensure compliance with TILA and RESPA.

Reconciliation of Debt : A statement reconciling the current balance of the loan, including any offsets for payments already made or value derived from the notes monetization or securitization.

Notice of Potential Violations : Failure to provide this information will be considered evidence of a violation of federal and state laws, including TILA, RESPA, and UCC provisions. I reserve the right to pursue the following remedies if this matter is not resolved promptly : Filing a complaint with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ).

Initiating a quiet title action to challenge the validity of the lien on the property. 

Seeking damages for fraud, misrepresentation, and breach of fiduciary duty.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
I recently conducted a review of my credit report and found several items that have caused me significant distress. These items appear to be unverifiable, inaccurate, and questionable. Your agency has failed to ensure the accuracy of the information as required under 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ) Accuracy of Reports. This statute mandates that consumer reporting agencies must follow reasonable procedures to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of the information they report.

Furthermore, under 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) Treatment of Inaccurate or Unverifiable Information, you are required to promptly delete or modify any information found to be inaccurate, incomplete, or unverifiable during a reinvestigation. If you are unable to provide me with verifiable proof of the accuracy of the disputed items within 15 days of your investigation, these accounts and the related information must be removed from my credit report. 

Additionally, under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I do not recognize any of the alleged creditors or debt collectors. I have never entered into a valid contract with any of these entities, nor have I engaged in any transactions with them. As such, these accounts are fraudulent and and inaccurate information. 

Moreover, under the Fair Credit Billing Act, my right to privacy has been violated, and this breach infringes upon my rights as outlined in The Privacy Act of 1974. Removing the inaccurate and fraudulent information from my credit report will help restore my privacy and prevent further violations.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX Dear CFPB, On XX/XX/2024 I deposited a check ( # XXXX ) in the mail from my PNC Personal Checking Account. The check was made out to the United States Treasury in the amount of {$XXXX}. The check as cashed for that amount on XX/XX/2024, and I assumed that everything was fine. I was first notified by the IRS that I still owed them the money on XX/XX/2024 by mail. I immediately contacted PNC bank and requested an image of the cashed check and received that 48 hours later. Upon opening the image I saw that the check had been altered and cashed by a XXXX  XXXX XXXX for the same amount I had made the check out to the IRS for. The check was not endorsed by anyone, and no personal identifying information is on the back of the check. This represents non-compliant bank procedures and the bank made critical errors that led to my funds not being protected as they are legally obligated to do as a regulated entity. I immediately contacted PNC Bank and reported the fraud and theft. They mailed me an affidavit, which I completed and had notarized and reported to them on XX/XX/2024 ( Reference # XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX ). They received it on XX/XX/2024. On XX/XX/2024 they contacted me and informed me that my case had been denied and that the case was considered closed on their end, due to that fact that it was not reported within 30 days of the theft occurring, which they are claiming is their policy. 

I am specifically documenting when the IRS notification was received, as this represents the first reasonable opportunity I had to discover the fraud. This is important because under UCC 4-406 ( f ), the one-year period begins when the fraud was reasonably discoverable, not necessarily when it occurred.

Under UCC 4-406 ( e ), a bank 's failure to exercise ordinary care in paying an item shifts liability away from the customer. In this case, multiple required security measures for a high-value item appear to have been bypassed : 1. The check was processed without a valid endorsement XXXX. The {$23000.00} amount should have triggered enhanced security review under XXXX requirements XXXX. Electronic deposit of an altered check of this size should have required manual review and verification XXXX. No verification of deposit authority appears to have been performed '' Furthermore, as this check was stolen from the mail, I had no reasonable opportunity to detect this fraud before it occurred. Under UCC Article 4, time limitations for fraud reporting do not apply when : - The customer could not reasonably have detected the fraud - The bank failed to exercise ordinary care - Required security protocols were not followed '' I will be filing formal complaints with the police, XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX, and the XXXX XXXX XXXX  I appreciate any assistance you are able to provide here. 

Thanks, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Under the FCRA, I am entitled to a thorough and transparent investigation of my dispute. I expect a prompt response to this request. If you fail to provide a detailed description of the investigation process, I will consider filing a complaint with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and may seek legal advice to ensure my rights are protected.

12 CFR 1006.34 ( c ) : The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) has established requirements for the validation of debts. Under this regulation, the debt collector must provide clear and accurate information about the debt, including a detailed description of the nature of the debt and the original creditor. This requirement has not been met in my case. 
Requested Actions : In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), I request that XXXX Consumer Center, Innovis, XXXX conduct a thorough investigation of my dispute, correct the inaccuracies, and provide me with an updated copy of my XXXX Consumer Center, Innovis, XXXX Consumer Disclosure Report once the corrections have been made. 
I respectfully request the following under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) : 1. Conduct a thorough investigation of this dispute and remove the inaccurate information from my consumer reports.

2. Provide me with a detailed written statement of the investigation results and any actions taken.

3. Send me an updated copy of my corrected consumer reports.

4. Address the following specific details regarding your investigation : o Methods used to verify the disputed information. 
o Sources consulted during the investigation. 
o Documentation reviewed to support verification.

o Verification process and criteria used.

o A timeline of the investigation, including key dates and actions taken.

Be advised that the description of the procedure used to determine the accuracy and completeness of the information is hereby requested, to be provided within fifteen ( 15 ) days of the completion of your investigation. Additionally, please provide the name, address, and telephone number of each person contacted regarding this alleged account. I am formally requesting a copy of any documents provided bearing my signature, showing that I have a legally binding contractual obligation to pay them the exact amount claimed. 
Additionally, I request a description of the procedures used to determine the accuracy and completeness of the disputed information and the contact details of each person consulted regarding this account. Please also provide copies of any documents bearing my signature that establish a legally binding contractual obligation to pay the amount in question.

Failure to correct these inaccuracies within 30 days, as required under the FCRA, may result in further action, including filing a complaint with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) or pursuing legal remedies.

Requested Actions : 1. Conduct a thorough investigation of the disputed accounts.

2. Remove the inaccurate information from my credit report.

3. Provide me with a written statement detailing the outcome of your investigation.

4. Send a corrected copy of my credit report to my address above.

5. Methods Used : Please describe the specific methods and procedures used to verify the disputed information.

6. Sources Consulted : Provide a list of all sources, including creditors or data furnishers, consulted during the investigation.

7. Documentation Reviewed : Detail any documentation or evidence reviewed to support the verification of the disputed information.

8. Verification Process : Explain how the accuracy of the information was verified and the criteria used for validation.

9. Timeline of Investigation : Outline the timeline of the investigation, including key dates and actions taken.

Additional Requests : 1. Procedure Description : Be advised that the description of the procedure used to determine the accuracy and completeness of the information is hereby requested. This should include a detailed explanation of how the reinvestigation was conducted and the specific steps taken.

2. Contacts : Additionally, please provide the name, address, and telephone number of each person contacted regarding this alleged account.

3. Documents Bearing Signature : I am formally requesting a copy of any documents provided bearing my signature, showing that I have a legally binding contractual obligation to pay the exact amount claimed.

Failure to respond satisfactorily within 30 days of receipt of this certified letter may result in a small claims action against your company, seeking {$1000.00} per violation for : 1. Defamation 2. Negligent Enablement of Identity Fraud 3. Violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act 4. Violations of the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau regulations ________________________________________ Part 2 : Request for Permanent Security Freeze and Opt-Out I also request the following actions to ensure the security and privacy of my consumer data : 1. Place a permanent security freeze on my consumer file to prevent unauthorized access or use of my personal information.

2. Permanently opt me out of all pre-approved credit and insurance offers, marketing campaigns, and data-sharing programs. 
Personal Information for Verification : Full Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX of Birth : XX/XX/year> Social Security Number : XXXX XXXX - XXXX Current Address : XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXX, CA. XXXX Phone Number : ( XXXX ) XXXX - XXXX Email Address : XXXX Enclosed are copies of my driver 's license and a utility bill for verification purposes. Please confirm in writing once these actions have been completed or if additional information is required. 
________________________________________ Relevant Laws : 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) : Compliance procedures for maximum possible accuracy.

15 U.S.C. 1681i : Procedures for disputed accuracy.

15 U.S.C. 1681c : Requirements for information in consumer reports.

12 CFR 1006.34 ( c ) : Validation of debt details and original creditor information.

________________________________________ Thank you for your attention to these matters. I look forward to your response within the timeframes mandated by the FCRA. Please contact me at ( XXXX ) XXXX XXXX or XXXX if you require further clarification. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX ________________________________________ Make sure to customize the placeholders with your details and attach the necessary documentation when sending this letter. Let me know if you need further refinements!

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XX/XX/year> Consumer Financial Protection Bureau Federal Trade Commission XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Subject : Formal Complaint Regarding Conflicting Credit Reports Issued by Equifax Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau and Federal Trade Commission, I am filing this complaint regarding conflicting and inaccurate credit reports issued by Equifax Information Services LLC. I have obtained two different credit reports from Equifax, and they show inconsistent and misleading information for the same account, violating the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 

Summary of the Issue : Account in Question XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX NA Discrepancy in Reports : XXXX Equifax report lists the account as " Collection/Charge-Off. '' Another Equifax report lists the account as " XXXX, '' but still includes the " charge-off '' notation, which is inaccurate given the settled nature of the account. 

These discrepancies create confusion and fail to meet the FCRA 's requirement for credit reporting agencies to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of the information they report ( 15 USC 1681e ( b ) ). 

Legal Concerns : XXXX. Violation of FCRA Accuracy Requirements : XXXX issuance of two reports with contradictory information fails to ensure accuracy and causes harm to my creditworthiness. 
XXXX. Failure to Investigate and Correct Disputes : Equifax has not corrected these errors despite my attempts to dispute the inaccuracies, violating 15 USC 1681i ( a ), which requires reinvestigation and resolution within 30 days. This account has been reporting inaccuracies for over XXXX years. 



Impact of the Errors : The conflicting reports and false remarks damage my credit profile and hinder my ability to secure financial opportunities. This is a clear violation of my consumer rights under federal law. 

Requested Actions : I am formally requesting the removal of the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  account from my credit report due to these violations of the FCRA. The failure to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of the information reported and the issuance of contradictory reports constitute grounds for deletion. 

Additionally, I respectfully request the following : XXXX. An investigation into XXXX reporting practices and their failure to address these inaccuracies. 


XXXX. Immediate action to ensure all incorrect, unverifiable, or inconsistent information on my credit report is corrected or removed. 

XXXX. Confirmation of the removal of the disputed account from my credit report in writing. 

Supporting Documentation : I have enclosed the following documents for your review : XXXX. Copies of two different Equifax credit reports showing conflicting information. 

XXXX settlement letter from XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX verifying the resolution of the account. 

I look forward to your acknowledgment of this complaint and an update on any actions taken. If additional information or documentation is required, I am happy to provide it. You may contact me at this email XXXX. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter and for taking steps to protect consumers from these unfair credit reporting practices. 

Sincerely, CFPB, FTC THIS ACCOUNT HAS REPORTED LIKE THIS FOR OVER XXXX YEARS

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
[ XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX ] [ XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX ] [ XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX ] [ XXXX ] [ XXXX ] [ Date : XX/XX/XXXX ] Equifax Information Services LLC XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Subject : Demand for Resolution, Compensation, and Accountability Regarding Credit File Mismanagement To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to formally demand resolution and compensation from Equifax Information Services LLC due to your willful noncompliance, negligence, and mismanagement of my credit file, in violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) regulations. The inaccuracies and deceptive practices I have encountered have caused substantial emotional and financial harm.

Over the past months, I have disputed several inaccuracies and fraudulent accounts on my credit report. Despite providing adequate documentation to support my claims, Equifax has consistently denied my disputes without conducting the thorough investigations required under the FCRA. The specifics of my complaints are as follows : 1. **Unauthorized Updates During Investigations** : Negative statements were added to my credit file while my disputes were still under investigation, misleading potential creditors.

2. **Failure to Address Specific Discrepancies** :
- Accounts linked to XXXX XXXX/ and its parent company XXXX XXXX inaccurately reported accruing balances for over 81 months.XXXX XXXX misrepresented subsidiarys accounts without legal justification ; and EQUIFAX willfully complied in this illegal misrepresentation and reinsertion. Specifically, the reinserted account from XXXX XXXX XXXX violates **15 U.S.C. 1681i ( b ) **, which states that consumers must be notified of the reinsertion of information that had previously been removed from their credit report without proper validation. 
- XXXX XXXX reported inflated debt for a fraudulent account. 
- XXXX XXXX inflated debt amounts regarding fraudulent accounts. 
- XXXX XXXX XXXX provided a fraudulent T-Mobile bill. 

Each of these accounts was disputed numerous times, yet they were reported as updated and verified without a proper investigation. After escalating the matter to the CFPB, XXXX, FTC, and the Federal Reserve, these inaccuracies were only deleted XXXX months later.

3. **Ongoing Misreporting of Student Loans** : Two Department of Education student loans, currently in litigation, are inaccurately reported as XXXX days late and marked as 180 days past due while showing a XXXX balance. Equifax acknowledged this situation but continues to report it inaccurately, violating **FCRA 611 ( a ) **, which ensures that investigations into disputed information are conducted promptly.

4. **Inconsistent Correspondence on Identity Verification** : I received four notifications regarding my disputes, three from the CFPB and XXXX that was contradictory. While my name and address were finally corrected, inconsistent communication demonstrates Equifax 's disregard for compliance with regulatory guidelines.

5. **Failure to Provide Validation of Debt** : Under **15 U.S.C. 1692g ( a ) **, debt collectors are required to provide validation of the debt upon request. Your failure to confirm the accuracy of debts listed, particularly those from XXXX XXXX and its subsidiaries ; as well as XXXX XXXX, constitutes a violation. Additionally, the situation exemplified in **XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX **, reinforces that reinserted accounts require valid documentation to substantiate their existence in consumer credit reports. 

Equifax 's actions are clear violations of the following statutes : - **FCRA 1681i** : Requires credit reporting agencies to conduct reasonable investigations into disputed information, which Equifax failed to perform in my case.

- **FCRA 609** : Grants consumers the right to request and obtain a disclosure of the information in their consumer reports, which correlates with your obligation to verify accuracy.

- **FTC Guidelines on Credit Reporting** : Enforce transparency and accountability, which Equifax has neglected, leading to significant damage to my credit standing. 

I believe I am entitled to compensation for the violations of these statutes. Therefore, I am formally demanding compensation in the amount of ** $ XXXX, calculated at ** {$1000.00} per violation** as allowed under the FCRA and reflective of the emotional and financial injuries incurred due to Equifaxs misconduct.

Additionally, I require that Equifax address these issues immediately. This includes : - Adequate and timely responses to all future complaints and disputes. 
- Thorough investigations into the accuracy of my credit file. 
- A review and correction of your identity verification requests, ensuring they do not replace the necessary diligence in investigating reported information. 

I expect a comprehensive response addressing my demands and outlining the corrective actions you will take within **15 days**. If I do not receive an adequate resolution by that time, I will pursue legal action to protect my rights under the FCRA and FTC regulations and seek the compensation mentioned above. 

Thank you for your immediate attention to this serious matter. I look forward to your prompt resolution. 

Sincerely, [ XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX ] [ XXXX ] [ Your Social Security Number XXXX ]

Consumer complaint narrative:
PLEASE BE ADVISED YOU EQUIFAX IS IN DIRECT VIOLATION OF FEDERAL LAW BY VIOLATING PRIVACY ACT OF 1974. 
Charge of accounts are considered, certificates of indebtedness, pursuant to I.R.S publication 4681 and it is now considered income and income can not be reporting on my consumer credit report, pursuant to Privacy act of 1974. 
The Privacy Act of 1974 is a federal law that protects individuals from the misuse of their personal information by the federal government. The act 's main goals are to balance the government 's need for information with the rights of individuals to privacy. 
The Privacy Act of 1974 : Protects individuals : The act protects individuals from the collection, use, maintenance, and disclosure of their personal information. 
Requires notice : Agencies must notify the public of their record systems. 
Requires consent : Agencies can not disclose an individual 's record without their written consent. 
Provides access : Individuals can request access to and changes to their records. 
Establishes record-keeping requirements : The act sets forth requirements for how agencies keep records. 

IRS Publication 4681 Canceled debt : If the abandoned property secures a debt for which you are personally liable and the debt is canceled, you will realize ordinary income equal to the canceled debt. This income is separate from any amount realized from abandonment of the property. You must report this income on your return unless XXXX of the exceptions or exclusions described in chapter XXXX applies.
