Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Credit Report Dispute Request for Investigation and Correction To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to formally dispute several inaccuracies on my XXXX credit report. I have reviewed my credit report as of [ Insert Date ], and I have identified the following errors that require immediate correction under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). Below is a detailed explanation of the disputed accounts and the inaccuracies : XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX  ( Account Ending in XXXX XXXX - Date Opened : XX/XX/XXXX Inaccuracy : The account shows a credit usage of 268 %, which is mathematically impossible given a {$300.00} credit limit. 
Requested Correction : Verify and update the balance and credit usage to reflect accurate and lawful reporting. 

XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX ( Account Ending in XXXX  ) - Date Opened : XX/XX/XXXX Inaccuracy : This account appears to duplicate the above account from XX/XX/XXXX. Both accounts indicate charge-offs, but there is no clarification as to whether they represent the same debt. 
Requested Correction : Investigate and delete any duplicate reporting. If they are separate obligations, please provide detailed documentation to verify the legitimacy of both accounts. 

XXXX. XXXX  ( Account Ending in XXXX  ) - Date Opened : XX/XX/XXXX Inaccuracy : The account shows a credit usage of 127 %, which exceeds the reported {$700.00} credit limit. Additionally, the last payment date and balance update timelines are inconsistent. 
Requested Correction : Verify and correct the credit usage and balance. Provide clarification on the reporting discrepancies for the timeline of updates. 

XXXX. XXXXXXXX XXXX ( Account Ending in XXXX XXXX XXXX Date Opened : XX/XX/XXXX Inaccuracy : This account shows a credit usage of 201 % with a {$600.00} limit and an outstanding balance of {$1200.00}. Additionally, the comment mentions first payment never received, but the report lacks detail on whether this is accurate. 
Requested Correction : Verify and update the reported credit usage and outstanding balance. Clarify and provide evidence to support the comment listed under this account. 

XXXX. XXXX XXXX ( Account Ending in XXXX  ) - Date Opened : XX/XX/XXXX Inaccuracy : The report states : Collection account. {$1800.00} past due as of XX/XX/XXXX, but there is no indication whether the debt is with the original creditor or a third-party collector. 
The timeline for updates is inconsistent, with Status Updated in XX/XX/XXXX and Balance Updated in XX/XX/XXXX, despite the account being opened less than a year before. 
The terms listed as 1 month do not align with the balance reported unless additional charges ( e.g., termination fees ) are properly documented. 
Requested Correction : Investigate the validity of this collection account, verify the timeline for updates, and ensure the balance reflects lawful reporting. Clarify whether the debt remains with XXXX or has been sold to a collection agency. 

XXXX. General Reporting Errors Inaccurate Status Updates : Several accounts reflect conflicting last payment dates and status update dates ( e.g., balance updates for closed accounts ). 
Duplicate Reporting : XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX accounts appear redundant. 
Requested Correction : Ensure that all statuses, dates, and balances are accurately reflected. 

I have attached a copy of my credit report with the disputed accounts highlighted for your reference, along with a copy of my government-issued ID and proof of address to verify my identity. 

Please conduct a thorough investigation into these issues and provide me with the results of your findings. If you determine that the disputed information is inaccurate, I request that you promptly update my credit report to reflect the corrections and notify any creditors that received the incorrect information. 

In accordance with the FCRA, I expect a response within 30 days. You may contact me via mail at the address above or by phone at ( XXXX ) XXXX if you require additional information. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your timely resolution. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
I recently conducted a review of my credit report and found several items that have caused me significant distress. These items appear to be unverifiable, inaccurate, and questionable. Your agency has failed to ensure the accuracy of the information as required under 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ) Accuracy of Reports. This statute mandates that consumer reporting agencies must follow reasonable procedures to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of the information they report.

Furthermore, under 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) Treatment of Inaccurate or Unverifiable Information, you are required to promptly delete or modify any information found to be inaccurate, incomplete, or unverifiable during a reinvestigation. If you are unable to provide me with verifiable proof of the accuracy of the disputed items within 15 days of your investigation, these accounts and the related information must be removed from my credit report.

Additionally, under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I do not recognize any of the alleged creditors or debt collectors. I have never entered into a valid contract with any of these entities, nor have I engaged in any transactions with them. As such, these accounts are fraudulent and and inaccurate information. 

Moreover, under the Fair Credit Billing Act, my right to privacy has been violated, and this breach infringes upon my rights as outlined in The Privacy Act of 1974. Removing the inaccurate and fraudulent information from my credit report will help restore my privacy and prevent further violations.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I purchased a XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX from XXXX XXXX, XXXX in XX/XX/XXXX. Due to the vehicle falling under the lemon law, the vehicle was purchased back by XXXX XX/XX/XXXX. At that time, XXXX was quoted a payoff amount of {$14000.00}. This was paid to XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX. 

Due to the account not showing as closed on my credit reports, I contacted ACA. I was told that I owe approximately {$600.00}. The rep and the manager on duty told me this was for late fees. How can I have late fees if the account was current when it was taken back to XXXX. I asked for a print out of what I owe and the statement shows a credit of {$120.00} on the payment ledger.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I opened my Ally Checking account XX/XX/year>. Almost immediately, I begin having online access issues and continuously got errors stating " You've been locked out of your account '' when trying to manage my online access. I have called ~10 times to speak with Ally Customer Support but no representative was able to resolve the issue ; in fact, they would say they do not see any error on their system ( their system did not acknowledge that I was getting locked out / getting error messages ).

One of the representatives acknowledged that the first " case '' was opened on XX/XX/year>. Since then, I have not been able to access my online account. In other words, for several weeks, I have not been able to know how much money I have on my account, what funds are going in and out, what bills have been paid, and my progress towards personal financial goals. 

This is a complete disaster and has caused incredible stress for the last several weeks. Ally Bank has not treated this issue with the severity it deserves, and has not provided any support or urgency to support my issue. I want to transfer ALL FUNDS out of Ally Bank and close the account immediately.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Dispute of Inaccurate Information and Request for Permanent Security Freeze and Permanent Opt-Out To : LexisNexis Consumer Center XXXX XXXX, XXXX Dear Representatives, I am writing to address two separate but related matters : 1. A formal dispute of inaccurate information on my LexisNexis Consumer Center, XXXX, and XXXX consumer disclosure reports. 
2. A request for a permanent security freeze and permanent opt-out on my consumer file. 
________________________________________ Part XXXX : Dispute of Inaccurate Information Description : I am writing to formally dispute inaccurate information contained in my consumer reports from LexisNexis Consumer Center, XXXX, and XXXX. Upon reviewing my reports, I identified several discrepancies that I believe to be incorrect and require immediate rectification under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 
The issues pertain to the following : 1. Inaccuracies : Specific inaccuracies in my reports are highlighted in the attached documentation. These inaccuracies affect the accuracy and integrity of my consumer data.

2. Failure to Validate Debt : As per 12 CFR 1006.34 ( c ), there has been a lack of validation for the debts in question. No clear and accurate description of the debts or evidence of contractual obligation has been provided.

Upon reviewing my consumer reports, I identified the following discrepancy that requires immediate correction : Disputed Account 1 Account Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number XXXX XXXX Dispute Reason Code XXXX XXXXXXXX - Inaccurate Information Explanation : I have never held an account with this number under the name XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX 
Disputed Account 2 Account Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Dispute Reason Code : XXXX - Inaccurate Information Explanation : I have never held an account with this number under the name XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Account 3 Account Name : XXXX  Account Number : XXXX Dispute Reason Code : XXXX - Inaccurate Information Explanation : I have never held an account with this number under the name XXXX  XXXX XXXX ( Original Creditor : XXXX XXXX XXXX ) Disputed Account XXXX Account Name : XXXX XXXX  ( Original Creditor : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  ) Account Number : XXXX Dispute Reason Code : XXXX - Inaccurate Information Explanation : I have never held an account with this number under the name XXXX XXXX  ( Original Creditor : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ) Disputed Account XXXX Account Name XXXX XXXX XXXX ( Original Creditor : XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ) Account Number : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX - Inaccurate Information Explanation : I have never held an account with this number under the name XXXX XXXX ( Original Creditor : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX C ) Disputed Account XXXX Account XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Original Creditor : XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX  ) Account Number : XXXX Dispute Reason Code : XXXX - Inaccurate Information Explanation : I have never held an account with this number under the name XXXX XXXXXXXX ( Original Creditor : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  ) Disputed Account XXXX Account Name : XXXX XXXX  Account Number : XXXX Dispute Reason Code : XXXX - Inaccurate Information Explanation : I have never held an account with this number under the name XXXX XXXX  Disputed Account XXXX Account Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Dispute Reason Code : XXXX - Inaccurate Information Explanation : I have never held an account with this number under the name XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX request a manual review of this information due to the complexity of the inaccuracies. I have attached highlighted copies of my credit report with the incorrect information clearly marked. Please investigate this matter and remove the inaccurate information from my credit report. Notify me in writing of the results of your investigation and any actions taken. 
Under the FCRA, I am entitled to a thorough and transparent investigation of my dispute. I expect a prompt response to this request. If you fail to provide a detailed description of the investigation process, I will consider filing a complaint with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and may seek legal advice to ensure my rights are protected.

12 CFR 1006.34 ( c ) : The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) has established requirements for the validation of debts. Under this regulation, the debt collector must provide clear and accurate information about the debt, including a detailed description of the nature of the debt and the original creditor. This requirement has not been met in my case.

Requested Actions : In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), I request that LexisNexis Consumer Center, XXXX, XXXX conduct a thorough investigation of my dispute, correct the inaccuracies, and provide me with an updated copy of my LexisNexis Consumer Center, XXXX, XXXX XXXX Disclosure Report once the corrections have been made. 
I respectfully request the following under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) : 1. Conduct a thorough investigation of this dispute and remove the inaccurate information from my consumer reports.

2. Provide me with a detailed written statement of the investigation results and any actions taken.

3. Send me an updated copy of my corrected consumer reports.

4. Address the following specific details regarding your investigation : o Methods used to verify the disputed information.

o Sources consulted during the investigation.

o Documentation reviewed to support verification.

o Verification process and criteria used.

o A timeline of the investigation, including key dates and actions taken.

Be advised that the description of the procedure used to determine the accuracy and completeness of the information is hereby requested, to be provided within fifteen ( 15 ) days of the completion of your investigation. Additionally, please provide the name, address, and telephone number of each person contacted regarding this alleged account. I am formally requesting a copy of any documents provided bearing my signature, showing that I have a legally binding contractual obligation to pay them the exact amount claimed.

Additionally, I request a description of the procedures used to determine the accuracy and completeness of the disputed information and the contact details of each person consulted regarding this account. Please also provide copies of any documents bearing my signature that establish a legally binding contractual obligation to pay the amount in question.

Failure to correct these inaccuracies within 30 days, as required under the FCRA, may result in further action, including filing a complaint with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) or pursuing legal remedies.

Requested Actions : 1. Conduct a thorough investigation of the disputed accounts.

2. Remove the inaccurate information from my credit report.

3. Provide me with a written statement detailing the outcome of your investigation.

4. Send a corrected copy of my credit report to my address above.

5. Methods Used : Please describe the specific methods and procedures used to verify the disputed information.

6. Sources Consulted : Provide a list of all sources, including creditors or data furnishers, consulted during the investigation.

7. Documentation Reviewed : Detail any documentation or evidence reviewed to support the verification of the disputed information.

8. Verification Process : Explain how the accuracy of the information was verified and the criteria used for validation.

9. Timeline of Investigation : Outline the timeline of the investigation, including key dates and actions taken.

Additional Requests : 1. Procedure Description : Be advised that the description of the procedure used to determine the accuracy and completeness of the information is hereby requested. This should include a detailed explanation of how the reinvestigation was conducted and the specific steps taken.

2. Contacts : Additionally, please provide the name, address, and telephone number of each person contacted regarding this alleged account.

3. Documents Bearing Signature : I am formally requesting a copy of any documents provided bearing my signature, showing that I have a legally binding contractual obligation to pay the exact amount claimed.

Failure to respond satisfactorily within 30 days of receipt of this certified letter may result in a small claims action against your company, seeking {$1000.00} per violation for : 1. Defamation 2. Negligent Enablement of Identity Fraud 3. Violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act 4. Violations of the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau regulations ________________________________________ Part 2 : Request for Permanent Security Freeze and Opt-Out I also request the following actions to ensure the security and privacy of my consumer data : 1. Place a permanent security freeze on my consumer file to prevent unauthorized access or use of my personal information.

2. Permanently opt me out of all pre-approved credit and insurance offers, marketing campaigns, and data-sharing programs.

Personal Information for Verification : Full Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX Date of Birth : XXXX Social Security Number : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Current Address : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, CA. XXXX  Phone Number : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Email Address : XXXXXXXX Enclosed are copies of my driver 's license and a utility bill for verification purposes. Please confirm in writing once these actions have been completed or if additional information is required. 
________________________________________ Relevant Laws : 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) : Compliance procedures for maximum possible accuracy.

15 U.S.C. 1681i : Procedures for disputed accuracy.

15 U.S.C. 1681c : Requirements for information in consumer reports.

12 CFR 1006.34 ( c ) : Validation of debt details and original creditor information.

________________________________________ Thank you for your attention to these matters. I look forward to your response within the timeframes mandated by the FCRA. Please contact me at ( XXXX ) XXXX XXXX or XXXX if you require further clarification. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX ________________________________________ Make sure to customize the placeholders with your details and attach the necessary documentation when sending this letter. Let me know if you need further refinements!

Consumer complaint narrative:
[ XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX ] [ XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ] [ XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX ] [ XXXX ] [ XXXX ] [ Date : XX/XX/XXXX ] Equifax Information Services LLC XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Subject : Demand for Resolution, Compensation, and Accountability Regarding Credit File Mismanagement To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to formally demand resolution and compensation from Equifax Information Services LLC due to your willful noncompliance, negligence, and mismanagement of my credit file, in violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) regulations. The inaccuracies and deceptive practices I have encountered have caused substantial emotional and financial harm. 

Over the past months, I have disputed several inaccuracies and fraudulent accounts on my credit report. Despite providing adequate documentation to support my claims, Equifax has consistently denied my disputes without conducting the thorough investigations required under the FCRA. The specifics of my complaints are as follows : 1. **Unauthorized Updates During Investigations** : Negative statements were added to my credit file while my disputes were still under investigation, misleading potential creditors.

2. **Failure to Address Specific Discrepancies** : - Accounts linked to World Finance/ and its parent company XXXX XXXX  inaccurately reported accruing balances for over 81 months.XXXX XXXX misrepresented subsidiarys accounts without legal justification ; and EQUIFAX willfully complied in this illegal misrepresentation and reinsertion. Specifically, the reinserted account from XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX violates **15 U.S.C. 1681i ( b ) **, which states that consumers must be notified of the reinsertion of information that had previously been removed from their credit report without proper validation. 
- XXXX XXXX reported inflated debt for a fraudulent account. 
- XXXX XXXX inflated debt amounts regarding fraudulent accounts. 
- XXXX XXXX XXXX provided a fraudulent T-Mobile bill. 

Each of these accounts was disputed numerous times, yet they were reported as updated and verified without a proper investigation. After escalating the matter to the CFPB, XXXX, FTC, and the Federal Reserve, these inaccuracies were only deleted XXXX months later.

3. **Ongoing Misreporting of Student Loans** : Two Department of Education student loans, currently in litigation, are inaccurately reported as XXXX days late and marked as 180 days past due while showing a XXXX balance. Equifax acknowledged this situation but continues to report it inaccurately, violating **FCRA 611 ( a ) **, which ensures that investigations into disputed information are conducted promptly.

4. **Inconsistent Correspondence on Identity Verification** : I received four notifications regarding my disputes, three from the CFPB and one that was contradictory. While my name and address were finally corrected, inconsistent communication demonstrates Equifax 's disregard for compliance with regulatory guidelines.

5. **Failure to Provide Validation of Debt** : Under **15 U.S.C. 1692g ( a ) **, debt collectors are required to provide validation of the debt upon request. Your failure to confirm the accuracy of debts listed, particularly those from XXXX XXXX and its subsidiaries ; as well as XXXX XXXX, constitutes a violation. Additionally, the situation exemplified in **XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX **, reinforces that reinserted accounts require valid documentation to substantiate their existence in consumer credit reports. 

Equifax 's actions are clear violations of the following statutes : - **FCRA 1681i** : Requires credit reporting agencies to conduct reasonable investigations into disputed information, which Equifax failed to perform in my case.

- **FCRA 609** : Grants consumers the right to request and obtain a disclosure of the information in their consumer reports, which correlates with your obli
gation to verify accuracy.

- **FTC Guidelines on Credit Reporting** : Enforce transparency and accountability, which Equifax has neglected, leading to significant damage to my credit standing.

I believe I am entitled to compensation for the violations of these statutes. Therefore, I am formally demanding compensation in the amount of ** $ XXXX, calculated at ** {$1000.00} per violation** as allowed under the FCRA and reflective of the emotional and financial injuries incurred due to Equifaxs misconduct.

Additionally, I require that Equifax address these issues immediately. This includes : - Adequate and timely responses to all future complaints and disputes. 
- Thorough investigations into the accuracy of my credit file. 
- A review and correction of your identity verification requests, ensuring they do not replace the necessary diligence in investigating reported information.

I expect a comprehensive response addressing my demands and outlining the corrective actions you will take within **15 days**. If I do not receive an adequate resolution by that time, I will pursue legal action to protect my rights under the FCRA and FTC regulations and seek the compensation mentioned above. 

Thank you for your immediate attention to this serious matter. I look forward to your prompt resolution. 

Sincerely, [ XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX ] [ XXXX ] [ Your Social Security Number XXXX ]

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing to demand immediate action to address the inaccurate, damaging, and negligent reporting related to two XXXX XXXX accounts and a lawsuit filed against me that has since been dismissed for want of prosecution ( DWOP ). Despite my efforts over the past three years to provide evidence of identity theft, neither XXXX XXXX nor the credit bureaus ( XXXX, Equifax, and XXXX ) have taken appropriate steps to resolve this matter. 

Here are the critical facts of this issue : 1. Identity Theft and Disputed Accounts : I was a victim of identity, a time during which two XXXX XXXX accounts in good standing were fraudulently used. 
I provided police reports and a Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) Identity Theft Report to XXXX XXXX and the credit bureaus, documenting this crime and disputing the debts. 
Despite clear evidence that these debts were not mine, XXXX XXXX refused to acknowledge the theft or resolve the accounts appropriately. 
2. Lawsuit Filed and Dismissed : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  pursued legal action against me in 2024, despite the ongoing identity theft dispute and my inability to pay for debts that were not mine. 
On XX/XX/year>, the court dismissed the case for want of prosecution ( DWOP ), with no judgment entered against me. This dismissal further supports my position that this debt is invalid and should not have been pursued in the first place. 
3. Credit Reporting Negligence : Despite the dismissal and my repeated disputes, all three credit bureaus continue to report inaccurate and derogatory information related to these accounts and lawsuit. 
The excuse provided by XXXXthat the lawsuit was filed and therefore can not be removedis baseless given that the case was dismissed, and the accounts were the result of identity theft. 
The continued failure to address this issue violates the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), which mandates accurate and fair credit reporting. 

This negligence has severely impacted my credit standing and financial stability for years. The prolonged failure to remove fraudulent accounts and the erroneous lawsuit from my credit file has caused undue hardship, limiting my ability to rebuild after the closure of my business.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Notice of Deletion of XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and Request for Removal from All Credit Reports Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing to inform you of the recent deletion of a charge-off from my XXXX credit report related to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX The account, identified as " XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, '' had a reported balance of {$1000.00} and was listed as a charge-off. 

As of XX/XX/year>, after submitting a formal dispute, XXXX completed their investigation and deleted the account from my XXXX report. Please find the relevant details of the account : Account Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Type : Charge-Off Amount : {$1000.00} Dispute Resolution Date : XX/XX/year> Outcome : Account Deleted According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), a consumer is entitled to accurate and verifiable information being reported on their credit report. Since XXXX has completed their investigation and determined that the information is unverifiable, they have deleted this account from my XXXX credit file. 

In light of the deletion from XXXX, I kindly request that all other credit reporting agencies, including but not limited to Equifax, XXXX, and XXXX, conduct a thorough review of this account. If these agencies can not verify this debt, I am requesting that they remove the account from my credit reports as well. The FCRA mandates that credit reporting agencies must ensure that any information they report is accurate, and if they can not verify the information, it must be deleted. 

Legal Basis for Removal : Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) Section 1681i : This section states that if any information is found to be inaccurate or unverifiable during a dispute process, it must be removed or corrected. Given that XXXX has deleted the account, the other CRAs are obligated to ensure their reports reflect accurate and verified information. 

Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) Section 1681e ( b ) : Requires that credit reporting agencies maintain procedures to ensure the accuracy of the information reported. 

Please take notice that I am requesting the removal of this unverifiable account within 30 days or less. If the account is not removed in the specified timeframe, I reserve the right to pursue legal action, including suing for violation of my rights under the FCRA. I understand that under FCRA Section 1681n, I may be entitled to seek damages if my rights have been violated, including statutory damages and attorney fees. 

I look forward to your prompt resolution of this matter and expect that the unverifiable account will be removed within the legally required timeframe.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing to file a formal complaint regarding the incorrect reporting of several accounts on my credit report by Equifax and its failure to properly investigate or correct these errors. The following accounts are being inaccurately reported, causing harm to my credit standing and violating my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ).

Accounts in Question : First Premier Bank Account ( Charge-Off ) - {$620.00} The account is reported as a charge-off, but I have disputed this information as it does not accurately reflect the status of the account. It is my belief that the charge-off was reported prematurely or inaccurately. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX  Account ( Charge-Off ) - {$1000.00} Similar to the previous account, this is another charge-off that is inaccurately reported on my credit report. I have disputed this information and request that it be verified or deleted. 
XXXX XXXX Account ( # XXXX ) - {$21000.00} ( Paid ) The XXXX account is reported as " Paid '', but it still reflects an outstanding balance of {$21000.00}, which is incorrect. The account should reflect either a XXXX balance or " Paid in Full '' with no remaining balance. Despite my efforts to resolve this, Equifax has not corrected this discrepancy. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX Account ( Collection ) - {$310.00} ( XXXX ) XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  account is reported as a collection. I have requested validation of this debt, but Equifax has not provided adequate documentation or verified the accuracy of the reported debt. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX Account ( # XXXX ) - {$670.00} ( Collection ) The XXXX XXXX XXXX account is listed as in collection. I have disputed the accuracy of this account, as I believe it does not match my records or has been improperly reported. 
Background and Violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) : Under the FCRA, I am entitled to a credit report that is accurate, complete, and verifiable. The information reported by Equifax and other creditors is clearly inaccurate and misleading, which is a violation of my rights under the FCRA. Specifically : FCRA Section 607 ( b ) requires that credit reporting agencies like Equifax ensure the accuracy and completeness of the information they report.

FCRA Section 611 ( a ) mandates that if an item on a credit report is disputed, the credit reporting agency must investigate and resolve the dispute within 30 days. However, Equifax has failed to correct the inaccuracies on my credit report despite my repeated disputes. 
Request for Resolution : I am requesting that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) assist in the following : Investigate the inaccurate reporting of the accounts listed above, which were not properly validated or corrected by Equifax. 
Ensure that the accounts from XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX are accurately reported, and that any unverifiable information is removed from my credit report. 
Ensure that Equifax complies with the FCRA by thoroughly investigating these disputes and correcting any inaccuracies, including providing proper documentation where necessary. 
Confirm that the XXXX account is correctly updated to reflect XXXX balance or " Paid in Full '' status, as the account should not have any remaining balance. 
Provide a copy of my corrected credit report showing the changes made to these accounts. 


I trust that the CFPB will take swift and appropriate action to ensure that Equifax complies with the FCRA and FDCPA, and that the inaccurate information on my credit report is corrected. I appreciate your assistance in resolving this matter promptly. 

Thank you for your time and attention to this important matter. I look forward to your response and the swift resolution of my complaint. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XX/XX/year> XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
VALIDATION AND CEASE AND DESIST XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Dear ( Debt Collector ) I recently received a debt collection notice from your office. I am writing to verify that you have contacted the correct individual and to request that you provide documentation confirming this. Please supply me with a copy of any contract or agreement signed with your company or the original creditor. 

In accordance with the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I request the following information : XXXX. The name and address of the original creditor and the current creditor. 
XXXX. Verification of the debt amount you are seeking to collect, including evidence that a contract exists creating the amount you claim is owed. 
XXXX. Documentation of all assignments showing the transfer of the debt from the original creditor to the current creditor. 
XXXX. Proof that the original creditor securitized the debt. 
XXXX. Documentation showing the assignments of the debt from the original creditor to the secured trust and then back to the original creditor. 

Please cease and desist from collecting on this debt until you have provided validation of the debt. 

Additionally, I request that you do not access my credit report or report anything to my credit bureaus. I dispute the validity of this debt amount, and this dispute should be reflected on my credit report if you have already reported this debt. 

Permissible Purpose : Please state your permissible purpose for accessing my credit information. I dispute your right to do so. 

Notification to Other Collectors : I dispute that I owe this debt to you. Should you transfer this debt to another collector, please inform them of my dispute regarding the validity of this debt. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally file a complaint regarding inaccurate and misleading information being reported on my credit report by XXXX. Specifically, I am addressing issues with a XXXX XXXX  account that is reporting in violation of credit reporting regulations. The following inaccuracies are causing significant harm to my credit score, and I am requesting immediate action to correct or remove these entries. 

XXXX. Re-aged Account XXXX XXXX XXXX  account is being reported with a re-aged date, which is a violation of credit reporting standards. This account should reflect its original date of delinquency and not a re-aged or altered date. This deliberate misrepresentation is harmful to my credit profile, and I demand the immediate removal of the re-aged date. 

2. Balance on Closed Account XXXX XXXX XXXX  account is also showing a balance despite being closed. A closed account should not reflect any outstanding balance. This inaccurate information is misleading and must be corrected immediately by removing the balance reported on this account. 

XXXX. Account Showing as Over the Limit The same account is incorrectly reporting as over the credit limit, despite being closed. A closed account should not be subject to over-limit reporting, and this misrepresentation of the accounts status is not only misleading but also unlawful. 

These inaccuracies are in direct violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), which mandates that all information reported to credit bureaus must be accurate and complete. The continued presence of these errors is damaging my credit score and may have broader implications on my financial well-being. 

I request that XXXX immediately investigate and correct the reporting of this XXXXXXXX XXXX account. The re-aged date must be removed, the balance on the closed account must be eliminated, and the over-limit status must be corrected to accurately reflect the closed status of the account. If XXXX is unable to correct these inaccuracies, I request that they be removed entirely from my credit report. 

Please acknowledge receipt of this complaint and confirm the actions taken to resolve these issues. I trust that the CFPB will assist in ensuring that my credit report accurately reflects my financial history and that these discrepancies are resolved promptly. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to a timely resolution.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports

Subject : Complaint Against XXXX for Refusal to Update Personal Information Dear CFPB, I am filing a formal complaint against Equifax for their refusal to update my personal information on my credit report, in violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 
Details of the Issue : Date of Initial Request : XX/XX/2024 Documents Submitted : Personal information update letter, driver 's license, Social Security card, and utility bill ( notarized ) Response from XXXX : XX/XX/2024, stating my request could not be processed due to missing government ID ( which was, in fact, included ). 
Violation of Rights : XXXX 's refusal to update my information is a direct violation of 15 USC 1681 ( a ) ( 4 ). The FCRA mandates that consumer reporting agencies must handle their responsibilities with fairness, impartiality, and respect for consumer privacy. By not properly reviewing the provided documentation, XXXX has failed to conduct a fair investigation, thus violating my consumer rights under : 15 U.S.C. 1681i : Procedure in case of disputed accuracy 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) : Compliance procedures to ensure maximum possible accuracy

Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Was not notified of investigation status or results
Consumer complaint narrative:
I was recently informed by a representative from Equifax regarding my case related to the data breach. She mentioned that my case had been closed because I failed to respond by the deadline. However, I had submitted a request for an extended claim period and sent an email notifying them about my change of address, but unfortunately, I did not receive any response to either communication. 

On XX/XX/year>, I spoke with another Equifax representative named XXXX. During our conversation, she assured me that she would reopen my case and that I would receive a follow-up call regarding the status of my claim. Unfortunately, I have yet to receive that call or any further communication about my case. 

I want to emphasize that I took my responsibilities seriously ; I completed all the required paperwork related to the data breach, which was quite time-consuming and took me approximately an hour and a half to finish online. After all this effort, I am left concerned about whether my information has been lost in the process. I would appreciate clarity on the situation and any next steps I should take to ensure my case is properly addressed.

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to report a violation of my consumer rights regarding a collection account reported on my credit report by XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. I have requested validation of the debt, as required by the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), but I have not received any documentation or response from either XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX or the credit reporting agency. 

Here are the details of the issue : Debt Collection on Credit Report : A collection account from XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX is listed on my credit report. This account is inaccurate or incomplete, and I have reasons to believe it may not be valid. 

Request for Debt Validation : On XX/XX/year>, I sent a formal request to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX for validation of the debt under Section XXXX of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ). This request required them to provide detailed documentation of the debt, including the original creditor, the amount owed, and proof that they have the legal right to collect the debt. 

Failure to Respond to Debt Validation Request : Despite the legal requirement for XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX to provide validation of the debt within XXXX days, I have not received any response. This failure to validate the debt violates my rights as a consumer. 

Violation of Credit Reporting Requirements : Additionally, I have contacted the credit bureau that is reporting this collection account. The credit bureau is also in violation of my rights because, under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), they are obligated to ensure the accuracy and completeness of the information they report. Since XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX has not validated the debt, the credit bureau is continuing to report this account without confirming its validity, which is a violation of my rights under the FCRA. 

As a result of these actions, I am requesting that the CFPB investigate the failure of both XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and the credit reporting agency to comply with consumer protection laws, including the FDCPA and FCRA. I am seeking the following actions : Immediate removal of the invalid collection account from my credit report. 
A written explanation from XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX regarding their failure to validate the debt. 
A correction or update to my credit report to reflect the accurate information. 
I appreciate your prompt attention to this matter and look forward to your assistance in resolving these violations of my consumer rights. 

Thank you for your help.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
I recently conducted a review of my credit report and found several items that have caused me significant distress. These items appear to be unverifiable, inaccurate, and questionable. Your agency has failed to ensure the accuracy of the information as required under 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ) Accuracy of Reports. This statute mandates that consumer reporting agencies must follow reasonable procedures to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of the information they report.

Furthermore, under 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) Treatment of Inaccurate or Unverifiable Information, you are required to promptly delete or modify any information found to be inaccurate, incomplete, or unverifiable during a reinvestigation. If you are unable to provide me with verifiable proof of the accuracy of the disputed items within 15 days of your investigation, these accounts and the related information must be removed from my credit report.

Additionally, under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I do not recognize any of the alleged creditors or debt collectors. I have never entered into a valid contract with any of these entities, nor have I engaged in any transactions with them. As such, these accounts are fraudulent and and inaccurate information.

Moreover, under the Fair Credit Billing Act, my right to privacy has been violated, and this breach infringes upon my rights as outlined in The Privacy Act of 1974. Removing the inaccurate and fraudulent information from my credit report will help restore my privacy and prevent further violations.

Consumer complaint narrative:
# # Summary for CFPB and FCRA Complaint **Subject : ** Formal Complaint Regarding Credit Reporting and Debt Collection Violations **Address : ** XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Summary of Issues : This complaint highlights systemic violations by multiple creditors, furnishers, and credit reporting agencies ( CRAs ), resulting in severe inaccuracies and harm to my credit profile. The following issues are identified : -- - # # # **Violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) : ** 1. **Failure to Conduct Reasonable Investigation : ** - Section 1681s-2 ( b ) : Creditors and CRAs failed to conduct proper investigations after disputes were filed. 

2. **Inaccurate Information Reporting : ** - Section 1681e ( b ) : CRAs failed to ensure the accuracy of information reported, including : - Incorrect payment history. 
- Re-aging of delinquent accounts. 
- Misrepresentation of charge-offs as active accounts. 

3. **Improper Reinvestigation : ** - Section 1681i ( a ) : CRAs did not reinvestigate disputed items in good faith, leaving inaccuracies unresolved. 

4. **Incorrect Reporting Beyond Statutory Limits : ** - Section 1681c : Charge-offs and delinquency dates were improperly reported beyond the allowable statutory period. 

-- - # # # **Violations of the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ) : ** 1. **Failure to Provide Clear Disclosures : ** - Section 1026.17 : Credit terms, including payment schedules and fees, were not disclosed accurately.

2. **Misrepresentation of Finance Terms : ** - Section 1026.18 : Credit transactions were misrepresented as loans, misleading the borrower about the nature of the agreement. 

-- - # # # **Violations of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) : ** 1. **Unauthorized Communication : ** - Section 1692c : Debt collectors communicated without my consent or proper authorization. 

2. **False or Misleading Representations : ** - Sect

ion 1692e : - Misrepresentation of debt character, amount, and legal status.

- Threatening legal actions not intended to be taken or legally permissible. 
- Communicating false information to CRAs, including disputed accounts. 

3. **Use of Deceptive Forms : ** - Section 1692j : Debt collectors furnished deceptive forms to create the false belief that a third party was involved in debt collection. 

-- - # # # **Impact of Violations : ** 1. **Financial Harm : ** - Loss of creditworthiness, denial of credit opportunities, and increased borrowing costs. 

2. **Emotional Distress : ** - Harassment and stress caused by deceptive and inaccurate reporting. 

3. **Interstate Commerce Impact : ** - These violations disrupt fair credit reporting and debt collection practices, negatively affecting financial systems reliant on accurate data. 

-- - # # # **Requested Action : ** 1. **Immediate Investigation and Correction : ** - Ensure all inaccuracies are corrected on my credit report across all CRAs. 

2. **Accountability for Violators : ** - Impose statutory penalties and sanctions against entities responsible for these violations.

3. **Compensation : ** - Request damages for financial harm and emotional distress under the FCRA , TILA, and FDCPA provisions.

4. **Regulatory Oversight : ** - Recommend increased oversight and auditing of the involved entities to prevent recurrence. 

**Attachments : ** Detailed exhibits and supporting documents have been provided for review.

-- - NOTICE : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Consumer Financial Protection Bureau XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX Re : Formal Complaint Against Credit Reporting Agencies and Debt Buyers for Misconduct , Inaccuracies, Unauthorized Inquiries, and Incorrect Personal Information on My Credit Report Agencies XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX EQUIFAX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX 
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Dear CFPB, I am filing this formal complaint regarding several violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) by credit reporting agencies and debt buyers. These violations include inaccurate reporting of charge-offs, unauthorized inquiries, incorrect personal information ADDRESS NAMES, and errors that continue to harm my credit profile. Despite my efforts to resolve these matters directly, the violations remain unaddressed. I seek your intervention to enforce the law and hold the responsible parties accountable. 
MY NAME XXXX : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  Re : Violations of Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) I recently got a copy of my consumer file and noticed that there was inaccurate information. According to the FCRA you must be reporting 100 % correct information at all times and that is not what my credit file reflects at this time. You have 30 days to remove the personal information listed in this letter. I am also requesting you to provide me with the furnisher of this information or where you got this information from. Please PERMANENTLY REMOVE the following. 
This letter serves as a demand for immediate corrective actions, including the removal of inaccurate information from my credit report and the imposition of appropriate fines and penalties for your non-compliance.the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S. Code 1681, and the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), 15 U.S. Code 1692. I demand immediate corrective actions, including the removal of inaccurate information, imposition of fines, and enforcement of compliance with relevant laws You are referring to a portion of 15 U.S. Code 1681c ( a ), which outlines restrictions on the inclusion of certain types of information in consumer reports. Here 's a rewritten version of the relevant clause with clarity on what consumer reporting agencies can not include : Consumer reporting agencies are prohibited from including in a consumer report any adverse items of information ( other than records of convictions of crimes ) that are older than 7 years. This includes adverse financial data such as : Accounts sent to collections. 
Charged-off accounts. 
Any other negative financial information. 
However, records of convictions of crimes are an exception to this rule and may be reported beyond the 7-year limitation. 
This provision ensures that outdated and irrelevant negative information ( except criminal convictions ) does not unfairly impact a consumer 's creditworthiness or access to opportunities. 
INCORRECT ADDRESS XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX 15 U.S. Code 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) pertains to the responsibilities of entities that furnish information to consumer reporting agencies, ensuring accuracy in the information they provide. Here 's a clear summary : 15 U.S. Code 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) - Duty of Furnishers to Provide Accurate Information 1. Prohibition on Reporting Inaccurate Information : A furnisher ( such as a creditor or lender ) can not knowingly furnish information to a consumer reporting agency if : The information is inaccurate. 
The furnisher has reason to believe the information is inaccurate. 
2. Obligation to Update and Correct Information : If the furnisher discovers that previously provided information is inaccurate or incomplete, they must : Promptly correct or update the information.

Notify all consumer reporting agencies to which the inaccurate information was furnished. 
INCORRECT NAMES XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX This section ensures that entities providing data to credit bureaus uphold accuracy and transparency, reducing the risk of harm to consumers due to incorrect information on their credit reports. Would you like further details or help crafting a notice or dispute related to this? 
Under 15 U.S. Code 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( B ), it is explicitly prohibited for any person to furnish information to a consumer reporting agency if : The information relates to a transaction or experience ( e.g., payment history ) that the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe involves an illegal activity. 
This includes any dealings or transactions, such as reporting payment history or account activities, that are associated with unlawful conduct. Reporting such information is considered a violation of federal law and undermines the integrity of consumer reporting. 
Let me know if you need help drafting this into a formal letter or document! 
Under 15 U.S. Code 1681b ( f ), the illegal reporting of inquiries refers to the prohibition of accessing or furnishing consumer reports for impermissible purposes. Here 's how this applies : Illegal Reporting of Inquiries : A consumer reporting agency or any person shall not obtain or use a consumer report unless : 1. The report is requested for a permissible purpose as outlined in 15 U.S. Code 1681b ( a ) ( e.g., credit applications, employment, insurance underwriting ). 
2. The requester has a legitimate business need for the information, authorized by the consumer or required by law. 
If an inquiry appears on a consumer 's credit report without a valid permissible purpose or the consumer 's authorization, this constitutes illegal reporting of inquiries. Such unauthorized inquiries can harm a consumer 's credit score or appear as misuse of their personal information. 

Would you like help drafting a dispute letter to address unauthorized inquiries or further explanation of permissible purposes?

Consumer complaint narrative:
They have contacted me on from XX/XX/scrub>XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  numerous of times and I've requested a 1099c due to it stating charged off/written off. They keep stating that it is not in collection every time I request it. I am writing to formally dispute the reporting of canceled debt related to my account with your institution. I believe that this matter has not been handled in compliance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically under 15 U.S.C. 1681 ( e ) ( B ), which requires the maintenance of accurate and complete information in consumer reports.

It has come to my attention that [ describe the issue, e.g., a canceled debt has been reported inaccurately or without the issuance of a Form 1099-C as required by the IRS ] . To resolve this matter, I request that you provide the following : A copy of Form 1099-C related to the alleged canceled debt, in compliance with IRS requirements . 
Documentation verifying the accuracy of the reporting of this debt, including the date of cancellation, amount, and applicable details. 
Immediate correction or removal of inaccurate information from my credit file, if applicable.

Under 15 U.S.C. 1681 ( e ) ( B ), you are obligated to ensure that all information you report is accurate and up to date. Failure to do so may result in further action to protect my rights under federal law. 

I request a written response to this dispute within 30 days, as provided by the FCRA. If this issue is not resolved to my satisfaction, I may pursue additional remedies, including filing a complaint with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) or seeking legal advice. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I look forward to your timely response.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  Consumer Financial Protection Bureau Federal Trade Commission XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Subject : Formal Complaint Regarding Conflicting Credit Reports Issued by Equifax Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau and Federal Trade Commission, I am filing this complaint regarding conflicting and inaccurate credit reports issued by Equifax Information Services LLC. I have obtained two different credit reports from Equifax, and they show inconsistent and misleading information for the same account, violating the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ).

Summary of the Issue : Account in Question : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Discrepancy in Reports : One Equifax report lists the account as " Collection/Charge-Off. '' Another Equifax report lists the account as " Paid, '' but still includes the " charge-off '' notation, which is inaccurate given the settled nature of the account.

These discrepancies create confusion and fail to meet the FCRA 's requirement for credit reporting agencies to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of the information they report ( 15 USC 1681e ( b ) ).

Legal Concerns : 1. Violation of FCRA Accuracy Requirements : Equifaxs issuance of two reports with contradictory information fails to ensure accuracy and causes harm to my creditworthiness.

2. Failure to Investigate and Correct Disputes : Equifax has not corrected these errors despite my attempts to dispute the inaccuracies, violating 15 USC 1681i ( a ), which requires reinvestigation and resolution within 30 days. This account has been reporting inaccuracies for over 3 years.

Impact of the Errors : The conflicting reports and false remarks damage my credit profile and hinder my ability to secure financial opportunities. This is a clear violation of my consumer rights under federal law.

Requested Actions : I am formally requesting the removal of the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX account from my credit report due to these violations of the FCRA. The failure to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of the information reported and the issuance of contradictory reports constitute grounds for deletion.

Additionally, I respectfully request the following : 1. An investigation into Equifaxs reporting practices and their failure to address these inaccuracies.

2. Immediate action to ensure all incorrect, unverifiable, or inconsistent information on my credit report is corrected or removed.

3. Confirmation of the removal of the disputed account from my credit report in writing.

Supporting Documentation : I have enclosed the following documents for your review : 1. Copies of two different Equifax credit reports showing conflicting information.

2. settlement letter from XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX verifying the resolution of the account.

I look forward to your acknowledgment of this complaint and an update on any actions taken. If additional information or documentation is required, I am happy to provide it. You may contact me at this email XXXX. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter and for taking steps to protect consumers from these unfair credit reporting practices.

Sincerely, CFPB, FTC THIS ACCOUNT HAS REPORTED LIKE THIS FOR OVER 3 YEARS

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative: I am writing to dispute the accuracy of certain information contained in my credit report as provided by your agency. This letter serves as my tenth formal dispute under the provisions of the fair credit reporting act ( 15 U.S.C. & 1681 ). I believe these inaccuracies may be linked to the Equifax data breach, which compromised my personal information. I have enclosed copies of ( supporting documents such as a statement, A FTC report, and verification of my identity that substantiate my claim. Please investigate this matter thoroughly. Correct the disputed information, and provide me with a revised copy of my credit report. Under the FCRA, you are required to investigate my dispute within XXXX  days or receipt of this letter, Notify the furnisher of the disputed information promptly and provided me with the results of your investigation and corrected credit report if changes are made. If the investigation does not resolve my dispute, I request that you include a statement of my dispute in my credit file and in future reports provided to others. Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
I recently reviewed my credit report and discovered numerous inaccuracies and questionable entries that require immediate attention. These include : Late Payments on Accounts : Several accounts, including those with XXXX, XXXX XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX, are inaccurately reporting late payments. These errors violate 15 U.S. Code 1666, which addresses billing errors. The reporting inaccurately reflects my payment history, and these accounts should be updated to " paid as agreed/never late. '' Unverified Debts : Multiple entries from companies such as XXXX, XXXX, and others are listed without proper validation of the debts. Under 15 U.S. Code 1692g, I have the right to request verification of these debts. To date, I have not received the required documentation, such as the original signed agreements or proof of the creditor-debt collector relationship. If validation can not be provided, these debts must be removed from my report per legal standards. 

Unauthorized Hard Inquiries : My report contains unauthorized hard inquiries from entities like XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, and others. These inquiries were made without my explicit consent, violating 15 U.S. Code 1681n ( a ), which establishes civil liability for willful noncompliance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). These inquiries negatively impact my credit score and must be deleted. 

In summary, my credit report contains numerous violations of the FCRA and related laws, including inaccurate reporting, failure to validate debts, and unauthorized inquiries. These errors are damaging and must be corrected immediately to comply with federal law.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
I recently conducted a review of my credit report and found several items that have caused me significant distress. These items appear to be unverifiable, inaccurate, and questionable. Your agency has failed to ensure the accuracy of the information as required under 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ) Accuracy of Reports. This statute mandates that consumer reporting agencies must follow reasonable procedures to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of the information they report.

Furthermore, under 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) Treatment of Inaccurate or Unverifiable Information, you are required to promptly delete or modify any information found to be inaccurate, incomplete, or unverifiable during a reinvestigation. If you are unable to provide me with verifiable proof of the accuracy of the disputed items within 15 days of your investigation, these accounts and the related information must be removed from my credit report.

Additionally, under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I do not recognize any of the alleged creditors or debt collectors. I have never entered into a valid contract with any of these entities, nor have I engaged in any transactions with them. As such, these accounts are fraudulent and and inaccurate information.

Moreover, under the Fair Credit Billing Act, my right to privacy has been violated, and this breach infringes upon my rights as outlined in The Privacy Act of 1974. Removing the inaccurate and fraudulent information from my credit report will help restore my privacy and prevent further violations.

Product: Checking or savings account
Consumer complaint narrative:
Summary of Issue : I have been a customer of KeyBank for three to four years. Five months ago, I deposited a check for the amount of {$4000.00} that was mistakenly identified by KeyBank as a third-party check due to an incomplete name. After depositing the check, KeyBank closed my account and has not released the funds. 

I have complied with all of KeyBank 's requests, including providing a notarized letter from the payee. KeyBank assured me the funds would be released after submission of the documents, but they have failed to do so. 

KeyBank 's Actions : KeyBank claimed they sent hold harmless and restitution forms to XXXX XXXX XXXX, the issuers bank. However, XXXX XXXX XXXX  has informed the issuer that they never received these forms or any communication from KeyBank regarding this matter. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX  also notified the issuer that the only way to receive the funds back would be by claiming fraud, which is not true. This is an unreasonable and unfair requirement, as it is not a case of fraud. 
The issuer, together with their bank, tried to contact KeyBank multiple times, but no one answered the phone. I even offered to arrange a call between all parties to verify that this is not fraud, but KeyBank did not accept or respond to my offer. 
KeyBank has repeatedly told me a different excuse each time I have called. They have claimed that the funds were sent, only to be contradicted in subsequent calls when I was told that the funds were not sent. I was also told that I should request the issuer to check with their bank to see if they received the forms, but XXXX XXXX XXXX  confirmed that they never received them. 
Additionally, I was told to have the issuer check with their bank to see if they received the funds, but again, XXXX XXXX XXXX reported that no such funds were sent. 
I have made multiple phone calls, visited the branch, and followed all instructions given by KeyBank, but I am still no closer to resolving this issue.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Name : XXXX XXXX Address : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX, FL XXXX Phone : XXXX Email : XXXX Date : XX/XX/year> Subject : Complaint Against Equifax for Failing to Fix Credit Report Despite Providing Identity Verification Complaint Summary : I am filing this complaint against Equifax for its failure to correct inaccuracies on my credit report, even after requesting and receiving documentation to verify my identity. Equifax has required me to provide proof of my identity and correct address because the information they have does not match, yet they continue to fail in resolving the fraudulent accounts on my credit report.

Details of the Complaint : 1. Equifaxs Failure to Act : Equifax has sent me requests to verify my identity and address, claiming the information they have does not match. 
I provided my government-issued ID passport and my XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX proof of address, yet Equifax has made no effort to fix my credit report by removing the fraudulent accounts. 
2. Fraudulent Accounts from Data Breach : The Equifax data breach exposed my sensitive personal information, resulting in several fraudulent accounts being opened in my name, including : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX Account ending in XXXX ) 3. Violation of Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) : Under the FCRA, Equifax is obligated to ensure the accuracy of credit reports and to promptly address disputes. 
Their requirement to verify my identity while failing to act on the fraudulent accounts I have reported is unacceptable and a failure to comply with the law. 

Impact on Me : Equifaxs mishandling of my case has caused significant emotional distress and financial harm. The fraudulent accounts remain on my credit report, damaging my credit score and preventing me from accessing credit or other financial opportunities. 

Desired Resolution : I request the CFPB to ensure that Equifax takes the following actions : 1. Remove Fraudulent Accounts : Immediately investigate and remove all fraudulent accounts, including XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX from my credit report. 
2. Provide a Corrected Credit Report : Issue me a corrected credit report that reflects the removal of these fraudulent accounts.

3. Acknowledge Verified Information : Accept and use the government-issued ID and XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX statement I have provided to update their records, preventing further delays. 
4. Confirm Compliance in Writing : Provide written confirmation that my identity has been verified, the fraudulent accounts have been removed, and my credit report has been corrected.

5. Prevent Further Excuses : Ensure Equifax stops delaying the resolution of disputes by requiring repetitive identity verification without taking appropriate action to fix credit reports. 

Supporting Documents : I am prepared to provide the following : Copy of my government-issued ID ( e.g., drivers license or passport ) XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX statement as proof of address FTC Identity Theft Report IC3 Complaint Report Conclusion : Equifaxs repeated delays and excuses in resolving my credit report disputes are unacceptable and have caused undue hardship. I trust the CFPB will ensure that Equifax fulfills its legal obligations under the FCRA and resolves this matter without further delay. 

Please contact me at XXXX or XXXX if additional information is required. 

Thank you for your assistance. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, VA XXXX XX/XX/2024 Consumer Financial Protection Bureau Federal Trade Commission Consumer Response Center XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Subject : Formal Complaint Regarding Conflicting Credit Reports Issued by Equifax Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau and Federal Trade Commission, I am filing this complaint regarding conflicting and inaccurate credit reports issued by Equifax Information Services LLC. I have obtained two different credit reports from Equifax, and they show inconsistent and misleading information for the same account, violating the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ).

Summary of the Issue : Account in Question : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Discrepancy in Reports : One Equifax report lists the account as " Collection/Charge-Off. '' Another Equifax report lists the account as " Paid, '' but still includes the " charge-off '' notation, which is inaccurate given the settled nature of the account.

These discrepancies create confusion and fail to meet the FCRA 's requirement for credit reporting agencies to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of the information they report ( 15 USC 1681e ( b ) ).

Legal Concerns : 1. Violation of FCRA Accuracy Requirements : Equifaxs issuance of two reports with contradictory information fails to ensure accuracy and causes harm to my creditworthiness.

2. Failure to Investigate and Correct Disputes : Equifax has not corrected these errors despite my attempts to dispute the inaccuracies, violating 15 USC 1681i ( a ), which requires reinvestigation and resolution within 30 days. This account has been reporting inaccuracies for over 3 years.

Impact of the Errors : The conflicting reports and false remarks damage my credit profile and hinder my ability to secure financial opportunities. This is a clear violation of my consumer rights under federal law.

Requested Actions : I am formally requesting the removal of the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX account from my credit report due to these violations of the FCRA. The failure to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of the information reported and the issuance of contradictory reports constitute grounds for deletion.

Additionally, I respectfully request the following : 1. An
investigation into Equifaxs reporting practices and their failure to address these inaccuracies.

2. Immediate action to ensure all incorrect, unverifiable, or inconsistent information on my credit report is corrected or removed.

3. Confirmation of the removal of the disputed account from my credit report in writing.

Supporting Documentation : I have enclosed the following documents for your review : 1. Copies of two different Equifax credit reports showing conflicting information.

2. settlement letter from XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX verifying the resolution of the account.

I look forward to your acknowledgment of this complaint and an update on any actions taken. If additional information or documentation is required, I am happy to provide it. You may contact me at this email XXXX. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter and for taking steps to protect consumers from these unfair credit reporting practices.

Sincerely, CFPB, FTC THIS ACCOUNT HAS REPORTED LIKE THIS FOR OVER 3 YEARS

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/year> Consumer Financial Protection Bureau XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Federal Trade Commission XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  : Formal Complaint Against Equifax for Violations of FCRA and FDCPA Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing to formally file a complaint against Equifax regarding their unlawful practices concerning my personal financial information. I believe that Equifax has engaged in activities that violate the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), and the Graham-Leach-Bliley Act. 

I have sent Equifax a notice requesting that they stop making reports on my personal finances. Despite this notice, they have failed to comply. The FCRA and the Graham-Leach-Bliley Act clearly state that consumers have the right to privacy, and I feel that my rights and liberties have been infringed upon by Equifaxs actions. My personal life and financial information should not be used for profit by a non-government agency, especially when I receive no benefit from such practices. 

I am particularly concerned about the following issues : 1. **Aggravated Identity Theft** : Equifax has purchased my private information from other corporations and subsequently sold this nonpublic information to other entities without my consent. I was not given any opportunity or notice to opt out of credit reporting, which constitutes a violation of my privacy rights. 

2. **Extortion and Coercion** : Equifax appears to be actively engaged in coercive practices by advertising nonpayment of debt as a means to influence payment. They have also made reports that are designed to disgrace and embarrass me as a consumer, which is a clear violation of the FDCPA and FCRA.

3. **False Reporting** : The reporting of false and inaccurate nonpublic information by Equifax has caused me severe distress, injuries, and damages. This practice seems to be a means for them to profit from the misuse of my stolen identifying information. 

I urge your offices to investigate Equifax for these violations and take appropriate action to protect consumers like myself from such unethical and unlawful practices. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt response. 

Sincerely THE IS NO DEBT OWED ON THIS ACCOUNT THIS ACCOUNT SHOULD STILL REPORT AS A COLLECTION OR CHARGE OFF.

Consumer complaint narrative:
This letter serves as a follow-up to prior communications regarding the XXXX XXXX XXXX account that XXXX  has inaccurately reported as accurate. Despite this assertion, the company furnishing the information has failed to provide proper certification of the alleged debt. Additionally, they have responded to the CFPB complaint but failed to certify that they possess or can produce the original document obligating me to pay, either for my review or for review by a judge in court upon request. 
As your legal team can confirm, under the rules of evidence, the company must produce the original document to establish standing in any claim. Furthermore, they have failed to return the debt collector certification, further discrediting their claim. By failing to produce such documentation, they have effectively conceded that they do not have a valid claim. 
Please be advised that XXXX is engaging in fraudulent reporting, in violation of Title 15, Section 1611 of the U.S. Code. By continuing to report inaccurate, incomplete, and unverifiable information after being notified, XXXX assumes liability for these actions. Liability for this debt has not been lawfully established. 
Please be advised that XXXX is engaging in fraudulent reporting, in violation of Title 15, section 1692 ( e ) of the U.S. Code A debt collector may not use any false, deceptive, or misleading representation or means in connection with the collection of any debt. Liability for this debt has not been lawfully established. 
PLEASE SEE ATTACHED.
