Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
My name is XXXX. I got my credit report on a website and was able to see that my information is being reported by companies like XXXX, Equifax, XXXX and with many inaccuracies that I never consented to or have reported that info myself nor did they ever contact me to ask for my consent, whether it be the personal information ( MY NAME ) that is incorrect on my Equifax report : MY CORRECT NAME : XXXX XXXX THE INCORRECT NAMES INCLUDED IN EQUIFAX REPORT, ( included along with the attachments provided ) : XXXX OR XXXX XXXX My consent was not asked for by these companies when it comes to all inquiries that are listed on my XXXX XXXX credit report, the inquiries are all Unauthorized, I need these removed immediately. 

Lastly, my consent was not asked for by XXXX for the account listed as negative Therefore, this is an Unauthorized by me, XXXX XXXX. ( company of account : XXXX XXXX account number : XXXX ) Under 15 USC 1666B , this is a billing error, always paid as agreed on time this is an error, this account is in violation.

Not only does Experians actions presently affect how lenders view my ability to borrow but it is completely violating me, my rights and the LAWS/ACTS/CODES that stand to protect me, because these companies have FALSE information they are using in my name I never consented for them to report nor was I, XXXX XXXX, asked XXXX XXXX. 

Misleading false reporting, negligently and inaccurately reporting failing to comply to 15 USC 1692 ( g ) Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically 15 USC 1681, section 602a, it is stated that consumer reporting agencies must handle their responsibilities with fairness, impartiality, and respect for consumer privacy. Equifax and XXXX are consumer reporting agencies, and as a consumer, I have the right to ensure that my private information is not disclosed. This right is supported by 15 USC 6801, which requires financial institutions to protect the privacy and confidentiality of their customers ' nonpublic personal information. Since these agencies are considered " furnishers of information '' under this law, they are obligated to follow these privacy standards.

Furthermore, according to 15 USC 1681, section 604a ( 2 ), a consumer reporting agency can only share a consumer report under specific circumstances, and one of those conditions is with the written consent of the consumer. Equifax, XXXX, and any financial institutions providing information to them do not have my permission, either written or verbal, to share my information. Any consent, whether implied or expressed, is hereby revoked. 
Additionally, 15 USC 6802 ( b ) ( c ) mandates that a financial institution can not disclose nonpublic personal information to a third party without informing the consumer about their right to opt out. Neither Equifax nor XXXX has provided me with this necessary information. According to 15 USC 1681c ( a ) ( 5 ), consumer reporting agencies are prohibited from including certain adverse information that is older than seven years, including any account or item that would negatively affect my credit, unless specifically authorized by law.

Moreover, 15 U.S. Code 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) stipulates that no one should report inaccurate information to consumer reporting agencies, and Equifax and XXXX must ensure they follow reasonable procedures to prevent such violations. Lastly, 12 CFR 1016.7 grants consumers the right to opt out of reporting services at any time, and I am formally exercising that right.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Consumer Financial Protection Bureau XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Federal Trade Commission XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  Subject : Formal Complaint Against Equifax for Violations of FCRA and FDCPA Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing to formally file a complaint against Equifax regarding their unlawful practices concerning my personal financial information. I believe that Equifax has engaged in activities that violate the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), and the Graham-Leach-Bliley Act.

I have sent Equifax a notice requesting that they stop making reports on my personal finances. Despite this notice, they have failed to comply. The FCRA and the Graham-Leach-Bliley Act clearly state that consumers have the right to privacy, and I feel that my rights and liberties have been infringed upon by Equifaxs actions. My personal life and financial information should not be used for profit by a non-government agency, especially when I receive no benefit from such practices. 

I am particularly concerned about the following issues : 1. **Aggravated Identity Theft** : Equifax has purchased my private information from other corporations and subsequently sold this nonpublic information to other entities without my consent. I was not given any opportunity or notice to opt out of credit reporting, which constitutes a violation of my privacy rights. 

2. **Extortion and Coercion** : Equifax appears to be actively engaged in coercive practices by advertising nonpayment of debt as a means to influence payment. They have also made reports that are designed to disgrace and embarrass me as a consumer, which is a clear violation of the FDCPA and FCRA.

3. **False Reporting** : The reporting of false and inaccurate nonpublic information by Equifax has caused me severe distress, injuries, and damages. This practice seems to be a means for them to profit from the misuse of my stolen identifying information. 

I urge your offices to investigate Equifax for these violations and take appropriate action to protect consumers like myself from such unethical and unlawful practices. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt response. 

Sincerely THE IS NO DEBT OWED ON THIS ACCOUNT THIS ACCOUNT SHOULD STILL REPORT AS A COLLECTION OR CHARGE OFF.

Consumer complaint narrative:
To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to inform you that your recent actions concerning the collection of an alleged debt are in direct violation of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) and applicable state laws. I have thoroughly documented the following For example, repeated calls to my place of employment despite being informed that such calls are not permitted. 

For instance, failure to provide the legally required validation notice within XXXX days of your initial communication with me. 

These actions are not only unlawful but also constitute harassment. The FDCPA ( 15 U.S.C. 1692 ) strictly prohibits debt collectors from engaging in abusive, deceptive, and unfair practices. By violating these regulations, you are liable for damages, including statutory damages of up to {$1000.00} per violation, actual damages, and attorney fees. 

Given the repeated and willful nature of these violations, I am hereby notifying you that I am escalating this matter to the office of the Attorney General of XXXX XXXX and XXXX. I am also considering additional legal actions against your agency to seek full redress for the harm caused by your actions. 

Effective immediately, I demand that you cease all forms of communication with me and any third parties in connection with this alleged debt. This is a formal cease and desist notice under the FDCPA. Any further communication from your agency, except to confirm receipt of this letter or to provide proof of debt validation as mandated by law, will be considered a further violation and will be documented as such. 

Please be aware that I am fully prepared to take legal action if these violations continue. This letter serves as evidence that I have provided your agency with notice of your violations and of my intent to pursue legal remedies. 

I expect a response in writing within XXXX  days of receipt of this letter, confirming your compliance with my requests. Failure to respond adequately will result in additional legal action, and a copy of this letter will be forwarded to the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) as well. Remove these fraudelent tradelines off of my credit report as I have attahced XXXX identity theft reports below.

I was listed in several major data breaches, compromising my personal information and making it susceptible to misuse. These breaches have resulted in the inclusion of numerous incorrect and unverified items on my credit reports, which vary inconsistently across the three major credit bureausEquifax, XXXX XXXX XXXX After obtaining my free credit reports, I discovered these discrepancies and initiated disputes with the companies reporting the negative items and the credit bureaus directly. 

Despite my efforts, the inaccuracies persist, causing significant harm to my credit standing and personal reputation.Despite my repeated efforts to correct multiple inaccuracies on my credit reports with all three credit bureaus, these errors remain unresolved. These inaccuracies negatively affect my creditworthiness and violate my rights under the FCRA.

These breaches make any electronic records suspect, as digital signatures and documents could have been compromised or fraudulently created.

Under 15 U.S.C. 1692g ( Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ), failure to provide this information invalidates the debt. Moreover, the inclusion of such unverifiable items on my credit reports violates the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681, which mandates that credit reports be accurate and complete.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally request your assistance in resolving a critical issue regarding inaccuracies on my credit report, which have severely impacted my ability to purchase a home. I discovered that my student loan accounts are being reported with a " collection '' or " charged off '' status, despite my consistent good standing and compliance with all repayment obligations. This erroneous reporting violates the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically 15 U.S.C. 1681g, as it fails to ensure the accuracy and integrity of the information being reported. 

The emotional distress caused by this situation is profound, as the inaccurate reporting has obstructed my ability to achieve homeownership, a significant milestone in my life. I respectfully request that the CFPB investigate this matter promptly and work with the relevant credit reporting agencies and loan servicers to correct these inaccuracies and remove the erroneous information from my credit report. 

Thank you for your time and attention to this matter.

On XX/XX/year>, I applied to an online credit card offer and was immediately approved to the given specified terms and conditions. This was mentioned in a dispute letter sent to the American Express authority and is being unrecognized. The lack of American Express transparency does not provide information on past or current accounts ( unknowingly what account are active or closed ). 

The presentation of billing statements are inaccurate. On XX/XX/year>, I received my initial billing statement with a balance of XXXX it was in participation to the new approved offer, there was no interest amount applied. This compelled me to utilizing the 0 % spending terms. 

On XX/XX/scrub>XXXX XXXX XXXX the second billing statement arrived with a balance of xxxxx this time there was a decision to apply a XXXX XXXX  interest rate. 

In summary, American Express has mention they have complete control setting all credit card terms and condition at any time. American Express ethical standards could have avoided this harassment by denying my credit card application and in the content of business manners could have disclosed a reason not to honor my request and not immediately approve the welcoming offer. 

Is there any enactment to abolish this type of behavior? 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
This is a result of identity theft, Equifax Data Breach and my non public personal information was compromised and exposed. As referenced in the Equifax Data Breach Settlement, reference number XXXX. These inaccuracies are having a direct and negative impact on my credit worthiness and I demand immediate action to rectify this matter. 


XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Equifax Consumer Services Center XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Subject : Immediate Removal of Derogatory Trade Lines and Inquiries Resulting from Data Breach Dear Equifax, I am writing regarding the grave violation of my privacy and consumer rights resulting from the Equifax Data Breach, which exposed my personal information to unauthorized parties. As a result of this breach, I have identified derogatory trade lines and unauthorized inquiries on my credit report that are both inaccurate and detrimental to my financial well-being.

These inaccuracies have a significant and unlawful impact on my credit report and have occurred through no fault of my own. Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and relevant consumer protection laws, Equifax is responsible for ensuring the accuracy of my credit information and is obligated to promptly correct any inaccuracies caused by errors or unauthorized activity.

To rectify this matter, I demand the following actions be taken within five ( 5 ) days of receipt of this letter : Remove all unauthorized and unknown trade lines immediately.

Remove all unauthorized inquiries made on my credit file.

Provide a full investigation report detailing the steps Equifax will take to ensure my personal information is secure moving forward.

The information on my credit file is irrefutably compromised due to Equifax 's negligence. I have documentation confirming that my personal information was compromised as a direct result of the breach. This negligence entitles me to relief under the FCRA and potentially other federal and state laws protecting consumers against such abuses.

Failure to resolve this matter within the given timeframe will compel me to escalate this issue further, including pursuing legal remedies and filing complaints with the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) and the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ).

I am also submitting this letter to the CFPB and request their intervention to ensure Equifax complies with consumer protection laws and eliminates the inaccurate derogatory accounts resulting from the data breach. My expectation is that Equifax, with the assistance of the CFPB, will act promptly to restore my credit profile to its accurate and fair state.

Please confirm receipt of this letter and inform me once all actions have been completed. I can be reached XXXX XXXX for any additional information you may require.

Sincerely, XXXX - XXXX XXXX Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Subject : Assistance Required to Rectify Credit File Inaccuracies Following Equifax Data Breach Dear CFPB, I am reaching out for your assistance as my rights as a consumer have been violated as a result of the Equifax Data Breach. My personal information was compromised during the breach, resulting in the appearance of derogatory trade lines and unauthorized inquiries on my Equifax credit report.

Equifax has failed to correct the inaccuracies promptly despite their obligation under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). I am requesting that the CFPB intervenes to ensure these violations are addressed and that my credit file is corrected within five ( 5 ) days.

I am attaching relevant documentation, including proof of compromised personal information, and I urge your agency to hold Equifax accountable to consumer laws to protect me and others similarly affected.

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your swift response.

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative: I am writing to dispute the accuracy of certain information contained in my credit report as provided by your agency. This letter serves as my tenth formal dispute under the provisions of the fair credit reporting act ( 15 U.S.C. & 1681 ). I believe these inaccuracies may be linked to the Equifax data breach, which compromised my personal information. I have enclosed copies of ( supporting documents such as a statement, A FTC report, and verification of my identity that substantiate my claim. Please investigate this matter thoroughly. Correct the disputed information, and provided me with a revised copy of my credit report. Under the FCRA, you are required to investigate my dispute within 30 days or receipt of this letter, Notify the furnisher of the disputed information promptly and provided me with the results of your investigation and corrected credit report if changes are made. If the investigation does not resolve my dispute, I request that you include a statement of my dispute in my credit file and in future reports provided to others. Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX TX XXXX XXXX Re : Account Number XXXX XXXX XXXX OFFICE OF THE ATTY XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Response to an insufficient validation you sent to me. This collection is not accurate or can be validated. Under the FAIR DEBT COLLECTION PRACTICES ACT, I have the right to request and receive validation of the alleged debt. I already asked that you provide me with a copy of all the following : 1 ) An explanation of what this alleged account balance is for.

2 ) A complete Audit Trail calculation of this balance, including the complete payment history on this account 3 ) Documentation that shows I agreed to pay this debt with my signature and documentation shows I gave you permission to have my information and paperwork showing I gave you authorization to report this to my credit report. No consent to you having my information and unauthorized use of my social security number is identity theft and you will be reported for such.

4 ) The Agreement that grants you authority to collect on this alleged debt.

5 ) A copy of your state license, including license number that give you rights to collect in my state.

6. ( The purchase agreement showing where you purchased my personal information without my consent which is fraud because you are unknown to me I never did business with you ) 7. ( Senior Executive from your office to Swear under penalty of perjury this corporation were present during the alleged debt you nor I can validate this because we wasnt present ) 8. ( The Original Promissory Note on this Alleged Debt ) 9.. ( Demand You provide Chain of Custody for account to ensure the financing and hand to hand transfers is correct ) 10.. ( Master Bill Of Sale ) ****** Reporting information that you know to be inaccurate or failing to report information correctly violates the Fair Credit Reporting Act and FDCPA.

Also you have committed the following FDCPA Violations you are sending deceptive forms making false belief that I owe you.

15 U.S. Code 1692j - Furnishing certain deceptive forms ( a ) It is unlawful to design, compile, and furnish any form knowing that such form would be used to create the false belief in a consumer that a person other than the creditor of such consumer is participating in the collection of or in an attempt to collect a debt such consumer allegedly owes such creditor, when in fact such person is not so participating. I am not participating in the collection of this alleged debt.

Stop contacting me about this or any other matter you have. cease and desist ASAP and delete this account from my credit reports, except to provide me with accurate validation of this debt by U.S. mail only not the same insufficient docs you already sent.

I also submitted this letter to the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), My State Attorney General Office and The Better Business Bureau to have confirmation of proof. 

You have 15 days from the date of this letter to respond with all items requested and I demand this item be removed immediately from all credit reporting agencies and 3rd parties or I will seek l Monetary compensation damages for the violations you already committed. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

I am requesting a thorough investigation of these discrepancies with documented written evidence to prove these late payment accusations that legally support these consumer reporting agencies inaccurate claims. 

Please provide my original creditors financial statements with payment history logs of my accounts showing these late payments with the exact dates, and dollar amounts of the actual missed payments and when these late payments were actually received, as well as provide me with a written transcript of the recorded phone call conversations with the time, date and staff persons names of when these late payment discrepancies were reported to these consumer reporting agencies from the original creditors.

I have consistently upheld my payment obligations without delay. As I appreciate your prompt attention and action on this matter.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
I recently conducted a review of my credit report and found several items that have caused me significant distress. These items appear to be unverifiable, inaccurate, and questionable. Your agency has failed to ensure the accuracy of the information as required under 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ) Accuracy of Reports. This statute mandates that consumer reporting agencies must follow reasonable procedures to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of the information they report.

Furthermore, under 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) Treatment of Inaccurate or Unverifiable Information, you are required to promptly delete or modify any information found to be inaccurate, incomplete, or unverifiable during a reinvestigation. If you are unable to provide me with verifiable proof of the accuracy of the disputed items within 15 days of your investigation, these accounts and the related information must be removed from my credit report.

Additionally, under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I do not recognize any of the alleged creditors or debt collectors. I have never entered into a valid contract with any of these entities, nor have I engaged in any transactions with them. As such, these accounts are fraudulent and and inaccurate information. 

Moreover, under the Fair Credit Billing Act, my right to privacy has been violated, and this breach infringes upon my rights as outlined in The Privacy Act of 1974. Removing the inaccurate and fraudulent information from my credit report will help restore my privacy and prevent further violations.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Name : XXXX XXXX Address : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX, FL XXXX Phone : XXXX Email : XXXX Date : XX/XX/2024 Subject : XXXX XXXX Equifax for Failing to Fix Credit Report Despite Providing Identity Verification Complaint Summary : I am filing this complaint against Equifax for its failure to correct inaccuracies on my credit report, even after requesting and receiving documentation to verify my identity. Equifax has required me to provide proof of my identity and correct address because the information they have does not match, yet they continue to fail in resolving the fraudulent accounts on my credit report. 

Details of the Complaint : 1. Equifaxs Failure to Act : Equifax has sent me requests to verify my identity and address, claiming the information they have does not match. 
I provided my government-issued ID passport and my XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX proof of address, yet Equifax has made no effort to fix my credit report by removing the fraudulent accounts.

2. Fraudulent Accounts from Data Breach : The Equifax data breach exposed my sensitive personal information, resulting in several fraudulent accounts being opened in my name, including XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( Account ending in XXXX ) 3. Violation of Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) : Under the FCRA, Equifax is obligated to ensure the accuracy of credit reports and to promptly address disputes. 
Their requirement to verify my identity while failing to act on the fraudulent accounts I have reported is unacceptable and a failure to comply with the law. 

Impact on Me : Equifaxs mishandling of my case has caused significant emotional distress and financial harm. The fraudulent accounts remain on my credit report, damaging my credit score and preventing me from accessing credit or other financial opportunities. 

Desired Resolution : I request the CFPB to ensure that Equifax takes the following actions : XXXX. Remove Fraudulent Accounts : Immediately investigate and remove all fraudulent accounts, including XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, and XXXX XXXXXXXX, from my credit report. 
2. Provide a Corrected Credit Report : Issue me a corrected credit report that reflects the removal of these fraudulent accounts. 
XXXX. Acknowledge Verified Information : Accept and use the government-issued ID and XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX statement I have provided to update their records, preventing further delays. 
4. Confirm Compliance in Writing : Provide written confirmation that my identity has been verified, the fraudulent accounts have been removed, and my credit report has been corrected.

5. Prevent Further Excuses : Ensure Equifax stops delaying the resolution of disputes by requiring repetitive identity verification without taking appropriate action to fix credit reports. 

Supporting Documents : I am prepared to provide the following : Copy of my government-issued ID ( e.g., drivers license or passport ) XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX statement as proof of address FTC Identity Theft Report IC3 Complaint Report Conclusion : Equifaxs repeated delays and excuses in resolving my credit report disputes are unacceptable and have caused undue hardship. I trust the CFPB will ensure that Equifax fulfills its legal obligations under the FCRA and resolves this matter without further delay. 

Please contact me at XXXX or XXXX if additional information is required. 

Thank you for your assistance. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
This letter is a formal complaint to Equifax, stating that inaccurate negative information, specifically late payments that were not actually late, was reported on the credit report without proper verification or consent, significantly impacting the credit score and causing credit denial due to the inaccurate data. The consumer is citing various sections of the U.S. Code related to consumer protection and credit reporting, emphasizing that they were not given the opportunity to opt out of sharing their information and that Equifax failed to adequately verify the information reported by third-party companies before impacting their credit score. 
Key points of the complaint : Incorrect information : The consumer claims all payments were made on time, yet their credit report shows late payments, which is considered inaccurate and misleading. 
Lack of verification : Equifax did not properly verify the information with the consumer before reporting negative information from third-party companies, violating consumer protection laws.

No consent : The consumer did not provide consent for their information to be shared with third parties and negatively impact their credit score without proper verification.

Legal references : The letter cites specific sections of the U.S. Code including 15 U.S. Code 6802, 6803, and 1692c, highlighting the legal right to accurate credit reporting and the requirement for consumer consent.

Impact on credit score : The inaccurate information has resulted in credit denial, causing significant financial harm to the consumer.

What the consumer is demanding : Immediate correction : Equifax should remove all inaccurate late payment information from the credit report.

Explanation of verification process : A detailed explanation of how the disputed information was verified and why the consumer was not notified about potential issues with their credit report.

Communication with third-party companies : Equifax should contact the third-party companies that provided the inaccurate information and ensure the correction is reflected across all credit reports.

Full copy of investigation : A complete copy of the investigation regarding the disputed information should be provided to the consumer via certified mail.

Next steps : Follow up : If Equifax does not address the concerns within a reasonable time frame, the consumer should consider contacting the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) to file a formal complaint. 

It has come to my attention that XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  has my information from ( CFPB ) my consumer report that is allowing my information to be used against my will and or knowledge. According to 15 U.S. Code 6802 - Obligations with respect to disclosures of personal information, I was never giving the opportunity to opt out of my information being viewed publicly and or against my Consent. 15 U.S. Code 1692c - Communication in connection with debt collection. 15 U.S. Code 6802 - Obligations with respect to disclosures of personal information. ( B ) the consumer is given the opportunity, before the time that such information is initially disclosed, to direct that such information not be disclosed to such third party ; and 15 U.S. Code 1681i - Procedure in case of disputed accuracy. 15 U.S. Code 1692c - ( a ), ( b ), ( c ), Ownership : I have no knowledge of this account. Additional comments : This account was open without my consent and or knowledge and needs to be DELETED/REMOVED PERMANENTLY in accordance to 15 U.S. Code 6802, 15 U.S. Code 6803 ( a ) Disclosure required, 15 U.S. Code 6803 ( c ).

To Equifax, I am requesting an immediate update to my credit report to reflect all previously listed " late payments '' as " current/up-to-date '' or " paid as agreed and always on time, '' as this inaccurate information has significantly impacted my ability to secure credit, including mortgages, auto loans, personal loans, and credit cards, due to the NEGATIVELY reporting on my credit history. I believe Equifax has played a major role in denying me credit opportunities by maintaining these inaccurate late payment listings, and I urge you to correct this issue promptly to accurately represent my current positive credit standing.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative: This complaint is related to a {$30000.00} wire transfer from Citibank to XXXX XXXX  in XXXX, FL on XX/XX/year>. The wire receipt indicated that the transfer was made, not to XXXX XXXX, but to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) in XXXX, NY. I reported the discrepancy to Citibank, requested a wire recall and reported that the beneficiary account holder was perpetrating fraud by posing as XXXX XXXX. Citibank denied my claim of fraud since the wire instructions originated from an authorized account holder. However, I believe certain regulatory gaps are being exploited, of which I am the victim. I believe the beneficiary bank, XXXX, is supporting the exploitation of an exemption in the Bank Secrecy Act that enables an account holder to operate without regulatory oversight. The wire transfer to XXXX appears to be part of its domestic operations, which is not true, the wire transfer instructions were received from an account holder located in XXXX. XXXX has been accused of multiple fraudulent transactions and, interestingly, they do not have a response mechanism for CFPB. My complaint against XXXX XXXX XXXX Bank went to the OCC through Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, but OCC response was not helpful because I do not have an account at XXXX, according to the form letter I received.

Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports

Consumer complaint narrative:
In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting act. The List of accounts below has violated my federally protected consumer rights to privacy and confidentiality under 15 USC 1681. 

XXXX : # XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX : # XXXX, has violated my rights I looked at my Equifax credit report on XX/XX/year> and noticed some things are XXXX and not accurate. And according to the fair credit reporting act Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates according to 15 USC 1681 ( e ) ( b ).

And according to 15 USC 1681i 5 they are suppose to do this ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In general if, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall- ( ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer.

and according to 15 USC 1681s-2 they are suppose to not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

A formal dispute of inaccurate information on my XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX consumer disclosure reports. 
XXXX. A request for a permanent security freeze and permanent opt-out on my consumer file. 
________________________________________ Part 1 : Dispute of Inaccurate Information Description : I am writing to formally dispute inaccurate information contained in my consumer reports from XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. Upon reviewing my reports, I identified several discrepancies that I believe to be incorrect and require immediate rectification under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 
The issues pertain to the following : 1. Inaccuracies : Specific inaccuracies in my reports are highlighted in the attached documentation. These inaccuracies affect the accuracy and integrity of my consumer data.

2. Failure to Validate Debt : As per 12 CFR 1006.34 ( c ), there has been a lack of validation for the debts in question. No clear and accurate description of the debts or evidence of contractual obligation has been provided. 
Upon reviewing my consumer reports, I identified the following discrepancy that requires immediate correction : Disputed Account 1 Account Name : US DEPT ED Account Number : XXXX Dispute Reason Code : XXXX - Inaccurate Information Explanation : I have never held an account with this number under the name US DEPT ED . 
Disputed Account XXXX Account Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Dispute Reason Code : XXXX - Inaccurate Information Explanation : I have never held an account with this number under the name XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Account XXXX Account Name : XXXX  Account Number : XXXX Dispute Reason Code : XXXX - Inaccurate Information Explanation : I have never held an account with this number under the name XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX ( Original Creditor : XXXX XXXX XXXX ) Disputed Account XXXX Account Name : XXXX XXXX  ( Original Creditor : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ) Account Number : XXXX Dispute Reason Code : XXXX - Inaccurate Information Explanation : I have never held an account with this number under the name XXXX XXXX  ( Original Creditor : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ) Disputed Account XXXX Account Name : XXXX XXXX  ( Original Creditor : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX - Inaccurate Information Explanation : I have never held an account with this number under the name XXXX XXXX  ( Original Creditor : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  ) Disputed Account XXXX Account XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Original Creditor : XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ) Account Number : XXXX Dispute Reason Code : XXXX - Inaccurate Information Explanation : I have never held an account with this number under the name XXXX XXXXXXXX ( Original Creditor : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  ) Disputed Account XXXX Account Name : XXXX XXXX  Account Number : XXXX Dispute Reason Code : XXXX - Inaccurate Information Explanation : I have never held an account with this number under the name XXXX XXXX Disputed Account XXXX Account Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Dispute Reason Code : XXXX - Inaccurate Information Explanation : I have never held an account with this number under the name XXXX XXXX XXXX I request a manual review of this information due to the complexity of the inaccuracies. I have attached highlighted copies of my credit report with the incorrect information clearly marked. Please investigate this matter and remove the inaccurate information from my credit report. Notify me in writing of the results of your investigation and any actions taken. 
Under the FCRA, I am entitled to a thorough and transparent investigation of my dispute. I expect a prompt response to this request. If you fail to provide a detailed description of the investigation process, I will consider filing a complaint with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and may seek legal advice to ensure my rights are protected.

12 CFR 1006.34 ( c ) : The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) has established requirements for the validation of debts. Under this regulation, the debt collector must provide clear and accurate information about the debt, including a detailed description of the nature of the debt and the original creditor. This requirement has not been met in my case. 
Requested Actions : In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), I request that XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX conduct a thorough investigation of my dispute, correct the inaccuracies, and provide me with an updated copy of my XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Consumer Disclosure Report once the corrections have been made. 
I respectfully request the following under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) : 1. Conduct a thorough investigation of this dispute and remove the inaccurate information from my consumer reports. 
2. Provide me with a detailed written statement of the investigation results and any actions taken.

3. Send me an updated copy of my corrected consumer reports.

4. Address the following specific details regarding your investigation : o Methods used to verify the disputed information.

o Sources consulted during the investigation.

o Documentation reviewed to support verification.

o Verification process and criteria used.

o A timeline of the investigation, including key dates and actions taken. 
Be advised that the description of the procedure used to determine the accuracy and completeness of the information is hereby requested, to be provided within fifteen ( 15 ) days of the completion of your investigation. Additionally, please provide the name, address, and telephone number of each person contacted regarding this alleged account. I am formally requesting a copy of any documents provided bearing my signature, showing that I have a legally binding contractual obligation to pay them the exact amount claimed. 
Additionally, I request a description of the procedures used to determine the accuracy and completeness of the disputed information and the contact details of each person consulted regarding this account. Please also provide copies of any documents bearing my signature that establish a legally binding contractual obligation to pay the amount in question. 
Failure to correct these inaccuracies within 30 days, as required under the FCRA, may result in further action, including filing a complaint with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) or pursuing legal remedies.

Requested Actions : 1. Conduct a thorough investigation of the disputed accounts.

2. Remove the inaccurate information from my credit report.

3. Provide me with a written statement detailing the outcome of your investigation.

4. Send a corrected copy of my credit report to my address above.

5. Methods Used : Please describe the specific methods and procedures used to verify the disputed information.

6. Sources Consulted : Provide a list of all sources, including creditors or data furnishers, consulted during the investigation.

7. Documentation Reviewed : Detail any documentation or evidence reviewed to support the verification of the disputed information.

8. Verification Process : Explain how the accuracy of the information was verified and the criteria used for validation.

9. Timeline of Investigation : Outline the timeline of the investigation, including key dates and actions taken.

Additional Requests : 1. Procedure Description : Be advised that the description of the procedure used to determine the accuracy and completeness of the information is hereby requested. This should include a detailed explanation of how the reinvestigation was conducted and the specific steps taken. 
XXXX. Contacts : Additionally, please provide the name, address, and telephone number of each person contacted regarding this alleged account. 
XXXX. Documents Bearing Signature : I am formally requesting a copy of any documents provided bearing my signature, showing that I have a legally binding contractual obligation to pay the exact amount claimed. 
Failure to respond satisfactorily within 30 days of receipt of this certified letter may result in a small claims action against your company, seeking {$1000.00} per violation for : 1. Defamation 2. Negligent Enablement of Identity Fraud 3. Violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act 4. Violations of the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau regulations ________________________________________ Part 2 : Request for Permanent Security Freeze and Opt-Out I also request the following actions to ensure the security and privacy of my consumer data : 1. Place a permanent security freeze on my consumer file to prevent unauthorized access or use of my personal information.

2. Permanently opt me out of all pre-approved credit and insurance offers, marketing campaigns, and data-sharing programs. 
Personal Information for Verification : Full Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX of Birth : XX/XX/year> Social Security Number : XXXX XXXX - XXXX Current Address : XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXX, CA. XXXX Phone Number : ( XXXX ) XXXX - XXXX Email Address : XXXX Enclosed are copies of my driver 's license and a utility bill for verification purposes. Please confirm in writing once these actions have been completed or if additional information is required. 
________________________________________ Relevant Laws : 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) : Compliance procedures for maximum possible accuracy.

15 U.S.C. 1681i : Procedures for disputed accuracy.

15 U.S.C. 1681c : Requirements for information in consumer reports.

12 CFR 1006.34 ( c ) : Validation of debt details and original creditor information. 
________________________________________ Thank you for your attention to these matters. I look forward to your response within the timeframes mandated by the FCRA. Please contact me at ( XXXX ) XXXX XXXX or XXXX if you require further clarification. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX ________________________________________ Make sure to customize the placeholders with your details and attach the necessary documentation when sending this letter. Let me know if you need further refinements!

Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/year>, I applied for a loan through the website ( eloanwarehouseXXXX  ) which included my name, job, income, reason for applying ( which was moving ), and social security number. After pre-approval online, the next step was for me to call a number to finish the approval process, I called the number listed : ( XXXX ) XXXX. The representative walked me through the process of verifying my income through an online bank verification platform called XXXX. He sent me a link via email and by text message. I clicked the XXXX link, selected my bank, and logged into my bank to share my information for income verification. After completion he asked me to do an online ID verification by sending me another link via email and text. I clicked the link and it was a platform that verified identities I took a snapshot of my ID, front and back then it asked me to scan my face side to side. After the identity verification, he told me to wait a few moments while he gets final approval. At this moment I could hear other people talking in the background, and I felt like it was a scam. He came back and told me that I was approved for {$1000.00} he read me my terms and conditions, and my bi-weekly payment amounts. He told me to accept the terms and conditions via email. He asked for my debit card number to instantly send the funds. After I gave it to him, he processed it, and he said oh, come on! What should I do? Then the phone went silent. At this moment I knew it was a scam and got worried. He came back XXXX seconds later and said my bank is blocking the deposit. I need to call them to unblock it. After he hung up, I logged into my online bank account and it was locked. I called XXXX XXXX explained what happened, and they confirmed that it was scammers, they immediately closed my account and reset everything. I upgraded my Iphone, and reset my password. I havent heard from the company since the XXXX

I am writing to file a formal complaint against XXXX, the mortgage company that acquired my loan approximately 7 months ago. I have encountered significant issues with their payment processing system, which have resulted in both confusion and unnecessary financial strain. Despite making my payments on time, I have received threatening letters from XXXX  claiming they did not receive my payments and stating they will contact credit agencies to report my late payments. 

Details of the Issue : XX/XX/XXXX : I made my mortgage payment through auto-pay as usual, and the payment was deposited into XXXX account. However, I later received a letter stating that they had not received my payment and that my account was overdue. I had to send an additional payment while they searched for the original payment. Weeks later, they found the payment and applied it to my account. 
XX/XX/XXXX : I sent my mortgage payment, which was deposited into XXXX account and endorsed on XX/XX/XXXX. However, on XX/XX/XXXX, I received another letter from XXXX  stating that they had not received the payment and that my account was now considered late. This is the second time this has happened. 
XX/XX/XXXX : After receiving the threatening letter, I made another payment for the same month to avoid any late fees or negative impact on my credit. However, I am now being asked to make my XX/XX/XXXX payment as well, leaving me effectively out an entire months mortgage and escrow payment while XXXX  attempts to locate my XXXX payment, which was already taken from my account on XX/XX/XXXX. 

This situation has caused significant stress and financial difficulty for me, as I have to pay twice for the same month while waiting for XXXX  to resolve their internal errors. I am concerned about the impact these errors are having on my credit and financial stability, especially considering I have made every payment on time.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
As you are aware, the FCRA requires that all information reported to the credit bureaus be accurate, complete, and verifiable. Specifically, Section 605 ( a ) of the FCRA mandates that negative information such as charge-offs can not be reported for more than 7 years from the date of the original delinquency. Additionally, under Section 607 ( b ), you are required to ensure that the information you provide to credit reporting agencies is accurate and up-to-date. 
I am particularly concerned about the fact that the charge-off on my account is being reported on a monthly basis, which is misleading and unfairly impacts my credit score. The FCRA prohibits the reporting of the same charge-off month after month when the event itself ( the charge-off ) has already occurred. This behavior can lead to a misrepresentation of my creditworthiness and is not in compliance with the legal guidelines set forth under the FCRA.
Company: CAPITAL ONE, NATIONAL ASSOCIATION - GREENWOOD DELAWARE BRANCH

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Subject : Complaint Against Equifax for Failing to Fix Credit Report Despite Providing Identity Verification Complaint Summary : I am filing this complaint against Equifax for its failure to correct inaccuracies on my credit report, even after requesting and receiving documentation to verify my identity. Equifax has required me to provide proof of my identity and correct address because the information they have does not match, yet they continue to fail in resolving the fraudulent accounts on my credit report.

Details of the Complaint : 1. Equifaxs Failure to Act : Equifax has sent me requests to verify my identity and address, claiming the information they have does not match. 
I provided my government-issued ID passport and my XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX statement as proof of address, yet Equifax has made no effort to fix my credit report by removing the fraudulent accounts. 
2. Fraudulent Accounts from Data Breach : The Equifax data breach exposed my sensitive personal information, resulting in several fraudulent accounts being opened in my name, including XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  ) 3. Violation of Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) : Under the FCRA, Equifax is obligated to ensure the accuracy of credit reports and to promptly address disputes. 
Their requirement to verify my identity while failing to act on the fraudulent accounts I have reported is unacceptable and a failure to comply with the law. 

Impact on Me : Equifaxs mishandling of my case has caused significant emotional distress and financial harm. The fraudulent accounts remain on my credit report, damaging my credit score and preventing me from accessing credit or other financial opportunities. 

Desired Resolution : I request the CFPB to ensure that Equifax takes the following actions : 1. Remove Fraudulent Accounts : Immediately investigate and remove all fraudulent accounts, including XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX from my credit report. 
2. Provide a Corrected Credit Report : Issue me a corrected credit report that reflects the removal of these fraudulent accounts.

3. Acknowledge Verified Information : Accept and use the government-issued ID and XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX have provided to update their records, preventing further delays. 
4. Confirm Compliance in Writing : Provide written confirmation that my identity has been verified, the fraudulent accounts have been removed, and my credit report has been corrected.

5. Prevent Further Excuses : Ensure Equifax stops delaying the resolution of disputes by requiring repetitive identity verification without taking appropriate action to fix credit reports. 

Supporting Documents : I am prepared to provide the following : Copy of my government-issued ID ( e.g., drivers license or passport ) XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX statement as proof of address FTC Identity Theft Report IC3 Complaint Report Conclusion : Equifaxs repeated delays and excuses in resolving my credit report disputes are unacceptable and have caused undue hardship. I trust the CFPB will ensure that Equifax fulfills its legal obligations under the FCRA and resolves this matter without further delay. 

Please contact me at XXXX XXXX XXXX if additional information is required. 

Thank you for your assistance. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Please ensure that the information is reviewed and, if necessary, corrected or removed from my credit report.

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I expect that you will act in accordance with the guidelines set forth by the Fair Credit Reporting Act and resolve this issue as soon as possible. Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
In XXXX of this year a security breach left XXXX XXXX people vulnerable to a hack which also involved millions of American 's personal social security numbers. 
Please see cited source : XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act 15 USC 1681 section 602 a states " There is a need to insure that consumer reporting agencies exercise their grave responsibilities with fairness, impartiality, and a respect for the consumers right to privacy. '' XXXX and XXXX are consumer reporting agencies and I am the Consumer. I have the right to make sure my private information isn't shared which is backed by 15 USC 6801 which states '' It is the policy of the Congress that each financial institution has an affirmative and continuing obligation to respect the privacy of its customers and to protect the security and confidentiality of those customers nonpublic personal information. '' ( Furnisher of information to credit agencies ) is a financial institution by definition under that title. 15 USC 1681 section 604 a section 2 states that " In general Subject to subsection ( c ), any consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report under the following circumstances and no other : in accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates. '' ( Furnisher of information to credit agencies ) the financial institution and the Consumer reporting agencies XXXX and XXXX do not have my consent to furnish this information and they surely do not have my written consent. Any and all consent to XXXX, XXXX, ( Furnisher of information to credit agencies ) whether it be verbal, non-verbal, written, implied or otherwise is revoked. 15 USC 6802 ( b ) ( c ) states that " A financial institution may not disclose nonpublic personal information to a nonaffiliated third party unless the consumer is given an explanation of how the consumer can exercise that nondisclosure option. '' ( Furnisher of information to credit agencies ) Never informed me of my right to exercise my nondisclosure option. Not only that 15 USC 1681C ( a ) ( 5 ) states '' Except as authorized under subsection ( b ), no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information Any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years. '' This account is an adverse item they are reporting again without my permission which is against the law. 15 U.S. Code 1681s2 ( A ) ( 1 ) A states " A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate. 15 U.S. Code 1681e states '' Every consumer reporting agency shall maintain reasonable procedures designed to avoid violations of section 1681c of this title and to limit the furnishing of consumer reports to the purposes listed under section 1681b of this title. XXXX and XXXX are not maintaining reasonable procedures. Also 12 CFR 1016.7 states that " A consumer may exercise the right to opt out at any time. '' I am opting out of your reporting services.

Product: Debt collection
Consumer complaint narrative:
I recently received a debt collection notice from your office. I am writing to verify that you have contacted the correct individual and to request that you provide documentation confirming this. Please supply me with a copy of any contract or agreement signed with your company or the original creditor. 
In accordance with the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I request the following information : 1. The name and address of the original creditor and the current creditor.

2. Verification of the debt amount you are seeking to collect, including evidence that a contract exists creating the amount you claim is owed.

3. Documentation of all assignments showing the transfer of the debt from the original creditor to the current creditor.

4. Proof that the original creditor securitized the debt.

5. Documentation showing the assignments of the debt from the original creditor to the secured trust and then back to the original creditor. 
Please cease and desist from collecting on this debt until you have provided validation of the debt. 
Additionally, I request that you do not access my credit report or report anything to my credit bureaus. I dispute the validity of this debt amount, and this dispute should be reflected on my credit report if you have already reported this debt. 
Permissible Purpose Please state your permissible purpose for accessing my credit information. I dispute your right to do so. 
Notification to Other Collectors I dispute that I owe this debt to you. Should you transfer this debt to another collector, please inform them of my dispute regarding the validity of this debt. 
Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to inform you that your recent actions concerning the collection of an alleged debt are in direct violation of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) and applicable state laws. I have thoroughly documented the following For example, repeated calls to my place of employment despite being informed that such calls are not permitted. 

For instance, failure to provide the legally required validation notice within XXXX days of your initial communication with me. 

These actions are not only unlawful but also constitute harassment. The FDCPA ( 15 U.S.C. 1692 ) strictly prohibits debt collectors from engaging in abusive, deceptive, and unfair practices. By violating these regulations, you are liable for damages, including statutory damages of up to {$1000.00} per violation, actual damages, and attorney fees. 

Given the repeated and willful nature of these violations, I am hereby notifying you that I am escalating this matter to the office of the Attorney General of XXXX XXXX  and XXXX. I am also considering additional legal actions against your agency to seek full redress for the harm caused by your actions. 

Effective immediately, I demand that you cease all forms of communication with me and any third parties in connection with this alleged debt. This is a formal cease and desist notice under the FDCPA. Any further communication from your agency, except to confirm receipt of this letter or to provide proof of debt validation as mandated by law, will be considered a further violation and will be documented as such. 

Please be aware that I am fully prepared to take legal action if these violations continue. This letter serves as evidence that I have provided your agency with notice of your violations and of my intent to pursue legal remedies. 

I expect a response in writing within XXXX  days of receipt of this letter, confirming your compliance with my requests. Failure to respond adequately will result in additional legal action, and a copy of this letter will be forwarded to the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) as well. Remove these fraudelent tradelines off of my credit report as I have attahced XXXX identity theft reports below.

Product: Credit card

Issue: Advertising and marketing, including promotional offers
Sub-issue: Didn't receive advertised or promotional terms
Consumer complaint narrative:
I received a targeted offer this past fall from American Express for the Delta Skymiles credit card. It specifically appeared with my name attached to it on the checkout page when I was purchasing a XXXX XXXX XXXX on the Delta website a few months ago. I trusted this deal to be truthful and accurate, and so I signed up for this card and hit the {$2000.00} required spending threshold, but noticed today that I had never received the welcome bonus offer that was promised. I reached out to AMEX through chat online, and they said it was not approved because at one point in the distant past I had this card before. That must've been YEARS ago, and even if I did, I still received the targeted offer that I was once again eligible for it again. 

The offer also stated that if I was approved for the AMEX card, I'd also get my first checked bag complimentary free ( which I did, no issues with that ), roadside assistance ( which appears to be as promised ), etc. I received this targeted offer due to my extensive business with Delta, I expect to receive it. It's a very unethical and misleading business practice to invite me to sign up for an offer and then never award the XXXX bonus miles for making $ XXXX in purchases in the first 3 months, yet afford me other perks of the card like roadside assistance and a free checked bag. Essentially, you're changing the terms of the card, for which I dutifully paid my {$99.00} annual fee, and then you bait-and-switched on me.

Please credit my Delta account, # XXXX with these XXXX miles as soon as possible as per the agreement. https : XXXX

Product: Debt collection
Sub-issue: Didn't receive notice of right to dispute
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XX/XX/year> PORTFOLIO RECOVERY XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX VA XXXX Subject : Dispute of Alleged Debt and Request for Debt Validation To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to formally dispute the validity of the debt you claim I owe. Under the protections provided by federal consumer laws, I am requesting debt validation and disputing any and all alleged debts associated with my name. This letter serves as notice of my dispute and as a demand for strict compliance with the law.

Pursuant to 12 CFR 1006.34 ( b ) ( 5 ), you have failed to provide the required validation information to substantiate the alleged debt. Additionally, under 12 CFR 1006.34 ( c ) ( 4 ) ( i ), I have not been given the opportunity to properly dispute the account as required by law.

Your actions, including the furnishing of this alleged debt to consumer reporting agencies without providing the proper disclosures required by law, constitute violations of 12 CFR 1006.34 ( d ) and 15 U.S.C. 1661-5 2 ( 7 ) ( A ). These actions amount to false, misleading, and deceptive practices, which infringe upon my consumer rights. 

In accordance with my rights under federal law, I am disputing the validity of this alleged debt. I also demand the following : 1. Debt Validation : Provide proof of the alleged debt, including a copy of the original agreement between myself and the original creditor.

2. Purchase Agreement : Furnish the purchase agreement or other documentation that demonstrates your authority to collect on this alleged debt.

3. Licensing and Bonding : Provide proof that your company is licensed and bonded to collect debts in my state. 

Furthermore, I hereby revoke any and all authorization for your company to contact me via phone calls, text messages, or emails, effective immediately. All future communication regarding this matter must be conducted through written correspondence sent to my mailing address listed above. 

Failure to comply with these requests or continued violations of my consumer rights will leave me with no choice but to pursue all available remedies, including filing complaints with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), and my state Attorney Generals office. 

Please provide the requested information within 30 days of receiving this letter. If you fail to do so, I will consider this matter resolved, and any further collection activity will be deemed unlawful. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/year> XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Subject : Dispute of Credit Report Information Under 15 USC 1681i ( a ) ( 6 ) ( B ) ( iii ) Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing to formally dispute certain information that appears on my credit report. I have reviewed the report provided to me and believe that there is inaccurate or incomplete information listed. Under 15 USC 1681i ( a ) ( 6 ) ( B ) ( iii ), I am exercising my right to dispute this item and request that your agency investigate the accuracy of the information.

The specific item ( s ) in question are : Portfolio Recover Account # XXXX I believe that this information is incorrect because it is outdated, showing a wrong balance. In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act, you are required to conduct a reasonable investigation of the disputed information and provide me with the results within the required timeframe. Please ensure that the information is reviewed and, if necessary, corrected or removed from my credit report. 
Please notify me of the outcome of your investigation as soon as it is complete. Additionally, if the dispute is resolved in my favor, please update my credit file accordingly and send me an updated copy of my credit report reflecting these changes. 
Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I expect that you will act in accordance with the guidelines set forth by the Fair Credit Reporting Act and resolve this issue as soon as possible. Should you need any further information from me, please do not hesitate to contact me at the above-mentioned phone number or email address. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
To Whom It May Concern at Schreiber Law LLC, I am writing to formally address a serious privacy concern regarding the delivery of sensitive documents by your office. On Sunday, XX/XX/year>, I observed an individual walking into my driveway carrying what appeared to be a rolled-up packet of papers. Shortly thereafter, I received a call from my mother-in-law informing me that she had discovered and opened a roll of documents left hanging on my doorknob. 

These papers contained sensitive personal and financial information related to an alleged debt. The delivery method not only left the documents exposed to weather conditions ( including rain ) but also allowed unauthorized individuals, including my in-laws, to access private details about my financial situation. 

This method of delivery raises significant concerns about the security of my personal information and appears to constitute a breach of privacy. Proper handling of such documents, particularly those containing sensitive financial details, is essential and expected under professional and legal standards.

He received confirmation from venmo the issue is resolved and he is good to go ( screenshots of message from venmo to customer are available for review ). Fast forward to XX/XX/year>, the {$500.00} sent from the sender is still being held by venmo and they have also now debited my account {$500.00} + {$190.00} fee. I spoke with venmo again this morning ( XX/XX/year> ) and they told me the issue is under review. I asked for details of why my account was debited, they said no info is available. I asked if I could speak with someone, they said no one is available to discuss. I asked how long how long the review will take and I was told there is no specific timeframe but I will receive an email in the future. Considering venmo is holding the {$500.00} sent by the sender to me while they investigate, how is it fair for venmo to also debit my account for an additional {$690.00}? Unfortunately venmo is totally unresponsive when I ask them this question. Id like an explanation as to why venmo was able to deduct {$500.00} + {$190.00} from my account without seeking my permission, in accordance with regulation E. I would be very grateful for any assistance CFPB can offer.

Dear CFPB, I am writing to formally submit a complaint against Credit Karma regarding a serious issue with my savings account. Dear Goldman Sachs Bank USA Compliance Department, I write in response to your investigation summary regarding the CFPB complaint involving the Apple Card. Your conclusion that " no error occurred '' is unsupported, as your response does not provide verifiable proof that disclosures and billing statements were delivered in compliance with 15 U.S.C. 1666b and 15 U.S.C. 1637 ( b ) of the Truth in Lending Act.

Under 15 U.S.C. 1666b ( a ) - Timing of Payments : " A creditor may not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open-end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose, unless the creditor has adopted reasonable procedures designed to ensure that each periodic statement including the information required by section 1637 ( b ) of this title is mailed or delivered to the consumer not later than 21 days before the payment due date. '' You mentioned that The Bank does not provide the additional documentation the Customer has requested ( such as tracking number, receipt of delivery etc. ) but this is the only information that can be used to prove if the disclosures were mailed or delivered not later than 21 days before the payment due date. 

Your response fails to provide evidence that reasonable procedures were followed to ensure the timely delivery of periodic statements. 


15 USC 1637 ( b ) mandates that creditors transmit a periodic statement to the account holder for each billing cycle in which there is an outstanding balance or finance charge. The statement must include, among other items : The outstanding balance, The minimum payment required, The due date for payment, and Any finance charges imposed during the billing cycle.

The absence of verifiable proof of timely delivery for these periodic statements directly violates the statutory requirements of 15 U.S.C. 1637 ( b ). 

My initial complaint requested specific evidence, such as : A tracking number, A receipt of delivery, or Other verifiable documentation confirming that disclosures and statements were delivered at least 21 days before the payment due date. 

Your response failed to provide this evidence, and instead referenced general notification practices that do not meet the statutory standard. Your response does not include details of the procedures employed to ensure compliance with 15 U.S.C. 1666b. Without such information, the Bank can not substantiate its claim that " no error occurred. '' Pursuant to 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 6 ) ( B ) ( iii ) and 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 7 ), you are required to provide a detailed explanation of the methods and evidence used in your investigation and how you used it to determine the validity of the reported late payments. These details are missing from your response.

To resolve this matter, I request the following : Verifiable evidence that billing statements were mailed or delivered at least 21 days before the payment due date, as required by 15 U.S.C. 1666b.

Include documentation such as tracking numbers, delivery confirmations, or other forms of proof.

A detailed explanation of the procedures and systems used to ensure compliance with 15 U.S.C. 1666b and 15 U.S.C. 1637 ( b ).

Your response must address the legal requirements raised. Any unrelated or irrelevant information will be interpreted as an attempt to evade compliance and will be noted for potential escalation.

Failure to provide the requested documentation will nullify your conclusion that " no error occurred '' and may constitute a willful violation of 15 U.S.C. 1666b, 15 U.S.C. 1637 ( b ), and 15 U.S.C. 1681n. I request a complete and substantiated response within 10 business days. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Product: Debt collection
Sub-issue: Didn't receive enough information to verify debt
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/year>, I attempted to contact Portfolio Recovery Associates via two methods to verify an alleged debt. First, I submitted an inquiry through their official website at https : //www.portfoliorecovery.com. Additionally, I emailed them directly at XXXX, an email address provided on their website for dispute-related matters. 

The purpose of my outreach was to request verification of the alleged debt in accordance with the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), which requires debt collectors to validate the debt upon request. Despite my efforts, as of today ( XX/XX/year> ), nearly two months have passed, and I have not received any response. Under the FDCPA, specifically 15 U.S.C. 1692g ( b ), if a consumer disputes a debt in writing and requests verification, the collector must cease collection activities until they provide verification. Failure to validate the debt within a reasonable timeframe may require the removal of the disputed item from my credit report. 

Given the lack of response and the elapsed time, Portfolio Recovery Associates is legally required to remove this debt from my credit report, as they have not fulfilled their obligation to verify or validate the alleged debt.

I need this resolve, under the Fair Credit Reporting Act, these disputed items may not appear on my credit report if they can not be supported by any evidence ( 1 ) In general No person ( company ) shall sell, transfer for consideration, or place for collection a debt that such person has been notified under section 1681c-2 of this title has resulted from identity theft.

( 2 ) Applicability The prohibitions of this subsection shall apply to all persons collecting a debt described in paragraph ( 1 ) after the date of a notification under paragraph ( 1 ).

( 3 ) Rule of construction Nothing in this subsection shall be construed to prohibit -- ( A ) The repurchase of a debt in any case in which the assignee of the debt requires such repurchase because the debt has resulted from identity theft ; ( B ) the securitization of a debt or the pledging of a portfolio of debt as collateral in connection with a borrowing ; or ( C ) the transfer of debt as a result of a merger, acquisition, purchase and assumption transaction, or transfer of substantially all of the assets of an entity.

A person that furnishes information to any consumer reporting agency shall have in place reasonable procedures to respond to any notification that it receives from a consumer reporting agency under section 1681c-2 of this title relating to information resulting from identity theft, to prevent that person from refurnishing such blocked information.

Product: Debt collection
Debt collection
Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally notify you that your attempts to collect on the alleged debt referenced above are in violation of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), 15 USC 16921692p. If you are not aware this entire claim is regulated by an arbitration agreement with XXXX XXXX, which clearly stipulates that any dispute must be resolved through arbitration due to the binding agreement. To date there has been no arbitration proceedings. As a direct result of that this is considered a material breach of the arbitration terms listed in the original agreement acknowledged by all involved parties. 

Furthermore, a payment was made to the original creditor on XX/XX/year> by XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, and proof of payment was provided, yet the negative entries related to this account remain on my credit reports for six years now. 

So in addition to the violation above, the additional violations are as follows : Under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), Section 807 ( 8 ), it is unlawful for debt collectors to use any false, deceptive, or misleading representation in connection with the collection of any debt. By failing to delete the account, your agency is potentially engaging in deceptive practices. 

Under Section 808 ( 1 ) of the FDCPA, continuing to report the debt in violation of my agreement with the original creditor could be considered an unfair practice.

Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), Section 623 ( a ) ( 1 ), your agency is required to provide accurate information to credit reporting agencies. Your continued reporting of this debt after being notified with proof of payment that it should be deleted is not only inaccurate but also in violation of this section.

Your agency has reported inaccurate information to credit bureaus in violation of 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( a ). Statutory Damages : {$1000.00} 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) Prohibition Against Knowingly or Recklessly Furnishing Inaccurate Information : Your agency has knowingly or recklessly furnished inaccurate information to credit bureaus, violating 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ). Statutory Damages : {$1000.00} These actions have caused significant harm to me, including damage to my credit score, and emotional distress as it relates to my ability to pursue other loans and credit opportunities. As a result, I am entitled to statutory damages of up to {$1000.00} for each violation listed above.

I am requesting immediate action to correct this matter. Please remove and delete any negative entries related to this account from all credit reporting agencies. As I confidently assert that you have no right to collect on this alleged debt.

I am writing this as I humbly seek to have this discrepancy resolved both promptly and amicably.

With that, my demands are as follows : 1. You must promptly notify any credit reporting agency to remove all information and/or tradelines associated with this account. I request a written confirmation of that communication to be sent to the address you have on file ; 2. A settlement agreement that I may retain for my records.

3. Monetary compensation in the amount of {$2000.00}.

While I do not desire or anticipate that your negligence may force me to pursue further legal action, that option will be explored. In the event that needs to happen, you are subject to a significant increase in demands to cover damages, attorney fees, and more. I am sure a company of your caliber does not look to unreasonably be exposed to those routes. 

Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter. We look forward to resolving this issue promptly and receiving confirmation of your compliance within 15 days.
