Product: Debt collection
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to file a formal complaint regarding inaccurate credit reporting by PORTFOLIO RECOV ASSOC related to my credit report. 

The account in question is being reported with a last payment date, but there is no corresponding payment history for that date. This discrepancy is misleading, and it violates my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ). Below are the details of the issue : The debt collector has reported a last payment date, but when reviewing the payment history, this date is not included as part of the documented payment history. 
The lack of accurate and consistent payment history creates a misleading or incomplete representation of my creditworthiness and is damaging to my credit score. 
As a consumer, I am entitled to accurate information on my credit report under the FCRA, which requires that all information reported to credit bureaus be complete, accurate, and verifiable. Specifically : FCRA Section 605 mandates that only accurate information can be reported to credit bureaus. 
FCRA Section 623 ( a ) ( 1 ) requires that furnishers of information ( in this case, the debt collector ) report accurate information, including complete payment histories. The failure to accurately report the payment history violates this section of the FCRA. 
FCRA Section 1681i entitles consumers to dispute inaccurate information and requires credit reporting agencies to investigate and correct or remove any inaccurate or unverifiable information. 
FDCPA Section 1692e prohibits debt collectors from making false representations about the status of a debt. The debt collector 's failure to include the corresponding payment history with the reported last payment date may constitute a violation of this provision. 
Requested Action : I respectfully request that the CFPB assist in ensuring that the debt collector complies with applicable consumer protection laws and that my credit report be updated to reflect the following : Deletion of the debt from my credit report due to the inaccurate and incomplete reporting of the last payment date without the corresponding payment history. The lack of verification and substantiation of this information renders the debt unverifiable under the FCRA. 
If deletion is not possible, I request that the credit reporting agencies conduct a thorough investigation and require the debt collector to provide a complete and accurate payment history, including a valid last payment date, in compliance with the FCRA. 
I have already attempted to resolve this matter directly with the debt collector, but they have failed to correct the discrepancies or provide adequate clarification regarding the inaccurate reporting. 

I am requesting that the CFPB investigate this issue and ensure my consumer rights are upheld in accordance with the FCRA and FDCPA. If this issue is not addressed in a timely and satisfactory manner, I will consider taking further legal action, including filing complaints with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and seeking remedies under the law. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt response and assistance in resolving this issue.

In addition, this addendum also requests for you to cease and desist the use, or potential use, of any third ( 3rd ) party to contact me in reference to this collection.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Alliant Credit Union used unfair collection practices to repossess my vehicle ; I have been long time member with Alliant Credit made vehicle payments on time paid more than monthly amount for 3 years recently fell on hard times. Reached out to Alliant Credit Union to discuss hardship/ deferment payment options which they have a plan that I'm billed monthly at XXXX to protect auto loan in the event I am faced with a hardship I had to " APPLY/QUALIFY '' for this assistance ; application were submitted for 3 months and were either ignored, marked as incomplete or denied. How do you get denied for hardship assistance when there's a reduction of income. All lenders offer the ability to place payments at the end of the loan without submitting proof of income/harship we have never used this benefit/program. It my belief we qualified due to national COVID disaster assistance programs, reduction of income due to being temporarily unemployed, and vehicle was in area of XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXo we had XXXX life changing events that Allaint advertise assistance for and we were repeatedly denied. Furthermore in State of Illinois lenders are required to send letter advising consumers of intent of repossession detailing redemption process ; and allow consumer 21 days to resolve issue before action is taken if loan is paid off more than 30 %. We never received written notification and loan is paid off 50 %. The original loan taken out XX/XX/XXXX was {$49000.00}. our current balance is XXXX which includes additional fees payments. Consumer rights were violated : 15 USC 1681b ( a ) ( 2 ), 15 USC 1681i, 15 USC 1681s-2, UCC 9 PART 6, UCC 9-609 ( b ) Breach of Peace, Public Disturbance. I logged into Alliant website and submitted payment of {$1500.00} which would have bought account current covering payment 2 months of payments our regular monthly payment is {$740.00} on XX/XX/XXXX at XXXX XXXX was advised by Alliant customer service representative the repossession order was sent out XX/XX/XXXX at XXXX XXXX which was after payment was submitted. Once XX/XX/XXXX when vehicle was repo 'd contact representative that advised to cancel payment from day before the amount due had changed ( fees added and needed to add XX/XX/XXXX payment which posted to account XX/XX/XXXX ) the new amount due is {$3600.00} which is outrageous. The total due of account was {$2200.00} on XX/XX/XXXX when payment for {$1500.00} was submitted. Its my assumption that Alliant Credit Union practiced unlawful collection tactics to repo vehicle due to the fact we have a great interest rate of 4 % the vehicle is more than 50 % paid off and there would be equity in vehicle if resold making repossession of vehicle more profitable transaction to bank verses working it out with a longtime consumer ; there is no reason we should have been denied hardship repayment due to income that's the purpose of hardship income changes. We had to submit application and checks stubs to " APPLY '' to use coverage program that I have been billed XXXX per month for last 3 years. Repossession was preformed without proper legal authority.

MAJOR CREDIT bureaus : I am writing to formally dispute numerous errors/ inaccurate information reflecting on my consumer credit profiles with all three major credit bureaus and to address several violations of consumer protection laws that have come to my attention. Upon reviewing credit reports dated XX/XX/XXXX I believe this action was taken unlawfully and in violation of both state and federal consumer laws, including the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) and the Uniform Commercial Code ( UCC ). The below mention account ( s )/ information were mishandled and in direct volitation of the following consumer laws ; I reference the following laws and regulations in support of my dispute : 15 USC 1681b ( a ) ( 2 ) 15 USC 1681i 15 USC 1681 s-2 15 USC 1681c-2 ( a ) 15 USC 1666b 15 USC 1637 ( b ) 15 USC 1681 e ( b ) 15 USC 1681b ( 2 ) 15 USC 1681 ( q ) 15 USC 1681 ( 2XI ) 15 USC 1692c 15 USC 1635 15 USC 1692g UCC 9 part 6 UCC 9-609 ( b ) 12 CFR 1006.34C 12 CFR 1006.6C 12 CRF 1026.13 Failure to provide written notice of repossession intent and redemption options in a timely manner Failure to provide 1099-c Breach of peace Public Disturbance 1. 15 USC 1681b ( a ) ( 2 ) : This provision states that consumer reporting agencies may furnish reports only for permissible purposes. I have concerns that my information has been accessed without a legitimate reason.

2. 15 USC 1681i : Under this statute, I am entitled to dispute inaccurate information in my credit report. I request that you investigate the accuracy of the information being reported.

3. 15 USC 1681s-2 : This law requires furnishers of information to provide accurate data. I believe that the information you have reported is incorrect and must be corrected.

4. 15 USC 1681c-2 ( a ) : This provision details the expiration of certain negative information. I believe that information being reported is outdated and should not be included in my credit file.

5. 15 USC 1666b : This section pertains to billing error resolutions. I have not received proper resolution pertaining to the billing discrepancies on my account.

6. 15 USC 1637 ( b ) : This law requires clear disclosure of terms and conditions, which I believe were not adequately provided in my case.

7. 15 USC 1681e ( b ) : You have a duty to ensure maximum possible accuracy in the information you report. Failure to do so constitutes a violation of this section.

8. 15 USC 1681b ( 2 ) : This section mandates that I must be informed of the nature of the information used to make adverse decisions. I have not received adequate information regarding this.

9. 15 USC 1681 ( q ) : This provision prohibits the use of consumer reports for improper purposes. I am concerned my report has been accessed without my knowledge or consent.

10. 15 USC 1681 ( 2XI ) : This statute emphasizes the importance of accuracy in credit reporting, which I believe has not been upheld.

11. 15 USC 1692c : Under this law, I have the right to request debt validation which has not been provided to me satisfactorily.

12. 15 USC 1635 : This statute requires that consumers be informed about their right to cancel certain transactions, which was not properly communicated in my case.

13. 15 USC 1692g : This section mandates that I be provided with validation of the debt upon request. I have not received the necessary validation.

14. UCC 9-609 ( b ) : This provision states that a secured party must not breach the peace during the repossession process. I have concerns regarding the manner in which the repossession was conducted.

15. 12 CFR 1006.34C and 12 CFR 1006.6C : These regulations govern the treatment of accounts in collections and require proper disclosures regarding debt collection practices.

16. 12 CFR 1026.13 : This section provides additional requirements for credit card issuers to address billing errors, which I believe were not met in this situation.

- Failure to Provide Written Notice of Repossession Intent and Redemption Options : I did not receive the required written notice prior to the repossession of my vehicle, violating my rights under relevant laws.

- Failure to Provide 1099-C : I have not received a 1099-C for any canceled debts, which is necessary for accurate tax reporting. 

- Breach of Peace/Public Disturbance : The manner in which the repossession was handled caused a public disturbance and did not adhere to the legal requirement of maintaining the peace. 

Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), I have the right to dispute inaccurate information in my credit file. I am requesting that you conduct a thorough investigation of this matter to verify whether the creditor has reported this debt accurately and whether they have fulfilled their obligation to issue a 1099-C. If they are unable to provide proof of the cancellation of debt and the corresponding 1099-C, I request that you remove this entry from my credit report. 

First, I would like to remind you that under the FDCPA, a creditor must provide proper notification before taking action such as repossession. I did not receive any written notice concerning a default or an impending repossession within the time frame required by law. Specifically, in Illinois where vehicle is registered lender is required to send written notice of default and repossession intent informing borrower of intent to recover vehicle provide instruction of remedy of default ; notice also allows borrower 21 days to bring loan current if vehicle is more than 30 % paid off. 

Additionally, I would like to request that you provide me with documentation proving your right to repossess the vehicle, including the original loan agreement and any correspondence related to the default. According to the law, I have the right to receive this information, and failure to provide it may constitute additional violations of our rights as a consumer. My personal data information has been leaked in multiple " DATA BREACHES '' companies, bureaus and social security administration.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Debt collection
Consumer complaint narrative:
I, XXXX XXXX, have received information regarding a debt that is being claimed against me. Through my rights, in accordance with 15 U.S. Code 1692g, I hold the right to verify the total debt amount, including any fees, and who the original party that is making the claim. After receiving such information I will review and respond within the 30-day period allotted to me under federal law.

If it is found that there is no evidence of this debt under my name then I demand that all credit bureaus and financial institutions be made aware or a complaint will be filed to the respective local or federal agency.

Furthermore, I request that you cease and desist any future telephone communication, whether through my residential or employment numbers. I am aware of the request for payment by your company and any further telephone communication shall be considered harassment in violation of 15 U.S. Code 1692d and shall be subject to State and Federal penalties. 
I appreciate your efforts in this matter and look forward to your response. 
Regards, XXXX XXXX

Product: Vehicle loan or lease
Consumer complaint narrative:
Date ( s ) of the event : I went to XXXX XXXX XXXX ( Now City Limits XXXX Pre-Owned ) XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX. I spent XXXX hours at the dealership trying to get approved for a car loan. 

Description of the issue : I was interested in purchasing a XXXX XXXX XXXX priced around {$17000.00}. I had a XXXX XXXX XXXX, but the dealership claimed that my credit history wasnt sufficient and that, as a XXXX XXXX, I didnt make enough income to qualify for the loan on my own. To help with the approval, they added my sisters income to the loan application. 

The process and misleading information : The dealership initially told me I could drive off with just {$500.00} down, but this amount kept increasing. By the end of the day, they pressured me into putting {$1000.00} downa sum that was difficult for me to afford. I was continuously pressured by the salespeople to accept the loan, even though I didnt fully understand the terms. 

I did not understand the interest rate or how it would affect the overall cost of the loan. As a naive buyer, I grew up in a low-income household and had no experience with loans, so I trusted the dealerships assurances. In the end, I signed a loan agreement through Santander Consumer with an interest rate of 24.10 % on a XXXX loan, with XXXX XXXX monthly payments. 

Loan details and ongoing financial burden : I purchased the XXXX XXXX XXXX with XXXX miles on it. The current payoff amount as of now is {$15000.00}, and I wont be done paying off the loan until XX/XX/XXXX. I feel like I was taken advantage of because I didnt understand the loan terms, and the interest rate is much higher than it should have been for someone with my credit score. According to my research, the average interest rate for someone with a XXXX XXXX XXXX should have been closer to XXXX %. Instead, I was stuck with an interest rate that is more than XXXX times the average rate. 

Quality and condition of the vehicle : The XXXX XXXX XXXX I purchased is already showing signs of wear, and Im concerned that the car wont even last until the end of the loan term in XXXX. I feel trapped in this loan, paying far more than I should for a used vehicle that wont retain its value. 

How I was treated by the dealership : I felt pressured and misled throughout the entire process. The dealership didnt take my financial situation into account and pushed me into accepting terms that werent in my best interest. I also feel that my lack of experience as a XXXX XXXXXXXX made me an easy target for this type of deal.

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/year> I emailed all XXXX email contacts for this company. The company responded on XX/XX/year>. I noticed this company flagged my credit account with the credit bureau on XX/XX/year>. Then I sent a follow up email on XX/XX/year>. As of, XXXX XX/XX/year> I have not received anything from this company. 

Dear XXXX XXXX, I hope this message finds you well. 

I am writing in to your communication regarding the debt you claim I owe. I would like to formally request verification of this debt, as is my right under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act. Please provide me with the following information : XXXX. **Verification of the Debt** : Please provide documentation verifying that I owe this debt, including the amount, the original creditor 's name, and any relevant account numbers. 

2. **Detailed Account Information** : I request a complete payment history, including any fees, interest, or penalties that may apply.

3. **Proof of Your Authority** : Please provide evidence that your agency is authorized to collect on this debt. 

Until I receive the requested verification, I kindly ask that you cease all collection activities and refrain from reporting this debt to credit bureaus. 

On XX/XX/year> your company reported to XXXX credit bureau. Your violating the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) by not properly validating the debt before reporting it to credit bureaus. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt response. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX reply on XX/XX/year> : Dear XXXX, Thank you for contacting XXXX XXXX regarding account number XXXX, We need additional time to obtain the required documentation. As soon as we have the documentation on hand, we will promptly forward to your attention. 

If you have any questions, please feel free to contact our office at XXXX. Hours of operation M-F XXXX EST. We look forward to helping you resolve this matter.

Sub-issue: Damage caused or loss of personal items in vehicle during the actual repossession
Consumer complaint narrative:
Santander repossessed my car last year and returned it after I paid all of the past due balance ( and the penalty fees they never retracted as promised ). The car was damaged as the transmission blew apart before I even got it home. My mechanic determined it was towed in gear when repossessed. A new transmission is {$6000.00}. I continued to pay my payments even though the car sits in my driveway unusable as I pay {$450.00} per week for alternative rides to work. Finally as of a few months ago, the expense for rides has taking its toll, and I struggle to pay my loan with Santander threatening to repossess my car yet again. Santander had given no indication on what their liability would be or their contracted tow companys liability would be from when they damaged it. The car is not driveable, however, they still expect their payments somehow and threaten to repossess it again, which would absorb all the investment I have in this car and ruin my credit even more. I have reported this over and over to no response so I reported it to federal consumer finance protection. 

I was then contacted by Santander and spoke to a senior account manager executive. I reiterated what happened and explained that when I looked into the warranty for the car, I learned that XXXX was considering a recall on the transmission for my cars year and explained that maybe that had something to do with its susceptibility to the towing error when getting repossessed. I explained that XXXX decided against the recall and had instead added the part to a customer satisfaction policy that pays for the entire transmission should it fail if purchased new from a dealership. I explained I did not appear to be a candidate, because even though it was purchased from a dealership with their loan, it was purchased as a used car. He said he had the autonomy to look into getting my car repaired as they provide many loans to this dealership and I can avoid another repossession IF I MADE A PAYMENT AND WITHDREW MY REPORT FROM THE CFPB. He said UNLESS I do those two things, he wont have a dialogue about what they can do to solve the problem. I logged on to withdrawal the complaint when I saw the case was closed already and that they are not going to take any responsibility for the damage done on the tow during the repossession when their company towed it in gear and destroyed the transmission. They said I never reported the damage in a timely fashion. This isnt true because I told them and their tow company when it happened and multiple times since. I have around {$12000.00} paid into this car and owe like {$18000.00} on a {$23000.00} sticker purchase because of the crazy interest rate. The car only has XXXX mi on it with a blown transmission, around XXXX  miles past the warranty expiration. 

So my complaint to the CFPB was closed arbitrarily as Im confused to what it has even done to protect me. I reopen this complaint with the above new information and ask for help on how I can get my car repaired. 

Finally, for Santander to hold any corrective action ransom based on me withdrawing a complaint from the CFPB is not acceptable. Nor is CFPB closing a complaint to basically endorse this blackmail acceptable. Thank you.

Product: Credit card
Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Issue: Problem with a purchase shown on your statement
Sub-issue: Credit card company isn't resolving a dispute about a purchase on your statement
Consumer complaint narrative:
I ordered an item ( merchant order # XXXX ) on XX/XX/year>, from the merchant, XXXX, for {$690.00}. I used my Chase credit card for this purchase. 

After a few days, the order was marked as delivered but it had not arrived. Because of this, we disputed the associated charge ( Chase transaction reference ID # XXXX ). Chase credited us the transaction amount, as is customary while an ongoing dispute is pending. 

Eventually, after a few more days the order did arrive. Because it arrived, I cancelled the charge dispute with Chase. Chase rebilled the charge to the credit card. 

Upon receiving the item, we eventually decided to return the item to the merchant. This return was accepted by the merchant, and they confirmed they received the item back ( correspondence attached below ). They confirmed multiple times that the refund was processed and funds were released to our method of payment. They confirmed the refund was processed on XXXX XX/XX/year>, at XXXX XXXX However, its been over 2 months now and we have not received the refund in our account with Chase. Chase claims they have not received any refund, and they have used many different reasons as to why we can not dispute this charge, or get refunded, while they investigate the refund process. 

Chase keeps closing my disputes and inquiries for varying and invalid reasons. I have called the Chase customer service many times and spent hours on the phone with them to no avail. 

Thus, we have returned an item and Chase refuses to process the return. We have lost {$690.00} to no fault of our own and no one will help us. 

I have included attachments to show multiple confirmations from the merchant that the funds have been released, as well as our credit card statements for every month since the original purchase, to prove that we have not been refunded.

Product: Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan
Issue: Charged fees or interest you didn't expect
Consumer complaint narrative:
Complaint to the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) I am submitting this complaint regarding XXXX XXXX practices for check cashing services offered through XXXX. I believe their process is misleading, potentially predatory, and results in financial harm to consumers. Below are the specific issues I have encountered : XXXX. **Misrepresentation of XXXX Options : ** - XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX options for check cashing : - " XXXX  XXXX  XXXX '' for a fee. 
- " XXXX processing '' for free. 
- It was my understanding that if a check did not qualify for " XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX, '' it would default to the XXXX processing option to allow for verification of funds. However, this fallback does not appear to be implemented in practice, leaving customers with no recourse if their check is denied for " XXXX in XXXX. '' XXXX. **Technical Issues Preventing Service Access : ** - On XX/XX/XXXX, I attempted to cash a check for {$XXXX} through the XXXX XXXX. Due to updates on XXXX platform, I was unable to complete the transaction. 
- This issue affects XXXX users, who currently can not see the check cashing option at all. As of this submission, the issue remains unresolved, effectively blocking access to a core feature of the service. 

XXXX. XXXX XXXX Process : ** - To troubleshoot the issue, I took a photo of the check and attempted to process it. This action triggered a hold on my account. 
- XXXX XXXX verification process appears superficial, relying on physical characteristics of the check ( e.g., security paper ) rather than contacting the issuing bank to confirm the validity of the check and guarantee of funds. This lack of thorough verification imposes unnecessary holds on legitimate checks. 

XXXX. **Predatory " VOID '' Instruction : ** - Numerous customers, including myself, have reported a troubling practice : - XXXX XXXX approves checks and instructs customers to write " VOID '' on the physical check. 
- After the customer complies, XXXX denies the transaction without further review of the check. 
- The check, now marked " VOID, '' can not be deposited elsewhere, leaving customers unable to access their funds. 

XXXX. **Excessive Fees : ** - For successful transactions, XXXX charges high fees. For example : - I cashed a check for {$XXXX} and was charged over {$XXXX} in fees. 
- These fees, equating to roughly XXXX  %, are excessive and resemble high-interest loans, especially when applied to cashiers checks or other guaranteed funds. 
- This practice appears predatory, targeting consumers who XXXX lack alternative options for immediate cash access. 

6. **Specific Incident Details : ** - The check I attempted to cash on XX/XX/XXXX was a cashiers check issued by XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX a guaranteed form of payment. Despite this, I encountered a hold and unclear verification procedures. 

**Impact on XXXX : ** XXXX XXXX practices : - Mislead consumers about available options for processing checks. 
- XXXX excessive fees for expedited service, resembling predatory lending. 
- Leave customers worse off by denying checks after instructing them to write " VOID. '' - Fail to provide equal access to services for Android users, undermining the reliability of their platform. 

I believe these practices violate consumer protection principles and XXXX constitute unfair or deceptive practices under federal law. 

Thank you for addressing this matter.

Product: Mortgage
Sub-issue: Trying to communicate with the company to fix an issue related to modification, forbearance, short sale, deed-in-lieu, bankruptcy, or foreclosure
Consumer complaint narrative: My father passed away XX/XX/year> and left house to us through a quitclaims deed which is filed through the local title company where we live and where the house is. This mortgage is through PHH and we have contacted them several times regarding assignments with this mortgage. We have filled out the needed paperwork for the forbearance and have sent the needed documentation that they requested as well. We have heard nothing regarding this case and when my sister or myself call for an update we are transferred to many different people whom all claim there is nothing on file regarding this. Different answers from each person. I know the information was received because I emailed everything and have the receipt email that it was received. We now are receiving letters from the company telling us the property is going to be foreclosed due to no payment. We have stated what we can pay monthly in the paperwork that they sent out and nothing has been replied too, only letters that stated the mortgage is in default due to no payment. We currently have it for sale and have excepted and offer and will be closing soon. The mortgage company will receive the amount in full that is owed and will be sent directly to them from our local title company when the closing takes place. When I requested a payoff letter they responded with the payoff letter but has not assisted in the response regarding the forbearance documents that was completed over 30 days ago. I have also requested information regarding a death clause that my father stated was on the mortgage as well but they claim nothing is listed on the mortgage regarding this, but can't provide me with the account information for me to go over. But they do state my full name is listed on the account right along with my sisters. I am requesting communication regarding these concerns and a response to the offer that we excepted involving the payoff of the mortgage in full and the needed paperwork to go over to see if any information is listed pertaining to the death of my father 's mortgage.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am submitting this complaint against TransUnion regarding fraudulent collections added to my credit report, my inability to effectively dispute them, and poor customer service that has worsened the situation. Time is critical, as I have a limited window to dispute the validity of these collections. Below are the key issues : 1.Fraudulent Collections Discovered on My Credit Report : Two fraudulent collections attributed to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX have appeared on my credit report. The first reports a balance of {$1000.00}, and the second reports a balance of {$870.00}. Both were added on XX/XX/year>. These accounts are fraudulent and the result of identity theft. I was only able to learn of these collections through XXXX XXXX because I have been unable to access my TransUnion credit report. 
XXXX.Inability to Access Credit Report Since XX/XX/year> : Since XX/XX/XXXX, I have been unable to view my credit report through TransUnion despite repeated attempts. This lack of access prevents me from verifying additional changes to my report or confirming whether disputes I filed have been processed. 
XXXXDispute Portal Malfunction : I currently have an open dispute with TransUnion, but I can not view its status or progress due to repeated errors in the dispute system. This has left me without a reliable way to address or escalate the fraudulent collections in a timely manner. 
XXXX.Conflicting Information and Poor Customer Service XXXX The agents I have spoken with have provided conflicting and unhelpful information. For example : One agent stated that my credit report is only updated weekly, which contradicts TransUnions claims of real-time reporting. 
Another agent discouraged me from mentioning my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) statutes, which I found both unprofessional and dismissive of my rights as a consumer. 
Some agents displayed unhelpful and rude attitudes during our interactions. Screenshots of these interactions are attached as evidence. 

Impact on Me : The combination of fraudulent collections, inaccessible tools, and poor customer service has left me unable to protect my credit profile or resolve issues caused by identity theft. I am at risk of long-term financial harm if these fraudulent collections are not removed promptly. The conflicting information provided by TransUnion agents has further delayed resolution and caused unnecessary stress.

Issue: Problem with a purchase shown on your statement
Sub-issue: Card was charged for something you did not purchase with the card
Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/XXXX : Fraudulent charge appeared on my credit card by XXXX XXXX. I filed a fraud dispute totaling {$99.00} with Bank of America. My cc was canceled, they sent me a new card, and I took all steps to updates passwords, etc. I was told a block was put on the merchant. 

XX/XX/XXXX : New fraudulent charges were made on my new credit card by XXXX XXXX ( {$88.00} ), and XXXX ( {$71.00} ). Updated all passwords, etc. again. 

XX/XX/XXXX : Another fraudulent charge from XXXX XXXX was made on my credit card ( {$99.00} ). Updated all passwords, etc. again. 

XX/XX/XXXX : I filed a new fraud dispute with Bank of America totaling {$250.00} for the charges made by XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, and XXXX XXXX. My credit card was cancelled again, a new cc was issued, and I was told that a block was put on all merchants. 

XX/XX/XXXX : A new fraudulent charge was made on my card from XXXX ( {$71.00} ). I filed ANOTHER fraud dispute with Bank of America. My credit card was canceled AGAIN, and a new card was issued. 

XX/XX/XXXX : a new fraudulent charge was made again on my card from XXXX XXXX ( {$99.00} ). 

It was at this point that I became aware that these are all subscription services and I was now stuck in a subscription trap, and made every attempt to contact the companies to cancel the subscriptions. 

XX/XX/XXXX : I made contact via email with XXXX XXXX and an account made in my name was located and canceled. 

XX/XX/XXXX : I made contact with XXXX XXXX via text, and they were able to locate the fraudulent account under the email address XXXX which is not my email. They confirmed cancellation of the account. 

XX/XX/XXXX : A Billing Dispute was created with Bank of America against XXXX XXXX ( {$99.00} ) for charges made on XX/XX/XXXX. 

I was very upset, angry, and at a loss of what to do with all of the repeated charges on my card. It was suggested by the Bank of America rep, that this time I file a " Billing Dispute '' instead of a fraud claim so that I didn't have to cancel my credit card again. I agreed, even though he didn't fully explain the difference between a billing dispute and a fraud claim. He said my only other option was to cancel my account completely and sign up for a new credit card with new terms. I was livid that this was his suggestion, and refused it. 

XX/XX/XXXX : Another fraudulent, recurring charge was made by XXXX XXXX ( {$100.00} ). 

XX/XX/XXXX : I filed a new fraud dispute with Bank of America, my credit card was canceled, and a new cc was issued with expedited delivery. I was assured by the BOA rep that it wouldn't happen again. I contacted XXXX XXXX, and was told that there is no account in my name, so they were not able to locate it. I am now waiting until XX/XX/XXXX to see if another XXXX XXXX charge is made on my card. 

XX/XX/XXXX : I contacted Bank of America to cancel the Billing Dispute filed on XX/XX/XXXX for {$99.00}, and instead requested to add it to the most current fraud claim against XXXX XXXX for {$100.00}. The BOA rep assured me that she canceled the dispute, and added it the the most recent fraud claim. There is currently no record in my account of these changes being made at all. 

XX/XX/XXXX : I receive notification from Bank of America that they have DENIED my fraud claims from XX/XX/XXXX for XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX because they concluded that " the charges were a subscription or recurring charge that I had paid in the past ''.

This entire process has been exhausting and inexcusable. I plan on escalating the matter to whatever lengths necessary.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Summary : I am being contacted by a debt collection agency regarding a credit card account and charge that has been deemed fraudulent by the issuing credit card company. The issuing credit card company sold that account even though they have provided in writing XXXX that I am not responsible for the charges and now I am dealing with a debt collection agency. Something inappropriate is happening here and needs to be investigated. 

On XX/XX/XXXX I received an XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX and on it there was a transaction for {$490.00}. I do not have an XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX  XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX and I did not make that transaction. I immediately took the following steps : I reported identify theft to the FTC - XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX I froze my credit I open disputes with the credit bureaus I called the credit card issuing bank which is XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX 

Speaking with the fraud depart of XXXX XXXX XXXX, I opened a fraud case XXXX  XXXX. I was told to call back in XXXX weeks. On XX/XX/XXXX, I called back and was told they need more time to complete the investigation. Some time in XXXX I receive a phone call from XXXX XXXX XXXX  asking me when I plan to pay my XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing to formally lodge a complaint regarding the repeated failure of TransUnion, XXXX, and XXXX to properly investigate and validate disputed information on my credit report, as required under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), codified at 15 U.S.C. 1681. Despite my numerous disputes and lawful requests for validation and verification, the credit reporting agencies have failed to provide evidence substantiating their claims and continue to report inaccurate and unverified information. 

To summarize : 1.Failure to Provide Proper Validation : I requested the following documents to validate the alleged debts : Validation of the debt ( including actual accounting ) ; Verification of the claim against me ( such as a sworn affidavit or a hand-signed invoice compliant with the Bills of Exchange Act, XXXX ) ; A true and certified copy of the original contract or agreement binding both parties ; A certified copy of the original note ( credit agreement ) under penalty of perjury, confirming it has not been sold ; Confirmation of the identity of the authorized representative who performed due diligence under the Money Laundering Regulations XXXX. 
These lawful requests were ignored or inadequately addressed. Instead, I received generic responses claiming the information was verified, without any substantive evidence to support these claims. 
2.Violation of 15 U.S.C. 1681i : Under 15 U.S.C. 1681i, credit reporting agencies are required to conduct a reasonable investigation when disputes are raised. Merely stating that the information was verified without providing evidence or details of the investigation constitutes a failure to meet this legal standard. 
3.Reappearance of Removed Items : Items previously removed from my credit report have inexplicably reappeared, raising serious concerns about the integrity of the investigation process and adherence to proper procedures. 
4.Failure to Respond in Good Faith : My repeated attempts to dispute these inaccuracies were met with dismissive responses warning me not to send further disputes. This is both inappropriate and contrary to consumer protection laws under the FCRA. 

Given the severity of these issues, I am requesting immediate action to : 1.Conduct a thorough, independent investigation into the practices of TransUnion, XXXX, and XXXX in handling my disputes ; 2.Ensure compliance with 15 U.S.C. 1681i by requiring the credit reporting agencies to provide documented proof of their investigations and validations ; 3.Remove any and all unverifiable and inaccurate items from my credit reports ; 4.Impose penalties or corrective actions against the credit reporting agencies for non-compliance with FCRA standards.

Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX Consumer Financial Protection Bureau XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, D.C. XXXX Subject : Formal Complaint Regarding Unverified Accounts and Consumer Rights Violations by TransUnion Dear Sir/Madam, I am filing this formal complaint with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) regarding TransUnion 's ongoing verification of inaccurate and unverifiable accounts on my credit report. These incorrect entries have caused significant harm to my credit score and have violated my rights as a consumer under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), and other related consumer protection laws. 

Despite my efforts to dispute these inaccuracies directly with TransUnion, these unverifiable accounts have continued to appear as " verified '' and remain on my credit report. It is evident that TransUnion has failed to investigate the accuracy of these accounts properly and allowed collection agencies to report unverifiable debt. This failure constitutes a clear violation of my rights and is damaging to my credit profile. 

Details of the Violation I have disputed multiple entries on my credit report with TransUnion. However, in several instances, these entries were marked as " verified '' without providing any substantive proof or documentation from the collection agencies to validate the reported debts. This lack of verification and substantiation violates the obligations set forth by the FCRA, and the actions of TransUnion undermine my ability to maintain a fair and accurate credit report. 

Consumer Rights Violated The actions of TransUnion and the collection agencies reporting unverifiable accounts directly violate several consumer rights under federal law : 1. Failure to Verify Information ( FCRA Section 1681i ) The FCRA mandates that credit reporting agencies must investigate disputed information within 30 days. If the information can not be verified, it must be removed from the credit report. TransUnion 's failure to properly verify these accounts is a direct violation of this requirement.

2. Inaccurate Credit Reporting ( FCRA Section 1681e ( b ) ) The law requires that credit reports be maintained with accurate information. By verifying and reporting unverifiable accounts, TransUnion is in violation of this provision, which has resulted in substantial harm to my credit standing.

3. Failure to Provide Adequate Notice of Negative Information ( FCRA Section 1681c ) TransUnion is required to notify me of any negative information added to my report, but they have failed to provide adequate proof of validation for the disputed accounts, which remain on my report without proper substantiation.

4. Unlawful Debt Collection Practices ( FDCPA ) The FDCPA prohibits debt collectors from reporting unverified or unverifiable debts to credit reporting agencies. By allowing collection agencies to report unverifiable accounts, TransUnion is enabling illegal debt collection practices.

Consumer Rights and Legal Protections Under the FCRA and FDCPA, I am entitled to the following rights : Right to Dispute Information ( FCRA Section 1681i ) : I am entitled to dispute inaccurate or unverifiable information on my credit report. TransUnion is required to investigate the dispute and remove any unverifiable accounts within the legally mandated time frame.

Right to Request Documentation ( FCRA Section 1681e ( b ) ) : If an account is verified, I have the right to request detailed documentation, including proof of debt validation from the collection agency reporting the information.

Right to Seek Legal Action : If these rights are violated, I am entitled to pursue legal remedies under both the FCRA and FDCPA, including seeking statutory and actual damages for the harm caused by the inaccuracies.

Requested Resolution I request that the CFPB investigate this matter and intervene to ensure that TransUnion upholds its legal responsibilities under the FCRA and FDCPA. I seek the following resolution : 1. Immediate removal of all unverifiable accounts from my credit report.

2. A full investigation and deletion of these inaccuracies by removing accounts that violate any of my rights as a consumer by any and all laws created and enforsed for the consumer.

3 u. Confirmation from TransUnion that it will take steps to ensure compliance with consumer protection laws.

If this matter is not resolved promptly, I will seek further legal remedies, including filing a lawsuit under the FCRA and FDCPA, and will continue to pursue complaints through all available channels.

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I trust that the CFPB will take the necessary steps to address these violations and help resolve this situation fairly and swiftly. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. Laws Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) : The FCRA outlines the following key provisions ( not exhaustive ) : Section 609 ( a ) ( 1 ) : The consumer has the right to obtain all information in their credit file.

Section 611 ( a ) ( 1 ) : If disputed, consumer reporting agencies must investigate any inaccuracies within 30 days.

Section 605 ( a ) : Consumer reporting agencies can not report negative information older than seven years or bankruptcies older than ten years.

Section 623 ( a ) : Furnishers of information ( creditors ) must provide accurate information to credit bureaus.

Section 605B : Victims of identity theft can request that fraudulent accounts be blocked. 


2. California Consumer Laws : California Civil Code 1785.25 ( a ) : It is unlawful for a person to furnish information to a credit reporting agency if they know or should know the information is inaccurate. 

California Civil Code 1785.16 : Consumers have the right to dispute errors, and credit bureaus must investigate disputes. 


3. Steps to Analyze Negative Accounts : For each negative account, I will : 1. List the account details.

2. Determine which FCRA and California laws are potentially violated.

3. Highlight any data that suggests non-compliance ( e.g., inaccuracies, outdated information, missing investigation after disputes ).

To analyze my report for violations of California Consumer Law and the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), I have broken down the inaccurate or unverifiable accounts with adverse information and cross-reference their reported details with the relevant laws. Here 's the organized data : Inaccurate Accounts and Violations XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX ( Account ending in XXXX ) Details : Original Creditor : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX : {$260.00} Past Due : {$260.00} Remarks : " Account information disputed by consumer ( FCRA ) ; Placed for Collection '' Removal Date : XX/XX/XXXX Potential Violations : FCRA Section 609 ( a ) ( 1 ) : Failure to verify the accuracy of information following a dispute by the consumer.

FCRA Section 611 ( a ) ( 1 ) : Consumer reporting agency 's duty to investigate disputed information within 30 days. 





XXXX. XXXX XXXX ( Account ending in XXXX ) Details : Original Creditor : Automobile Club Balance : {$180.00} Past Due : {$180.00} Remarks : " Account information disputed by consumer ( FCRA ) ; Placed for Collection '' Removal Date : XX/XX/XXXX Violations : California Civil Code 1785.25 ( a ) : Furnisher knowingly providing inaccurate information to a credit bureau.

FCRA Section 623 ( a ) : Obligation of furnishers to ensure information supplied to bureaus is accurate. 


XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Account ending in XXXX ) Details : Original Creditor : Progressive Insurance Balance : {$130.00} Past Due : {$130.00} Remarks : " Account information disputed by consumer ( FCRA ) ; Placed for Collection '' Removal Date : XX/XX/XXXX Potential Violations : FCRA Section 605 ( a ) : Reporting negative information older than 7 years is prohibited.

California Civil Code 1785.16 : Credit bureaus must process disputes and update or remove inaccurate data promptly. 


XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX  ( Account ending in XXXX ) Details : Original Balance : {$390.00} Pay Status : Charge-off Removal Date : XX/XX/XXXX Potential Violations : FCRA Section 623 ( a ) : Furnishers must provide complete and accurate information to consumer reporting agencies.

California Civil Code 1785.16 : Investigation of disputed errors must result in corrections or deletion. 


XXXX. XXXX XXXX ( Account ending in XXXX ) Details : Original Balance : {$220.00} Pay Status : Sold ; was Charged-off Remarks : " Purchased by another lender ; Paid in full/was a charge-off '' Removal Date : XXXX XXXX  Violations : FCRA Section 609 ( a ) ( 1 ) : Failure to provide proof of accuracy for disputed charge-offs.

California Civil Code 1785.25 ( a ) : Inaccurate reporting after the account was " Paid in full/was charged-off ''.

Check if the listed removal dates for negative accounts comply with the 7-year limit ( 10 years for bankruptcies ). 



Yes, my credit report shows instances of duplicate reporting, where the same account or debt is being reported by multiple entities. This typically occurs when an original creditor sells a debt to a collection agency, and both the original account and the collection account are listed on the report. Duplicate reporting can unfairly impact credit score. 

Heres an example from my report : Duplicate XXXX XXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX ( Account ending in XXXX ) Original Creditor : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX : {$260.00} Past Due : {$260.00} Remarks : " Placed for Collection '' XXXX. '' 2. FCRA Section 623 ( b ) ( 1 ) : " After receiving notice of a dispute with regard to the completeness or accuracy of any information provided to a consumer reporting agency, the furnisher of information shall : Conduct an investigation with respect to the disputed information ; Review all relevant information provided by the consumer reporting agency ; Report the results of the investigation to the consumer reporting agency. '' 3. California Civil Code 1785.16 ( a ) : " If the consumer credit reporting agency determines the dispute is frivolous or irrelevant, it shall notify the consumer, and upon request by the consumer, reinvestigate the matter. 3. Failure to Communicate Results : There is no evidence that I was notified of the investigation results or provided with any updated information.

If the collection accounts listed on my credit report do not match my records and Im unable to verify the agencies, balances, or past-due amounts, this may violate my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and California Consumer Credit Reporting Laws . Heres why : Potential Violations of my Rights 1. FCRA Section 609 ( a ) ( 1 ) : Right to Accurate Information Ihave the right to request complete and accurate information about every account reported, including : The name of the creditor or collection agency. 

The original balance, amount owed, and payment history. 

The date the account was opened and placed for collection. 


If the information provided on my credit report is incomplete, inaccurate, or unverifiable, it violates my rights under the FCRA. 

2. FCRA Section 611 ( a ) ( 1 ) : Right to Dispute Inaccuracies If the collection accounts do not match my records, I have the right to dispute the accuracy of the information. The credit bureau and collection agency must : Investigate within 30 days of receiving your dispute.

Provide verification of the debt, including the original creditor and all supporting documentation.

Delete the information if it can not be verified.

Failure to investigate or resolve a dispute violates the FCRA.

3. FCRA Section 623 ( a ) : Responsibilities of Information Furnishers Furnishers ( e.g., collection agencies ) are required to : Report accurate and complete information.

Investigate and correct disputed accounts promptly.

If the balances, past-due amounts, or creditor names are incorrect, it could violate this section.

4. California Civil Code 1785.25 ( a ) : " No person shall furnish information to a consumer credit reporting agency if they know or should know the information is inaccurate. '' If the collection agencies reported inaccurate or unverifiable information, they could be in violation of California law.

5. California Civil Code 1785.16 : Credit reporting agencies must : Investigate disputes within 30 days.

delete unverifiable or inaccurate information.

What This Means for me If the information on the collection accounts ( e.g., agency names, balances, dates, and past-due amounts ) can not be verified or does not match my records, those accounts should be removed from my credit report. Reporting unverifiable or inaccurate information harms my credit and violates my consumer rights.

Based on the details in my credit report, it appears that the collection accounts may be unverifiable for the following reasons : Issues with Verifiability in Collection Accounts XXXX. XXXX XXXX ( Account ending in XXXX ) Original Creditor : Automobile Club Balance : {$180.00} Remarks : " Account information disputed by consumer ( FCRA ) ; Placed for Collection '' Potential Verifiability Issues : The original creditor 's information is vague and may not provide sufficient details about the origin of the debt. 

Theres no supporting documentation ( e.g., account statements, contracts ) showing that I owe this amount. 



XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Account ending in XXXX ) Original Creditor : Progressive Insurance Balance : {$130.00} Remarks : " Account information disputed by consumer ( FCRA ) ; Placed for Collection '' Potential Verifiability Issues : Dispute status remains unresolved, and the agency hasnt provided evidence to validate the debt. 

Missing details on the original account ( e.g., date of delinquency, itemized charges ). 



XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX ( Account ending in XXXX ) Original Creditor : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX : {$260.00} Remarks : " Placed for Collection '' Potential Verifiability Issues : No documentation proving the debt was properly assigned or sold to XXXX XXXX XXXX. 

Original balance details and payment history are unclear. 



XXXX. XXXX XXXX Account ending in XXXX ) Pay Status : " Sold ; was Charged-off '' Balance : {$0.00} Remarks : " Purchased by another lender ; Paid in full/was a charge-off '' Potential Verifiability Issues : Duplicate reporting with XXXX XXXX XXXX suggests conflicting information. 

No proof showing the account transfer or resolution status. 



Indicators of Unverifiable Accounts 1. No Supporting Documentation : Collection agencies must provide clear documentation, such as contracts, account statements, or payment histories, to verify the debt. None of these details are present in my report.

2. Disputes Unresolved : If I have disputed these accounts and the agencies have not responded with adequate validation, they are unverifiable under the FCRA.

3. Conflicting or Missing Details : Original creditor names are unclear or vague. 

Balances and dates do not match my records.

Legal Framework for Verification 1. FCRA Section 611 ( a ) : Consumers Right to Dispute The credit bureau must investigate disputes within 30 days and remove unverifiable information. 



2. FCRA Section 623 ( b ) : Responsibilities of Furnishers Collection agencies must investigate disputes and provide validation to the credit bureau.

3. California Civil Code 1785.25 ( a ) Creditors or agencies can not knowingly report inaccurate or incomplete information.

Key Violations When an Account Is Wrongly Verified as Accurate 1. FCRA Section 611 ( a ) : Failure to Conduct a Reasonable Reinvestigation TransUnion is required to conduct a reasonable reinvestigation of disputed accounts within 30 days of receiving a dispute. 

If the account is wrongly verified as accurate, it indicates that : TransUnion failed to obtain sufficient evidence from the furnisher or creditor. 

They relied solely on the creditor 's response without validating the accuracy of the records. 



2. FCRA Section 623 ( b ) : Furnisher 's Failure to Properly Investigate Furnishers of information ( e.g., collection agencies or creditors ) must : Investigate disputes forwarded by the credit bureau.

delete, or verify the information based on an actual review of their records.

If the furnisher does not provide proper documentation to verify the debt but still reports it as accurate, it violates this section.

3. FCRA Section 609 ( a ) ( 1 ) : Failure to Provide Complete and Accurate Records If TransUnion fails to provide me with the supporting documentation or the original records upon request, this is a violation. 

Verified accounts must be substantiated with legitimate records ( e.g., contracts, statements, or proof of the debt ). 


4. California Civil Code 1785.16 : Duty to Delete Inaccurate Information California law requires credit reporting agencies to delete inaccurate or unverifiable information after a dispute.

If TransUnion verifies inaccurate accounts without proper documentation, it violates this law.

5. California Civil Code 1785.25 ( a ) : Reporting Incomplete or Inaccurate Information Furnishers ( e.g., collection agencies ) must not report incomplete or inaccurate information to credit bureaus.

If TransUnion relies on inaccurate information provided by the furnisher and verifies it, this creates liability for both TransUnion and the furnisher.

6. FCRA Section 605 ( a ) : Reporting Obsolete Information If the account includes outdated information ( e.g., a delinquency older than 7 years ), verifying it as accurate violates this section.

Why This Is Problematic Burden of Proof : The credit bureau can not simply accept the creditor 's response as verification. They must ensure the information is accurate and complete through independent analysis. 

Lack of Transparency : If they fail to provide documentation to back their verification, it indicates a failure to comply with FCRA and California law. 



Under FCRA Section 616 and 617, I may be entitled to damages for willful or negligent noncompliance. This includes statutory damages, actual damages, and legal fees.

Under this regulation, the debt collector must provide clear and accurate information about the debt, including a detailed description of the nature of the debt and the original creditor. This requirement has not been met in my case.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Formal Dispute of Inaccurate Late Payment Reporting Under FCRA from Edfinancial. 
Dear XXXX I am writing to formally dispute the reporting of XXXX instances of XXXX day late payments on my student loan account serviced by Edfinancial , which had a highest balance of {$5500.00} and is now fully paid off as of XX/XX/XXXX. The information reported is inaccurate and does not align with my payment history. 
Legal Basis for Dispute : 1. 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) : Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), credit reporting agencies are required to conduct a reasonable reinvestigation of disputed information within 30 days of receiving a dispute. 2. 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) : Credit reporting agencies must follow reasonable procedures to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of the information they report. The late payments listed for my account are inaccurate and need verification or removal.

3. 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) : Furnishers of information, such as Edfinancial, are prohibited from reporting information they know or reasonably should know to be inaccurate. 4. 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 2 ) : Furnishers are obligated to correct and update information that is incomplete or inaccurate after becoming aware of the issue. Details of the Dispute : Loan Servicer : Edfinancial Accoun
t Information : Student loan opened XX/XX/XXXX. 
Disputed Information : XXXX instances of being XXXX days late are inaccurately reported. Based on my payment records, I believe these entries are incorrect.

Action Requested : I request a reinvestigation of this account and removal of any inaccurate late payment entries. Please provide detailed evidence, including payment records and timelines, to support any claims of delinquency. 
XXXX XXXX social Security XXXX Thank you

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Debt collection
Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Sub-issue: Debt was result of identity theft
Consumer complaint narrative:
Summary : I am being contacted by a debt collection agency regarding a credit card account and charge that has been deemed fraudulent by the issuing credit card company. The issuing credit card company sold that account even though they have provided in writing 3x that I am not responsible for the charges and now I am dealing with a debt collection agency. Something inappropriate is happening here and needs to be investigated. 

On XX/XX/XXXX I received an Ulta Beauty Rewards Mastercard Credit Card bill and on it there was a transaction for {$490.00}. I do not have an Ulta Beauty Rewards Mastercard Credit Card and I did not make that transaction. I immediately took the following steps : I reported identify theft to the FTC - XXXX. # XXXX I froze my credit I open disputes with the credit bureaus I called the credit card issuing bank which is Comenity Capital Bank. 

Speaking with the fraud depart of Comenity Capital Bank, I opened a fraud case # XXXX. I was told to call back in 2 weeks. On XX/XX/XXXX, I called back and was told they need more time to complete the investigation. Some time in XXXX I receive a phone call from Comenity Capital Bank asking me when I plan to pay my Ulta Beauty Rewards Mastercard Credit Card bill. I explained to the fraudulent situation and was transferred to the Comenity Capital Bank fraud group. After explaining again that the card was NOT opened by me and the charge was NOT mine, the fraud representative said they will follow up on my case. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I receive a letter from Comenity Capital Bank that after their thorough investigation of my claim, they have concluded that I am not responsible for the disputed balance amount on the Ulta Beauty Rewards Mastercard credit card account. In addition they have submitted a request to the 3 national credit reporting agency to remove this account from my credit bureau report; signed the Account Protection Team. On the same day of receiving this letter, I wrote a letter to Comenity Capital bank to please forward proof that this fraudulent account has been closed. Instead of receiving proof of the account closed, I received copies of the XX/XX/XXXX letter on XX/XX/XXXX and again on XX/XX/XXXX. 

At this point everything seemed to be completed appropriately until XX/XX/XXXX. I received a letter from Comenity Capital Bank - from their Recovery Team, informing me the Ulta Beauty Rewards Mastercard credit card account was closed, charged off and sold to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. I called Comenity Capital Bank, spoke to someone named XXXX XXXX about how the account was fraudulent, how I have documentation stating I am not responsible for the charges and was assured the issue will be looked into. 

Since XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX has called, sent letters and even provided copies of Ulta Credit card bills that were never delivered to my address. The debt collection agency claims I now owe {$710.00} and if I want to dispute this debt I can write them about it. 

Here is the problem with entire scenario. Not only is my time valuable, the charge was determined by Comenity Capital Bank to not be my responsibility and yet now I am in a position, where I am responsible for defending myself to a debt collector when they shouldn't have access to the account in the first place. There is something inappropriate happening here. Either Comenity is completely incompetent or perhaps they are selling fake overdue accounts. Another possible scenario is the collection agency is working to collect on known resolved accounts and are trying to swindle money from me that I do not owe. This is why I am submitting this complaint. Thank you for your attention to this matter.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to inform you that your recent actions concerning the collection of an alleged debt are in direct violation of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) and applicable state laws. I have thoroughly documented the following For example, repeated calls to my place of employment despite being informed that such calls are not permitted. 

For instance, failure to provide the legally required validation notice within XXXX days of your initial communication with me. 

These actions are not only unlawful but also constitute harassment. The FDCPA ( 15 U.S.C. 1692 ) strictly prohibits debt collectors from engaging in abusive, deceptive, and unfair practices. By violating these regulations, you are liable for damages, including statutory damages of up to {$1000.00} per violation, actual damages, and attorney fees. 

Given the repeated and willful nature of these violations, I am hereby notifying you that I am escalating this matter to the office of the Attorney General of XXXX XXXX  and XXXX. I am also considering additional legal actions against your agency to seek full redress for the harm caused by your actions. 

Effective immediately, I demand that you cease all forms of communication with me and any third parties in connection with this alleged debt. This is a formal cease and desist notice under the FDCPA. Any further communication from your agency, except to confirm receipt of this letter or to provide proof of debt validation as mandated by law, will be considered a further violation and will be documented as such. 

Please be aware that I am fully prepared to take legal action if these violations continue. This letter serves as evidence that I have provided your agency with notice of your violations and of my intent to pursue legal remedies. 

I expect a response in writing within XXXX  days of receipt of this letter, confirming your compliance with my requests. Failure to respond adequately will result in additional legal action, and a copy of this letter will be forwarded to the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) as well. Remove these fraudelent tradelines off of my credit report as I have attahced XXXX identity theft reports below.

I Used " WISE.COM '' to transfer XXXX {$200.00} to XXXX in the XXXX XXXX, on XX/XX/XXXX. The Company implemented a new third party for funds transfer called " PLAID ''. MY ACCOUNT log in was altered and transfer screens were changed. Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Old information reappears or never goes away
Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing to formally lodge a complaint regarding the repeated failure of XXXX, XXXX, and Equifax to properly investigate and validate disputed information on my credit report, as required under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), codified at 15 U.S.C. 1681. Despite my numerous disputes and lawful requests for validation and verification, the credit reporting agencies have failed to provide evidence substantiating their claims and continue to report inaccurate and unverified information.

To summarize : 1.Failure to Provide Proper Validation : I requested the following documents to validate the alleged debts : Validation of the debt ( including actual accounting ) ; Verification of the claim against me ( such as a sworn affidavit or a hand-signed invoice compliant with the Bills of Exchange Act, XXXX ) ; A true and certified copy of the original contract or agreement binding both parties ; A certified copy of the original note ( credit agreement ) under penalty of perjury, confirming it has not been sold ; Confirmation of the identity of the authorized representative who performed due diligence under the Money Laundering Regulations XXXX. 
These lawful requests were ignored or inadequately addressed. Instead, I received generic responses claiming the information was verified, without any substantive evidence to support these claims. 
2.Violation of 15 U.S.C. 1681i : Under 15 U.S.C. 1681i, credit reporting agencies are required to conduct a reasonable investigation when disputes are raised. Merely stating that the information was verified without providing evidence or details of the investigation constitutes a failure to meet this legal standard.

3.Reappearance of Removed Items : Items previously removed from my credit report have inexplicably reappeared, raising serious concerns about the integrity of the investigation process and adherence to proper procedures.

4.Failure to Respond in Good Faith : My repeated attempts to dispute these inaccuracies were met with dismissive responses warning me not to send further disputes. This is both inappropriate and contrary to consumer protection laws under the FCRA. 

Given the severity of these issues, I am requesting immediate action to : 1.Conduct a thorough, independent investigation into the practices of XXXX, XXXX, and Equifax in handling my disputes ; 2.Ensure compliance with 15 U.S.C. 1681i by requiring the credit reporting agencies to provide documented proof of their investigations and validations ; 3.Remove any and all unverifiable and inaccurate items from my credit reports ; 4.Impose penalties or corrective actions against the credit reporting agencies for non-compliance with FCRA standards.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Shellpoint made an Unauthorized credit to my loan principal for {$7900.00}. I requested the refund on XXXX XX/XX/XXXX and they told me it would take 3 business days which was due Friday, XXXX XX/XX/XXXX. After not getting my money I called and they said I wouldn't get my money back until XXXX XX/XX/XXXX. After that date no money was received so I called again and they said would be 14 business days since the request. But still nothing. I chatted with Shellpoint on XXXX XX/XX/XXXX and the representative said " No ETA at this time showing on the notes ''. 
I don't understand why this happened in the first place. The money was a wire transfer my husband made on XXXX XX/XX/XXXX to reinstate my loan that was in foreclosure. Unfortunately, he made a mistake in the reference number so Shellpoint couldn't identify the destination, or at least that's what they told me the many times I called trying to fix the problem. After many unsuccessful attempts, and because Shellpoint sent a new reinstatement letter that we needed to pay, we ended up recalling the wire on XXXX XX/XX/XXXX and counting with the money going back to us. We had to borrow money from friends to be able to pay the new reinstatement letter. I made many calls following up on the recall but all the time they said they didn't know anything. Until XXXX XX/XX/XXXX when we called and to our surprise they said Shellpoint credited the money to my loan on XXXX XX/XX/XXXX. Does it make any sense? The wire was recalled first of all on XXXX XX/XX/XXXX. And in all my calls and emails I was very " very clear '' that I needed this money back asap. I NEVER AUTHORIZE SHELLPOINT TO PUT THAT MONEY IN MY LOAN. I RECALLED THE WIRE ON XXXX XX/XX/XXXX. XXXX ASKED AT LEAST 5 TIMES SHELLPOINT TO AUTHORIZE THE RECALL BUT SHELLPOINT " NEVER ANSWERED ''. INSTEAD, THEY PUT THE MONEY IN MY LOAN PRINCIPAL. 
I spoke with many customer service agents, all the time I had to tell the story again and again, most of them did not know anything and were unable to answer my questions, they just said to wait or create a ticket or escalate the ticket. I asked them if I could talk to a supervisor or to someone to get help but always they denied saying I can't talk to anybody. My family is suffering right now because we needed the money since XXXX. We have debts to pay. We have to pay the mortgage tomorrow and we don't have any money. I don't understand how Shellpoint deals with people. There's no access to a supervisor or wire department, ( I sent them many emails none of them replied ). Many bankers told me that it's absurd. That the recall was supposed to be resolved a long time ago. XXXX told XXXX that they asked at least 5 times Shellpoint to authorize the debt to do the refund but Shellpoint never answered the request of XXXX. Why??? I already made a complaint with XXXX  and so far no response. I hope with this complaint I get some answer because I don't know what else to do. Should I go to an attorney or bring Shellpoint to court? In another call I spoke with XXXX, and she said my refund request was made on Friday, XXXX XX/XX/XXXX. That's a lie! I called 3 days before and spoke with a guy XXXX he was the one doing the refund request and he said it would take 3 business days. Why XXXX didn't see that? Do you see what I'm saying? Shellpoint is a Mess! the agents are lost! they don't know what they doing or saying! it's just ridiculous! Shellpoint doesn't care for the clients. I remember with another mortgage institution I had access to an account manager that would call me or email me directly with concerns about my account. Shellpoint doesn't have anything close to that. There are just agents answering calls or chatting but doing nothing... I don't know who really takes care of issues like mine. This is important. I NEED MY MONEY ASAP PLEASE! I need to pay my mortgage and I don't have the money now I might go into foreclosure again... is that what they are relooking for? so they can take more money from me? Please help me.

OnXX/XX/2024 I sent an email to TrueAccord requesting that all communications regarding my alleged debt be conducted via mail and not via email. Specifically, I asked for proof of the debt and verification of their authority to collect the debt in the state of South Carolina to be sent to the physical address they have on file. 

Despite my clear instructions, I received a response via email from TrueAccord onXX/XX/2024. This response ignored my request to cease email communication. 

On XX/XX/2024, I sent a second email reiterating my request under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), clearly stating that all future correspondence, including validation documentation, must be sent to my physical address. I emphasized that continued email communication would be a violation of the FDCPA. 

However, on XX/XX/2024, I received yet another email from TrueAccord. This third email again ignored my request and sought my consent to receive validation documentation via email. 

Over the course of three communications ( on XX/XX/XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ), I explicitly requested TrueAccord to cease email communication and send all correspondence via mail. Despite these repeated requests, they have continued to email me, violating the FDCPA and disregarding my consumer rights. 

I am seeking assistance to ensure that TrueAccord complies with my request to communicate solely via mail and ceases their unlawful email communications immediately.

Product: Credit card
Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Issue: Advertising and marketing, including promotional offers
Sub-issue: Didn't receive advertised or promotional terms
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/year> I made a purchase online at XXXX XXXX in the amount of {$3700.00}. American Express advertises on their website that you will earn 3 % cash back on XXXX XXXX XXXX purchases, up to {$6000.00} per year, then 1 % above {$6000.00}. Once the transaction posted, only 1 % cash back was earned. Despite it meeting the terms of it being an online purchase, and not being specifically excluded it did not earn the advertised 3 % cash back. 

If you look at the following information published by American Express ( https : //www.americanexpress.com/us/rewards-info/retail.html ) you will see that XXXX XXXX XXXX purchases includes Furniture Stores , one example listed, with the disclaimer that it is not a complete list. It is also not on the excluded list. 

Having met all the requirements to earn the 3 % cash back, it has not been credited. This is a bait and switch and I would not have used this credit card to make that purchase had I known American Express would claim ignorance regarding categorizing this transaction as an online purchase, due to some obscure and opaque transaction classification. This results in the consumer having to take all the risk and American Express receiving the benefit of the card being used for the purchase, and then subsequently deny a benefit which it widely advertises. Clearly this is a bait and switch and false advertising. 

American Express knows exactly which transactions are an online purchase. One example is that a CVV code was used to authorize the transaction, and there was no swipe or tap, or chip inserted. Additionally, American Express is aware that it is a retail transaction as it is categorized as Merchandise & Supplies - Furnishing. American Express is willfully denying benefits it advertises by using arbitrary reasons to deny the benefit despite them clearly being aware that the transaction was an online XXXX retail purchase. 

This should be investigated and this unfair consumer practice should be stopped.
