XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, GA XXXX Chex Systems , Inc . 
Attn : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, MN XXXX Subject : Formal Dispute and Demand for Investigation Regarding Inaccurate Account Reporting To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to dispute the adverse information associated with my name, XXXX XXXX, and Social Security number in your records. This letter serves as my formal demand for a comprehensive investigation under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and other applicable consumer protection laws. The following accounts and details are under dispute : Disputed Accounts and Details 1. Reported By : XXXX XXXX  Name on Record : XXXX XXXX Reported Address : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, GA XXXX SSN : XXXX Date of Closure : XX/XX/XXXX Account Number : XXXX Original Charge Off Amount : {$200.00} Closure Status : Unpaid XXXX. Reported By : XXXX XXXX  Name on Record : XXXX XXXX Reported Address : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, GA XXXX SSN : XXXX Date of Closure : XX/XX/XXXX Account Number : XXXX Original Charge Off Amount : {$150.00} Closure Status : Paid in Full XXXX. Reported By : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX on Record : XXXX XXXX XXXX Reported Address : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, GA XXXX SSN : XXXX Date of Closure : XX/XX/XXXX Account Number : XXXX Original Charge Off Amount : {$2500.00} Closure Status : Unpaid XXXX. Reported By : XXXX XXXX  Name on Record : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Reported Address : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, GA XXXX SSN : XXXX Date of Closure : XX/XX/XXXX Account Number : XXXX Original Charge Off Amount : {$300.00} Closure Status : Unpaid Basis for Dispute 1. Unauthorized Reporting : I have not authorized or provided consent for the reporting of this information to third-party agencies. Please provide documentation, including contracts signed with my wet-ink signature, proving my explicit consent for these records to appear on my consumer report.

2. Inaccuracies in Reporting : The details provided are inaccurate, incomplete, and unverified. As per FCRA Section 611, I request an immediate investigation and verification of these records to ensure compliance with federal laws.

3. Permissible Purpose : I demand evidence of your compliance with 15 U.S.C. 1681b ( a ), showing that you had a legitimate permissible purpose to access and report my information. 

Request for Documentation Within 5 days, I demand the following documents for each disputed account : 1. All records, agreements, and contracts bearing my signature that establish the validity of the reported information.

2. Verified evidence showing compliance with FCRA and communication records from the data furnishers.

3. Details of the investigation and the methods used to validate the adverse information.

Cease and Desist Until this dispute is resolved, I demand that ChexSystems cease and desist from reporting or sharing any information regarding these accounts. Continuation of reporting unverified information constitutes defamation and harassment, and it subjects ChexSystems to potential civil liability under the FCRA and FDCPA.

Legal Reservation This letter serves as a good-faith effort to resolve the matter. I reserve all rights under U.C.C. 1-308 and applicable consumer protection laws. Failure to respond appropriately within the allotted time frame will be taken as your agreement to remove the disputed information from my consumer file.

I trust you will address this matter promptly. Please contact me at your earliest convenience to confirm receipt of this letter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX Without Prejudice, U.C.C. 1-308

Product: Checking or savings account
Sub-issue: Account opened without my consent or knowledge
Consumer complaint narrative:
To whom it concerns, As a Financial Instituion, A Bank must investigate and conduct a reasonable proper investigation of unauthorized transactions. Independent Financial is attempting to Dishonor Regulation E, and Believes they are above all Financial Regulations and Rules. To protect consumers, the Electronic Fund Transfer Act ( EFTA ), as implemented by Regulation E, requires financial institutions to investigate when a consumer notifies them of an error for an electronic fund transfer ( EFT ), to communicate the results within specific timelines and correct the error if one is found, and to limit the consumers liability if the error involves unauthorized transactions. Independent Financial not only denied my unauthorized transaction claim, they closed and " Ended the Banking Relationship '' as they state so they do not have to provide further evidence. I believe this bank is violating Regulation E Guidelines, and I do not believe they are conducting proper investigations, I will provide some evidence below. First and foremost, the Bank has not only falsely accused me, they have not provided sufficient supporting documentation which is in my right to request either. Independent Financial was notified on XX/XX/XXXX that my debit card and pin number and wallet and phone were stolen. At the same time a dispute was opened. Transactions had occurred at multiple places, when I was able to review the transaction history by statement that I had to call in and request. First and foremost these transactions were conducted at a XXXX XXXX In XXXX Oklahoma, and a XXXX XXXX in XXXX Oklahoma. I live in XXXX, Texas. These locations are between 2-3 Hours away from me. I did not visit these merchants or establishments at any point in time, and I did not conduct business at these merchants. I will provide further transaction evidence below. I notified Independent Financial within 60 Day 's Which is required by law. Once you receive your statement, If you determine there is an error on the account, then you must notify the bank promptly which is what I have done. Instead of conducting a proper regulation E investigation, It was determined by XXXX XXXX, that He doesn't have to conduct an investigation. By Email his response said he conducted his own " Review '' Investigation and determined that no error occurred. In the claim Denial letter it states I can request Documentation used in their investigation by calling Customer Service. However XXXX has stated that he does not have to provide documentation used in his investigation because he doesn't believe he has to. Even though it states that on company letter head. So he has advised XXXX XXXX to close and end the banking relationship, To shush me from calling in and requesting documentation used in their investigation. Instead of Following Banking Guidelines the bank chooses to end the customer relationship, and instead FALSELY accuse the customer the victim of theft of being the one conducting the theft. This is false. Secondly, They state that the transactions were conducted at my Home Address. That's not possible because the merchants themselves, XXXX and XXXX XXXX said that the transactions occurred by Physical Card swipe, and Pin Key. So again this is false information they are providing in their response. They also state they previously responded to the matter on XX/XX/XXXX and in their response their " Review Concluded that the activity in the account was believed to be intentional '' Therefore they were unable to approve the claim. As I stated previously, When a wallet is stolen and you are robbed for your wallet, That is not intentional. No victim would choose to have their wallet robbed or intentionally stolen. I believe based on that statement that the bank is bias and proceeding to write false information and hate against a victim of theft in efforts to not have to resolve the issues at hand. The Bank has not conducted a proper investigation. It is not possible to pay for XXXX or XXXX XXXX from my home. I did not grant anyone permission to use my account, I did not intentionally get robbed or choose that either. This is slander for one, and I really believe the CFPB Should further investigate into this financial institution for what they are writing to consumers. XXXX XXXX may have proceeded from the theft. That's why he can't conduct a proper investigation. At this point it isn't clear. I filed a police report after Independent Financial Demanded I file one, and the police department Detective Page from the XXXX Police Department was investigating the crime however someone from Independent financial named XXXX called her and told her they would conduct their own investigation and that they did not want XXXX Police Department to further investigate the crime. XXXX. A Bank is responsible for fraudulent transactions that are conducted from a stolen Debit card and unauthorized EFT Transfer. The Bank is refusing to cooperate because the bank would rather end customer relationships, and hope that the customer doesn't pursue legal means to fight the bank in a court of law. At this point Independent Financial has stolen over {$5000.00} from me and It's unacceptable. I have provided documentation proof. The bank ended the customer relationship because the bank knows that I didn't conduct the fraud, If the bank wants to continue to falsely slander me, then I want documentation proof that shows that I was intentionally robbed. I do not want to see a false accusation in their response again. The bank believes they are above all consumer protection laws, they are financially abusing customers and victims of fraud. They fail to follow their due diligence when opening customers accounts. As I stated it's not possible to conduct a transaction that requires a physical customer signature and or physical customer card insert from your home address. However according to independent financial that the transactions occurred from my physical home address in XXXX Texas, and somehow processed in XXXX Oklahoma and XXXX Oklahoma. Which is not possible. I am a victim of fraud, and I do believe at this point Independent Financial owes me documentation used in their investigation, an apology letter, and XXXX XXXX. As, Independent Financial has bypassed following the EFT ACT, and Has attempted to bypass XXXX XXXX Liability Policy, and Lastly, has definitely bypassed investigating the unauthorized transactions that occurred with the stolen debit card and pin. Much less to their statement of stating that I conducted the transactions intentionally, from my home address WHICH IS FALSE. As I stated previously, No one wants to be intentionally robbed. I stated where I was robbed, and I provided supporting documentation. An Identity Theft Affidavit, A Police Report, and Proof that the police report listed the transactions from Independent Financial. Independent Financial can end the banking relationship that is fine, because I didn't do anything. I am a victim of theft, and I did not intentionally rob myself. That doesn't make sense and that is not conducting a proper investigation. I am requesting Documentation used in their investigation, and I am requesting that the bank be investigated for Violating Consumer Laws and Rights. Especially Regulation E. Since this bank is a CFPB Regulated bank, I would like for Independent Financial to be investigated by the CFPB. Regulation E is not being followed by this bank, and instead they are falsely accusing consumers that are victims of theft and fraud, and refusing to conduct a proper investigation, refusing to provide documentation. If a Claim is Denied a Bank must provide supporting documentation that strongly supports the denial at a consumers request, which this bank is refusing to honor. In their Letter on Company Letter head it even states I am entitled to request documentation used in their investigation. However when I did so, they told me they have to transfer me to XXXX XXXX and they called over XXXX XXXX XXXX and got no response. They have no documentation. Truly, all the Bank has done is slander and falsely accuse me the victim of fraud. The Bank owes me for the fraudulent transactions and I fully expect my cashiers check or funds. I can pickup in branch. I am not going away, and I do not believe my issues are being addressed. Also I never filed a dispute on any online banking transfers that occurred. I filed a dispute on the transactions listed below which occurred by PHYSICAL CARD SWIPE AND BY ENTERING THE CARD NUMBER. This requires a pin number and additionally, these transactions correlate to me being robbed. I did not intentionally rob myself, and I did not intentionally have anyone rob me. However in their latest response it states that I said I disputed the online banking transfers that occurred which is false. The Transactions I have listed below all show to be physical card swipes POS transactions and ATM Withdrawals and these are the transactions I have disputed. These transactions are unauthorized. These transactions are protected by mastercard XXXX liability policy, and Additionally, In the rules and regulations these transactions are protected by Regulation E. I did not intentionally conduct these transactions. These transactions were conducted and my wallet and card and pin were stolen as I mentioned these transactions were not conducted from my home address it's very frustrating to be told and slandered that you were intentionally robbed. No one wants to intentionally be robbed I assure you that. I did not conduct these charges. I listed the transactions below and also on my police report. The Police Report that is attached, and the email submission picture proof shows that the report was filed with these listed transactions to the XXXX Police Department. This is further proof that I am a victim of fraud. Again I am not disputing Online Transfers. I am disputing transactions I did not conduct with a card and pin that were stolen. Robbed. I am a victim of robbery/theft and not the person whom conducted the transactions.

The purpose of formally disputing inaccurate and unverifiable information being reported on my credit report by XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) concerning an alleged debt from XXXX XXXX. I have no knowledge of this debt, have never received any communication regarding it from either XXXX XXXX  or XXXX XXXX XXXX prior to its appearance on my credit report, and XXXX XXXX XXXX has reported an address associated with this debt where I have never resided. 

XXXX. Unrecognized Debt and Lack of Communication : I have no recollection of incurring any debt with XXXXXXXX XXXX I have never received any notices, letters, phone calls, or other forms of communication from either XXXXXXXX XXXX or XXXX XXXX XXXX regarding this alleged debt before it was reported to XXXX. 
XXXX. Inaccurate Address XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  has reported an address XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX associated with this alleged debt. I have never resided at this address. 
XXXX. Lack of Relationship with XXXX XXXX XXXX  : I have no contractual agreement or business relationship with XXXX XXXX XXXX. I have not provided them with any personal information or authorized them to collect any debt on my behalf. 
XXXX. Potential XXXX Related Issue : The timeframe of this alleged debt appears to fall within the XXXX pandemic period, during which specific protections were in place regarding evictions and debt collection. I suspect this may be related to fraudulent activity exploiting these protections. 

FCRA Violations : I believe the reporting of this debt violates several provisions of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), including but not limited to : FCRA XXXX XXXX ( a ) ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c ( a ) ) Prohibits reporting inaccurate information. Reporting a debt I was never notified of, associated with an address I never lived at, is inaccurate. 

FCRA XXXX XXXX ( a ) ( XXXX ) ( A ) ( 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( a ) ( XXXX ) ( A ) ) : Requires furnishers to provide accurate information. Both XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXX have failed to do so.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing to demand immediate action to address the inaccurate, damaging, and negligent reporting related to XXXX American Express XXXX and a lawsuit filed against me that has since been dismissed for want of prosecution ( XXXX  ). Despite my efforts over the past XXXX years to provide evidence of identity theft, neither American Express nor the credit bureaus ( XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX ) have taken appropriate steps to resolve this matter. 

Here are the critical facts of this issue : XXXX. Identity Theft and Disputed Accounts : I was a victim of identity, a time during which XXXX American Express accounts in good standing were fraudulently used. 
I provided police reports and a Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) Identity Theft Report to American Express and the credit bureaus, documenting this crime and disputing the debts. 
Despite clear evidence that these debts were not mine, American Express refused to acknowledge the theft or resolve the accounts appropriately. 
XXXX. Lawsuit Filed and Dismissed : American Express National Bank pursued legal action against me in 2024, despite the ongoing identity theft dispute and my inability to pay for debts that were not mine. 
On XX/XX/year>, the court dismissed the case for want of prosecution ( DWOP ), with no judgment entered against me. This dismissal further supports my position that this debt is invalid and should not have been pursued in the first place.

3. Credit Reporting Negligence : Despite the dismissal and my repeated disputes, all three credit bureaus continue to report inaccurate and derogatory information related to these accounts and lawsuit.

The excuse provided by XXXX  the lawsuit was filed and therefore can not be removedis baseless given that the case was dismissed, and the accounts were the result of identity theft. 
The continued failure to address this issue violates the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), which mandates accurate and fair credit reporting. 

This negligence has severely impacted my credit standing and financial stability for years. The prolonged failure to remove fraudulent accounts and the erroneous lawsuit from my credit file has caused undue hardship, limiting my ability to rebuild after the closure of my business.

Product: Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan
Consumer complaint narrative:
On or around the XXXX of XXXX I purchased two XXXX XXXX XXXX from the XXXX  for seats in the new stadium. I was informed after making a 20 % down payment that my monthly payments would be directly debited from my account. I have had seasons tickets with the XXXX  for over 20 years. The XXXX licenses cost {$10000.00} each. 
I gave them my credit card and they had me sign a Loan Agreement with M & T Bank for the balance of the funds. 
I next received a call from M & T 's customer service department looking for the details of my account again, after I supplied them on the purchase contract. I provided the necessary information and thought I had done everything I needed to do, subsequently I received a collection call from M & T indicating I was in arrears, I once again provided my bank account details and once again thought this was finished, since that time I have received numerous collection calls, one a week and during this journey received the answer for the calls was because M & T could not access my bank account. I am a XXXX resident, but gave them a USD account at my XXXX XXXX  ( XXXX ) consistently. M & T 's inability to direct debit became my problem, so in discussions with M & T collection personnel I forwarded four checks in payment of my loan whilst they figured out what they have to do to rectify the problem on their end. Needless to say the calls kept coming after I posted the checks, we did have a Postal Disruption in XXXX, these calls are flat out harassment, what can I do to insure M & T makes a direct debit. I have discussed alternatives, but M & T will not cover the wire costs if I wire or use XXXX XXXX, note the payments are {$210.00} a month, a wire costs {$45.00}. 
I am looking for M & T to figure out a way to direct debit and live up to the terms of the original contract. Why was I assured by both The Bills and M & T that this was an acceptable means of repaying my loan at time of origination and subsequently?

They did not contest the bankruptcy when given the opportunity After I filed my XXXX tax return, I received a 1099-C in the mail from Oportun at the end of XXXX of XXXX. The 1099-C stated that my debt was " forgiven '' when it was not, it wa

s discharged in bankruptcy. The IRS and State of NJ informed me that I had to include the 1099-C and amend my tax return. I filed all the necessary forms to show that the debt on the 1099-C was discharged in bankruptcy and therefore not taxable. Due to the way the 1099-C was issued, I've been forced to pay the IRS {$1000.00} as taxes on the money that was " forgiven '' by Oportun.

Due to Oportun 's inaccurate 1099-C, I'm being forced to pay taxes on debt that was discharged in bankruptcy. This is illegal and unconstitutional. I've tried to reach out to Oportun to have the 1099-C corrected but they refuse to do so.

I am filing a formal complaint against GreenState Credit Union for multiple violations of the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ) under U.S. Code 1638 ( a ). Despite my formal demand letter dated XX/XX/year>, the credit union has failed to address or resolve these violations. 

Details of the Violations : 1. Improper Itemization of Fees : The loan agreement fails to properly itemize prepaid finance charges such as XXXX XXXX, dealer fees, and state lien fees, violating 1638 ( a ) ( 2 ).

2. Inaccurate APR Disclosure : The disclosed APR of 6.69 % does not align with the finance charge and loan amount, indicating a potential understatement in violation of 1638 ( a ) ( 4 ).

3. Ambiguous Terms : The agreement includes a Variable Rate clause without providing the necessary disclosures required under 1638 ( a ) ( 7 ).

4. Failure to Disclose Late Fees : The contract does not clearly disclose late fees or collection costs, violating 1638 ( a ) ( 9 ). 
5. Inadequate Breakdown of Total Sale Price : The total sale price lacks transparency, failing to differentiate between vehicle cost and financing charges, in violation of 1638 ( a ) ( 5 ).

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, WI XXXX XX/XX/year> Portfolio Recovery Associates LLC XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX VA XXXX **Subject : ** Cease and Desist Request Under 15 U.S.C. 1692c ( c ) Dear Portfolio Recovery Associates This letter serves as a formal request, pursuant to the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), 15 U.S.C. 1692c ( c ), that you immediately cease and desist from any and all further communication with me regarding the alleged debt referenced in your prior correspondence. 

Please be advised that I am fully aware of my rights under the FDCPA. Under 15 U.S.C. 1692c ( c ), upon receipt of this written request, you are legally prohibited from contacting me except to confirm your compliance with this request or to notify me of specific legal actions you may pursue. 

I demand that you immediately stop all forms of communication with me, including but not limited to : - Phone calls- Letters - Emails - Text messages- Any other form of contact Failure to comply with this request will constitute a violation of the FDCPA, and I will not hesitate to report such violations to the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and my state Attorney General 's office. I also reserve the right to pursue any and all legal remedies available to me. 

This letter does not serve as an acknowledgment of any debt, nor does it serve as a waiver of my rights under the FDCPA or any other applicable federal or state law. 

Please confirm in writing that you have received this notice and that all further communications have been terminated. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. 



Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear SoFi Bank, I am writing to express my serious concern regarding your handling of a dispute I filed on several denied claims concerning unauthorized or incorrect transactions on my accoun. 

Despite submitting all the necessary documentation and providing clear evidence to support my claim, I was informed that the dispute was either denied or delayed without proper justification within the required timeframe of fewer than 48 hours. This delay and subsequent denial directly contravene your obligation to provide timely responses under federal regulations, specifically the Electronic Fund Transfer Act ( EFTA ) and Regulation E guidelines for dispute investigations. 

The following points illustrate my concerns : Failure to Respond Timely : My dispute was submitted on several dates, and I was assured that it would be addressed promptly. However, as of XX/XX/year>, no action has been taken or communicated in a timely manner. 
Dismissal Without Proper Investigation : Your denial appears to lack adequate explanation or supporting evidence, leaving me to question whether my claim was properly reviewed. 
Violation of Consumer Protection Standards : As a customer, I have the right to expect due diligence in handling legitimate disputes, especially when they involve potential financial fraud or errors. 
The transactions in question are clearly unauthorized, as I provided evidence showing I did not make the charges, I had never done business with XXXX, and several merchant charges happened online. I request an immediate and thorough review of my case, along with a detailed explanation of your investigation process and the reason for the denial or delay. You have restricted my bank account of an XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX without just cause. You have tarnished this nations reputation by your actions Failure to address this matter promptly will leave me no choice but to escalate this issue by filing a complaint with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and other relevant authorities. I value my relationship with SoFi Bank and hope this matter can be resolved amicably and efficiently. 

Please respond to this complaint within 24. You may contact me at XXXX or email if further information is required. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing to formally lodge a complaint regarding the repeated failure of XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX to XXXX investigate and validate disputed information on my credit report, as required under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), codified at 15 U.S.C. 1681. Despite my numerous disputes and lawful requests for validation and verification, the credit reporting agencies have failed to provide evidence substantiating their claims and continue to report inaccurate and unverified information. 

To summarize : 1.Failure to Provide Proper Validation : I requested the following documents to validate the alleged debts : Validation of the debt ( including actual accounting ) ; Verification of the claim against me ( such as a sworn affidavit or a hand-signed invoice compliant with the Bills of Exchange Act, 1882 ) ; A true and certified copy of the original contract or agreement binding both parties ; A certified copy of the original note ( credit agreement ) under penalty of perjury, confirming it has not been sold ; Confirmation of the identity of the authorized representative who performed due diligence under the Money Laundering Regulations 2007. 
These lawful requests were ignored or inadequately addressed. Instead, I received generic responses claiming the information was verified, without any substantive evidence to support these claims.

2.Violation of 15 U.S.C. 1681i : Under 15 U.S.C. 1681i, credit reporting agencies are required to conduct a reasonable investigation when disputes are raised. Merely stating that the information was verified without providing evidence or details of the investigation constitutes a failure to meet this legal standard.

3.Reappearance of Removed Items : Items previously removed from my credit report have inexplicably reappeared, raising serious concerns about the integrity of the investigation process and adherence to proper procedures.

4.Failure to Respond in Good Faith : My repeated attempts to dispute these inaccuracies were met with dismissive responses warning me not to send further disputes. This is both inappropriate and contrary to consumer protection laws under the FCRA. 

Given the severity of these issues, I am requesting immediate action to : 1.Conduct a thorough, independent investigation into the practices of XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX in handling my disputes ; 2.Ensure compliance with 15 U.S.C. 1681i by requiring the credit reporting agencies to provide documented proof of their investigations and validations ; 3.Remove any and all unverifiable and inaccurate items from my credit reports ; 4.Impose penalties or corrective actions against the credit reporting agencies for non-compliance with FCRA standards.

Product: Debt collection
Sub-issue: Didn't receive enough information to verify debt
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX F.H. Cann & Associates , Inc. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Subject : Cease and Desist Demand Regarding Alleged Debt Reference XXXX XXXX  Dear F.H. Cann & Associates , Inc., This letter serves as formal notice that I dispute the alleged debt associated with the above reference number and demand that you cease and desist all communication and collection activities related to this matter immediately. 

Violation of Debt Collection Laws Upon review of your correspondence and alleged collection practices, I believe your actions violate multiple laws, including the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), 15 U.S.C. 1692 et seq., and other federal statutes, as follows : 1. Improper Assignment of Debt ( 812 ( a ) ) The letter you provided names XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX as the original creditor. However, it appears that XXXX XXXX no longer owns this debt. If the debt was transferred or sold, your attempts to collect while referencing XXXX XXXX create a false and deceptive belief that XXXX XXXX is still participating in the collection effort. This violates 15 U.S.C. 1692e and 812 ( a ).

2. Extortionate Practices ( 18 U.S.C. 894 ) Your attempt to collect on this alleged debt, without proper proof of ownership or authority, amounts to extortionate practices. Under 18 U.S.C. 894, the use of any implicit or explicit threat to collect an extension of credit by improper means is strictly prohibited.

3. Failure to Provide Proper Validation Pursuant to 15 U.S.C. 1692g, your notice fails to meet the required standards for debt validation. Specifically : It does not adequately validate the debt with clear evidence of ownership and a full accounting of the alleged amount. 
It does not provide proof that you have the legal authority to collect this debt, as required under federal law. 

Demand for Immediate Action 1. Cease All Collection Activities I demand that you immediately cease and desist all communication with me regarding this alleged debt. Any further contact, including phone calls, letters, or other communications, will be considered harassment and reported to the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), and other relevant authorities.

2. Drop All Debt Collection Actions If you can not provide indisputable proof of your legal authority to collect this debt, I demand that you drop all collection actions and update your records to reflect that no further action should be taken against me. 
3. Provide Proof of Ownership and Validation If you intend to continue pursuing this matter, you must furnish : Documentation proving that the alleged debt is valid, including a signed agreement or contract ; Evidence that you lawfully own or have been assigned the debt ; A full accounting of the alleged amount owed.

Notice of My Rights Under the FDCPA, you are prohibited from contacting me further unless you can fully validate the debt and prove your legal authority to collect. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Complaint Against Resurgent Capital Services for FDCPA Violations and Failure to Validate Debt Details of the Complaint : 1. Background : I am filing this complaint regarding Resurgent Capital Services failure to provide proper validation of a debt they claim I owe under Account Number XXXX. I have repeatedly requested debt validation in compliance with the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) ( 15 U.S.C. 1692g ), but the company has failed to provide sufficient and legally required documentation to substantiate the debt. 

- On XX/XX/year>, I sent a formal request for debt validation. 
- On XX/XX/year>, I received an incomplete response that failed to include : - An agreement with the original creditor authorizing Resurgent Capital Services to collect on the alleged debt. 
- A signed agreement bearing my name as the alleged debtor. 
- A complete accounting or itemization of the alleged debt. 
- Any documentation proving my obligation to pay. 

Additionally, I requested verification of Resurgent Capital Services acquisition of the debt, including a complete chain of title and proof that the debt was acquired lawfully. This documentation was also not provided. 

2. Follow-Up : On XX/XX/year>, I sent a second letter reiterating my demand for proper validation and informing Resurgent Capital Services that they were in violation of the FDCPA. To date, I have not received an adequate response.

3. Violations of Federal Law : Resurgent Capital Services has violated the following : - 15 U.S.C. 1692g ( b ) : Failing to provide proper debt validation within the legally mandated timeframe.

- 15 U.S.C. 1692e ( 8 ) : Continuing to report unverified information to credit reporting agencies. 

These violations have caused undue stress and potential damage to my creditworthiness. 

4. Requested Resolution : I respectfully request that the CFPB investigate Resurgent Capital Services actions and hold them accountable for their failure to comply with the FDCPA. Specifically, I request that : - Resurgent Capital Services be required to provide full validation of the alleged debt or cease all collection activities.

- All inaccurate or unverifiable reporting related to this debt be removed from my credit file.

- The CFPB ensure Resurgents compliance with federal laws to prevent future violations. 

Supporting Documentation : I have attached the following to support my complaint : - Copies of my debt validation letters ( dated XX/XX/year>, and XX/XX/year> ). 
- Resurgent Capital Services incomplete response ( dated XX/XX/year> ). 
- Certified mail receipts and tracking information for my communications. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt response and assistance.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Complaint Regarding Inability to Access Credit File and Credit Freeze Tools Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, I am writing to formally file a complaint against TransUnion regarding persistent issues accessing my credit file and credit freeze tools through their website. Despite having an active account for OVER XXXX years, I have been consistently blocked from accessing the mandatory credit reporting and freeze tools. XXXX months ago, while applying for a loan, I was unable to unfreeze my TransUnion credit report, which prevented the lender from accessing my credit file. Apparently, the lender uses Trans Union. As a result, I was unable to secure the lowEST-interest rate loan I was pursuing. I had to find an agency that used XXXX. these problems do not exist on my XXXX and XXXX profiles. I'm also aware of a number of friends that have the same issue with XXXX XXXX My credit score is consistently over XXXX. 

While I am able to log in to the TransUnion website, I am FIRST presented with offers to purchase their paid services. However, when I attempt to access my credit report or manage credit freezes, I am met with a message stating that the information can not be accessed at this time. This issue has persisted for almost XXXX years, and I have been unable to find an effective resolution or reliable communication channel with TransUnion to address this matter. 

I believe this behavior raises concerns about compliance with consumer rights to access their credit information and manage credit freezes as mandated by law. I respectfully request the CFPB 's assistance in resolving this issue and ensuring that TransUnion provides the required access to its services. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter.

Despite my dispute, Allied Collection Service has continued attempts to collect on this account, and the reporting remains inaccurate. 

Under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) and the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), I am requesting the following : 1. Cease and Desist Communication : Allied Collection Service must immediately cease all communication regarding this account with me.

2. Verification of Debt : Provide documented proof validating the accuracy of this debt and the details surrounding it.

3. Correction or Deletion : If the debt can not be validated with accurate documentation, it must be removed from my credit report immediately.

Thank you for your attention to this matter. Please confirm receipt of this complaint and provide an update on the status of your investigation. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX
